Text:
Are you ready to join the team designing the future of mobility? HyperloopTT is looking to onboard a remote contributor specializing in Experience Design. The future is now boarding, join us.

The HyperloopTT Design team utilizes a broad range of skills to develop human-centric solutions for hyperloop stations, infrastructure and capsules while prioritizing sustainability, design thinking and material innovation. Our passionate team works in close collaboration with leading global design partners to define the future of travel and an unprecedented experience.

As a HyperloopTT Experience Designer, you will design human-centric experiences throughout our design products. You will bring key hyperloop journey touchpoints to life and develop frictionless experiences for passengers. Remote position 10+ hours a week in exchange for stock options.

Responsibilities

Collaborate cross-functionally to bring passenger journey to life through human-centric design thinking and methodology
Work with industrial and architectural designers to implement experiences that create a seamless experience for passengers
Design for user and passenger experiences of all digital and physical design projects
Occasionally participate in design efforts outside of your area of expertise as necessary and as your skill set allows

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Behavioral Design or a related field, or equivalent experience demonstrated by ability
Experience designing and mapping user interfaces and experiences
Portfolio showing comprehensive experience creating and designing for user experiences
Proficient in Adobe Creative Cloud Apps

Who You Are

Passionate about the hyperloop and other new innovations
A proactive self-starter able to add value to our unique organizational structure
Independent thinker, problem solver and learner that can effectively collaborate in teams
Adaptable, quality-driven and results-oriented
Respond to feedback and suggestions in a positive manner
Creative with high aesthetic standards
Detail-oriented with excellent communication skills
Human-centric thinking

Why Us

HyperloopTT is a collective of mobility innovators catalyzing the first breakthrough transportation in a century. From the beginning, we have united experts across the globe to realize the hyperloop and create a frictionless travel experience. We are passionate about the journey, looking to obstacles as opportunities and doubters as inspiration. We are far from dreamers; we are doers. We move forward every day. Come join us.

Latham & Watkins, a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world, is currently seeking a ServiceNow Business Process Analyst to join our winning team, located in our Global Services Office in downtown Los Angeles. The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our clients with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation and collaboration.


As the global outbreak of COVID-19 continues to unfold, Latham has taken precautions to help protect our people, clients, and the communities where we live and work. This includes a temporary shift to remote working for the majority of our lawyers and staff. This role will likely start remotely while the firm continues to evaluate the situation.


The ServiceNow Business Process Analyst will receive a generous total compensation package. Bonuses are awarded in recognition of individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham's comprehensive benefit program including healthcare, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a 401k plan, and more! In addition, employees receive 10 paid holidays per year, and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure.


As a ServiceNow Business Process Analyst at Latham, you will be responsible for the review, analysis and evaluation processes, systems, and user needs for planned projects based on the business plan of the department. You are involved in the development of business cases, facilitation of analysis workshops, the selection of the most effective solution and the definition and management of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) to ensure enterprise operational and IT deliverables meet the requirements of the enterprise. You will utilize Agile and SDLC methodologies to manage all work on the ServiceNow platform, while accomplishing these and other critical functions:


Partnering with business users to gather all requirements to formulate business specifications and translating those into business functionality.
Documenting workflows and results of business analysis and obtaining requirement sign-offs stakeholders.
Assisting the development team in translating application functionality into application architecture and the technical requirements.
Designing and executing test plans and test script to ensure that business requirements and functional specifications are implemented properly.
Applying knowledge of system capacity to determine feasibility of projects.
Conducting meetings on all levels of management for purposes of presentations, reviews, approvals of recommendations, etc.
Conducting training sessions to implement new or improved systems and procedures.
Recognizing and identifying potential areas where existing business services policies and procedures require change, or where new ones need to be developed, and making recommendations in these areas.
Maintaining a strong understanding of leading ITSM processes, methodologies, and frameworks.
Demonstrating implementing ITIL-based processes using ServiceNow or similar ITSM platforms.
Performing technical writing in multiple formats, including end-user documentation, operations guides, technical reports, and technical process flows, which promote and enable activity planning and risk reduction, ensure compliance, and simplify access to information.
Assessing the criticality of problems and prioritizing accordingly.
Presenting ideas and solutions in non-technical, business-friendly terms.
Performing Business Requirements gathering, data validation & data mapping review, Business Process flow, Business Process Modeling.
Conducting GAP analysis and demonstrating understanding of the AS-IS and TO-BE business processes.
Attending requirements review and validation sessions as required.


As a ServiceNow Business Process Analyst, you will be expected to apply your organizational and communication skills while displaying a positive, high-energy attitude. The successful Analyst must have effective and positive presentation skills when training and mentoring staff, the ability to learn new applications and concepts quickly in order to test and support these applications in ServiceNow, and the ability to think logically and analytically in order to diagnose problems and bring about rapid resolutions. The ideal candidate will have strong presentation skills and intermediate level competency with Word, PowerPoint and Visio. The candidate should also be adept with different software development methods (SDLC) like Water Fall and Agile (SCRUM) Method, and display an understanding of cloud service providers, standard infrastructure and application product offerings and customer support.


A Bachelor’s degree is desired. Six (6) years of relevant experience may be considered in lieu of a degree.


A minimum of five (5) years of technology support experience and five (5) years of analyst experience on the ServiceNow platform is required. A minimum of three (3) years of agile/scrum experience is required. ITIL Foundation certification required, and PMP certifications and ServiceNow certifications are a plus but not required. Experience working in an agile-scrum environment where documentation, high attention to detail, and team collaboration is required. Some project management experience is preferable.

Occasional travel to might be required. This position may require the individual to work nights and/or weekends.

Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by clicking the ‘Apply Now’ link.


Latham & Watkins is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our commitment to diversity, equal opportunity and sustainability enables Latham & Watkins to draw from a remarkable wealth of talent to create one of the world's leading law firms.


Latham & Watkins LLP will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance (FCIHO). Please click the link below to review the Ordinance.


Please click here to review your rights under U.S. employment laws. #LI-AH1

Los Angeles, California, United States
Department
Technology
Position Type
Full-Time/Regular

Position Title: Sales Executive
Reports to: Chief Client Officer
Position Location: Telecommute
Date: 1/17/21
POSITION OVERVIEW:
The Sales Executive will be responsible for using proven ability to drive new business to the organization. Sales Executives are part of a team of sales, service and marketing professionals who leverage the company’s resources to identify, attract and secure contracted business with net new clients. The Sales Executive is the lead salesperson providing strategic and consultative management for a portfolio of new client prospects. Sales Executives are strategic advisors to prospective clients and have in-depth understanding of the client’s business, goals, challenges, trends, and direction. The position requires passion for helping clients meet their business objectives by providing claims, network and other insurance solutions.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Leads and manages the entire sales cycle from lead generation through close.
Secures contracted business with new clients within a specified territory.
Independently creates and cultivates a pipeline of potential clients.
Utilizes the company’s vast resources to create solutions that exactly meet client needs.
Creates selling opportunities by identifying prospects and evaluating their position in the industry, researching and analyzing sales options.
Regularly contacts and meets with prospective clients to understand their buying decisions and needs.
Identifies, pursues, and qualifies growth opportunities for the company.
Establishes and maintains productive peer-to-peer relationships with customers and prospects.
Develops winning strategies, coordinates internal resources and leads communication with prospective clients.
Provides real time updates through sound pipeline management and documentation.
Works closely with business leaders to build client level solutions.
Leverages professional network, colleague industry contacts, conferences and other means to gain access to potential clients.
Skillfully gains access to decision makers, overcomes objections and obstacles.
Embodies the Alacrity Way of Selling throughout all interactions with internal and external stakeholders.
PREFERRED CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS:
Demonstrates the ability to quickly gain a firm understanding of company strategic objectives; clearly understands his/her functional responsibility for these objectives; has a track record of successfully implementing goals, strategies and plans essential to supporting overall company strategy.
Strong self-motivation with a pioneering/entrepreneurial attitude.
Proven and successful sales track record with experience in achieving growth objectives.
Experience performing complex sales engagements within the insurance industry.
Demonstrated experience negotiating contract terms and building solutions that meet client needs.
Ability to understand complex business situations and how to provide solutions.
Conveys a sense of urgency and drives issues to closure.
Uses personal creativity to introduce novel, new ideas, concepts, approaches, processes or tools that enhance the business’s strategic goals and business results.
Remains objective, optimistic and enthusiastic toward work and others, despite resistance.
POSITION QUALIFICATIONS AND TRAITS:
Education:
Bachelor’s degree
Experience:
8+ years’ experience in business development, sales, or program management with a solid track record of designing solutions linked to strategic business goals.
Travel:
Ability to travel up to 40%
Required Skills:
Must possess excellent written and oral presentation skills
Ability to successfully and sustainably gain access to decision makers
Must possess solid analytical skills and attention to detail
Must be consultative and solution oriented
Proactive ability to translate market insights into action plans
Demonstrated negotiation competencies with excellent problem solving skills
Strong leadership and consensus building skills
Demonstrated ability to interface with all levels of clientele
Business and financial acumen
Aptitude for selling

JobTitle: Field Consultant - Los Angeles, CA Part-time
Text:
Field Consultant - Los Angeles, CA Part-time
Los Angeles, CA, USA Req #178
 Friday, February 5, 2021
Overview

EXL (NASDAQ: EXLS) is a leading operations management and analytics company that designs and enables agile, customer-centric operating models to help clients improve their revenue growth and profitability. Our delivery model provides market-leading business outcomes using EXL’s proprietary Business EXLerator Framework™, cutting-edge analytics, digital transformation and domain expertise. At EXL, we look deeper to help companies improve global operations, enhance data-driven insights, increase customer satisfaction, and manage risk and compliance. EXL serves the insurance, healthcare, banking and financial services, utilities, travel, transportation and logistics industries. Headquartered in New York, New York, EXL has more than 32,000 professionals in locations throughout the United States, Europe, Asia (primarily India and Philippines), South America, Australia and South Africa. For more information, visit www.exlservice.com.

The Company
Commercial and personal line insurance carriers rely on EXL as a key business partner through our Castle High Value and EXL Risk Control service offerings. We offer a variety of field inspection and risk control services to support our clients’ underwriting processes. EXL’s consultants deliver industry-leading professionalism, quality and turn-around time, and our innovative solutions help our clients keep ahead of the competition. https://www.exlservice.com/survey-and-risk-control
The Position
EXL Survey and Risk Control is looking for skilled professionals to perform field inspections/surveys on high value homes and small businesses for personal lines and commercial lines insurance companies.
EXL’s Castle High Value and Risk Control divisions are the nation’s leading residential and commercial insurance survey companies. Castle provides replacement cost estimating and loss prevention services on high value homes for personal lines insurance carriers. Risk Control’s field professionals evaluate commercial businesses and their operations with a thorough understanding of coverage and exposure, documenting underwriting concerns and making recommendations for risk improvement.
EXL is interested in motivated and self-directed professionals who come with experience in the insurance industry and/or loss control and/or with knowledge of the construction and real estate business. We understand experience in both personal lines and commercial lines insurance is rare, so the company offers an excellent training program to cross-train. All interested candidates are encouraged to submit their qualifications. Come join the EXL Survey and Risk Control team!

The Location
This position is intended to service the county of Los Angeles in CA. The work for this territory includes but is not limited to the following cities: San Fernando Valley, Van Nuys, Encino, Sherman Oaks, and the surrounding area.

This is a non-exempt, work-from-home, employee position in which the Field Consultant is responsible for completing multiple EXL Survey products and other support tasks. Products serviced to include High Value Surveys, Commercial Risk Control Surveys, Phone Surveys and Desk Surveys. Field Consultants must complete the requisite number of surveys each month to achieve personal revenue production goals. Also accountable for ongoing pricing research and local insurance agency visits to help maintain future order flows. Additional responsibilities include mentoring, quality review and other special projects as directed by manager.
High Value Surveys
Conduct property surveys on high value homes, documenting the construction materials, workmanship and special features of the structure
Determine square footage of the home through detailed measurements or by replicating available building plans
Generate an estimate replacement cost based on industry calculators, EXL resources and your personal findings at the home
Observe and assess physical and liability hazards to the property, including natural hazards such as wildfire and hurricane exposure. Document all such hazards for underwriting, including recommendations for risk improvement.
Competed a detailed survey report write-up, including narrative assessments

Commercial Lines Risk Control Surveys
Conduct underwriting surveys and loss control assessments on commercial businesses
Observe and evaluate risk for various commercial insurance lines of business including Property, General Liability, Workers Compensation and Auto/Fleet.
Engage business owner to discuss and ascertain corporate safety culture, loss history, risk management controls and maturity of company safety programs
Document all hazards observed for underwriting, and make recommendations for risk improvement.
Complete a detailed survey report write-up, including narrative assessment

Other Duties
Phone and Desk Surveys
Regularly meet with local insurance agents to build a personal rapport, and promote the company’s products and services
Additional responsibilities include pricing research, mentoring, quality review and other special projects as directed by manager
Continually upgrade your Survey skillset through company-provided training and other learning opportunities.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Needed
High Value Survey or Commercial Survey experience preferred
Excellent professionalism and emotional intelligence
Strong analytical skills and resourcefulness
Solid aptitude for risk assessment and replacement cost
Excellent written and oral communications
Knowledge in use of computer equipment, software, and general office equipment
Ability to manage multiple projects at once and handle time sensitive urgencies
Willingness to travel

EEO/Minorities/Females/Vets/Disabilities
Other details
Pay Type Hourly

We are people who want to make a difference.
Everything we do starts with people. It’s what makes us different from all other car companies. If you share our belief in the power of people and our passion for human-centric innovation, you will thrive together with brilliant, like-minded colleagues who are committed to making a true difference?


Volvo Summary:
Volvo’s mission is to be the world’s most progressive and desired premium car company and to make people’s lives less complicated. Here at Volvo we are looking for individuals that want to be a part of this progressive change as well as be talented, committed and fun spirited when joining our globally diversified workforce. Employees at Volvo Car Inc. are the key component to our current and future success. We continue to follow the initial core values instilled by our founders Assar Gabrielsson and Gustaf Larson (Gothenburg, Sweden Circa 1927). Everything we do here at Volvo starts with people in mind. We are looking for employees who are analytical, interpersonal, technical and teamwork driven to join the Volvo family and by providing our employees with a foundation for success we can help develop the latest and greatest innovations to the car manufacturing market.

Job Summary:
The Technical Support Team is looking for motivated and driven individuals to provide technical support to retailer technicians and internal customers. The Field Technical Specialist will provide support using strong written, verbal, and face-to-face communication skills. This position is field based and requires regular travel, in a designated area, to resolve difficult customer concerns.

The candidate will provide the highest quality information and repair methods that comply with Volvo's established repair methods and procedures. This position requires the candidate to work together as part of a local support hub and operate independently when necessary.

Primary Responsibilities:
Assist Retailer Technicians with guided expert level diagnostics to ensure a prompt vehicle repair
Analyze, document, and report technical faults found on Volvo products and diagnostic tools
When necessary, escalate appropriate problems or situations to resolve the concern timely
Assist the larger Retailer Technical Support Team with Master Tech Meetings as needed
Evaluate support cases concerning customer complaints, prior warranty repairs, software status, etc.
Travel throughout the year as needed to support ‘on site’ at retailers as well as occasionally to Sweden
Perform special follow-ups, investigations and other requests to support the Volvo organization
Looks for new and innovative solutions to problems and finds creative ways to produce results
Display a good understanding of the organization's mission, goals, and strategies in daily work
Investigate and resolve difficult repair situations by duplicating and testing during development days

Key Competencies/Abilities:
Associate or Bachelor degree preferred, or automotive technical certification considered
Five years of Automotive experience including hybrid (master technician preferred)
Eight ASE (Automotive Service Excellence) and L1 & L3 (advanced level specialist & hybrid certifications)
Expert knowledge of diagnostic procedures, manufacturer specific special tools, and test equipment
Leadership skills are also a plus, such as a shop foreman or a team leader
Work independently to logically analyze a technical problem, identify the root cause and document the results
Effectively plan, coordinate and document daily scheduling of retailer visits, investigations and activities
Strong PC skills to perform daily work (i.e. Office products, computer hardware, additional software)
Strong communication skills to present technical information and persuade different audiences
Interact professionally representing the Volvo brand with employees and customers in a Volvo retailer
Push for continuous improvement, search for new and innovative solutions to technical problems
Vehicle fire and collision investigation knowledge/skills preferred
Ability to assess and identify actionable outcomes to improve support for our retailers


Who are we?
Everything we do starts with people. Our purpose is to provide freedom to move, in a personal, sustainable and safe way. We are committed to simplifying our customers’ lives by offering better technology solutions that improve their impact on the world and bringing the most advanced mobility innovations to protect them, their loved ones and the people around them.

Volvo Cars’ continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. The people of Volvo Cars are committed to making a difference in our world. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with over 40,000 employees across the globe. We believe in bringing out the best in each other and harnessing the true power of people. At Volvo Cars your career is designed around your talents and aspirations so you can reach your full potential. Join us on a journey of a lifetime as we create safety, autonomous driving and electrification technologies of tomorrow.

Welcome to the new standard of healthcare! Premise Health is the world’s leading healthcare access provider. We deliver purpose-driven career experiences in a culture-centric work environment—ensuring that employees at the nation's best companies get, stay, and be well. In a changing healthcare environment, we know there's a better way for organizations to help their people live healthier lives by delivering the right care at the right time, right where they work.

Partnered with visionary organizations around the globe, we offer a broad range of healthcare services and deliver an effortless patient experience that raises the bar, lowers costs, and redefines the meaning of quality care. By shifting the conversation from cost to return and from treatment to prevention, we are committed to help people, their families, and the organizations they work for be at their best. We are looking for a Strategic Advisory Associate to work remotely in support of our clients across the US. If you possess a “whatever it takes attitude” keep reading.

It’s hard to pinpoint a “typical” day here (and who wants typical anyway?), but as the Strategic Advisory Associate you are responsible for assisting in driving strategic initiatives with clients to meet their healthcare objectives. What You’ll Do for Us: Partner with Premise Operations and Business Development teams to lead strategic dialogue with clients in order to help meet client’s broad healthcare objectives Understand and advise clients on key strategic and innovative movements within the broad healthcare sector and provide perspective on how such actions could impact self-insured employer segment and specific client(s) Ability to respond to client needs through a deep understanding of key stakeholder objectives the development of creative solutions that effectively meets respective client needs through tangible growth opportunities Support the Strategic Advisory team in developing compelling content/intellectual capital that positions Premise Health as thought leader within healthcare innovation Understand current and emerging Premise product offerings and be able to clearly articulate value proposition with a focus on existing clients Support the development and operating model of newly created Strategic Advisory Group functional team in order to ensure that team is designed to maximize client strategic value and Premise impact Education: BA/BS required Experience: 3-5+ years of related experience with demonstrated career progression and increasing levels of responsibility Knowledge and Skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Previous management consulting experience advising clients on strategic initiatives Broad healthcare sector knowledge understanding around payer, provider, and employer segments, including knowledge of emerging/disruptive companies Ability to create and maintain strong internal and external relationships Ability to navigate comprehensive internal resources to connect the appropriate resources and products to achieve desired results What We’ll Do for You: At Premise Health, you’re not an employee – you’re a team member. We have health centers, pharmacies, fitness centers and offices scattered across the country, but we’re all working together to deliver exemplary and delightful service to our clients, their employees and family members. We’re proud of the culture we’ve built, and we aim to assist our team members in living their best life – in and out of the workplace.

That’s why you’ll find us taking a yoga class together or starting a book club. We know that we can only help people get, stay, and be well if we do the same for ourselves. We’re also not afraid to share what we’re up to – check out some of our smiling faces. As an employer, we want to compensate you for the work you do with more than a paycheck (although you’ll get one of those too).

Premise Health offers competitive benefits packages including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k), paid holidays and vacation time, and a company-sponsored wellness program. We are an equal opportunity employer of nice people and value inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Named one of the fastest growing companies in the nation by Inc. Magazine, The Execu|Search Group offers each individual room for their own growth while also fostering a team environment. We’re a growing giant in the staffing & placement industry that has been taking names and making moves since the mid-1980s. We have 10 offices throughout the East Coast & Midwest, 250+ employees & growing, and there are few industries that we shy away from working in. Who we are
Albert is a new type of financial service that uses powerful technology to automate your finances, with a team of human experts to guide you. Albert saves and invests automatically for you, helps you avoid overdrafts, finds savings you’re missing, identifies bills you’re overpaying, and much more. Text Albert a financial question, and we’ll not only offer guidance; we’ll help you make it happen.
We’re an LA-based startup with a proven business model, backed by top-tier institutional investors, with over 4 million users who have trusted Albert to help them achieve their financial goals. We’re on a mission to improve the financial lives of millions of people with a beautifully-designed, simple product, and we’re looking for thoughtful, talented people to join us on our journey.
About the role
The product designer will contribute across multiple areas of our brand, creating rich and engaging in-app experiences. The ideal designer is a hands-on, inventive individual with the ability to think from visual, UX and content perspectives. On an average day, the product designer might layout app screens, create illustrations for use across the brand, collaborate with writers, engineers and product managers to deliver quality product, create imagery for news on The Post, design financial infographics, and design assets for external communications.
Our design values
Simplicity: there is a massive, tangled web of financial products. We work tirelessly to make Albert simple and easy to use. This is done with great design.
Clarity: our goal is to create a transparent and straightforward experience for our users. We believe design should always elevate and enhance content, not distract from it.
Friendly: understanding personal finances isn’t just about the numbers: building a healthier relationship with money impacts all areas of a person’s life. That extra layer of empathy is crucial to our brand.
Things you're good at
Detail: You have an expert eye for typography, color and layout.
Information design: You are able to distill complex problems and information into designs that are engaging, easy to understand and simple to follow.
User experience: Ability to think holistically, in a user-centric fashion, with a sharp eye for detail and consistency.
Flexibility: You are comfortable laying out designs that are mainly typographic and highly informational and are also able to design and illustrate for content that is highly visual.
Organization: Work across multiple layers of our organization, including design, product, writing, marketing, engineering, financial services and senior management.
Communication: Keep lines of communication open and seek out feedback on a regular basis.
Teamwork: at Albert, the underpinning of our culture is caring. We care about our customers’ financial wellness, we care about the health of our business, and we treat each other with kindness and respect.
Responsibilities
Design across all stages of product including, wireframes, mockups, and prototyping for mobile app & web products.
Contribute to product requirements by researching competitors, looking at existing internal data, and information as needed on API docs.
Asset creation including icons, illustrations, and basic motion design/animations.
Create eye-catching content for The Post and PR.
Produce infographics explaining financial concepts in collaboration with our financial geniuses.
Ensure consistency in creative and copy with the company’s brand and design direction.
Collaborate with engineers to create quality product.
Manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously, from concepts to deliverables.
Requirements
A portfolio showcasing your design, process and skill delivering compelling creative product.
An advanced proficiency with Adobe Creative Cloud and other relevant design tools.
Experience with wire-framing and prototyping tools.
Ability to design with the context of how coding structures work is a plus.
4-5 years of work experience as a designer, at an agency or in-house.
BA/BS or equivalent in graphic design, user experience or similar design.
Benefits
Competitive salary and equity
Health, vision and dental insurance
401k match
Free lunch

Summary
The VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System (GLA) is currently recruiting for two (2) Security Assistant to work in Police Services Los Angeles, CA. The primary purpose of the Dispatcher is work in the dispatch call center of Police Service providing communication support for Police Patrol Operations.
Responsibilities
Major duties include but are not limited to:

Communicate all codes clearly over the medical center's overhead paging system.
Perform work of a general office support nature, which encompasses a variety of different duties and responsibilities.
Receive and directs callers and visitors. Provides information about the organization, its functions, activities, and personnel.
Receive and/or gives out forms, and assists visitors and/or callers with the completion of forms or documents.
Support and implements policies, procedures, and methods for identifying and protecting confidential information, personnel, property, facilities, operations, or material; performs work in support of established security programs; or performs protective services work in guarding Federal buildings, personnel, and materials.
Perform support work related to personnel, physical, or information security programs. Monitors operation of communication/security & related electronic equipment.
Ensure electronic equipment is properly maintained.
Monitor and directs response to security and life safety communications, radio dispatching, telephone, and other emergency communication circuits.
Monitor the operation of all communication/security and related electronic equipment. Receives and compiles information from various sources related to police and emergency incidents, taking appropriate action regarding intrusion, duress, and hold-up alarms.
Direct response and/or modifies responsible personnel depending on the type of incident or request.
Provide administrative support, which includes issuing keys, parking decals and ID badges to employees, as needed.
Assist the Security Assistant with briefing visiting nursing students.
Prepare the computerized VA Police Daily Operations Journal.
Maintain locked area access logs and business representative and visitor sign in/out logs. Maintains visitor and business representative sign in/out logs.
Verify identification and purpose of visit and prevents access to building of unauthorized visitors.


Work Schedule: 5:00 am - 5:30 pm or 5:00 pm to 5:30 am; Alternating days and weekends off.

Telework: Not Available
Virtual: This is not a virtual position.

Qualifications
To qualify for this position, applicants must meet all requirements by the closing date of this announcement, 02/17/2021.

Time-In-Grade Requirement: Applicants who are current Federal employees and have held a GS grade any time in the past 52 weeks must also meet time-in-grade requirements by the closing date of this announcement. For a GS-05 position you must have served 52 weeks at the GS-04. The grade may have been in any occupation, but must have been held in the Federal service. An SF-50 that shows your time-in-grade eligibility must be submitted with your application materials. If the most recent SF-50 has an effective date within the past year, it may not clearly demonstrate you possess one-year time-in-grade, as required by the announcement. In this instance, you must provide an additional SF-50 that clearly demonstrates one-year time-in-grade.

Note: Time-In-Grade requirements also apply to former Federal employees applying for reinstatement as well as current employees applying for Veterans Employment Opportunities Act of 1998 (VEOA) appointment.


You may qualify based on your experience and/or education as described below:
Specialized Experience: You must have one year of specialized experience equivalent to at least the next lower grade GS-04 in the normal line of progression for the occupation in the organization. Examples of specialized experience would typically include, but are not limited to:
Managing different forms of communication,
Perform administrative support,
Attention to detail and
Customer service in a medical care setting.
OR,
Education: Applicants may substitute education for the required experience. To qualify based on education for this grade level you must have
4 years above high school
You will be rated on the following Competencies for this position:
Administration and Management
Attention to Detail
Communications and Media
Customer Service

Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religions; spiritual; community; student; social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

Note: A full year of work is considered to be 35-40 hours of work per week. Part-time experience will be credited on the basis of time actually spent in appropriate activities. Applicants wishing to receive credit for such experience must indicate clearly the nature of their duties and responsibilities in each position and the number of hours a week spent in such employment.

Physical Requirements: Work is sometimes sedentary but requires walking, standing and carrying of medium weight items such as office supplies.

For more information on these qualification standards, please visit the United States Office of Personnel Management's website at https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/.
Education
A transcript must be submitted with your application if you are basing all or part of your qualifications on education.

Note: Only education or degrees recognized by the U.S. Department of Education from accredited colleges, universities, schools, or institutions may be used to qualify for Federal employment. You can verify your education here: http://ope.ed.gov/accreditation/. If you are using foreign education to meet qualification requirements, you must send a Certificate of Foreign Equivalency with your transcript in order to receive credit for that education. For further information, visit: http://www.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ous/international/usnei/us/edlite-visitus-forrecog.html.
Additional information
VA supports the use of telework as a way to help attract and retain talented individuals in public service, increase worker productivity, and better prepare the agency to operate during emergencies. This position may be authorized for telework. Telework eligibility will be discussed during the interview process.

Receiving Service Credit or Earning Annual (Vacation) Leave: Federal Employees earn annual leave at a rate (4, 6 or 8 hours per pay period) which is based on the number of years they have served as a Federal employee. VA may offer newly-appointed Federal employee's credit for their job-related non-federal experience or active duty uniformed military service. This credited service can be used in determining the rate at which they earn annual leave. Such credit must be requested and approved prior to the appointment date and is not guaranteed.

Special Employment Consideration: VA encourages persons with disabilities to apply, including those eligible for hiring under 5 CFR 213.3102(u), Schedule A, Appointment of persons with disabilities [i.e., intellectual disabilities, severe physical disabilities, or psychiatric disabilities], and/or Disabled veterans with a compensable service-connected disability of 30% or more. Contact the Agency Contact for information on how to apply under this appointment authority via the Selective Placement Coordinator.

The Interagency Career Transition Assistance Plan (ICTAP) and Career Transition Assistance Plan (CTAP) provide eligible displaced Federal/VA competitive service employees with selection priority over other candidates for competitive service vacancies. To be qualified you must submit appropriate documentation (a copy of the agency notice, your most recent performance rating, and your most recent SF-50 noting current position, grade level, and duty location) and be found well-qualified for this vacancy. To be well-qualified: applicants must possess experience that exceeds the minimum qualifications of the position including all selective factors, and who are proficient in most of the required competencies of the job. Information about ICTAP and CTAP eligibility is on OPM's Career Transition Resources website at http://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/workforce-restructuring/employee-guide-to-career-transition/.

Placement Policy: The posting of this announcement does not obligate management to fill a vacancy or vacancies by promotion. The position may be filled by reassignment, change to lower grade, transfer, appointment, or reinstatement. Management may use any one or any combination of these methods to fill the position.

It is the policy of the VA to not deny employment to those that have faced financial hardships or periods of unemployment.

This job opportunity announcement may be used to fill additional vacancies.

Veterans and Transitioning Service Members: Please visit the VA for Vets site for career-search tools for Veterans seeking employment at VA, career development services for our existing Veterans, and coaching and reintegration support for military service members.

Latham & Watkins, a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world, is currently seeking a Global Timekeeping Specialist to join our winning team, located in Global Services Office in downtown Los Angeles. The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our clients with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation and collaboration.

As the global outbreak of COVID-19 continues to unfold, Latham has taken precautions to help protect our people, clients, and the communities where we live and work. This includes a temporary shift to remote working for the majority of our lawyers and staff. This role will likely start remotely while the firm continues to evaluate the situation.

The Global Timekeeping Specialist will receive a generous total compensation package. Bonuses are awarded in recognition of individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham's comprehensive benefit program including healthcare, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a 401k plan, and more! In addition, employees receive 10 paid holidays per year, and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure.

As a Global Timekeeping Specialist at Latham, you will be responsible for coordinating the activities of the Timekeeping team. You will oversee the daily maintenance, updating, and reporting of employee records in the firm’s timekeeping system (Intapp) and the firm’s financial system (Elite), while accomplishing these and other critical functions:

Ensuring accurate and timely completion of time uploads from the firm’s timekeeping system (Intapp) to the firm’s financial system (Elite) by reviewing logs of scheduled uploads, generating reports Elite Reports, and reporting any errors found to the designated staff in the Global Technology Department.
Processing timesheet corrections by running reports from Elite and comparing the results from Elite to Time Modification reports generated from the Time Modifications tool. Processing any necessary corrections in Elite.
Using various reports to identify timesheet entries requiring follow-up. Using e-mail and telephone to communicate with timekeepers from around the firm to identify appropriate actions to correct problems.
Generating reports and performing analysis of timekeeper data.
Assisting with maintenance of Timekeeping Practices section of Billing Homepage Intranet site.
Making recommendations to department managers regarding improvements to firm timekeeping procedures, processes and workflow.
Responding to requests for information from timekeepers and legal secretaries in a timely matter. Keeping requester informed of project status as appropriate.
Serving as a subject matter expert regarding timekeeper PACE (the method of measuring the productivity of attorneys and paralegals). Researching discrepancies and responds to inquiries.

As a Global Timekeeping Specialist, you will be expected to apply your organizational and communication skills while displaying a positive, high-energy attitude. The successful Global Timekeeping Specialist must have the ability to work in a team environment with a customer service focus, and handle confidential and sensitive information with the appropriate discretion. The successful candidate will demonstrate general clerical and data entry skills with a high level of accuracy, and the organizational skills needed to manage time well, prioritize effectively, and handle multiple deadlines. Knowledge and proficiency in PC Applications, including MS Office, is required.

Four years of experience in general accounting practices, and three years of experience in timekeeping processes and practices are desired. Prior experience with Intapp, Elite, and Timekeeping systems is preferred. A two year Associates Degree in Accounting, Business Administration or related field is preferred.
Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by visiting the Latham & Watkins online application using the link provided.

ABOUT US

Trigger invents unrivaled mixed reality experiences for the world’s top brands. From major marketing campaigns to powerful enterprise solutions, our work combines premiere content with the latest technology, blending physical and digital worlds in innovative yet measurable ways.

Founded in 2005, Trigger is a Los Angeles-based agency with more than 200,000 hours of development in AR, VR, and XR. Trigger is a showcase developer for Snap, Vuforia, Google, Avegant, and ODG. Our portfolio includes work for Disney, Lucasfilm, Sony Pictures, LEGO, Honda, Adidas, NBA, and many more high-profile clients.

SUMMARY

Trigger is looking for a talented and motivated intern with a passion for mixed reality to apply for our Summer 2021 Internship Season (May - August). This is a part-time, paid internship that offers a unique opportunity to learn from and work in close collaboration with a team of mixed reality (XR) experts one or more of the following focus areas:


Creative: Concepting, ideation, design, UX/UI, art direction
Technology: Unity or Web development, mobile apps, prototyping
3D: Modeling, rigging, texturing, animation, retopology
Project Management: Team leadership, scope & budget tracking, scheduling
Sales: Market & client research, outreach, marketing


This internship will be fully remote. Please let us know in your application below if you have any limitations when it comes to working remotely (e.g. computer, environment, schedule, etc.).

WHAT TO EXPECT


Become embedded with the team on at least one active project and follow along from start to finish including standups, sprint planning and reviews, and client meetings.
See firsthand the inner workings and collaboration of a digital project team, in addition to providing direct support via notetaking, QA testing, and other tasks related to your particular focus area.
Learn about all aspects of mixed reality from experts in the field, including AR & VR best practices, industry trends, and emerging technologies.
Gain on-the-job experience and training for various tools such as SalesForce, JIRA, Adobe, Unity, Maya, and more.
Participate in creative brainstorming sessions for new project opportunities.
Weekly check-ins with Company, Career, and Culture mentors, plus portfolio and/or resume reviews and lunch with our CEO.
Valuable networking opportunities with the Trigger team plus high-profile clients and technology partners.
Join in on any and all aspects of Trigger’s culture including our Employee Resource Groups, after-work social clubs (such as Book Club, Game Night, D&D, and more), and company-wide events.

REQUIREMENTS


College or university students that are currently enrolled in a relevant major or have a demonstrated interest in the field
Proactive, self-motivated, and highly organized
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to work in a fast-paced and highly creative environment
Sharp eye and keen attention to detail
Strong work ethic and desire to take ownership of tasks
A love for the intersection of tech, entertainment, toys, games, and pop culture

THE APPLICATION PROCESS


The deadline to apply for our Summer 2021 Internship Season is March 15th, 2021 at 11:59pm Pacific.

To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter and answer the write-in questions included in the application form.
Once all applications have been received, the interview process will take place throughout the months of March and April. Our final decision will be made by early May.
We expect this role to receive considerable interest, and regret that we will have to turn down the majority of applicants. We know the internship search can be a stressful one, and we will promptly notify any candidates who are not selected.

OUR VALUES & CULTURE

At Trigger, we care deeply about maintaining a positive culture, as emphasized in our Core Values:


Foster innovation and embrace change
Take action and work hard
Strive for excellence
Value individuals
Work better together
Commit to integrity
Enjoy the work
Be kind, be considerate, do good


We have a remote-friendly culture with frequent virtual events like Jackbox Happy Hours and our ongoing Dungeons & Dragons campaign.

OUR DIVERSITY & INCLUSION COMMITMENT

At Trigger, we know that justice, diversity, equity, and inclusion add a real and measurable value to our culture, our employees, and our work. We are committed to taking action that will create diverse representation at all levels of our organization and ensuring that Trigger is a safe, equitable, and supportive environment for all marginalized groups. We believe in the power of innovation and commit to embracing forward-thinking changes so we may become DE&I leaders and take action well ahead of what might be considered "the norm."

We encourage applicants from all backgrounds and identities to consider themselves for this role. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.

About RealtyMogul

Our mission is to simplify real estate investment by connecting investors to high quality commercial real estate transactions. Real estate is the most popular asset class in the world, and probably the most fraught with peril for the individual investor. Individuals have extremely limited information and access beyond their own neighborhood. The ability to do due diligence is minimal, and it is complex to negotiate, purchase, manage, and liquidate.

RealtyMogul was created to make this asset class available. We allow our investors to buy portions of properties instead of entire ones or get exposure to multiple properties via third party funds or our proprietary REITs. We source the partners or investments ourselves, diligence them ourselves and walk every property that we offer up for investment.

We have been at it for 7 years and have backed more than 70 operating partners across the country in addition to building our own direct acquisitions team. We have learned what a great property that is well managed looks like. We leverage our experience to find the best deals, actively asset manage, and maximize our investors' returns.

Today we are one of the largest, most recognizable brands in online real estate crowdfunding, with over $600 Million in capital invested into over $2.8 billion of real estate nationwide. We were recently named the #1 Commercial Real Estate Crowdfunding Platform by Motley Fool. We remain focused on building the best online experience to enable investment into highly vetted commercial real estate assets and to educate our growing user base about the many aspects of real estate investing, all through an online, scalable platform.

About Your Role

We are looking for an intelligent, motivated, detail-oriented individual to work remotely and join our growing team. The ideal candidate will be computer savvy, meticulous, personable, and be able to both take direction and be pro-active.

What You'll Do:
Collaborate with the Marketplace Operations Team to facilitate fundraising activity for the RealtyMogul commercial real estate investment technology platform
Deliver top-tier client support and effective communication with investors and the Investor Relations Team
Respond to customer inquiries through our online ticketing system
Perform administrative functions and back office processes within the marketplace application in accordance with regulatory requirements
Coordinate with colleagues from various departments on all operational processes for efficient operation of the company
Collaborate in team discussions and development initiatives for improving the efficiency and effectiveness of company operations
Coordinate with the commercial real estate closing team to ensure all fundraising responsibilities are completed
Who You Are:
You possess a 1-2 years of operational experience including customer relationships, investment support, operating data systems and administration of process
You have extreme attention to detail and are highly reliable
You must be able to participate in a fast-paced environment
You are exceptionally well organized
You possess excellent phone, email and verbal communication skills
Your spelling and grammar are beyond reproach

Text: Job Description - Photo editor*We are a pole dance fitness competition series that gives pole dancers a place to show off the skills that they have learned at their studio. We focus on amateur performers who are over 18. Giving the competitor her superstar moment and making her look her very best on stage and in photos and video are our priorities. We want to make the competitor feel like they are getting to be “famous”, the center of attention, or the leading lady of the day. We’re giving the experience of a professional theater performance to an amateur that would normally not get this opportunity.**Our website is www.polesportorg.com and you can read more about our company at www.polesportorg.com/mission.**To apply, please send cover letter, resume, and link to portfolio or past projects. Qualified applicants will be contacted for a phone interview and skills test.**Overview:**The final product you will be working on is a photo/video package that we give to the competitors as part of the event. They receive 20 edited photos from their performance.**Outcomes:**Competitors are thrilled with how they look in photos.**Making sure that you budget your time well so that all deadlines are met - this can be challenging given the high volume of photos and length of upload and download times.**Job Requirements:**Lightroom Classic competencyGoogle Sheet competencyAvailability for 20 hours for editing per event, spread out over a 1 month period (schedules TBA). Events begin in April 2021.**Ultimately, you are responsible for:**Photos properly cataloged (34,000-100,000 images per event)Quality of edits matches the rest of the teamEdits and uploads are completed on schedule**Compensation is $16 per hour.***Job Types: Part-time, ContractPay: $16.00 per hourBenefits:Flexible scheduleEducation:High school or equivalent (Preferred)Experience:Adobe Lightroom Classic: 1 year (Required)Contract Renewal:LikelyFull Time Opportunity:NoWork Location:Fully RemoteTypical start time:10AMTypical end time:7PMCompany's website:polesportorg.comCompany's Facebook page:Facebook.com/polesportorganizationCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

PLEASE SEND COVER LETTER, RESUME, AND REEL AT WWW.HITRECORD.ORG/JOBSWhat is HITRECORD?Founded and led by actor and artist Joseph Gordon-Levitt, HITRECORD is an open online community for creative collaboration. Users don't just post about themselves and vie for attention; they work together on various art and media projects that they couldn't have completed independently.So far, HITRECORD has operated as a successful production company, winning two Emmy’s for its television shows, partnering with numerous brands from Samsung, Zappos, and LG to the ACLU, paying contributing community members a total of nearly three million dollars. With over 1,000,000 registered users, we have evolved from a production company into a platform.HITRECORD is now seeking an individual to join the team as a short term Video Editor in order to assist with the video content demands of the company.Our commitment to diversity and inclusion: We deeply understand the value of bringing together a team with different perspectives, educational backgrounds, and life experiences, and we prioritize diversity within our team. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply. Our mission is to inspire creativity through collaboration.About the Role: HITRECORD is seeking a highly creative, organized, and motivated individual to take on the role of Video Editor in the Post Production department. This role is suited for individuals with experience in video editing who also have a basic knowledge of animation/motion graphics. The individual would also be responsible for occasional media management tasks of their own projects in order to archive them into HITRECORD’s systems. This position’s work can be done remotely and there is no need to go into an office.The Video Editor would be responsible for the creation of multimedia videos for release on the HITRECORD platform and social channels. Videos could range from informational docu-style videos to freeform visual collages of photos and video. Editors will be responsible for the curation and souring of their own cutaways from the HITRECORD platform. Job Title: Senior Human Factors Engineer/Researcher
Reports To: Manager User Research
Group/Division: Laboratory Products

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $25 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them.
Location-Carlsbad, CA / or Remote
Division: Life Sciences Solutions Group.

How will you make an impact?
Thermo Fisher Scientific is looking for a Senior Human Factors Researcher to support the development of products and experiences throughout our life sciences portfolio. This role will focus on delivering quality user research insights, using both qualitative and quantitative methods, to help set strategy and achieve usability and desirability in new product development. This role will play an integral part in our internal Experience Design Center (XDC) team for developing and designing rich customer experiences for all of our brands. You will work across the product development lifecycle, including discovery, ideation and concept testing, and final validation. This role will work cross-functionally with our User Interface and Industrial Designers, product management, and R&D teams. We are seeking somebody with a proven track record of improving usability through user centered design research, who has experience with user research in both digital and physical products, experience in B2B enterprise systems is a plus. This role is expected to work with minimal supervision, to exert initiative, and support team members on assigned projects.

What will you do?
Act as senior researcher and lead on user research programs. Work with stakeholders to understand project objectives, identify when user and design research should be conducted, and determine appropriate research methods, including but not limited to ethnographic research, 1:1 interviews, surveys, and usability testing.Develop and deploy research plans, including participant recruitment, testing logistics and protocol. Conduct and manage testing, independently or with a project team
Conduct and/or manage data processing. Analyze and synthesize user research and define appropriate functionality and product requirements to drive short term wins or future re-designs. Support project team’s synthesis of user research data with other technical and business data. Analyze research findings, develop insights and present to project teams and stakeholders.
Work with interdisciplinary teams of designers and engineers to generate concepts and specifications for both physical and digital interfaces and demonstrate those concepts to key stakeholders.Develop user personas and scenarios to clarify results of user research and focus the teams design efforts on the needs of key users.Perform detailed analysis of internal and external products.Provide accurate, well-defined, and articulate verbal and written presentations to stakeholders.Conduct frequent and direct contact with stakeholders regarding deliverables and general project communications to maintain and improve stakeholder relationships and to ensure stakeholder satisfaction.

How will you get here?
EDUCATION
Bachelors or Master’s degree in human factors, usability engineering, HCI / User Systems UX, psychology and/or research from an accredited school and 7+ years of work experience or a combination of education and relevant work experience.
EXPERIENCE
Capable of juggling a number of prioritiesAble to deliver research results in a high pressure, dynamic environment to large groupsExpertise in a broad range of research methodologies including quantitative and qualitative; knowing how, when (and when not) to use themDemonstrated proficiency conducting end-user research, including ethnographic research, usability testing, concept testing, task analysis, and surveysExperience with conducting design research workshops with stakeholdersExperience with creating personas and use casesAbility to interact with a variety of stakeholders in a cooperative and productive manner with little supervisionHighly developed interpersonal and communication skillsProject management experienceSkilled storyteller, excels in creating compelling, concise and visual presentationsExcellent written and oral presentation skillsCommitment to the customer and to product qualityPassion for identifying problems and pain-points and inventing solutions for the user and working with designers to collaborate on solutionsSuccessful candidates can translate what they know about people into actionable design insightsResearch experience with Enterprise software and/or connected platforms and devices is a-plusDomestic and international travel is required when travel is possible

Thermo Fisher Scientific is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer

Responsible for carrying out sales objectives; implementing sales and account strategies as set out by management and achieving results in a matrix sales organization; discovery, development and realization of Project Opportunities in own Sales District as well as soliciting new customers/contractors to increase demand for products; cultivating long-term relationships with key account decision makers; demonstrating effective sales call planning and execution skills including utilization of CRM to manage efforts and drive results tracked through visits and CRM Opportunity Funnel; delivering professional sales presentations; working with local manufacturing reps as directed by Regional Sales Director; maintaining sales reports and forecasts; tracking expenses; drive participation in Corporate training objectives; demonstrating commitment to continuous professional development.

JOB DESCRIPTION DETAILS
Sales Initiatives
Contribute to the development and implementation of sales and account strategies as set out by management, in accordance with corporate goals; develop and implement Key Account Plans for strategic accounts within specified territory in order to exceed expectations in revenue retention/growth, account profitability, and customer satisfaction/loyalty.
Increase demand for company’s products by discovery, development and realization of Project Opportunities as represented in CRM; prospecting/soliciting new business partners; maintaining a cycle of scheduled calls and visits to customers based on CRM Segmentation Strategy; grows customer/contractor database for specific territory.
Cultivate long-term relationships with key account decision makers; develop a complete understanding of the organization’s structure and key buying influences of assigned account.
Conduct sales calls and deliver professional presentations to various individuals, including but not limited to cross-functional teams, architects, wholesale distributors, builders, developers, facility engineers, plant managers, code officials, educators, contractors, etc. utilizing appropriate resources.
Advance market growth by understanding, adapting and effectively communicating the value proposition for each constituent group.
Ownership and ongoing management of annual sales plan and strategic account plans in order to achieve market penetration in various segments/territories to promote each product line.
Works with local independent manufacturer’s representative agencies as directed by Regional Sales Director in support of the Residential Sales Management Team.
Travel to various locations to provide ongoing training and support as requested or needed.
Receive leads from trade shows or other sources; prioritize leads in order to make contact and follow up on resulting opportunities.
Provide support to cross-functional teams as needed to ensure client deliveries are executed as agreed. Contributes to further adoption of EDI and VMI by Distributors within the District and the Regions.

Reporting
Maintain monthly sales reports and business metrics; identifies business opportunities; reports on trends and new products.
Provide weekly reporting and updates to management, both ongoing and as requested.
Prepare reports daily/weekly/monthly for management regarding field activity, sales, competitors and forecasts.
Track travel and incidental expenses; prepare and submit expense reports on a timely basis ensuring expenses are within budget parameters.
Maintain, updates, and utilizes CRM/SAP Mobile Sales daily activity calendars to track information, including but not limited to documenting Opportunities in that sales funnel, entering sales call activities, linking customers, ranking contractors and keeping calendars up-to-date.

Other
Attends meetings as required and/or assigned.

Performs other duties as required and/or assigned
Special Job Dimensions
Will be required to travel up to 80% of the time.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Knowledge of computer programs, including but not limited to Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook, PowerPoint, SAP and CRM
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Good listening skills
Strong interpersonal and customer service skills
Strong organizational skills and ability to handle multiple priorities
Strong relationship building and strategic selling skills
Proven selling ability and proven track record of business development, including effective sales call
planning and execution skills; business acumen to meet revenue, profitability and customer satisfaction
Ability to interpret and forecast changes in customers’ buying patterns and product requirements
Ability to function autonomously or as a team player

Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, profit margins, unit conversions, percentages, area and volume.
Ability to be self-motivated and comfortable working from home office
Ability to give presentations in front of various groups
Ability to communicate with all levels of the organization
Ability to acquire and recruit new customers

Ability to create demand and drive sales results with installer segment
Ability to travel to meet customer expectations and internal requirements

JobTitle: Contract Technical Writer - Digital and Print
Text:
Ontrak is looking for a Contract Technical Writer!
Bring your passion for writing Digital and Print Content to a growing company while working from home!

The Technical Writer is responsible for working with internal teams for the content, formatting, and presentation of collateral to support the OnTrak product. The Writer would oversee the preparation and finalization of all product documentation including the development of a publication process that includes inter- and intra-departmental project teams.
This role functions as a subject matter expert on interpretation of business data requirements and technical programming documentation into structured data asset documentation to support product management and presentations research and metrics into product marketing documentation and presentations that can be used to support business operations and key stakeholders on program procedural development.
Essential Functions:

Responsible for independently writing materials and providing communications across mixed media (print, digital, web).
Managing the entire editorial process for new product collateral including project plan development, proofreading, editing, copyediting, formatting, referencing, permissions, approvals, and publication rules management.
Leverage appropriate approaches and publication techniques to gather content, document according to national standards and procedures, and prioritize based on corporate objectives.
Requirements:

Bachelor's Degree. In lieu of degree, equivalent education and/or experience
Strong verbal, writing and publication skills; critical thinking and ability to translate complex data models and concepts into publicly consumable collateral.
Prior experience designing and developing external facing publications
Demonstrated success in technical writing related to data asset content
Experience producing digital and print content.
Experience with clinical data
Exceptional technical writing skills including product specifications, user guides
Ability to work cross-functionally and gain alignment.
Ability to convey clinical data in a clear, concise manner
Familiarity with clinical data models and healthcare regulations.
Strong time management and organizational skills with the ability to consistently deliver work on time.
Strong comprehension of evidence-based research in the behavioral health space.
Demonstrated ability to navigate various stakeholder groups and cultivate consensus-based decision making.
Proficiency using Microsoft Office applications and digital publication tools.
Confluence required

Preferred:

Experience with behavioral health concepts and terminology.
Certification Applied business analysis, business modelling, or project
Master's Degree

Our remote opportunities require:
A quiet, private, distraction-free home office work environment
A reliable high-speed internet connection (cable, DSL, or fiber) with speeds of at least 10Mbps download and 5Mbps upload. Most positions will require that you be hard-wired to your internet access and Wi-Fi will be disabled. Traveling with your computer is not allowed unless travel is required for the position.
Discipline to work from home while following a set schedule
Background check clearance

ABOUT US

Ontrak, Inc. is making a positive impact on people’s lives every day. We use predictive analytics to identify health plan members with unaddressed behavioral health conditions that worsen chronic disease, then engage, support, and guide these members to better health with a personalized, human-centered approach. This has led us to where we are today: growing fast and saving lives as we do.

To support our explosive growth, we’re looking for compassionate, hard-working people-lovers to join our team. If innovating in the field of patient care is something you’re passionate about, we encourage you to join our mission to improve the health and save the lives of as many people as possible.

Impact lives in so many ways
You'll be an integral part in supporting people coping with their unique life challenges. Every member of the Ontrak team contributes to accomplishing our goals and upholding our people-centric values.

The new face of mental health
Our model is research-based, and we are invested in staying on the leading edge of treatment. You'll help us break down barriers and stigmas associated with mental health.

Career options
Our ongoing strong growth and evolution, we are looking for people who want to do their best at work. Join our team and take your career to the next level with Ontrak. We are committed to promoting from within.

Excellent compensation
In addition to a competitive wage, we offer comprehensive benefits including medical, dental and vision insurance; a 401(k) plan; paid holiday, vacation and sick time; flexible spending accounts; Basic Life/AD&D, Employee Assistance Program and Travel Assistance Program and more.

Ontrak, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

Text:
Position Overview - Technical Account Manager – PLM- USA
Engage with customer to gather business and technical requirements, determine business needs and architect appropriate solutions within the Product Lifecycle Management domainCritical lead in the development of successful sales strategies aligned to Campaigns and Value Streams for competitive displacement and broadening the overall Siemens portfolio usage within the customerUtilizing advanced knowledge of customer business needs, engineering and manufacturing processes, industry best practices and competitive differentiation to lead pursuit teams that will prepare and deliver compelling customer experiences in support of selling efforts.Critical contributor within PLM sales processMaintain excellent knowledge of Aerospace and Defense industry

Responsibilities
This candidate will be responsible to establish and build a trusted advisor and credible business and technical consultant relationship with clients and sales executivesOversee and guide the client in the selection of appropriate solutions and suites of technologyGather and advise the customer in the definition of high level business and technical requirementsProvide guidance on the technical capabilities and business value of their current and proposed Siemens solution portfolioLead the development and delivery of presentations, demonstrations, proof of concepts, proposals and business and technology status reviews (e.g., TRBs, MRBs)Regular interaction with executives to become a trusted advisorDevelop a strong high-level knowledge of the entire breadth of Siemens' digital enterprise product design and manufacturing portfolioManage customer technical queries and coordinate the resources that respondSupport account managers and pre-sales resources in defining and executing on sales opportunitiesLead the construction of meaningful collateral for client requests for information (RFI, etc.), proposals (RFP, RFQ, etc.), demonstrations and proof of concept exercisesExcellent understanding of the Aerospace and Defense industryRecord and distribute results of client meetings and subsequent agreementsDocument and share best practices and customer success stories within the vertical, BU and across the PL organization

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience
Qualified Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the Unites States. Qualified Applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now, or in the future, for employment in the United States.Must currently be located in the continental United States and be able to work remotely from a home office.Must have at least 5+ years of experience in PLM space, which includes doing the proof of concepts, defining the requirements and scope of PLM Solutions deployment, as well as being part of the selection process.Excellent verbal group presentation and written communications skillsExcellent organizational skills that positively influence teams with a common understanding of what success looks likeBS/BA in an engineering or manufacturing-related disciplineSelf-starter, motivated and able to work with a minimum of direct supervision.Experience leading and managing teams of technical and business consultants from within, and outside of their formal organizationMust be open to an average of 30% travel, almost exclusively domestic

2 + years of expertise in digital enterprise space.Proven success and experience in an Engineering/Manufacturing Engineering role in the aerospace and defense industryProven record of ability to present technology solutions in front of groups while incorporating specific selling techniques.
