Stray Cat Alliance is a non-profit organization focused on educating and empowering communities to advocate for every cat’s right to be safe, healthy, and valued. Everyday, our team works to save the helpless lives of kittens and cats by providing: spay/neuter, trap-neuter-return (TNR), adoptions, wellness care, medical care, and community shelter support. Our goals are to:Eradicate cruelty toward cats through advocacy, rescue, and education.Find loving forever homes for cats and kittens taken in through all of our programs.Help shelters transform themselves from executioners to safe havens for cats by implementing Stray Cat Alliance’s life-saving policies and procedures.Educate the community about the plight of free‐roaming cats and empower people to take action to stop population growth through spay and neuter.Create and sustain a No-Kill Nation by mentoring other communities to become no kill through our grassroots programs.Stray Cat Alliance envisions a time when all cats are valued and safe whether in homes or communities, and when shelters serve as temporary safe havens.We are seeking a part-time Grant Writer to support the organization’s lifesaving programs. The Grant Writer, under the direction of the Director of Development, will research, prepare, submit, and manage grant proposals and reports. The successful candidate will be a person who enjoys working independently to meet deadlines and funding goals, and takes pride in producing excellent work. This position requires clear, persuasive writing and skills in data analysis, research, program budgeting, project management, and outcome measurement. This role will work primarily off-site but must at times be present at Stray Cat Alliance’s facilities in Los Angeles (90018) to work in collaboration with development, accounting, and marketing staff, and with animal program managers.**TO APPLY: Please submit a cover letter and resume. Application materials should be received by February 18, 2021*ESSENTIAL DUTIESCreate and submit LOIs, proposals, grant budgets, and supporting documentsWork with the Director of Development to conduct grants research and create a schedule for proposals and reportsAssist in managing foundation relationshipsCreate and submit interim and final grant reports on time, including narratives of grant activities, reporting on performance measures/project outcomes, and on grant spendingCoordinate with the marketing team in carrying out any required or desired PR or other recognition associated with each awarded grantMaintain records on every grant applied for at Stray Cat Alliance, track the progress of each application, and manage reporting requirementsLog all grant documents and correspondence into an established document management systemWork courteously and cooperatively with staff, volunteers, fosters, adopters, and donors.**QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLSA flair for persuasive and succinct writing is essentialPrevious grant writing experience strongly preferred, though candidates may substitute experience in legal, business, or technical writing if also able to demonstrate the ability to write a story wellAbility to understand both Stray Cat Alliance’s needs and programs, and the needs of grantmakersThorough and exacting research skills; familiarity with grant databases such as the Foundation Center Directory OnlineAbility to craft grant budgetsFirm understanding of performance measurement and ability to understand and collect relevant program data for proposals and reportsAbility to understand and execute complex instructionsSelf-motivated to complete tasks on time, take initiative, and to reach for excellenceDetail-oriented, adaptable, organized, and demonstrated ability to successfully manage multiple projects and tasks with relatively few resourcesMust be able to work well independently and in collaboration with other staffBackground in animal welfare and/or a passion for animals requiredProficiency in MS Word and Excel; additional experience with G-Suite tools a plus**TIME COMMITMENTPart-time with an average of 15-20 hours per week, including weekend and holiday work. The role offers some flexibility in setting work hours as long as deadlines are met without fail and meetings are attended as needed.**To apply: Please submit a cover letter and resume. Application materials should be received by February 18, 2021EMPLOYMENT DISCLAIMER: This job description is not a contract - management reserves the right to change its contents at any time. Stray Cat Alliance does not discriminate on the basis of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, or sexual orientation. Stray Cat Alliance is an Equal Opportunity Employer.*Job Type: Part-timePay: $14.00 - $30.00 per hourWork Location:One locationHours per week:10-19Typical start time:9AMTypical end time:6PMThis Job Is:A good fit for applicants with gaps in their resume, or who have been out of the workforce for the past 6 months or moreOpen to applicants who do not have a college diplomaCompany's website:www.straycatalliance.orgCompany's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/StrayCatAlliance/Work Remotely:Yes

Text: Why Work Here?“We're an amazing and growing team of HR professionals who are passionate about HR and love what we do! This position is initially part-time and could grow to full-time in 2-3 months or sooner over the coming months. The incumbent must have reliable transportation, valid driver’s license, smartphone, PC, and other office hardware to work with clients remotely. Specific responsibilities include:Offering Professional HR services to CAHR Clients - varying in size from under 5 to over 50 employees; either serving as the sole HR professional or providing guidance on projects or serving as a mentor to junior HR professionals.Perform full-cycle HR from recruiting, hiring and onboarding to projects that include updating handbooks, benefits administration, LOA, W/C and claims management, improving performance management, coach/discipline/terminate employees as needed; attend UI hearings, and perform any other task required to meet a company’s HR needs.Full-cycle recruiting – sourcing, screening, hiring, onboardingConducting HR Audits of all HR areas including assessing recruiting, hiring, onboarding benefits, training, evaluations, termination policies, practices and forms and determine gaps; and as needed provide solutions to improve their HR infrastructure.Being proactive and with a critical eye, identifying legal gaps and non-compliance and making suggestions, and as needed, take corrective actionIdentifying need for new processes, procedures and policies and creating them as neededUpdating or creating Employee Handbooks; Westport Commercial, a successful Commercial Real Estate Mortgage Broker offers experienced Intermediaries higher splits, lower friction and more freedom.Westport Commercial is growing, seeking individuals who possess the desire to work remotely, using tools and support provided by Westport CommercialThis is NOT an employment offer but an opportunity to build a business for yourself using our methods, tools, team and track record.Origination positions are full commission, nonsalaried with no caps on your income.Westport Commercial Provides the Following Tools for Success:Branded e-mailOngoing support, guidance and business insightAnalytical support including branded forms and templatesInsights into assessing probable opportunitiesBusiness development methods, marketing, metrics and targetsAccess to proprietary lender relationshipsInsights into lender idiosyncrasies & underwriting methodsParticipation in webinars and team calls, sharing best practicesFinancing memo templates and techniques for getting noticedPublic Relations releasesWeb site placement for credibility buildingUse of various data sourcesUse of Trademarked Logo for business cards, signature block and e-stationary and moreBrand Standard GuidelinesCRMDigital marketingExperienced Originators generally close $25 to $50MM+ of middle market loans, annually. Keeping the bulk of these earned fees should be an Originator's goal. Please note, Origination opportunities are non-salaried.REQUIREMENTSWe are not a bank.We are called Intermediaries, ‘Brokers’ or Originators. Originators work from a home office or executive suite. If no, this is not a good fit.As with any business proposition, there is risk, such as wasted time if you fail. On the other hand, the upside is yours to develop. If you are seeking no risk, this is not a fit.BENEFITSNo other origination platform offers the advantages Westport Commercial provides its professional originators.If you are looking for a great challenge and the opportunity to earn $200,000+++ while having fun and freedom, learning and growing in the BEST business for long term wealth creation, then please apply in confidence.Affiliating with a professional nationally recognized commercial real estate mortgage brokerage company is meaningful to potential clients and lenders. This cannot be taken for granted! At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.
We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 3,500 homes in 13 cities. We have raised more than $80m in funding to date and that’s just the beginning. But enough of the numbers.
What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day easier.
We are looking for a VIP Manager, who will be managing all aspects of the stays for our highest value guests. Internally, this is one of our most cross-functional roles as it works closely with Enterprise Sales, Operations, and Marketing to create personalized experiences and provide concierge-level support in resolving issues.
What you will focus on:
Be the primary point of contact for VIP guests during their stay
Partner with Enterprise Sales, Inbound Sales, and Marketing to understand needs of incoming VIP guests
Coordinate the delivery of personalized experiences by working closely with GMs, Operations and Real Estate.
Consolidate and circulate insights and actionable feedback from guests throughout Blueground
Identify opportunities for improved outcomes for all Blueground guests.
Requirements
What we are looking for:
Successful candidates for this role will have a proven track record of supporting high-end clients by working cross-functionally to find creative solutions to complex problems as well as a desire to contribute to a collaborative team environment. The position is remote-friendly through 2021, with the expectation of the ability to travel to the office in one of our cities several times per week starting in 2022. There are core working hours that are pacific standard time, and generous time-off policies which respect a healthy work-life balance. That said, this is a salaried position that brings commensurate expectations for flexibility to respond to guest and business needs.
7+ years of professional experience
3+ years in a customer-facing role in a start-up environment
Excellent ability to communicate professionally, but with empathy, both verbally and in writing
Strong prioritization and organization skills and the ability to multi-task competing priorities
Nice to have: 3+ years experience in hospitality, real estate, or as an executive assistant
Minimum Bachelor’s degree
Benefits
Your benefits:
Competitive salary
Flexible paid time off
Enhanced parental leave
401k retirement plan
Private life and health insurance plan
Dynamic working environment with talented people
Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in Boston and winter in Dubai!
At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

HireArt is helping our client find a Contract Technical Recruiter to develop recruiting strategies that meet anticipated staffing needs.
You will use your technical knowledge to hire candidates to join the engineering, sales, and data science teams. You will use negotiation skills to help staff bright and talented people who are looking to make an impact in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate will have 1+ years of experience as an internal recruiter.
This is a full-time (40 hours per week), 6-month contract position through HireArt and will be fully remote.
As Contract Technical Recruiter, you will:
Develop recruiting strategies that meet anticipated staffing needs.
Review job orders and employment applications to match applicants with job requirements.
Search for candidates using various sources such as internet recruiting resources, networking, job fairs, recruiting firms, or employee referrals.
Select job applicants and confirm qualifications, refer them to the hiring team, and make recommendations when appropriate.
Interview job applicants as part of the screening process to get information on their work history, job skills, training and education, and inform them of the position’s duties and responsibilities, compensation, benefits, and working conditions.
Analyze employment data related to the position and create reports based on your findings.
Advise management on implementing, organizing, and preparing recruiting programs while providing them with training on interviewing, counseling techniques, performance appraisals, or documentation of performance issues.
Schedule phone screens and coordinate on-site interviews.
Contact applicants to inform them of their application status and conduct background or reference checks on job applicants, particularly those who will be given job offers.
Requirements
Bachelors degree
1+ years of experience as an internal recruiter
Strong negotiation skills
Excellent interpersonal communication skills
Strong social aptitude and ability to build relationships
Technical knowledge to be able to talk to job prospects and understand qualifications
Desired Qualifications:
Coursework in business, human resources, psychology, information technology or a technical field
Previous work experience in sales, research, operations, customer service, information technology, administration, or other related jobs
Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), 6-month contract position through HireArt and will be fully remote.
HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas.

Overview:

Technical Recruiter/Sourcer
Location: Remote
Salary: $32-$38hr (Weekly Pay!)
6 month contract (potential for extension or permanent )
Full-time: M-F (flexible hours)
Benefits: Medical/Dental/Vision
**Please apply if you have 3+ years as a Sourcer for Technical role- supporting recruiters. Proven track record for sourcing Software Engineers, Sr. Technical Program Manager with emerging technology**
Our client is a people-first organization. Their goal of building the global platform for online and live experience relies on our foundation of top talent and strong company culture. Their team is the face of company. They are charged with finding, attracting, and bringing on the best of the best to drive companies growing business and award-winning culture forward. Hiring the best talent globally is no easy feat. However, they have a talented team who has an inspiring story and mission. Each member of their team is invested in telling the company’s story, building the brand, and establishing new processes that challenge the traditional and often dated methods of recruiting.
Duties:
As an in-house Technical Sourcer your main focus will be sourcing for technical roles across the US. Building a pipeline and an expert in LinkedIn recruiter. In this role you’ll act as the “boots on the ground” for sourcing. Partnering closely with the recruitment team to provide support. You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and the hunt to find the best talent!
THE TEAM:
They are a highly collaborative, quick-moving, and innovative team of recruiters, marketers, and coordinators who seek out the best talent for globally. They partner closely with our recruiters to identify their needs and empower them to make mission-critical hiring decisions. The belief recruiting should be a company-wide effort, that candidate experience comes first, and that hiring should be based on relationships and not transactions. The are not fans of conventional post and pray recruiting methods. They are willing to take risks, test new ideas and tools, and rely on data to drive the decisions they make.
Requirements:
4+ years strong Sourcing experience in technical roles- previous experience working in a Tech organization.
Must have experience sourcing Software Engineer, Senior Analyst, Product Analytics, Senior Technical Program Manager, Front End Engineer etc.
Expert using LinkedIn recruiter and other creative methods for sourcing
Understanding tech language- java, phyton etc.
Background working in start-up experience is a plus.
Requires experience with emerging technology.
Proven ability in building strong relationships with recruiters
Ability and experience in a fast-paced environment.
Experience recruiting throughout the US
Passion for providing excellent candidate experience.
ATS experience Mastery of CRM/ATS databases
Must be a pro at sourcing, assessing, and pitching a candidate, all while being providing excellent candidate experience.
A positive, make-it-happen spirit, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-performance environment
Ability to use past and current data to drive decision making and educate leaders
Desire to proactively contribute to recruiting process. You’re always looking for new ways to optimize, and are open to testing new methods and tools
You can articulate vision and culture, and work to understand how it matches a candidate’s career goals and values
Ability to close a candidate, not because you’re great at sales, but because you understand the business need, the candidate’s motives, and can thoughtfully piece it together for everyone’s gain
Ability to nurture top candidates so when the time is right for both them and the business, we can make the right hires
Great interpersonal, written/verbal communications skills, and a sharp sense of humor.
Please send your resume. Thank you!

All of our technicians roll from their homes in our company trucks. Cell phones and laptops are provided. We courier all parts to you.

The technician must be comfortable with interacting with Customers, vendors and other company staff. We have plenty of work and trucks ready to roll!

About Flamingo Appliance Service:

We are a family-owned company, serving Customers from Florida to California. Having grown from one tech to over 100 in just ten short years, we have quickly become an industry leader. We are THE largest independent appliance service company in the country. With this growth has come the opportunity – the need – to develop our own talent. Our leadership has developed from within. Come join us… help us Change the Industry!

You love sales, but you also want to sell a product that is innovative and can makes a real difference in people’s lives.


We are Smarter Alloys, and we are offering you that opportunity.


Smarter Alloys is at the forefront of the smart materials revolution. An innovator in shape memory materials, Smarter Alloys is enabling a transformation in design and utility of products and devices used by everyone, everywhere. Smarter Alloys’ Multiple Memory Material™ technology unlocks the full potential of shape memory alloys to be materials that truly function like machines. With applications ranging from wearable technology to medical devices, Multiple Memory Material is a platform technology that expands the application space of shape memory materials across a wide range of industries.


Our newest product, the Paradigm series endofile, is poised to change the face of endodontics, by allowing doctors to provide more precise and effective care than ever before. By utilizing our Multiple Memory Material™ technology we have designed the new Paradigm series endofile to have a flexible core and a strong cutting edge. It is a hybrid microstructure that offers flexibility without trade-offs.


As we enter launch phase we are looking for a new Endodontic Sales Representative to increase our presence in oral care offices across the United States.


Endodontic Sales Representative


As our new endodontic sales rep, you will be responsible for all Paradigm sales and support in the United States.


Succeeding in this role means much more than just having good sales skills. You also have an excellent grasp of the endodontic industry and can talk with authority to dental professionals. You are able to confidently build strong relationships with endodontists and administrators and become a trusted product advisor.


Ideally, you also have a specific background in endodontic/dental sales, or previous experience selling nitinol-based medical devices (stents/tubes/wires). You bring a strong knowledge base to the role and are eager to learn much more.


You’re a terrific communicator and are comfortable selling to a wide variety of people, whether it’s over the phone or face-to-face. You’re highly detail-oriented, self-motivated, and comfortable working independently from home or on the road. The only limit to your success will be how hard you are willing to work.


Practically speaking, you will:


Develop a deep understanding of our product line, particularly Paradigm endofiles and our Multiple Memory Material technology
Be flexible and responsive to the needs of your customers
Build out a customer list and become a trusted source for all your customers’ needs
Work closely with dentists and endodontists to help them understand the product and use it effectively
Provide guidance on the safe and effective use of our products
Support local, regional and national trade shows as needed.
Achieve and exceed sales quotas while managing the territory within assigned expense budgets.
Build and maintain strategic relationships with both dealer reps and key customers by co-traveling and direct selling activities.
Develop and present business plans and promotions to customer base that drives results.
Effectively uses CRM to properly manage sales opportunities within the territory.

You will have responsibility for a huge territory, a unique and proprietary portfolio with lots of differentiation, and the ability grow the role as wide as you can imagine.

This is a tremendous opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a dynamic, growing company and eventually build your own team of salespeople.


Working @ Smarter Alloys


This is a full-time permanent position. Smarter Alloys is based out of our Cambridge, Ontario office, though you will have lots of flexibility in how and where you work. You will have the opportunity to work out of your home office or spend as much time on the road as necessary.


We offer a competitive compensation package that is commensurate with experience, as well as the ability to build and grow your own role. [Our compensation package includes base pay plus variable bonus based on achieving and driving results.]


We are a small, innovative and fast-moving company that is on the cutting edge of the medical device industry. We have aggressive growth goals and are looking for someone who is willing to put in the work to help us get there. If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you.


Qualifications


A strong background in dental or endodontic sales
Proven experience meeting or exceeding monthly targets
Experience with Nitinol-based medical devices in the dental or healthcare sector
Possess high level sales skills with a successful track record
Strong and effective planning and prioritization skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
A Bachelor's degree
3+ years outside sales experience
Valid driver’s license with acceptable driving record


How to Apply


We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us with the “Help” button in the application.

Smarter Alloys and all Smarter Alloys Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law.

We will review applications as they are received and look forward to hearing from you

We are looking for an ambitious and motivated Sales Development Representative to join our growing team!


At JustPremium, we bring creativity to digital advertising.

We deliver engaging experiences for major brands, reaching audiences around the world.

Our creative, inquisitive and energetic team is comprised of 130 people, across 13 offices, including London, New York, Brussels, Düsseldorf and Mexico City, and our headquarters in Amsterdam. Here you will meet people who are passionate, work hard, and think differently to deliver premium results to every project. Join our team, develop your skills daily, have fun, and help us to expand one of the most dynamic ad-tech scales-up in the world.


As our SDR you will help grow our expanding list of top tier advertisers. This is an essential role as you will be the fuel of the sales organization. You will be responsible for helping secure meetings with brands and medium to large sized ad agencies.


You’ll be joining our aim to bring Creativity to Digital and work independently in this new role on our Demand team.


If you would like to work in an environment where…

You collaborate with people who are energetic, creative and helpful
You have the opportunity to develop your skills and support your co-workers so that we can excel as a team.
We value equality and embrace diversity


…Then you would be a great candidate if you have the traits below:

Experience:

1-2 year of sales or media planning experience
Experience with PipeDrive, Outreach (or any other automated outreach tool), and LinkedIn Sales Navigator is a plus, but not a requirement
A Bachelor's degree from accredited college or university


Skills:

Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to write/speak professionally and succinctly
Naturally curious, you love learning and improving yourself
You have integrity and the genuine desire to educate and help organizations
Amazing organisation and planning skills
Goal focussed
You embrace and quickly adap to new tools and technology
A high level of energy, motivation, initiative, discipline and commitment


What You'll Be Doing (daily/monthly tasks)

Prospect quality leads and generate meetings through cold email and call campaigns
Qualify inbound leads and triage to the sales team
Work with Sales Management to create and implement new prospecting strategies
Identify revenue opportunities within verticals and time them appropriately based on seasonality
Using social media to build trust and your online reputation
Leverage CRM and prospecting tools to execute, track and optimise outbound campaigns
Anticipate seasonal activities to drive meetings at the appropriate time of year
Work with sales team to identify appropriate sales strategies based on prospect needs
Contribute to JustPremium team knowledge and best practices in new business and expansion sales excellence, industry, market feedback and customer value


What You Will Love About Us

We are one of the coolest ad-tech companies around
We offer great responsibility, ownership and a chance to grow and develop
You will work with motivated JustPremium teams around the globe. With 28 different nationalities, it is an intercultural experience
Paid vacations/Healthcare/Flexible working
Flexible working environment – currently this is WFH and we expect this to be a 50/50 split of working from home/office in the future


We are looking forward to seeing your application!

JobTitle: Clinical Research Associate - Oncology (virtual in the Western U.S.)
Text:
Requisition Number2013
Employment Type:Regular
We’re a global, mid-size CRO that pushes boundaries, innovates and invents — because the path to a cure for the world’s most persist diseases is not paved by those who play it safe, but by those who take pioneering, creative approaches, and implement them with quality and excellence. We are experts, bright thinkers, dreamers and doers and, together, we are changing the way the world experiences CROs, in the best possible way.
Our Clinical Research Associates (CRA) are home-based. Worldwide offers a wide range of industry-best benefits that include unlimited PTO, 10 paid holidays and matching 401(k).

To be considered for the CRA role, candidates will ideally have 5 years of experience in field monitoring for site qualification, initiation, interim monitoring, site management and study close-out visits for studies in accordance with Good Clinical Practices (GCPs) and applicable local and international regulations and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). Our CRAs are responsible for the quality of data submitted from study sites. In addition, CRAs must assure timely submission of data, including appropriate reporting and follow-up for all safety events by site personnel.

Experience in Oncology is required.

Requirements:

2+ years of experience as a Clinical Research Associate
Bachelor degree or equivalent education and experience
Oncology experience required
Willingness to travel required

Public Goods is a DTC e-commerce company, the digitally native, membership-driven, one-stop-shop that offers high-quality, sustainable essentials across grocery, household, and personal care. Public Goods' mission is to make premium-quality, healthy and sustainable products more accessible. We value the environment and we believe that together, our small choices can make a big impact.
It is an exciting time to join Public Goods. You will have opportunities to make an unprecedented impact on defining the future of the business. We value diversity and inclusion, and we welcome people from different backgrounds and perspectives. Public Goods received series A funding in 2020.
Duties:
Build overall strategy across PR and Influencer space that will position Public Goods as a buzz-worthy brand
Establish and nurture relationships with publications, websites, reviewers, influencers, affiliates, and other media partners.
Build brand awareness and generate excitement around shopping through strategic and proactive consumer PR programs and strategic community engagement communications.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to identify key trends (industry/broad consumer marketplace) and opportunities to advance Public Goods’ business priorities.
Align PR strategies with business milestones and work in close partnership with internal stakeholders across marketing, sales, and product to ensure timelines, budgets, and deliverables meet the needs of the business.
Manage affiliate marketing programs
Build PR team, recruit and manage one junior PR
This is a remote position
Requirements
Self-starter with 6-8 yrs minimum experience at a PR agency. Experience with DTC/eCommerce is a plus.
Knowledge of and experience working with diverse and multicultural audiences
Excellent writing abilities
Strong manager and team player who can work well with others
Understand how to use data to power content and PR success
Have a track record of selecting and managing relevant vendors and partners
Bachelor’s degree in public relations, journalism, marketing, or a related field
Benefits
Competitive compensation package salary + equity.
100% covered Medical/Dental/Vision/telemedicine services for employees
Public Goods lifetime membership and monthly credits to both Public Goods and a monthly stipend for books of your choice!

LA Regional Organizer
Reports to: Chief Strategist

Location: Los Angeles, remote (potential office post COVID)_

Status: Full-Time with Benefits


Are you a dynamic, accomplished organizer and relationship-builder wanting to make a difference on climate change? We are looking for a smart, collaborative, enthusiastic, professional to lead our Climate-Safe California partnership and organizing efforts in Southern California. Working collaboratively, we will accelerate equitable climate policy based on the latest science and the rapidly worsening climate reality globally, and in California.


About The Climate Center

The Climate Center, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, works to deliver rapid greenhouse gas reductions at scale, starting in California. Founded in 2001, The Climate Center played a key role in the tremendous growth of Community Choice Agencies (CCAs), local government-led alternatives to investor owned utilities. CCAs grew from 2 to 23 over the past 6 years and now provide 88% clean energy to over 11 million Californians.
The Climate Center has launched a bold, science-based campaign, Climate-Safe California, to accelerate climate action timelines in California, catalyzing other states, our nation and countries around the world to greater action for a climate-safe future.


Our goal is that California, the world’s fifth largest economy, achieves net-negative emissions, draw down of past emissions greater than current emissions, by 2030, 15 years ahead of current law. This entails for main areas of policy: phasing out fossil fuels in electricity transportation, building and industry sectors; ramping up investments in nature-based sequestration of past emissions on natural and working lands; ensuring resilience in all of our communities to increasing extreme events and power shutoffs; and securing the billions of dollars needed annually to realize these urgent goals.
Our policies and programs, guided by these three key principles, must: (1) be based on the latest science, (2) ensure a just transition for workers, their families and their communities, dependent on fossil fuel industries, and, (3), prioritize climate justice to ensure that low income communities and communities of color are no longer disproportionately harmed by the production and use of fossil fuels, and the growing impacts of climate change with equitable access to climate-friendly solutions.
The Organizer and Partnership Coordinator will play a key role mobilizing California to support this urgently needed campaign.


Position Description

The Organizer is responsible for recruiting and mobilizing and tracking partner organizations across cross sectors starting in the LA Region to build an engaged base of support to take action in support of the urgent Climate-Safe California goals.


Job Responsibilities

Recruiting and organizing new supporters of Climate-Safe California including NGOs, especially environmental justice and climate groups, labor unions, health organizations, business, major donors, opinion leaders, etc.
Keeping The Climate Center supporters in the Southern California region engaged in actions to forward Climate-Safe California
Lead Southern CA area cross-sector network building
Develop strategy and lead regional field organizing activities for policy campaigns
Represent The Climate Center and actively participate in relevant coalitions and community partner meetings
Organize, lead, and participate in community education meetings, trainings, and other events
In coordination with the Government Affairs Manager and others on staff, organize and attend lobbying visits with state and local officials and provide testimony to administrative agencies and governing bodies, and develop and cultivate relationships with lawmakers and decision-makers to advance Climate-Safe California objectives
Provide trainings for community members and coalition partners on how to conduct policy advocacy with decision makers
Contribute to development of advocacy materials including letters, fact sheets, toolkits, action alerts, blog posts, and social media content
Develop local/regional action toolkit for distribution to partners, and follow up with them to get their feedback
Help identify and develop compelling human stories to detail the experiences of communities impacted by fossil fuel production and use, climate injustice and climate impacts
Support webinars/summits/events that educate and mobilize regional partners and supporters
Deliver relevant presentations to partner organizations and the public, working with Director of Communications
Develop and implement an annual workplan with specific, measurable quarterly outcomes for creating a loyal and active base of supporters for the Climate-Safe CA campaign
Assist in supporting fundraising activities in the LA region
Work on special projects to achieve the goals of Climate-Safe California such as:
Preparing agendas for and facilitating Climate Safe CA Mobilizing team meetings
Tracking partners and endorsements
Assisting team members with outreach
Taking meeting notes
Other tasks may be assigned depending on need and after consultation with members of the Management Team


Qualifications

A demonstrated commitment to climate change, climate justice and just transition, and to Climate-Safe CA goals and principles
At least 5 years of organizing, campaign, and/or advocacy experience
At least 5 years working in working in the LA and broader region, with experience with climate change, energy, resilience, nature-based solutions and/or related issues
Proven success working effectively with coalitions and building coalitions
Experience implementing a grassroots campaign
Experience planning and facilitating workshops, trainings, meetings, and other community engagement
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Excellent time-management and organizational skills.
Flexible, team player
Comfortable working independently and taking initiative along with good judgement
Ability to participate in, create and sustain inclusive and engaging spaces for all races/ethnicities, genders, ages, classes, and geographies
Bilingual Spanish/English communication skills preferred but not required
Willing to work evenings and weekends as needed
Regular travel throughout the region and occasional travel to other parts of state (travel post COVID)


Salary and Benefits

Salary is commensurate with experience. The Climate Center also offers an excellent benefits package.
Benefits Package:

Generous medical, dental and vision plan
401(k) plan with opportunity for match.
Dynamic and supportive team atmosphere


At The Climate Center, we care about each other and know that each employee has a whole like that includes time outside of work. The Climate Center provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability or genetics. We value diversity and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply, even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications.
Application Process

Please apply online by submitting a cover letter, resume, short sample of some recent communications (written, video, social media) developed primarily by you, and 3-5 references with your application. Applicants are strongly encouraged to submit materials by February 26, 2021. The position will remain open until filled. No telephone calls, please. Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

JobTitle: Field Service Regional Specialist (NA West) - Attune platform
Text:
Position Location: Remote – GSS West Region USA
Position Summary:
Business Title: Regional Specialist – Band 6/7
Position Objective:
Regional Specialists (RSs) are field based technical experts dedicated to providing remote and in person support to the Field Service Engineers (FSEs) in the US and Canada.
RSs will provide quick, accurate and highly technical instrument support to FSEs on specific instrument platforms. The support will be in the form of direct phone support, interactive remote support, and on-site technical support.
RSs will take a proactive role in FSE support networks, and drive “best practices.”
RSs will partner with Territory Specialists (TSs), Service Development Managers (SDMs), District Managers (DMs), and the Training Department. Success will be measured in part by their ability to equip FSE’s to be more proficient in their work - on-site call avoidance, increased first time fix, reduced repair labor and parts consumption, increased instrument uptime, and reduced support costs as measured by MTTR, MTTI, MPCR, FTF, OCA, etc..
Essential Functions:
Desire to help, teach, mentor, with the ability to hold others accountable - drive best practices
Provide immediate phone and e-mail support to FSE’s
Mentor engineers newly trained on specific instruments – provide feedback
Manage service escalations to quickly resolve the issue and maintain customer satisfaction
Document platform problems and present qualified data to TSs and SDMs
Communicate critical technical instrument information via FSE support networks.
Actively participate in documenting solutions in the discussion databases – edit, annotate, moderate
Assist the Training Department in developing class content and implementation of classes if needed
Travel as needed – triage travel needs and coordinate travel schedule. Travel estimated to be 40-70%. Manage overtime.
Support Territory Specialists (TS) and Service Development Managers (SDM) in the release of new products.
May be required to perform other related duties as required and/or assigned.
Desired Qualifications:
Education
Bachelor’s degree with major in science or engineering and/or equivalent experience.
Masters level degree preferred
Experience
3 years of relevant instrument experience in field service engineering. Must have experience with the Thermo Fisher Scientific models associated with this requisition, as specified in the job title (i.e. qPCR, CE sequencing, NGS, Attune NXT, etc.). A broad range of additional instrument training/experience is beneficial.
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
Technically proficient as to be considered a "specialist" or "expert" on the specified product line.
Candidate must possess excellent people skills. Must have good verbal and written communication skills to effectively troubleshoot technical issues over the phone, through email, or in person.
Excellent troubleshooting skills
Participates as a positive influence on the team
Is required to lift 50 pounds. May be required to stand for long periods of time while performing duties. Must be able to work overtime and flexible shifts. Must be able to work safely with chemicals and hazardous materials.

Why Gainsight?

Gainsight is the leader in customer success and product experience software. The Gainsight Customer Cloud offers everything your business needs to retain customers and drive growth in the age of the customer. As the first cloud of its kind, Gainsight brings together the required technologies to deliver a superior post-sale experience, ensuring customers easily adopt products they've purchased and achieve their desired business outcomes in partnership with their vendor. Gainsight joined the Vista Equity Partners portfolio in 2020.

Leading companies such as LinkedIn, Adobe, Tableau, Splunk, and Box choose Gainsight culminating in our recognition as one of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world by Forbes, one of the fastest-growing private companies in America by Inc. Magazine, and as one of 20 Great Workplaces in Tech by Fortune Magazine. Gainsight's CEO, Nick Mehta, has been recognized as one of the Top SaaS CEOs in America. The company has offices in California, Phoenix, St. Louis, London, and India. Gainsight is a remote-friendly workplace. Gainsight was recognized as one of the Best Work-From-Home companies in 2021.

With diversity and inclusion at the forefront of Gainsight's core values, we promote a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusiveness regardless of, but not limited to, race, gender, sexual orientation, family status, religion, ethnicity, national origin, physical disability, veteran status, or age. By joining the Gainsight team, you'll be playing a significant role in our growth, having an opportunity to put your fingerprints on our next phase of scale and customer impact, giving you the opportunity to apply and grow your expertise.

Job Description

This role will be remote based in Southern California

Enterprise Account Executives are responsible for selling Gainsight solutions to prospective customers. Using a consultative sales approach, the successful candidate will create and cultivate relationships to build and maintain customers for life. The Enterprise Account Executive will work with all Gainsight stakeholders including Customer Success Managers, Professional Services, Pre-Sales, Product Support and Product Management to anticipate and meet customer expectations.

What You'll Do

Sales Process

Achieve sales quota for assigned territory and/or accounts
Maintain appropriate sales development activity to ensure healthy pipeline management
Overcome technical and business objections of prospective customers as necessary
Conduct online or onsite product demonstrations to qualified prospects as necessary
Respond to RFPs for qualified business opportunities where Gainsight is a fit
Work with the Professional Services organization to evaluate training and consulting needs to support implementations
Product and Market Knowledge
Maintain a thorough understanding of the Gainsight product and services offered
Gain an understanding of Gainsight's use in the industry, as well as best practices
Be a subject matter expert for your designated industry and territory

Sales Administration

Work with Business Development Representatives to define and support prospecting efforts within assigned territory.
Enter new leads, contact data, log calls and other sales information for prospects and customers into SFDC
Prepare formal proposals, produce price quotes, work with management on contract negotiations, and gather all necessary paperwork to process orders
Investigate and resolve customer problems with deliveries, payments, product use or implementation (as required)
Provide feedback (customer/prospect needs, industry trends, market perceptions, competitive intelligence, etc.) to company management, Marketing and Product Management teams
Conduct online webinars as a means of generating qualified leads
Plan, promote and conduct round table events in key locations within your territory
Travel to and attend trade shows, conferences, round tables and onsite visits; 40-50% travel per year
Required skills

What We're Looking For

Bachelor's degree/MBA preferred
Minimum of five years experience selling Enterprise Solutions (SaaS and services) into Fortune 1000 companies
Comfort and expertise calling on and presenting to C-Suite level contacts, six figure deal sizes and 6-12 month sales cycle
Proven track record of identifying business issues and creating value while managing multiple stakeholders and decision makers in a complex sales cycle
Demonstrated history of quota achievement/overachievement
Highly competitive, entrepreneurial and self-driven
Experience in the Customer Success field working with Chief Revenue Officers and Chief Customer Officers strategizing to drive .
Job Benefits

At Gainsight, we don't believe in doing things as a "means to an end." Life's too short to have anything short of a joyful work environment that we passionately believe in. We think that "work vs. life" is a false choice created by pundits, cynics and consultants. We also believe that any community (like a company) needs a ton of diversity and a very small number of things that bring us together.

Here are Our 5 Values

Golden Rule: We try to practice the Golden Rule ("Do unto others..." and that sort of thing) by exercising reliability, trust and giving back to each other and our community.
Success for All: We believe that success for our stakeholders—whether our teammates, clients or shareholders—comes with a sincere focus on continuous learning, selfless teaching and making a difference in each other's lives.
Child-like Joy: We aspire to experience child-like joy in our work and lives, injecting a spirit of passion, optimism and laughter into everything that we do.
Shoshin: We believe in a beginner's mind. Don't surround yourself with people like you-diversity breeds creativity.
Stay Thirsty, My Friends: We believe in a totally internally-driven strive for greatness. The solution is think more, not doing more.

Why You'll Love It Here

Our Attitude: We've created a new industry from scratch, and we're on the fast track!
Our Leadership: We offer the leading tech solution for driving Customer Success.
Our ROI: Reduce customer churn, increase up-sell, and improve customer satisfaction.
Our Technology: Deep Salesforce.com hooks, predictive analytics, and a beautiful user interface.
Our Impact: We help our customers make millions of dollars more per year.
Our Clients: Big companies like Box, Adobe, Marketo, and many others.
Our Team: Tech all-stars from Facebook, Box, and others (and top consulting firms like BCG and McKinsey!).
Our Values: They are unique - Golden Rule, Success for All, Child-like Joy, Shoshin, and Stay Thirsty, My Friends.
Our Office: If you showed up one day, you might find anything from karaoke performances to mini-golf championships.

Health benefits include medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability, life insurance, 401k after first quarter of employment, and flexible PTO.

Gainsight is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, where applicable, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

We’re Squeeze, a feel-good company, from the Founders of Drybar.Our mission is to use the power of massage to improve the health and happiness of our guests (and team members!), so they can be their best selves. We are committed to ensuring your experience with us is positive, rewarding and fulfilling.A bit about us: Squeeze was designed to modernize the massage experience. Our revolutionary app-based booking and payment platform simplifies the process, making scheduling, paying, tipping, and rating easy, breezy, Squeezy. Similar to Postmates and Uber, after a Squeeze Massage, instead of dealing with a clunky, stressful checkout process, our guests simply float out with the ability to tip and rate their therapist at their leisure post massage.Personalized services allow guests to select massage preferences as well as control in-room settings from lighting to temperature to sound, all in a beautifully designed space. It’s a completely fresh approach to a way better massage experience.Additionally, we’ve partnered with an equally-minded “feel-good” nonprofit: Canine Companions for Independence. Canine Companions improves the lives of people with disabilities by providing highly trained assistance dogs at no charge to the recipient. Here’s how we’re partnering with them:- For every membership sold, Squeeze is helping to provide a day of canine support to a person with a disability through Canine Companions for Independence.- Local events throughout the year where Squeeze employees will have the opportunity to participate and volunteer.- And… Puppy Time! Periodically throughout the year, Canine Companions will bring puppies to our shop to brighten our spirit and day!*THE FEELS: OUR FIVE CORE VALUES*THE FEEL-GOOD REVOLUTIONWe give more than massages. We help our customers feel relaxed, grounded, centered and cared for, so they can be better mothers, bosses, husbands, coworkers, neighbors, and friends. We make the world a better place by gettin’ the good feels flowin’.DO WHAT YOU LOVE AND LET IT LOVE YOU BACKWe’re passionate about what we do, so we give it our all, each and every day. And it turns out, the more we give, the more we get back, which is pretty squeezing sweet.LITTLE THINGS ARE BIG THINGSWe believe that sometimes the smallest things have the biggest impact. These little gestures may seem insignificant, but they add up to a meaningful difference in our guest’s experience, and the way we make them feel. So, don’t just think big. Think small.BE CURIOUS AND CONFIDENTNobody likes feeling stiff or stuck. That’s why they get massages! And what’s true for the body is true for the soul. If we stretch ourselves to learn and grow, we’ll be invincible, both as individuals and as a company.SHINE BRIGHTHuman touch is essential for life, and the benefits are astounding. In addition to elevating mood and reducing stress, studies show that a friendly touch releases oxytocin—the "cuddle hormone"—which promotes feelings of trust, empathy, and love. It starts with us. Our hands to their hearts. So love what you do, and let your power radiate the warmth and goodness the world needs.*YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES AT SQUEEZE*- Develop and maintain detailed financial models to support the company budget and 5 year long-term strategic plan- Build dynamic, detailed and scalable financial and operational models driven by key financial and operational metrics- Partner with cross functional teams to develop financial Opex & Capex forecasts with value-added insight, including monthly meetings to identify key risks & opportunities- Perform fluctuation analyses between forecast and actual results- Generate financial reports and presentations to support internal reporting including updating monthly financial reviews and quarterly board materials for executives- Maintain same shop comp models, and track key KPIs- Develop financial business cases for promotional campaigns and track performance- Analyze pricing strategies including promotions, package sizes, competition- Work to refine our planning/forecast processes and spread accountability throughout the organization- Help drive new initiatives by creating detailed business cases to evaluate and support decision making- Manage franchisor to franchisee payments process & ensure franchisees have adequate insight to financial distributions- Work closely with Accounting/Bookkeeping to ensure all transaction data is in order- Support franchisee partners on shop development & improving financial performance*EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS*- 3+ years in investment banking or corporate finance- Undergraduate degree in accounting, economics, mathematics or finance- Ability to work well in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and exhibit flexibility- Extraordinary Excel / financial modeling skills- A natural at translating data into insights & communicating those in layman's terms- Outstanding organizational skills with the ability to multitask- Intermediate to advanced knowledge of accounting- Experience with Tableau preferred- Experience with franchise systems that have a large membership component*BENEFITS & PERKS*- Competitive salary with bonus potential- Meaningful stock option grant after one-year of employment- 2-weeks vacation- Health benefits- A revolutionary, feel-good culture- 1 free Mid Squeeze (50-minute massage) a month- Puppy time (seriously, through our partnership with Canine Companions for Independence, you get to participate in events throughout the year that include quality time with puppies!)If you want to be involved in growing and shaping a feel-good revolution with ongoing career opportunities, then we’d love for you to be part of our team and exciting future.We look forward to hearing from you!Job Type: Full-time

JobTitle: Manager, Domestic Field Application Scientists - US remote
Text:
Position can be based anywhere in the US, in close proximity to an airport.

Position Summary:
Field Application Scientists (FAS) for Thermo Fisher Scientific’s Transplant Diagnostics (TDX) division are responsible for supporting TDX’s annual initiatives and priorities through key activities that center around facilitation of field-based product demonstrations, product training, and product troubleshooting.
The Manager, Domestic Field Application Scientists’ primary responsibility will be to manage the activities of an FAS team. In addition, this individual will be required to maintain a deep understanding of, and practical familiarity with, key product lines. The candidate will make routine use of this product line knowledge when working closely with TDX’s Domestic and LATAM customer base. Further use of TDX product line knowledge and application will be instrumental in the development and subsequent execution of worldwide technical workshops, to drive the TDX division’s long history of providing continued education in the field of Transplantation/HLA.
Key Responsibilities:
Coordinate and approve FAS activity and planning. Understand commercial initiatives and assist in prioritization during scheduling conflicts
Maintain metric-driven success and accountability through SFDC and Concur
Ownership of experimental plan creation and facilitation of field-based product line troubleshooting. Collaborate with the Technical Application Specialists when troubleshooting is required as part of a Customer Inquiry.
Assign and perform customer demonstrations/trainings to facilitate sales of new products and development of KOLs
Travel as needed to tradeshows, workshops and customer laboratories in support of commercial activities
Increase FAS visibility to the organization by showcasing success stories and accomplishments
Champion the practice of maintaining close relationships with FAS colleagues, with the intent to promoting collaboration, sharing of best-practices, learning, and overall communication across the FAS team
Implement and manage strong relationships between FAS and Account Managers by working closely with commercial management to develop best practices and rules of engagement within a matrixed environment.
Maintain proficiency in legacy TDX product lines, software applications, equipment and keep current with advancements in the field of transplantation/HLA. Coordinate with internal tech support to arrange for continuing education opportunities to develop staff technical acumen for all product lines.
Search for and identify opportunities for clinical studies and white papers
Maintain an up-to-date understanding of current Commercial initiatives and strategies; maintain close collaboration with TDX Commercial team to act on current initiatives and opportunities
Lead and/or participate in cross divisional customer experience teams to scope and design standardized business processes
Collect team feedback of ‘voice of the customer’ and provide product feedback to departments such as R&D, Marketing and Tech Support
Manage team T&E forecasting and budget
Develop PMD plans and goals with FAS team
Minimum Qualifications:
A Bachelor’s degree, or greater, from an accredited higher learning institution in the Biological or Chemical Sciences.
At least seven (7) years of related working experience required, preferably in an HLA Laboratory or related HLA establishment
At least five (5) years management experience is preferable.
Preferred Qualifications:
Direct experience and knowledge of TDX’s Antibody Detection and/or Molecular Typing products is preferable.
Strong knowledge and comfort with Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Demonstrate success and comfort with creation and facilitation of technical programs and curriculums to both small and large audiences.
Schedule and complete customer or channel partner visits on short notice to provide urgent product assistance.
Take complex subjects and communicate the subject clearly and effectively to an audience of differing levels of familiarity.
Effectively able to multi-task responsibilities and activities, and adapt to sudden changes in expectations and job needs.
Exercise independent discretion and judgment in execution of duties and decisions.
Effectively communicate, both orally and in writing, to management, customers, and third parties.

We’re Squeeze, a feel-good company, from the Founders of Drybar.Our mission is to use the power of massage to improve the health and happiness of our guests (and team members!), so they can be their best selves. We are committed to ensuring your experience with us is positive, rewarding and fulfilling.A bit about us: Squeeze was designed to modernize the massage experience. Our revolutionary app-based booking and payment platform simplifies the process, making scheduling, paying, tipping, and rating easy, breezy, Squeezy. Similar to Postmates and Uber, after a Squeeze Massage, instead of dealing with a clunky, stressful checkout process, our guests simply float out with the ability to tip and rate their therapist at their leisure post massage.Personalized services allow guests to select massage preferences as well as control in-room settings from lighting to temperature to sound, all in a beautifully designed space. It’s a completely fresh approach to a way better massage experience.Additionally, we’ve partnered with an equally-minded “feel-good” nonprofit: Canine Companions for Independence. Canine Companions improves the lives of people with disabilities by providing highly trained assistance dogs at no charge to the recipient. Here’s how we’re partnering with them:- For every membership sold, Squeeze is helping to provide a day of canine support to a person with a disability through Canine Companions for Independence.- Local events throughout the year where Squeeze employees will have the opportunity to participate and volunteer.- And… Puppy Time! Periodically throughout the year, Canine Companions will bring puppies to our shop to brighten our spirit and day!*THE FEELS: OUR FIVE CORE VALUES*THE FEEL-GOOD REVOLUTIONWe give more than massages. We help our customers feel relaxed, grounded, centered and cared for, so they can be better mothers, bosses, husbands, coworkers, neighbors, and friends. We make the world a better place by gettin’ the good feels flowin’.DO WHAT YOU LOVE AND LET IT LOVE YOU BACKWe’re passionate about what we do, so we give it our all, each and every day. And it turns out, the more we give, the more we get back, which is pretty squeezing sweet.LITTLE THINGS ARE BIG THINGSWe believe that sometimes the smallest things have the biggest impact. These little gestures may seem insignificant, but they add up to a meaningful difference in our guest’s experience, and the way we make them feel. So, don’t just think big. Think small.BE CURIOUS AND CONFIDENTNobody likes feeling stiff or stuck. That’s why they get massages! And what’s true for the body is true for the soul. If we stretch ourselves to learn and grow, we’ll be invincible, both as individuals and as a company.SHINE BRIGHTHuman touch is essential for life, and the benefits are astounding. In addition to elevating mood and reducing stress, studies show that a friendly touch releases oxytocin—the "cuddle hormone"—which promotes feelings of trust, empathy, and love. It starts with us. Our hands to their hearts. So love what you do, and let your power radiate the warmth and goodness the world needs.*ABOUT YOU*- You are an extremely experienced, business-savvy and people-oriented operations & training manager with 5-10 years experience working in high-volume franchised retail service businesses.- You are obsessed with creating effective, turn-key training programs to help operating partners drive their bottom line.- You have a hospitality orientation, strong sense of urgency, and warm demeanor with effective communication skills.- You understand the importance in maintaining brand consistency across regions and will stop at nothing to ensure our operating partners are fully equipped to deliver exceptional guest and team member experiences.- You are passionate about all things health and wellness and wholeheartedly believe in the benefits of massage for a balanced lifestyle.- You can’t help but grow and are constantly striving to be your best self, and you’re excited to leap into a rewarding adventure with a new Squeeze family.*YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES AT SQUEEZE*- Learning & Development- New Shop Openings- Existing Shop Operations- Additional Responsibilities*EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS*- 5-10 years in retail, preferably hospitality and / or service-related experience- Franchise experience with a strong sense of how to support Operating Partners & manage strong personalities- Unparalleled understanding of how to create effective training curriculum to drive business results*BENEFITS & PERKS*- Competitive salary with bonus potential- Meaningful stock options- 2-weeks vacation- Health benefits- A revolutionary, feel-good culture- 1 free Mid Squeeze (50-minute massage) a month- Puppy time (seriously, through our partnership with Canine Companions for Independence, you get to participate in events throughout the year that include quality time with puppies!)If you want to be involved in growing and shaping a feel-good revolution with ongoing career opportunities, then we’d love for you to be part of our team and exciting future.We look forward to hearing from you!Job Type: Full-time

Tinder is on a mission to change the world by bringing people together and facilitating millions of connections that otherwise might not have been possible. We’re looking for a contract technical recruiter to help us attract top talent and grow our awesome Engineering team across California .
This will be a highly impactful contract role responsible for partnering with Engineering teams to understand staffing needs and work collaboratively on recruiting strategies. The ideal candidate for this role has a consultative approach with exceptional analytical and interpersonal skills, and experience in tech recruiting. If you’re passionate about developing recruiting strategies that connect meaningfully to our growing business needs, then this is the right role for you.
This role will be hired through a third party partner and remote/virtual across the U.S.
In this role you will:Partner closely with the business to identify, build and execute effective recruiting strategies to engage the best and the brightest engineering talentResponsible for full life cycle, recruiting support for engineering teams within TinderBuild and maintain a network of technical talent through ongoing relationship managementEstablish and maintain relationships with hiring managers, and proactively report on pipeline activity to facilitate effective recruiting and hiring discussionsMeasure performance metrics to drive continuous improvement in technical sourcing and recruiting strategies and partner with peers in the execution of these strategiesManage an outstanding and efficient candidate process and experienceServe as an internally and externally-facing representative of Tinder and our recruiting team
We're looking for:3+ years of experience recruiting for a variety of positions with an emphasis on software and mobile engineering across multiple regionsDemonstrated success sourcing and closing technical talent in a high-growth environment within the technology industryStrong knowledge of a web-based ATS, preferably GreenhouseMust be a great networker and have a track record organizing and attending meetups, conferences, and events as a way to attract candidatesExperience with progressive sourcing techniques including direct sourcing and internet data mining and recruiting techniques such as search engines, Boolean search strings, LinkedIn and other online networking communitiesSelf-motivated and driven to succeed while needing minimal supervisionOrganized, able to work in fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks as well as adapt to business priorities that change quicklyMust have a passion for the “the hunt” and no fear in picking up the phone to identify and sell passive candidates on opportunitiesCommitment to utilizing your leading edge recruitment techniques, working hard and having fun in a dynamic environment


As part of our team, you’ll enjoy:
Working on a product that has an immediate impact on people’s lives all around the worldCollaborating with a team of creative, fun and driven colleaguesComprehensive health coverage, competitive salary, 401(k) employer matchOther perks and wellness benefits like a fitness membership subsidy, paid concierge medical membership, pet insurance offerings, and a commuter subsidyAccess to mental health resourcesFertility preservation benefitsNo Meeting Wednesdays, an annual Learning + Development stipend, and access to a wide range of product and service discounts through PerkspotCharitable donations match up to $15,000 annuallyMonthly and weekly interactive virtual events including Book Club, trivia with prizes and yoga workoutsThe opportunity to join six active Employee Resource Groups (ERGs)
At Tinder, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our product, and our community. We strive to make our workplace an inclusive and diverse environment, giving people from all walks of life the opportunity to have a voice. We champion and encourage those who bring different perspectives, ideas, and creativity to join our team dedicated to bringing people together across the globe. Tinder is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace where we welcome all people regardless of sex, gender identity, race, ethnicity, disability, or other lived experience.

Financial Analyst - Decision Support (Remote)

We are hospitals and affiliated medical groups, working closely together for the benefit of every person who comes to us for care. We build comprehensive networks of quality healthcare services that are designed to offer our patients highly coordinated, personalized care and help them live healthier lives. Through collaboration, we strive to provide all of our patients and medical group members with the quality, affordable healthcare they need and deserve.

The Financial Analyst – Decision Support assists with the planning and implementation of DSS systems, servers and other system integration related components to ensure high levels of availability and security of the core organizational applications. Links component subsystems and ensure they work together as a unit. The position will have a supporting role of developing and analyzing the contribution margin analysis.

Job Responsibilities/Duties
Plans, develops, and implements technological applications that are customized to meet an organization’s needs. Applies thorough knowledge of financial analysis and systems technology to identify and design solutions within decision support systems. Participates in the development and improvement of the company’s business data and collection processes.
Consults with administration and business units to determine needs of integrations. Certifies corporate policies and definitions are applied at newly integrated facilities. Ensures that the organization's computer and network systems are up to date and consistent with the latest technological trends.
Understands the needs of end-users and creates a process, if necessary, to capture the data. Partners with Finance, IT, Finance Operations, and other related functions to verify and ensure the accuracy and completeness of the data. Analyzes and corrects process logic problems.
Works with hospital operations to ensure contribution margin analyses are reporting service lines meaningful to each unique facility. Helps produce and/or set up contribution margin templates at each facility when needed.
Partners with various lines of business and departments to help manage change and understand the operational impact. Maintains and communicates project status reports and tracking, delivering projects timely.
Qualifications

Minimum Education: Bachelor’s Degree Required. Master’s Degree of Business Administration preferred.
Minimum Experience: Three (3) years experience with system integrations, cost accounting, and productivity analysis required. Five (5) years healthcare experience required. Demonstrates excellent organizational skills/abilities and is detail oriented. Ability to define a complex problem, collect data, establish data, and draw a valid conclusion. Ability to maintain a work pace appropriate to the workload. Demonstrates customer service skills appropriate to the job. Ability to effectively communicate in a clear and concise manner.

Req. Certification/Licensure: None.

Employee Value Proposition

Prospect Medical Holdings, Inc., is guided by a diverse and highly experienced leadership core. This group maintains the vision that has made Prospect a needed difference-maker in the lives of so many patients today, and many executives contribute to our continued efforts. As a member of our highly effective team of professionals, benefit eligible positions will receive:

Company 401K
Medical, dental, vision insurance
Paid time-off
Life insurance

Prospect Medical Systems has a zero-tolerance policy regarding the use of drugs and alcohol. Our Company is committed to maintaining a productive, drug free workplace that keeps employees and patients safe from harm. For this reason, we require applicants to pass a screening for drug use as a condition of employment. This includes: alcohol, marijuana, cocaine, opiates and methamphetamines.

How to Apply

To apply for this role, or search our other openings, please visit http://pmh.com/careers/ and click on a location to begin your journey to a new career with us!

We are an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to veteran status, disability, race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or other protected characteristics. If you need special accommodation for the application process, please contact Human Resources.
