Support the roadmap strategy for the software product portfolio
Identify and analyzes market trends and competitive strategy.
Collect and analyze VOC from customers and internal stakeholders for customer requirements
Be the champion for user experience
Works collaboratively with cross functional team members to drive growth for the business segment.
Partner with the instrument product management on NPI
Lead sustaining activities for existing product line
Regular updates and present to leadership team on project status
Identifies opportunities for increasing customer and business value through product differentiation.
Leads new product development process from concept through commercialization, including voice of customer research, definition of customer and product requirements and value proposition, manage product launches and sales training.
How will you get here?
Education
Bachelors, Masters or PhD in Business, Life science, Computer Science or equivalent required.
Experience
Minimum 2+ years of relevant experience required
Strong software background required
Understanding of life sciences, genomics, or molecular biology and/or qPCR technology is preferred
Business development skills and cross-functional team leadership experience required
Experience in managing multiple stakeholders and resolving conflict within teams.
Demonstrated effectiveness in marketing, product management or strategy role including participating in market analysis, planning and new product development
Strong customer facing experience required
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
Highly self-motivated leader with ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects
Ability to plan, execute and measure with a strong sense of urgency to drive results.
Ability to be successful in a highly matrix environment
Ability to see new business opportunities, set and meet aggressive objectives and develop strong working relationships will be required for success
Ability to manage project scope, budget and schedule to achieve timely completion of project deliverables

Description - External
At Wheeler Financial from Pitney Bowes, your success is our success.
Regional Sales Executive – Wheeler Financial from Pitney Bowes (WF) is a new bank-owned equipment leasing and finance company in the U.S. and leverages Pitney Bowes brand as well as an existing list of over 750,000 active customers. WF provides a full product suite of financing and lease options for Pitney Bowes customers’ equipment and capital expenditure needs and has focus on the following industries, Manufacturing, Construction, Healthcare/Medical, Food & Bev, IT and Office Space.
The Position: Regional Sales Executive (RSE)
The Regional Sales Executive (RSE) is responsible for marketing various loan & lease products to our targeted industry segments and customer base. RSE is required to be located within the assigned territory. Travel is required weekly to visit customers and prospects. The RSE role requires a strong background in sales and credit with a high degree of expertise in various finance structures including operating leases and loans. You will be expected to develop a territory and grow the territory to significantly larger numbers in subsequent years. The RSE is expected to work closely with the Wheeler Financial team to develop a strong pipeline, have familiarity with SuperTrump, Salesforce.com, and be proficient in financial analysis.
The Candidate:
5+ years of successful Direct Sales experience in equipment financing/leasing.
This candidate is required to have a passion for excellence and embody a strong work ethic which will be essential for the success of this position. We are looking for a solid team player that can develop strong relationships with internal and external customers. WF is looking for a person who is excited to cultivate a territory by cold calling on prospects from an existing Pitney Bowes customer database as well as their existing client base. The candidate must embrace the Wheeler culture of a strong risk and compliance-driven business which clearly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and our company. The candidate will be responsible for completing all applicable training and compliance programs (Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance, Market etc). We are looking for an individual who is excited to work hard, have fun and be part of a growing team backed by 100 years of Pitney Bowes’ winning culture.

Qualifications
Qualifications - External
Qualification:
Minimum 5 years cash flow lending experience meeting/exceeding sales quota
Strong business acumen and technical expertise (product and structure familiarity)
Background in credit or risk training a plus
Demonstrated ability to engage clients through direct origination/channel development
Excellent planning, organization and communication skills (both verbal and written), combined with a positive, mature and professional attitude.
Strong interpersonal and customer service skills
Strong attention to detail and excellent follow-up
Self-starter … takes initiative to learn in a rapidly changing and fluid environment
Strong teamwork and demonstrated ability to own end-to-end sales process including initial client engagement, application/credit approval and client onboarding
Need to facilitate the collection and dissemination of required business information for underwriting/credit approval
Maintains accurate records of all sales and prospecting activities; prior experience with Salesforce.com preferred
About Wheeler Financial
Wheeler Financial from Pitney Bowes is a financial services company dedicated to helping small and middle market companies gain access to capital. With a broad set of capabilities and financial products, Wheeler Financial can help customers access the working capital required to meet the needs of their business. Wheeler Financial from Pitney Bowes member FDIC is in Shelton Connecticut. www.Wheelerfinancial.com
Pitney Bowes is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that values diversity and inclusiveness in the workplace.
Women/Men/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/LGBTQ are encouraged to apply.
All interested individuals must apply online. Individuals with disabilities who cannot apply via our online application should refer to the alternate application options via our Individuals with Disabilities link.

Advatix was founded by leading performers from Amazon and FedEx as a consulting firm focused on eCommerce, logistics, and fulfillment. XPDEL provides 3PL and 3PF services to an array of eCommerce companies. With a team spread across two continents, the sister companies share a common finance organization. Our Finance team combines traditional financial planning and analysis with broader business decision making and strategy, directly supporting leadership. Finance is embedded in daily operations, supporting both near-term execution and long-term planning. Team members are expected to analyze data and provide recommendations and to lead cross-functional decision-making and implementation of the recommendations.
Role Description
The Finance Intern reports directly to the Director, FP&A and works in support of finance team and company objectives. The Intern carries out responsibilities specifically related to finance, compliance, and accounting. This role is a learn/grow role where the Intern is expected to take on progressively more complex projects and assignments over the duration of the internship.
Key Result Areas
Maintain compliance folders, including creating tracking spreadsheets for all licenses, certificates, etc
Oversee client asset management database (AssetPanda) and support client requests on assets
Support the Finance team with special projects as assigned
Authorities
This position reports to the Director FP&A and has no reports. This is a part-time hourly internship.
Requirements
A robust analytical skill set and questioning mindset
Experience with financial accounting (GAAP, accrual vs cash, etc.)
Experience in creating presentations and written summaries explaining a business case
Skill in analyzing large datasets
Excellent modeling skills (e.g., Microsoft Office Excel; experience with Power BI and SQL a plus)
Ability to work independently, detail-oriented, and execution focused
Strong verbal, written and presentation skills
Meticulous attention to detail
Ability to accurately follow instructions
Understands the need for maintaining high levels of confidentiality
What to Expect
This is a 5-month paid internship for 10-15 hours a week. Work is fully remote and can range from managing a database of client assets to calculating average delivery cost across 8 markets. The expectation is the intern will be able to work independently and create superior work product. Previous interns have received offers from Capital One, Tesla, and Wayfair.
Advatix is committed to an inclusive workplace that does not discriminate against race, nationality, religion, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender, or gender identity. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualiﬁed individual to apply. We are an EEOC Employer.

JOB DESCRIPTION:
We are looking for dynamic, and engaging teachers who can teach kids ages 2-6 in a wide variety of subjects spanning STEM, niche topics like “Monster Trucks,” different languages, etc. Responsibilities include developing curriculum for our asynchronous learning, mapping decks and narratives for live online classes, and fostering strong parent-teacher relationships. You will help manage all things learning to provide a fun and creative experience for our students and families.
WHO WE ARE:
We’ve been known to be described as “the perfect blend of virtual education and unplugged learning designed for children ages 2- 6.” Yes, in those words exactly. More than that, we’re a tight-knit team of spunky educators who believe that learning should be dynamic, interactive and inclusive.
BümoBrain supports parents in need of options aside from traditional schools. Our platform is built based on the following principles: creativity, critical thinking and exploration, backed by 350 years of educators’ experience from around the globe. We offer daily age-specific and unplugged activities that are flexible, accessible, and family-friendly.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Teach small, intimate online Zoom classes of 6 students maximum
Work closely with our edteam to design and develop age-specific curriculum
Manage the learning process from start to finish via ideation and execution
Establish strong relationships with students and parents
Have FUN!
REQUIREMENTS
Fluent in BOTH English AND Tagalog
Someone who can roll with the punches, and think on their feet
Preferably has a background in education, teaching credentials, or relevant experience working with kids
Tactful communicator who is tech-savvy & proficient in Zoom, Seesaw, or willing to learn!
Flexible & capable of quick turnaround for tight deadlines
Strong organizational and time management skills
Multitasker who can juggle multiple responsibilities as once
Has the ability to make anything FUN!
Los Angeles, CA preferred but remote ok (Within the US)
BENEFITS
Work directly with in an emerging startup with an accelerated growth pattern
Potential for rapid promotions if results delivered
Directly make an impact as part of our innovative, tight-knit community

We’re looking for hard-working and proactive individuals who want to develop their career at IDBS and is looking for a “startup” culture with the security of an established company. Our mission is to help people everywhere find a job and company they love. We're transforming an entire industry through the power of transparency. As the worldwide leader in employer branding and insights, our vision is for a world where transparency holds companies accountable to strive to become better employers.

Please note this role is open to remote hiring. Our main office locations are in San Francisco, CA, Chicago, IL and Uniontown, OH.

We are looking for a proactive, innovative, self-starter who wants a hands-on role in building structure, systems, programs, and processes to improve operational efficiency across all of recruiting at Glassdoor! This person should have strong leadership skills, capable of communicating creative solutions, eliciting feedback and collaborating, and delivering innovative solutions to tackle operational initiatives.

What You'll Do:
Lead and mentor a growing team of Recruiting Coordinators
Deliver recruiting data and analytics with weekly, quarterly, and annual reporting on sourcing, interviewing activity, tracking towards hiring goals, and candidate experience
Manage and scale our recruiting systems and tools to maximize workflow efficiency, enhance candidate and employee experience, and ensure compliance and consistency
Identify opportunities for operational improvements across recruiting programs and implement changes to keep them as effective and efficient as possible
Handle the ongoing delivery of projects by identifying cross-functional dependencies, help make resourcing decisions and trade-offs, and building awareness of work across impacted stakeholders
Provide dedicated support to Recruiting leaders helping to prioritize initiatives, influence the design of centralized projects, and help with execution of projects
Own and refine the process and documentation for a world-class experience for candidates, interviewers, hiring managers, and our recruiting team
What You'll Bring:
Minimum 3 years of Recruiting Operations experience
Minimum 1 year of management experience
Advanced Greenhouse ATS experience required
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Experience introducing tools, platforms, and programs
Proficient with: Gem, SeekOut (or similar sourcing tools), LinkedIn, Glassdoor and Gsuite
Proven track record of delivering data-driven insights and translating those into process improvement recommendations
Strong project management skills with experience driving projects from beginning to end
Immigration program experience a plus
Workday experience a plus
Interest in incorporating diversity and inclusion initiatives into recruiting programs
Why Glassdoor?
Work with purpose – join us in creating transparency for job seekers everywhere
100% company paid medical/dental/vision/life coverage, with 80% dependent coverage
Long Term Incentive Plan
401(k) Plan with a Company Match to prepare for your future
Generous paid holidays and open paid time off
Our Commitments
Pay transparency: Pay bands and compensation philosophy are shared publicly to ensure that everyone is paid fairly. Our annual Pay Gap Study found no gender or race/ethnicity pay gap at Glassdoor.
Diversity data transparency: Glassdoor externally publishes diversity information about its employee population to hold ourselves accountable to our commitment to change. We also provide programs and resources to foster a greater sense of belonging for our employees.
Employee feedback transparency: We publicly publish our employee feedback survey responses to ensure everyone has a complete picture of what it's like to work here.
Company performance transparency: Glassdoor will provide candidates easy access to the financial performance of the HR Tech strategic business unit of Recruit Holdings, of which Glassdoor is a part.

Operating transparently at Glassdoor is fundamental to us walking the talk as we advocate for transparency everywhere. The ultimate goal is not just to change how we operate at Glassdoor, but for every employer to follow our lead!

JobTitle: Virtual Health & Wellness Coaching Team Lead
Text:
Nice to meet you, we’re FULLFILL!

At FULLFILL we’re enthusiastically committed to eradicating obesity-related diseases through compassionate support, mindful practice, engaging lessons, a supportive community, self-nurturance, and a lot of fun!

FULLFILL is a brand-new digital hub that encompasses physical, social, mental, and emotional wellness in a fun, engaging platform with live on-camera coaching at its center. Through a whole-person wellness approach, we plan to lead millions to a healthier and happier future.

Will you be a part of our mission?

What does coaching look like at FULLFILL?

Our coaching exemplifies the belief that our participants have the power to transform their own lives. We are simply walking beside them assisting in the discovery of their own solutions and holding them accountable in an authentic and gracious way.

Our coaches are engaging, dynamic, and thrive from meeting with their members face-to-face in a live, virtual on-camera setting.

Our coaches work from a place of deep curiosity; asking powerful questions to help our participants reflect on where they are and where they want to be.

Our coaches are authentic, empathic partners. We engage in weekly experiments with our members; where missed goals and achieved ones are equally celebrated as an opportunity to discover other pathways to success and to learn resilience in the face of adversity.

Our coaches are advocates, who will empower our members to own their journeys and outcomes.

What do our Coach Leads do?

Our Coach Leads are responsible for fostering, challenging, engaging, and cultivating a team of 10 remote coaches

They partner with each coach to discover, provide resources and hold them accountable for their career growth

Facilitate weekly team meetings that encompass everything from training, best practices, sharing resources, team building, and housekeeping

Evaluate coach performance using qualitative and quantitative tools, provide kind, clear, and actionable feedback accordingly

Deliver and coach to disciplinary action as needed

As coaches ourselves and to ensure we understand the nuances of delivering our program, Coach Leads will also support a cohort of members.

A thought and process partner for the coaching org, collaborating closely with the Director of Coaching to envision, build and scale the future of FULLFILL Coaching.

Required Quals

Experience leading remote teams in a 100% virtual environment to grow and hit performance targets

A background and excitement for behavior change, coaching, supportive counseling, positive psychology, wellness, and weight loss for better lifelong health outcomes.

Experience interviewing, coaching, encouraging participants and employees through barriers and the stages of change

Comfortable spending most of your day on-camera interacting live with groups, individual participants, and teammates

Applies the coaching mindset to your own performance and welcomes feedback and the opportunity to evolve your skills

Tenacious and nimble problem-solver, always seeking solutions and sharing best-practices

Technologically adept and up for learning new platforms, programs, with the ability to pass that knowledge on to others

Thrives in a start-up environment, nimble in our priorities and processes

Comfortable with conceptual ideas and broad directions and able to help capture and refine into more concrete directives and processes

The ability to self-manage and motivate others in a remote working environment

Well-practiced written and oral communication skills

Preferred Quals

A graduate of an NB-HWC Approved Health and Wellness Coaching Program

NBC-HWC or ICF certification

Previous health and wellness coaching experience in a virtual, live, on-camera environment

Comp & Benefits

Fulltime salaried position
80 hours of annual PTO
6 Paid FULLFILL Holidays a year
100% Employer paid Health and Dental coverage

FULLFILL, INC is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Avenue 8 Inc HQ San Francisco Real Estate/TechnologyWe are pioneers in the use of creativity, data, and technology to modernize the real estate brokerage industry. The future begins with Avenue 8. We believe agents struggle with too much complex technology. Creates work flow and on-time communications with escrow. Completes and collates our interactive documents and wiring instructions to ensure escrow(s) direct commission funds, as required, to individuals, entities (llc or corporation) and/or other approved entities.Embraces accountability for efficient preparation and delivery of accurate CDAs (commission disbursement authorizations) to escrow officers, to compliance, and to brokerage officers for signatures.Over-communicates in the most timely manner possible, when working in our transaction management platform, fielding questions from agents, and fulfilling requests from the Compliance Manager and/ or the Managing Broker.Performs other duties as assigned, including, for example, tracking of sales (closings), lease (settlements), and updating key data banks inside our back office software platform, which track, update, and safeguard transaction status, dates, list price, sales price, etc.Experience and background positions that are favorable for this role may include: real estate brokerage administration, payment processing, customer service, outside sales, and/or any positions requiring advanced interpersonal communications skills, self-guided work ethic, and high level of attention to detail.A college degree and an active CA real estate license are not required, but will be considered as positive influencing factors in reviewing candidates. JobTitle: Executive Assistant - Opportunity for Working Remotely Los Angeles, CA
Text:
Executive Assistant, VMW Cloud Sales - Job Description
Job Overview:
As the Executive Assistant supporting the VP of VMware Cloud Sales, you will own a range of advanced administrative and executive support related tasks and work independently within established guidelines. You will also need to make decisions in planning, organizing, and scheduling various meetings and project/program reviews.
In this role you will interact with executives across multiple operating companies as well as customers globally in a dynamic work environment, while remaining flexible, dedicated, resourceful and efficient. A high level of integrity and confidentiality is crucial to this role. Extraordinary written and verbal communication skills, independent decision-making ability and attention to detail are equally important.
Job Responsibilities:
Schedule and manage a demanding Outlook calendar, prioritize & resolve schedule conflicts, handle scheduling challenges arising from urgent requests from C-suite staff, external contacts and internal team members.
Liaise with senior level executives including C-suite executives and their assistants throughout VMware and throughout the Dell Technologies family of companies
Coordinate domestic and international travel, including visas, and complete expense reports in a timely manner
Provide support to GM’s direct reports when needed
Coordinate meetings/calls with external customers/attendees and their Executive Assistants
Schedule team meetings (onsite/offsite), team events, etc. including catering, if necessary
Required Skills/Experience:
A strong team player, who thrives in a collaborative setting and works well within a global environment
Able to work with individuals at all levels of the organization
Pro-active, polished, positive and personable with excellent communication skills and an upbeat, “can do” attitude
Ability to take initiative with confidence, think clearly, creatively solve problems and make decisions under pressure
Resilient, ability to manage multiple projects and deliver quality work to deadlines
Discretion, diplomacy and excellent judgment; high degree of integrity when dealing with confidential and sensitive information
Meticulous attention to detail
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel formulas and PowerPoint features
Experience with extensive international and domestic travel itineraries
Desire to learn about the business and be part of our Cloud Services team
Category : General and Administrative
Subcategory: Administrative Support
Experience:

About Shift We believe car buying should be fun, fair, and accessible to everyone. We’ve set out to transform an industry, using technology to bring transparency and convenience to the car buying process.And we aren’t stopping there. We seek to bring that same openness and simplicity to car ownership too, with payments, maintenance, and insurance in one easy app. At SHIFT, we’re building the tools that empower people to buy, own, and sell the cars that make life go. We’ve recently entered the public markets (Nasdaq: SFT) and are experiencing rapid growth. This is a great opportunity to join a hyper growth company changing an industry!As Financing Specialist, you will be responsible for all aspects of fraud detection/fraud investigation/fraud resolution in the Acquisitions unit. This highly motivated individual works closely with the FinOps Team to coordinate further investigation/stip gathering. Reports to Financial Operations Manager.Problems don’t intimidate you, you intimidate problems. Some would call you proactive, but you know you’re doing what needs to be done. You’re looking for a job that’ll give you the tools to kickstart your career, but grant you the autonomy to own your outcomes. You enjoy the challenge of championing new skills to improve the way we work. You’re ready to roll up your sleeves and make your mark.As a Funding and Contract Specialist, you'll be the keeper of the Finance Operations pipeline, an emergent leader as you own the flow of funds to Shift. You will become the Subject Matter Expert in contract funding, fearlessly following-up with our lenders to ensure accurate and timely loan bookings. You’ll work tirelessly with our bank partners and customers to see that each loan is paid and accounted for, ultimately supporting Shift in its mission of putting dreams in driveways.You will work remotely in your own personal Loan Zone (equipment provided) and will report to the Finance Operations Manager (a pretty OK guy).What you'll do: Meticulously manage, track and prevent aged accounts receivables in a fast paced environmentAnalyze loan approvals and audit contract structure (Yes, 2+2 DOES equal 4)Generate loan documents with remarkable speed and precisionHandling customers personal information with love while complying with all federal, state, and local regulations.Maintain lender relationships and hold banks accountable for timely fundingAbility to build meaningful relationships internally and externally; follow-up with customers, field reps, and other outside entities (employers, creditors, etc) to resolve escalationsProvide excellent customer service to all lenders and sales repsWhat you'll haveAbility to thrive under pressure and in a fast paced environmentThe desire to adapt, change, and growThe grit to find solutions to problems where others have failedAn eagle eye and passion for detailStrong communication skillsSupervision/leadership abilitiesAssociates degree or equivalent experienceCollege degree preferred*Who We Are *At Shift, we’re all about growth - which means people who are eager to grow, who are ready to roll up their sleeves and learn new things. We were founded by a scrappy group of visionaries who were by no means “car experts” - so we don’t expect you to be one, either! We’ll take the open-minded go-getter over the pure subject matter expert any day. In that spirit, we also care about building a diverse and inclusive workplace and company. To put it simply, cars are meant for everyone, so we believe our company should be, too. We never discriminate against any candidate on the basis of gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, race, ethnicity, religion, color, national origin, marital status, veteran status or disability status. We welcome and encourage people of all backgrounds and walks of life to apply, even if you’re unsure if you meet all the requirements. (Even if this particular role isn’t the right fit, chances are we will have the right one soon!)*Why Join Now?*Having gone public in October 2020, we are at the beginning of our journey and hope you join us for the ride! Shift is a leading end-to-end auto e-commerce platform transforming the used car industry with a technology-driven, hassle-free customer experience. Shift’s mission is to make buying or selling a used car fun, fair, and accessible to everyone. We provide comprehensive, digital solutions throughout the car ownership lifecycle: finding the right car, having a test drive brought to you before buying the car, a seamless digitally-driven purchase transaction including financing and vehicle protection products, an efficient, digital trade-in/sale transaction, and a vision to provide high-value support services during car ownership.Job Type: Full-timePay: Up to $24.03 per hourWork Location:Multiple locationsBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligible

Text: HR Onboarding Specialist We are looking for an HR Onboarding Manager to oversee the procedures our company follows before and after hiring new employees. HR Onboarding Manager responsibilities include scheduling new hires’ training, creating company policies and processing employment documents. To be successful in this role, you should be able to help new employees adjust to their work environment while making sure our hiring procedures comply with labor laws. Ultimately, you will ensure our hires get a warm welcome and experience smooth onboarding to their new roles.ResponsibilitiesOrganize orientation programs (first day, first week, first month and first quarter)Act as a consultant to new employeesCreate and update our employee handbookMonitor new hire turnover and retention ratesSchedule and oversee training sessionsIntroduce new hires to current employeesAdd new employees’ information to company’s payroll systemCommunicate with new hires before their start date to provide necessary information (e.g. work schedules and contract details)Process employment paperworkCoordinate relocation procedures for expatsLiaise with internal teams to create corporate accounts for new employeesGather candidate experience feedback from new hiresAssist existing employees when they move to a new department or positionSkillsProven work experience as an HR Onboarding Manager or in relevant HR roleGood knowledge of labor legislationFamiliarity with employment paperwork, including terms of agreement, fixed-term contracts and confidentiality actUnderstanding of payroll proceduresExcellent verbal and written communication skillsConfidentiality and work ethicsRelated keywords: human resources, recruiter, hrJob Types: Full-time, Part-timePay: $15.00 - $24.00 per hourBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceDisability insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offTuition reimbursementVision insuranceEducation:High school or equivalent (Preferred)Experience:Human resources: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:Multiple locationsBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processPersonal protective equipment provided or requiredTemperature screeningsVirtual meetings

Bellhop is one of the fastest growing companies in the $30B moving market and is on a crusade to transform the industry into a space that's more trustworthy, reliable, and fun. We do this by combining our first-to-industry tech-enabled logistics management platform with an outstanding crew of movers and drivers to deliver a more enjoyable experience. We have a heart for delivering outstanding customer service in a space that's known for letting you down - and we do that one high five move at a time.… This is where you come in…The City Operations team oversees the largest and densest markets within our portfolio. This will be the team developing, experimenting, and iterating on local operational tactics to drive success within these markets. This will require partnering with cross-functional departments across the company and collaborating on best practices for city operations across regions.This role will oversee the Los Angeles market with full responsibility for market performance and the customer experience in one of our flagship markets.If this sounds right to you, come join our rocket ship! We are overhauling the moving industry, one move at a time.RESPONSIBILITIES:Build and establish the bellhops team - Onboard and coach a team of Moving Pros in your market. You will build a culture of customer focused obsession into the workforce.Manage warehouse operations - You will manage a warehouse location that will be the central meeting point for bellhops and house all your capital assets including moving trucks.Problem Solve - You will be operating a technology platform combined with asset & workforce management in a logistically complex environment. All kinds of obstacles, barriers, problems, and snags happen on a daily basis and you must be ready to solve them as fast as they happen. You see upcoming systemic problems from far away, and nip them in the bud.Ownership and market growth - You will be responsible for your city P&L and quality rating as well as identifying and sharing best practices that benefit the company large-scale. You will be empowered to find innovative ways to succeed in your market - in fact, we provide bonus incentives for doing so.Develop and hone the local ops playbook - You will be building out a new operating model for Bellhops with in-market management. As the pioneer, you will be developing the playbook but also iterating it with each new learning.Partner with internal teams - You will work closely with Bellhops Acquisition, Customer Care, Truck Operations, Quality and other internal teams to unlock success in your market. City Operations taps into HQ resources like Marketing, Accounting, Finance and will need to strike the right balance between city and overall company targets.Grow and adapt to business needs - We are still a startup in a fast growth phase putting new operations and technology processes that are new to an industry. The role can and will change over the course of time and you will be able to rise to the occasion to tackle these changing business problemsQUALIFICATIONSDeep city knowledge - The key to operational success and high quality moves factor is knowing your city like the back of your hand.Entrepreneurial hustler - You have a bias for action. You can thrive in a startup environment and roll up your sleeves to do anything necessary to ensure success.Process acumen - You have the ability to build and document complex processes with many moving parts and dependencies from scratch.Management experience - Management experience with a large hourly or part-time workforce. You possess the EQ to inspire and lead a team. Experience at a Moving Company is a plus.Clear communicator - You are a clear and concise communicator with the ability to synthesize a lot of information quickly and highlight key insights.You have 2+ years of operations experience - Bachelor’s degree required or relevant work experience in lieu of.OUR VALUES:While each member of our team has a specific, clearly defined role, we’re all connected by a strong set of values that’s been developed to build long-term relationships, foster advancement, and guide the decisions we make. We want each individual at our company to grow as we grow. And so we invest in their professional development and support them as they learn new skills and take on bigger challenges.To bring out the best in our people, each day we encourage and celebrate:Innovator’s Mind. Drive to identify opportunities and create solutions to better serve our customers.Owner’s Grit. The commitment to get things done the right way even if it’s the hard way. We never settle for anything less.Servant’s Heart. The devotion to care for others by putting them first and treating them as we’d like to be treated.Playful Spirit. The willingness to approach life with optimism, energy, and lightheartedness.Winning Drive. We relentlessly raise the bar in our efforts. We learn quickly from our mistakes.WHY WORK AT BELLHOP?Because every day you will be able to see the positive impact you have on people’s lives. Moving is considered one of the most stressful experiences people go through, and we have found a way to make it easier and more comfortable.Because you will collaborate with exceptionally talented people. Our tech-enabled approach means you will work with teams of top-shelf engineers, product managers, operations strategists, customer-care specialists, and growth experts. You will also be joining us at a time when you’ll have a huge opportunity to chart the course for our continued growth.Because our culture sets us apart. We have ambitious goals and make sure everyone feels encouraged to own their portion of the business, experiment with new ideas, and take the proper actions to achieve success.Because we take good care of each other. We provide competitive compensation packages that include a significant equity incentive as well as health coverage and accommodations to achieve a sustainable work-life balance.Bellhop believes if we want to build a company that works for everyone—we must include everyone, which is why we're proud to be an equal opportunity employer that complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. Bellhop strictly prohibits and does not tolerate harassment or discrimination against employees, applicants, or any other covered persons because of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, sex, gender, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, citizenship, sexual orientation, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services.Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offParental leaveVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Operations: 2 years (Preferred)Management: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteCompany's website:getbellhops.comBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyOnly full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processPersonal protective equipment provided or requiredSocial distancing guidelines in placeVirtual meetings

Cross Country Healthcare is looking for top talent to join our team

Our solutions leverage our nearly 40 years of expertise and insight to assist clients in solving complex labor-related challenges while maintaining high quality outcomes. We are dedicated to recruiting and placing highly qualified healthcare professionals in virtually every specialty and area of expertise. With more than 9,500 active contracts, our diverse client base includes both clinical and nonclinical settings, servicing acute care hospitals, physician practice groups, outpatient and ambulatory-care centers, nursing facilities, both public schools and charter schools, rehabilitation and sports medicine clinics, government facilities.

Regional Sales Manager - West
About us:
Decoral System USA is a company with over 40 years of experience in research, development and manufacturing of decorative powder coating systems. Decoral is considered the industry leader for architectural, industrial and OEM decorative applications and is a fully integrated company that manufactures every component in its systems. Our company develops its own equipment, powder coatings, transfer films and inks.
Position Summary:
We are seeking dedicated sales professionals experienced in regional multi-state coverage to join us in our next phase of national expansion. The RSM will call on new & existing customers to introduce and sell Decoral capital equipment systems for sublimation. The RSM will manage the assigned territory following our go-to-market strategies with the objective of growing revenues and profits through the assignment of new OEM & Job Shop Licensees in the region.
This position is remote based. Candidate must live within the region.
Western Region consists of CA, OR, WA, NV, UT, AZ
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Prepares and negotiates quotes and contracts with potential clients/business partners.
Meet regularly with existing customers and prospects in sales territory to understand their evolving business needs and position existing portfolios to meet surfaced needs.
Develop in-depth knowledge of the company's core OEM products via successful completion of the required sales training program and utilize this knowledge to successfully sell the machinery equipment to new and existing customers in assigned territory.
Create and execute a territory sales plan that meets or exceeds established sales quotas and supports Company revenue and profit targets.
Work closely with National Sales Director, maintaining constant open dialog on daily activities and new business opportunities.
Assist and lead customer's visits to our R&D facility making sure all proper internal personnel is communicated and required documentation is in place (NDA)
Attend trade shows to promote products and brands.
Will integrate the Company CRM as the foundation of the daily workday, filtering all sales activities through the CRM.
Position Requirements:
Prior experience selling industrial product lines (no consumer products).
Prior experience managing a multi-state territory in a sales capacity.
Bachelor's degree in Business preferred.
Demonstrate ability to communicate to C level executives, VP / Directors as well as working with mid-level management and support staff.
Experience & prior success with new business development and lead qualification
Permanent access to appropriate office space within the home or alternate location.
Experience projecting market trends, building forecasts, managing an active business pipeline
Travel:
This position requires a Road Warrior ready to own the assigned region.
The successful candidate will be required to travel an average of 50% and can expect to be on the road 3 to 5 days a week, about 2 weeks a month on average.
Travel will consist of (a) within an assigned territory, (b) national trade shows, (c) Florida HQ office and (d) to assist in other regions as needed.
Compensation:
Base salary
Commission on capital equipment sales.
Car Allowance.
Health Benefits Plan.
Vacation and Holiday pay.

About Shift We believe car buying should be fun, fair, and accessible to everyone. We’ve set out to transform an industry, using technology to bring transparency and convenience to the car buying process.And we aren’t stopping there. We seek to bring that same openness and simplicity to car ownership too, with payments, maintenance, and insurance in one easy app. At SHIFT, we’re building the tools that empower people to buy, own, and sell the cars that make life go. We’ve recently entered the public markets (Nasdaq: SFT) and are experiencing rapid growth. This is a great opportunity to join a hyper growth company changing an industry!As Financing Specialist, you will be responsible for all aspects of fraud detection/fraud investigation/fraud resolution in the Acquisitions unit. This highly motivated individual works closely with the FinOps Team to coordinate further investigation/stip gathering. Reports to Financial Operations Manager.Problems don’t intimidate you, you intimidate problems. Some would call you proactive, but you know you’re doing what needs to be done. You’re looking for a job that’ll give you the tools to kickstart your career, but grant you the autonomy to own your outcomes. You enjoy the challenge of championing new skills to improve the way we work. You’re ready to roll up your sleeves and make your mark.As a Funding and Contract Specialist, you'll be the keeper of the Finance Operations pipeline, an emergent leader as you own the flow of funds to Shift. You will become the Subject Matter Expert in contract funding, fearlessly following-up with our lenders to ensure accurate and timely loan bookings. You’ll work tirelessly with our bank partners and customers to see that each loan is paid and accounted for, ultimately supporting Shift in its mission of putting dreams in driveways.You will work remotely in your own personal Loan Zone (equipment provided) and will report to the Finance Operations Manager (a pretty OK guy).What you'll do: Meticulously manage, track and prevent aged accounts receivables in a fast paced environmentAnalyze loan approvals and audit contract structure (Yes, 2+2 DOES equal 4)Generate loan documents with remarkable speed and precisionHandling customers personal information with love while complying with all federal, state, and local regulations.Maintain lender relationships and hold banks accountable for timely fundingAbility to build meaningful relationships internally and externally; follow-up with customers, field reps, and other outside entities (employers, creditors, etc) to resolve escalationsProvide excellent customer service to all lenders and sales repsWhat you'll haveAbility to thrive under pressure and in a fast paced environmentThe desire to adapt, change, and growThe grit to find solutions to problems where others have failedAn eagle eye and passion for detailStrong communication skillsSupervision/leadership abilitiesAssociates degree or equivalent experienceCollege degree preferred*Who We Are *At Shift, we’re all about growth - which means people who are eager to grow, who are ready to roll up their sleeves and learn new things. We were founded by a scrappy group of visionaries who were by no means “car experts” - so we don’t expect you to be one, either! We’ll take the open-minded go-getter over the pure subject matter expert any day. In that spirit, we also care about building a diverse and inclusive workplace and company. To put it simply, cars are meant for everyone, so we believe our company should be, too. We never discriminate against any candidate on the basis of gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, race, ethnicity, religion, color, national origin, marital status, veteran status or disability status. We welcome and encourage people of all backgrounds and walks of life to apply, even if you’re unsure if you meet all the requirements. (Even if this particular role isn’t the right fit, chances are we will have the right one soon!)*Why Join Now?*Having gone public in October 2020, we are at the beginning of our journey and hope you join us for the ride! Shift is a leading end-to-end auto e-commerce platform transforming the used car industry with a technology-driven, hassle-free customer experience. Shift’s mission is to make buying or selling a used car fun, fair, and accessible to everyone. We provide comprehensive, digital solutions throughout the car ownership lifecycle: finding the right car, having a test drive brought to you before buying the car, a seamless digitally-driven purchase transaction including financing and vehicle protection products, an efficient, digital trade-in/sale transaction, and a vision to provide high-value support services during car ownership.Job Type: Full-timePay: Up to $24.03 per hourWork Location:Multiple locationsBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligible

JobTitle: Government Underwriter DE/FHA VA LAPP/SAR- (FULL TIME REMOTE)
Text:
Government Underwriter DE/FHA VA LAPP/SAR- (FULL TIME REMOTE)
We are a multi-billion dollar servicer and wholesale lender specializing in conventional, FHA, VA and USDA loans. We are looking for experienced DE/VA nderwriter's who can execute daily underwriting of new government loan submissions.
Common tasks will include signing off of conditions, approving new loans, and recommending underwriting exceptions. Other tasks will include review of loan to value ratios, credit reports, applications and all submitted documentation to ensure loans meet investor and company standards.

We offer phenomenal compensation, work/life balance, benefits, FULL TIME REMOTE OPTIONS, and have been named a "best place to work" in Southern California for 5 years in a row and counting. We look forward to meeting you!
What You Will Be Doing
Underwrite/review new loans- approve, decline or counter
Sign off on loan conditions and final approval of loans prior to funding in accordance with
published turn times
Examination of loan applications and supporting documentation to ensure accuracy and fulfillment;
each loan meets secondary market, investor and company standards guidelines
Serve as go-to person for underwriting support for production teams
Work with Processing and Funding Departments to resolve complex issues, restructure
loans as well as meet lock expirations and other deadlines
Respond to Quality Control, Quality Assurance, and Post-Closing audits and issues in a timely
manner
What You Need for this Position
Strong knowledge of VA and FHA/DE guidelines; Agency experience a plus
FHA Direct Endorsement/Chums #, VA SAR/LAPP Designation a big plus
Experience and knowledge of DU and LP
Thorough understanding of underwriting guidelines (Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac), policies and
procedures
Minimum 3-5 years of recent government first trust deed mortgage underwriting experience,
including appraisal review
Must have a high school diploma or equivalent
What's In It for You
Our employees enjoy top of the market compensation and full benefit benefits which include medical, dental,
vision, life, and disability insurance, flexible benefits plan, 401(k) plan, and paid holidays, as well as
vacation and sick leave.
So, if you are a Government Underwriter DE/FHA VA LAPP/SAR- (FULL TIME REMOTE) with experience, please apply today!Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

As the only global provider of commercial solutions, IQVIA understands what it takes to deliver nationally and internationally. Our people help biopharma get their medicines to the people who need them. We help customers gain insight and access to their markets and ultimately demonstrate their product's value to payers, physicians and patients. A significant part of our business is acting as the biopharma's sales force to physicians or, providing therapy area educational input to physicians and patients. With the right experience, you can help deliver medical breakthroughs in the real world.
Virtual Sales Professional – Cardiology
IQVIA is looking for high performing, results-oriented sales professional with a track record of success to join our team as a Virtual Sales Professional. This role is responsible for selling Biopharmaceutical products directly to cardiologists and working collaboratively with a field-based sales team on behalf of our client, AstraZeneca.
The Virtual Sales Professional (VSP) engages health care professionals (HCPs) in virtual discussions to promote assigned client products, maximize the products’ selling potential and meet program and Client objectives. The VSP achieves this by developing and maintaining relationships with HCPs and educating them about product features, benefits, safety profile and approved indications to ensure appropriate patient use. The VSP utilizes approved tools and resources for product promotion and maintains a competent level of product, territory and customer activity knowledge.
Responsibilities:
Create and implement strategically sound business plans and tactical strategies within the assigned customer base to achieve individual and company goals for sales, market share, call metrics, appropriate sample distribution, etc.
Manage daily sales call activity according to defined expectations, with the purpose of influencing customers and increasing product sales:
On behalf of Client, promote Client's products via virtual interactions with assigned HCP targets, engaging them in in-depth program.
Profile and manage a list of HCP targets and provide value-added benefits to grow product volume.
Maintain call productivity and metrics that are required by program.
Manage promotional budget.
Maintain thorough knowledge of AstraZeneca’s products and programs.
Fully comply with all laws, regulations and Supplier Policies, Code of Conduct, all privacy and data guidelines, relevant state and federal laws and regulations, and terms and conditions prescribed in the Sample Administration Agreements and PDMA Guidelines.
Participate in teleconference and live National, regional and district meetings and training sessions and represent client at National and/or local conventions when requested.
Requirements:
Results-oriented with a track record of success.
Bachelor’s degree required.
1+ years sales experience required with:
Experience in inside sales/ contact center required
Pharma/biotech and/or B2B sales experience preferred
Demonstrated success in prior roles i.e. sales rankings, awards & achievements
Superior verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to clearly articulate via phone in a professional and grammatically proficient manner, with the ability to adapt tone, volume, and pace to most effectively communicate
Ability to travel to work related meetings and functions (including overnight and/or weekend).
Must be able to successfully complete client training and meet training expectations in order to proceed to servicing client’s customers within the parameters of the program.
Qualifications, Skills and Abilities:
Results-oriented with a track record of success.
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
Clear, articulate and grammatically sound speech and professional appearance.
Strong rapport building skills and active listening skills.
Excellent selling, closing, persuasion and presentation skills.
Ability to learn, understand and communicate complex technical/medical terminology and to maintain the required technical expertise including competitive product knowledge.
Self-motivated and disciplined.
Good organizational and planning skills, strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Demonstrated technical aptitude with computer technology and devices (e.g. iPad, apps).
At IQVIA, we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. The advanced analytics, technology solutions and contract research services we provide to the life sciences industry are made possible by our 67,000+ employees around the world who apply their insight, curiosity and intellectual courage every step of the way. Learn more at jobs.iqvia.com.
IQVIA is an EEO Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled
IQVIA, Inc. provides reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities. Applicants who require reasonable accommodation to submit an application for employment or otherwise participate in the application process should contact IQVIA’s Talent Acquisition team at workday_recruiting@iqvia.com to arrange for such an accommodation.

About Core Digital Media
We’ve been crushing it in direct-response advertising for over 10 years, using a combination of talented people, platforms, and data to turn ad impressions into high-quality customers for our clients. Now, we are looking to expand our reach and our offering.
The Opportunity
We are seeking a Digital Marketing Manager who can leverage data to strategically test and optimize compelling creative messaging and content. This person will be responsible for partnering with a design team to create ads that perform, optimize, and analyze paid marketing campaigns for Core Digital Media consumer brands across display and native platforms.

You
You are creative, analytical, metrics-driven, and action-oriented. You are comfortable taking ownership and developing strategy, as well as rolling up your sleeves to get things done. You demonstrate a clear ability to develop tactics and campaigns that drive the business goals: audience growth, engagement, acquisition, and reach.
Responsibilities:
Create and manage online paid advertising campaigns across display
Write compelling marketing copy that drives action online and brand awareness
Generate new creative concepts and imagery that drives action online
Prepare and analyze marketing datasets
Communicate program results to internal stakeholders and management
Skills:
Strong analytical thinking
Creative with the ability to understand what motivates online behavior
Review and report on key marketing metrics
Familiar with online marketing basics
Strong communication skills
Qualifications:
A four year college degree with strong computer skills.
Some online marketing experience
Experience with Microsoft Excel, and familiarity with other productivity applications
Detailed oriented person with high sense of accountability and integrity
Self-starter with entrepreneurial spirit
Core Digital Media an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.
Core Digital Media is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees. CDM provides employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.

About Core Digital Media
We’ve been crushing it in direct-response advertising for over 10 years, using a combination of people, platforms, and data to turn ad impressions into high-quality customers for our clients. Now, we are looking for another to join the team and continue this tradition.

The Opportunity
We are seeking a strong Online Marketing Manager who can leverage data and their own creativity to produce highly profitable DR marketing campaigns. This involves strategically testing all available levers, optimizing based on data, and creating compelling creative assets. This role is a very hands-on position with direct management and execution of marketing campaigns for Core Digital Media across social and native platforms.

You
You are creative, analytical, metrics-driven, and action-oriented. You are comfortable taking ownership and developing strategy, as well as rolling up your sleeves to get things done. In addition, you are comfortable writing copy, making images, and editing videos (or are enthusiastic about learning these skills). Ultimately, you have demonstrated an ability and motivation to achieve business goals.

The OAL will serve as a peer leader and resource to the "TEAM" at both an area and national level. A willingness to travel over a broad geography is required (approx. 60% travel).

ORGANIZATIONAL BACKGROUND


Public Counsel is the largest pro bono public interest law firm in the country. Founded in
and other inequities by delivering free legal and social services to the most vulnerable
members of our community. Public Counsel operates eight legal projects: Children’s Rights,
Community Development, Consumer Rights, Homelessness Prevention, Immigrants’ Rights,
Veterans’ Rights, the Audrey Irmas Project for Women & Girls’ Rights, and our impact
litigation project, Opportunity Under Law. Public Counsel has a full-time staff of over 130.
We seek to have a racially inclusive staff.
Public Counsel’s Children’s Rights Project (CRP) serves children, youth, and their families
on a variety of legal issues, including probate legal guardianship, public benefits, and
adoption. The adoptions team and the guardianship team are part of the larger Children’s
Rights Project. The guardianship team operates a free legal clinic three days each week,
providing pro per assistance with petitions for guardianship, visitation, and termination of
guardianship. The team also supports the families involved in guardianships with social
services and immigration assistance. The adoptions team assists caregivers adopting
children from the Los Angeles County foster care system. In addition to finalizing the
adoption, the team helps families adopting children with special needs access services and
public benefits including health and mental health care, Adoption Assistance and Foster
Care benefits, Social Security Benefits, regional center services and resolving issues with
Medi-Cal.
JOB SUMMARY


This is a full time position, with time split equally between the guardianship team and

adoptions team. The Coordinator will focus on conducting intake interviews with adopting

parents with the adoptions team and preparing guardianship and other applications for

pro per litigants with the guardianship team. In addition, the Coordinator will provide

other program and administrative support.

The position has the following responsibilities:
 
Conduct issue screening intake interviews with adopting parents by phone. Draft

case summary memos, including a case advocacy plan for pro bono attorneys.
 
Assist litigants at the Pro Per Guardianship Clinic to complete the legal documents

necessary in a probate guardianship matter. (The clinic is currently operating

remotely, but is housed inside the Stanley Mosk courthouse in downtown Los

Angeles.)
 
Open new matters for clients, conduct conflict checks, and create client database

entries and hard copies of files.
 
Assist with administrative duties related to the everyday functions of the
Guardianship Clinic and Adoptions Project.

ESSENTIAL JOB SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED
 
Experience conducting client interviews
 
Excellent oral and written communication skills
 
Strong computer skills; familiarity with Word, Outlook, Excel, Case Management
Software/database systems and legal form software preferred
 
Ability to communicate in an empathetic and professional manner with
supervisor, team members, and litigants;
 
Strong interpersonal and organizational skills: ability to work in a fast-paced
environment balancing multiple tasks and remaining detail-oriented
 
Experience working with children and/or public benefits preferred but not
required
 
B.A degree or substantial work experience preferred
 
Spanish language fluency strongly preferred
 
Experience working with individuals of diverse cultural, racial, geographic, and
economic backgrounds;
 
Commitment to economic and racial justice and the mission of Public Counsel.

START DATE AND COMPENSATION
 
Salary is commensurate with abilities and experience
 Immediate, full-time non-exempt position.
 Public Counsel offers a competitive benefits package including: (1) medical, dental,

and vision coverage with both HMO and PPO options, (2) the option to enroll in a

Flexible Spending Account, (3) a 403(b) retirement plan with elective contribution

and an employer contribution after a year of employment, and (4) employer-paid

life insurance and disability plans.
 Public Counsel follows all emergency state and local orders arising from the current

COVID-19 crisis. Though generally this position is office-based, currently all staff
must work remotely from their homes. Public Counsel will assess when the physical

office will reopen in a manner consistent with public health and local and state

emergency orders.
APPLICATION DEADLINE

Continuous until position is filled.

TO APPLY

We value lived experiences and experiences working with clients across a range of settings.

Please consider discussing such experiences in your cover letter, especially if they are not

reflected in your resume. Email a cover letter, resume, and brief writing sample (in PDF

format) to:


Karen Ullman, Supervising Senior Staff Attorney

Children’s Rights Project – Adoptions Project
Public Counsel
Los Angeles, California 90005
Email: pcpost1@publiccounsel.org

No phone calls please.

ABOUT US

RepairSmith is on a mission to deliver convenient auto repair everywhere. The company's at-home service offers car owners complete, convenient repair and maintenance service, upfront prices before booking, and five-star quality service all at an affordable price. RepairSmith delivers repair and scheduled maintenance on-location for fleet owners to maximize vehicle utilization and consolidate costs.
Founded in 2018, RepairSmith is based in Los Angeles and offers service across 550+ cities. All RepairSmith mechanics are employees of the company and are equipped with quality tools and parts to deliver a five-star service experience. The company is backed by Daimler AG.
RepairSmith has been recognized by Built In LA as one of the 'Best Places to Work,' and awarded the 'Business Transformation Award' by the Association for Corporate Growth in Los Angeles. RepairSmith's technicians have been named 'Essential Worker Hero of the Year' by the Consumer World Awards.
To learn more, visit www.RepairSmith.com and follow the company on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest and YouTube.
THE JOB
We are looking for an experienced Product Manager who is passionate about building products that customers love. Join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to help design, build and roll-out products that deliver the RepairSmith’s vision and strategy.
The perfect person for the job is excited to move fast, follow industry standards, think at scale, and loves delighting customers through technology and customer experiences.
WE WILL DEPEND ON THIS PERSON TO:
Gain a deep understanding of customer experience, identify and fill product gaps and generate new ideas that grow revenue, improve customer experience and drive user growth
Translate product strategy into detailed requirements and basic wireframes
Create buy-in for the product vision both internally and with key external partners
Scope and prioritize activities based on business and customer impact
Work closely with engineering teams to deliver with quick time-to-market and continuously deliver products that delight users and provide business goals
Drive product launches including working marketing team, operations team, executives, and other product management team members
Act as a product evangelist to build awareness and understanding of user experience
Represent the company by visiting customers to solicit feedback on company products and services. This could include performing ride-alongs with our Technicians, talking with car owners and r&d field projects.
YOU SHOULD HAVE:
Proven work experience in product management or as an associate product manager
Proven track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle
Proven ability to develop product strategies and effectively communicate recommendations to executive management
Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies
Strong problem-solving skills and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job
Skilled at working effectively with cross-functional teams across multiple stakeholders
Excellent written and verbal communication skills who can own and manage a ticket backlog from design to launch
Experience working across agile or lean kanban teams spanning Startup to Midsize Organizations
3 - 5 years experience in a related role
Undergraduate degree in related area or equivalent practical experience
WORKING WITH US:
Competitive salary (DOE)
Unlimited vacation time
Work from home capabilities
100% company paid employee medical, dental and vision insurance
Casual atmosphere and great people to work alongside
Interviews will take place after resumes have been screened for minimum requirements. Please note that this position is not restricted solely to the responsibilities listed above and that the job scope and responsibilities are subject to change.
REPAIRSMITH, INC. IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. ALL QUALIFIED APPLICANTS WILL RECEIVE CONSIDERATION FOR EMPLOYMENT WITHOUT REGARD TO RACE, COLOR, AGE, RELIGION, SEX, NATIONAL ORIGIN, DISABILITY, PROTECTED VETERAN STATUS, OR ANY OTHER CHARACTERISTIC PROTECTED UNDER FEDERAL, STATE OR LOCAL LAW.

Learn at night, work during the day. No coding.
80% of our alums have secured entry-level corporate jobs and the average salary bump post-program is $30k. Climb Hire graduates work at IBM, Better.com, Nike, BetterUp, Gusto, and more.
If selected, you will:

Learn skills needed to break into a new career.

No college degree or relevant working experience required.

Work your way towards a Salesforce Administrator Certification.

Pay it Forward
Our program is free upfront. After you land a job paying more than $45k, you'll be asked to pay it forward and support another student in their studies.
Location: 1.5 hours (100 mi.) from San Francisco Bay Area, Sacramento, or Los Angeles, CA; Denver, CO; and Minneapolis, MN. (fully remote)
Apply today
Climb Hire prepares working adults to break into jobs in tech. Climbers complete 150 hours of specialized training in 24 weeks. Most Climbers are between the ages of 22-33 and the majority do not hold four-year degrees.
The Program

You learn:

In-demand skills (Salesforce, data management, system administration)

State-of-the-art job search tools

Professional and soft skills (Resume, LinkedIn, Communication, Google suite, Slack, etc.)

An active community of peer learners and instructors:

A support network

Alumni who help facilitate, teach, and mentor

Certified and licensed trainers with over 20 years of experience educating diverse populations to enter the professional job market

Employment Support:

Targeted job search support including 1:1 career mentorship

Job opportunities sourced through our large network of employer partners

Job referrals through the Climb Hire community - a community of minorities and underrepresented groups that made their way to better tech jobs.

What you need

An internet connection and access to a computer

Time - 6 hours per week for 24 weeks (two 3 hour sessions each week); and at least 10 per week for assignments and a capstone project

Commitment to attend class and complete assignments

Climb Hire’s mission is to create economic opportunity for overlooked and hidden talent. The core of our program is to build a more inclusive workforce that is prepared to enter the technology sector. We highly encourage individuals from underrepresented groups to apply.
Learn more: www.climbhire.co
Apply today
This is a remote position.

Why RevLocal?
RevLocal is the leader in personalized digital marketing and a Google Premier Partner. RevLocal was also voted by Inc. Magazine as one of the top 50 places to work and multiple years earning a position as Inc. 500’s Fastest Growing companies.
By connecting businesses with a dedicated Digital Marketing Strategist and a powerful platform, RevLocal delivers seamless digital marketing services for businesses that want to be validated by existing customers and discovered by new ones. RevLocal optimizes its approach for the ever-changing digital landscape to ensure local businesses are visible and relevant online.
We know how difficult it can be to run a business because our founder started as a small business owner himself. With the client relationship as the foundation, RevLocal makes digital marketing efficient, effective and affordable for all.

Company Overview

In 2009, Accordion set out to prove that there was a better way to work in finance – and more specifically, a better way to unlock value potential in private equity portfolio companies. In the years since, our firm has grown into a bi-coastal team of 150+ finance and technology professionals, serving nearly 200 of the world's leading private equity firms out of offices in New York, San Francisco, Boston, Charlotte, and Dallas.

Our mission is to shape a new era in the private equity industry. Focusing exclusively on the office of the CFO of PE-backed companies, we're committed to driving value creation through financial consulting services and portfolio operations technology.

So, what does it mean to work at Accordion? It means thriving in a high-growth, agile, and collaborative environment. It means changing the way private equity firms create value at their portfolio companies. And ultimately, it means making your mark on the firm's future – by embracing a culture rooted in humility and a firm-wide commitment to building something great, together.

Financial Accounting Advisory Services (FAAS)

With the increase in complexity of the business environment and transactions, CFO's of private equity backed companies are increasingly being looked towards to drive strategic insights for their business. Finance organizations are no longer simply result reporters, but rather, they couple these results with forward looking data to provide strategic insights which are leveraged to make business decisions. Efficiency of process and meaningful control environments allows for speed of financial reporting with increasingly accurate measures, leaving more time for the finance team to add future enterprise value, rather than look backwards.

Accordion's FAAS Practice is comprised of a dedicated team providing accounting and financial advice to support PE backed portfolio companies on a wide range of transactions and events, including Accounting Policies & Procedures, ERP/Financial System Execution, Financial Statement Close Process, Process & Controls Implementation, Technical Accounting, Finance/Accounting Assessment & Design and Finance & Accounting Organization Standup resulting from a Carve out or Merger transaction. We are doers and problem solvers – making sense of complexity and bolstering sponsors' value creation thesis's.

This is a contracting role reporting to the Managing Director of the FAAS Practice, and will be working remote with some travel in the future.

What you'll do

As a Consultant on the FAAS team, you will:-

Work collaboratively with a diverse set of colleagues to serve clients in the areas of financial accounting matters and business processes:
Prepare financial statements, typically in connection with acquisitions, carve-outs, proposed sale transactions, restatements, etc.
Assist in the in the design and implementation of new accounting policies and procedures
Assess and improve financial accounting close process; including accelerating and streamlining monthly and quarterly reporting processes
Establish and document best-in-class financial and operational internal controls and/or assisting in controls remediation
Assist with audit preparation
Oversee and manage financial reporting and operational system implementations
Assess and design finance and accounting organizational structure
Bring deep financial accounting expertise and leading practices to engagements
Manage multiple client engagements at the same time, ensure projects are on track, manage client expectations and perform course corrections when necessary
Interact and build relationships with C-level personnel at portfolio company as well as representatives from Private Equity sponsors
Assist in growing the firm by identifying and driving business development activities
Identify and sponsor internal initiatives
You have
7+ years of relevant professional experience working in a client serving role at a top-tier public accounting or financial advisory firm, and/or mix of client service and private industry experience at a senior level
Proven experience successfully managing multiple projects at the same time, managing not only client/sponsor dynamics but internal team dynamics as well
Bachelor's degree in Accounting or related field. CPA is a plus
A strong and up-to date knowledge of US GAAP (exposure to IFRS is a plus), with deep technical understanding of topics such as ASC 606 revenue recognition, lease transactions, purchase accounting, etc.
Experience preparing financial statements and drafting footnote disclosures. Experience with carve-outs and restatements is a plus
Experience performing financial and operational internal control reviews
Knowledge of performing IT assessments and financial system implementation experience is a plus
Experience working with Private Equity, with an understanding of the unique requirements of the Private Equity consulting environment
Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills
Strong client service mindset


Accordion Partners is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.
