Opportunity and Impact
Xceleran is looking for a valuable 100% commission sales representative to join our team! We are looking to expand exponentially this year with an outside sales team who share our drive and motivation as well as our desire to serve our customers with the highest level of service.
We are creating our 100% commission outside sales team who can work from anywhere in the world...
We invite you to apply.
We're growing like crazy and we need motivated and driven, take-charge salespeople to expand on this success.
Our 100% commission-based team has a very clear and realistic path to make $100K+ per year ($80K+ in your first year); with a product that almost sells itself. This salesperson model has been created by life-long salespeople, not a CPA or CFO. Together, our team carefully crafted this role and designed it based on creating “the dream” sales role that you’d want to stay in forever.
Our #1 goal for you as a salesperson is to help you live your ideal life, including:
Uncapped Earning Potential- We want you to make so much money you don’t know what to do with it.
Time Freedom- You need to have time to enjoy your financial freedom. What good does it do to make a bunch of money but have no time to enjoy life?
Flexibility- We don’t believe in sales managers… We believe in mentors!!! You will have your own performance coach, accountability coach and onboarding specialist who will be there to support you as you grow. Get things done on your schedule… no more punching a clock.
Industry and Company
Formed in 2005 as myServiceForce and has since been rebranded to Xceleran. Xceleran now provides a community for ALL your business services. Xceleran provides office and field functions to automate the administration, billing, and collections of field service calls. Payment processing in the field at the time the work is done is a small business best practice that eliminates the pitfalls of invoicing and collections.
We have a ridiculous amount of support for our sales team including:
Personal and group coaching… designed to take your skills and abilities to the next level.
Technology tools and automation created to allow you to get rid of the mundane, repetitive tasks that bog down most salespeople.
The time to dominate this market segment is now, and it’s time for you to come and show off what you can accomplish!
Key Responsibilities
Respond in a timely manner to all leads.
Initiate outbound efforts (call, text, email) each day to prospects.
Qualify prospects, gauge interest, and schedule sales calls.
Collaborate with the team on improving prospecting strategies.
Ability to identify & source information on prospective clients.
Qualifications
Strong company culture fit
Ability to receive inbound and make outbound phone calls via cell or internet (wired ethernet) in a quiet environment without interruptions.
Strong listening skills and excellent phone demeanor.
Technologically proficient; not necessarily an expert, but knowledgeable
Excellent written and verbal communication
CRM experience a HUGE plus
Other Information
Compensation: 100% commission - High Six Figures is achievable ($160K+), anything less than Six Figures would be considered a failure. (There is no ceiling to your compensation plan)
Bonus opportunities
Working from anywhere in the world
We appreciate your interest in joining our team!

ABOUT US:

DFO is on a mission to create and deliver superior e-commerce software, marketing, and products to make the world a better place. To accomplish this, DFO needs people that love:

Performance marketing
Technology
E-commerce
People and the world!


DFO is global in operations, culture, and language, with offices in New York, San Diego, San Francisco, Toronto, Vancouver, Mexico City, Sao Paulo, The Hague, Amsterdam, Hong Kong, Ho Chi Minh (Saigon), and Manila.

ABOUT THE POSITION:

We’re looking for a highly motivated person who is an expert in global digital media buying for e-commerce on Facebook, Google, Bing, Programmatic and Native platforms.
This position is full-time and includes a competitive base salary and a generous commission based on performance. The candidate must be willing to relocate or commute to one of our global offices.
A remote position may be allowed for the right person.
NOTE: IF YOU HAVE NEVER MANAGED HUGE BUDGETS ON FACEBOOK OR THE OTHER PLATFORMS MENTIONED ABOVE, THIS POSITION IS NOT FOR YOU!

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:

Create, maintain, and grow large scale media buys across multiple accounts, brands, and products
Conduct audits of ongoing media positions to identify areas for optimization and improved performance
Analyze your media buys and associated metrics daily to ensure profitability.
Proactively optimize your campaigns by adjusting the advertisements (creatives) and all other levers at your disposal, such as rates, placements, dayparting, geo-targeting, etc., to ensure CPA goals.
Set-up and monitor advertising campaigns using ad tags or site-served creatives

YOUR SKILLS:

You have at least two years of proven experience in buying online media at scale. If you don’t have this, please do not apply;

You’re an expert at split-testing ads;

You’re an expert at building high performing ads;

You’re analytical and use critical thinking skills while also being very risk/reward-driven

You’re an expert at Facebook Ads; OR

You’re an expert at Google or SEM; OR

You’re an expert at Amazon PPC; OR
You're an expert at Native (Outbrain/ Taboola); OR

You're an expert at TikTok;

Best hardware
Education allowance

An exciting and diverse team all around the world!
Value given to ideas and opinions!
Friendly coworkers!
Valuers of innovation

ABOUT US

RepairSmith is on a mission to deliver convenient auto repair everywhere. The company's at-home service offers car owners complete, convenient repair and maintenance service, upfront prices before booking, and five-star quality service all at an affordable price. RepairSmith delivers repair and scheduled maintenance on-location for fleet owners to maximize vehicle utilization and consolidate costs.
Founded in 2018, RepairSmith is based in Los Angeles and offers service across 550+ cities. All RepairSmith mechanics are employees of the company and are equipped with quality tools and parts to deliver a five-star service experience. The company is backed by Daimler AG.
RepairSmith has been recognized by Built In LA as one of the 'Best Places to Work,' and awarded the 'Business Transformation Award' by the Association for Corporate Growth in Los Angeles. RepairSmith's technicians have been named 'Essential Worker Hero of the Year' by the Consumer World Awards.
To learn more, visit www.RepairSmith.com and follow the company on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest and YouTube.
THE JOB
We are looking for an experienced Product Manager who is passionate about building products that customers love. Join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to help design, build and roll-out products that deliver the RepairSmith’s vision and strategy.
The perfect person for the job is excited to move fast, follow industry standards, think at scale, and loves delighting customers through technology and customer experiences.
WE WILL DEPEND ON THIS PERSON TO:
Gain a deep understanding of customer experience, identify and fill product gaps and generate new ideas that grow revenue, improve customer experience and drive user growth
Translate product strategy into detailed requirements and basic wireframes
Create buy-in for the product vision both internally and with key external partners
Scope and prioritize activities based on business and customer impact
Work closely with engineering teams to deliver with quick time-to-market and continuously deliver products that delight users and provide business goals
Drive product launches including working marketing team, operations team, executives, and other product management team members
Act as a product evangelist to build awareness and understanding of user experience
Represent the company by visiting customers to solicit feedback on company products and services. This could include performing ride-alongs with our Technicians, talking with car owners and r&d field projects.
YOU SHOULD HAVE:
Proven work experience in product management or as an associate product manager
Proven track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle
Proven ability to develop product strategies and effectively communicate recommendations to executive management
Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies
Strong problem-solving skills and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job
Skilled at working effectively with cross-functional teams across multiple stakeholders
Excellent written and verbal communication skills who can own and manage a ticket backlog from design to launch
Experience working across agile or lean kanban teams spanning Startup to Midsize Organizations
3 - 5 years experience in a related role
Undergraduate degree in related area or equivalent practical experience
WORKING WITH US:
Competitive salary (DOE)
Unlimited vacation time
Work from home capabilities
100% company paid employee medical, dental and vision insurance
Casual atmosphere and great people to work alongside
Interviews will take place after resumes have been screened for minimum requirements. Please note that this position is not restricted solely to the responsibilities listed above and that the job scope and responsibilities are subject to change.
REPAIRSMITH, INC. IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. ALL QUALIFIED APPLICANTS WILL RECEIVE CONSIDERATION FOR EMPLOYMENT WITHOUT REGARD TO RACE, COLOR, AGE, RELIGION, SEX, NATIONAL ORIGIN, DISABILITY, PROTECTED VETERAN STATUS, OR ANY OTHER CHARACTERISTIC PROTECTED UNDER FEDERAL, STATE OR LOCAL LAW.

We’ll grant access to our final edited photos/videos back to you for your portfolio.Be the owner of the EquipmentEquipment requirements: PhotographyFull frame DSLR or mirrorlessNikon D850 D750, Canon 5D, 6D Sony A9, A7R, A7VideographyCan shoot AT LEAST 1080 60fps HDPanasonic GH5, Sony A7III, Canon EOS R, Canon 80D, Canon 6D MKII, Canon 5D MKIVStabilization is required for videographers, Monopod, Zhuyin Crane, Ronin S, etc.Drone is highly desirableLense: Fast prime lens 1.2-1.8 for low light, Zoom lens with wide range (Example 24-70mm)Audio ability requiredLive streaming ability preferred4 RulesShow up- Shot the weddings you’re assigned (go-figure)Grow- Build your book of clients. Continue to do freelance work and other jobs that you land. (You will NOT sign a non-compete): Communicate- Promptly engage and respond with us, brides/couples & teammates.Point-and-shoot! We edit everything in-house. You’ll get the credit and we’ll let you promote that work in your portfolio.4 BenefitsExtra Time - Just point-n-shoot. No marketing, selling, editing, etc.Extra Cash- Make ($50-$100/hour). That adds up quickly. Plus we cover travel : )Extra exposure- Get paid to grow your portfolio and gain clients. Everyone there has events coming up: Family portraits, baby shots, graduations, etc. Remember to take your business cards.Extra experience- Perfect your craft and experiment. Practice makes perfectAbout us: Since being in the e-commerce wedding space since 2017, our clients have asked us to provide photography and videography services. Weddings have lots of decisions and now our bundles of services make life that much easier for brides. We’re protective of our clients and their special day! You will be required to grant access to Kapturly of some sample work for us to show clients. You own it but just give us permission to show you off : ) In return we will grant access to our edited work back to you to add to your portfolio. Our goal is to give you more paid opportunities while providing bundled services for our clients.Job Types: Part-time, ContractPay: $50.00 - $100.00 per hourSchedule:HolidaysWeekendsExperience:Wedding: 1 year (Required)Contract Length:More than 1 yearFull Time Opportunity:NoWork Location:One locationCompany's website:www.kapturly.comWork Remotely:Yes

Our mission is to help people everywhere find a job and company they love. We're transforming an entire industry through the power of transparency. As the worldwide leader in employer branding and insights, our vision is for a world where transparency holds companies accountable to strive to become better employers.

Please note this role is open to remote hiring. Our main office locations are in San Francisco, CA, Chicago, IL and Uniontown, OH.

We are looking for a top notch Talent Acquisition Partner to hire top talent across our G&A teams. You will partner effectively with hiring managers to source, assess and hire exceptional talent for Glassdoor. This role will own the full lifecycle of the recruiting process –uncovering phenomenal talent, delivering a superb candidate experience and ultimately closing the right candidates.

What You'll Do:
Drive the recruiting process for assigned roles, working closely with hiring managers and internal teams to determine proficiencies needed for each role, manage the hiring process, and flagging any roadblocks along the way.
Deliver pipelines of talent for open roles, using a combination of sourcing, networking and applicants from targeted sources.
Ensure a Glassdoor-worthy candidate experience by following up with candidates in a timely fashion and providing transparency throughout the process.
Partner with internal teams effectively throughout the interview process to create efficiencies in the hiring process and a seamless onboarding for candidates
Stay connected to the competitive landscape, including trends in tech recruiting and compensation
Build and maintain candidate pipelines via networking, referrals, creative sourcing, social media, Boolean searches, and events
Act as a Glassdoor ambassador/advocate promoting our employer brand, culture, and vision
Organize and facilitate interview debriefs
What You'll Bring:
3 years of recruiting experience. Experience with G&A roles is preferred, with other non-tech experience being a wonderful plus
BA/BS in Business, Human Resources or similar preferred
Ability to attract and excite the best talent, delight them throughout the process and ultimately close candidates
Consistent track record with sourcing, recruiting and closing outstanding talent
Depth of experience using ATS systems understanding how data and metrics are reported (we use Greenhouse!)
Demonstrated ability to assess talent beyond matching keywords on a resume
Why Glassdoor?
Work with purpose – join us in creating transparency for job seekers everywhere
100% company paid medical/dental/vision/life coverage, with 80% dependent coverage
401(k) Plan with a Company Match to prepare for your future
Generous paid holidays and open paid time off
Our Commitments
Pay transparency: Pay bands and compensation philosophy are shared publicly to ensure that everyone is paid fairly. Our annual Pay Gap Study found no gender or race/ethnicity pay gap at Glassdoor.
Diversity data transparency: Glassdoor externally publishes diversity information about its employee population to hold ourselves accountable to our commitment to change. We also provide programs and resources to foster a greater sense of belonging for our employees.
Employee feedback transparency: We publicly publish our employee feedback survey responses to ensure everyone has a complete picture of what it's like to work here.
Company performance transparency: Glassdoor will provide candidates easy access to the financial performance of the HR Tech strategic business unit of Recruit Holdings, of which Glassdoor is a part.

Operating transparently at Glassdoor is fundamental to us walking the talk as we advocate for transparency everywhere. The ultimate goal is not just to change how we operate at Glassdoor, but for every employer to follow our lead!

Glassdoor is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Glassdoor is an equal opportunity employer; committed to creating a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

Proficient in Microsoft Office

Are you ready to join the team designing the future of mobility? HyperloopTT is looking to onboard a remote contributor specializing in Industrial Design. The future is now boarding, join us.

The HyperloopTT Design team utilizes a broad range of skills to develop human-centric solutions for hyperloop stations, infrastructure and capsules while prioritizing sustainability, design thinking and material innovation. Our passionate team works in close collaboration with leading global design partners to define the future of travel and an unprecedented experience.

As a HyperloopTT Industrial Designer, you will design the human interface components of HyperloopTT capsules and relevant products. You will lead the effort to ensure that the HyperloopTT capsule enables a seamless passenger experience. Remote position 10+ hours a week in exchange for stock options.

Responsibilities

Develop design proposals for HyperloopTT capsules, ranging from broad design themes to specific component-level features
Create compelling sketches that show HyperloopTT's vision for the future of transportation and passenger experience
Collaborate with engineers and design partners to find solutions that fulfill design vision and engineering constraints
Participate in cross-functional strategy, timing, and process discussion as it pertains to capsule development
Occasionally participate in design efforts outside of your area of expertise as necessary and as your skill set allows

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in automotive or transportation design, or equivalent experience demonstrated by ability
Experience working in advanced and production design of transportation
Must understand fundamental concepts of transportation design and engineering
Knowledgeable understanding of materials used for transportation vehicles interior and exterior and their impact on passenger experience
High level of skill taking 2D sketches to 3D modeling
Proficient in Adobe Creative Cloud Apps and 3D modeling tools such as Rhinoceros, Solid Edge, SolidWorks, Maya, etc

Who You Are

Passionate about the hyperloop and other new innovations
A proactive self-starter able to add value to our unique organizational structure
Independent thinker, problem solver and learner that can effectively collaborate in teams
Adaptable, quality-driven and results-oriented
Respond to feedback and suggestions in a positive manner
Creative with high aesthetic standards
Human-centric thinking
Passionate about new technology
Detail-oriented with excellent communication skills

Why Us

HyperloopTT is a collective of mobility innovators catalyzing the first breakthrough transportation in a century. From the beginning, we have united experts across the globe to realize the hyperloop and create a frictionless travel experience. We are passionate about the journey, looking to obstacles as opportunities and doubters as inspiration. We are far from dreamers; we are doers. We move forward every day. Come join us.

Are you ready to tell the greatest mobility story of our generation? HyperloopTT is looking to onboard a remote or Los Angeles based contributor specializing in creative copywriting. The future is now boarding, join us.

The HyperloopTT Marketing team creates and distributes the company's vision for the future of mobility. Collaborating with and across all departments, we define and lead the brand experience, develop and implement global strategies, design and develop innovative digital solutions, and ensure consistent messaging across all channels, teams and regions.

As a HyperloopTT Creative Copywriter, you will generate inspirational yet credible copy and scripts for creative projects. You will work cross-functionally to embed technology, sustainability, and safety messaging into HyperloopTT content. Remote position 10+ hours a week in exchange for stock options.

Responsibilities

Investigate and validate all claims included in the copy for accuracy
Conduct reviews of creative communications and provide feedback to the team on messaging and effectiveness
Develop and maintain an in-depth familiarity with all HyperloopTT projects, technologies and facts
Occasionally participate in marketing efforts outside of your area of expertise as necessary and as your skill set allows

JobTitle: Associate Cybersecurity Counsel - Opportunity to Work Remotely Los Angeles, CA
Text:
This role is available to candidates in the US only.
About the Company
VMware accelerates digital transformation through a software-defined approach to business and IT. The trusted platform provider of choice for more than 500,000 customers globally, VMware is the pioneer in virtualization and an innovator in cloud and business mobility. A proven leader, VMware allows customers to run, manage, connect, and secure applications across clouds and devices in a common operating environment.
Our team of 30,000+ people working in 60+ countries worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our Company EPIC2 values of execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate, and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow.
About the Legal Team
“Fearless legal innovators.” That’s the mantra of VMware’s Legal Team. We’re dedicated to working out creative ways to mitigate legal risks while helping the Company pursue its goals in the global marketplace. We focus on leading with strategic solutions, inspiring an ethical culture, and driving VMware to success. We also reach out to the community by donating hundreds of hours of pro bono support each year. Are you interesting in enriching your career by working on a diverse, award-winning team that goes beyond traditional corporate legal departments? Join our team and you will help provide strategic solutions that impact the success of our business, our customers, and the community.
Job Role & Responsibility
We are seeking an experienced Cybersecurity attorney to join VMware’s Litigation, Employment, Cybersecurity & Regulatory Compliance (LECRC) team. The VMware LECRC team is a global team that focuses on identifying and managing risks, providing practical legal guidance to our clients, and defending the Company against claims anywhere across the globe. Our team practices a collaborative, creative, practical, and results-oriented approach to providing legal advice. If you are looking to join an energetic team where you can be a team builder and a standout colleague, then you have found the place. This position is eligible to be based in Palo Alto, CA, Broomfield, CO, Atlanta, GA, Boston, MA, Austin, TX, Reston, VA, or Bellevue, WA and will report to the Cybersecurity Counsel.
Responsibilities include:
Provide legal guidance to and collaborate with Information Security, Product Security, Privacy, and other business teams as part of security investigations and incident response activities
Review and track security related contractual obligations
Support the Information Security and Product Security teams on cybersecurity and other related legal matters
Coordinate and collaborate with other legal teams, including Privacy, Litigation, Commercial, Employment, and Government Relations on various cybersecurity-related matters
Review and prepare responses to requests from law enforcement or government agencies
Provide practical and strategic advice and counseling to internal clients while balancing risk and business objectives
Build and maintain a positive relationship with internal clients who become involved in cybersecurity-related matters
Collaborate with internal team members and outside counsel to efficiently manage cybersecurity matters and various aspects of outside counsel relationships
Working closely with the Information Security, Privacy, and Government Relations teams, advise the Company about proposed and implemented global cybersecurity laws, regulations, and initiatives
Operate effectively and cost-efficiently, remaining mindful of budget requirements and limitations
Candidate Requirements
J.D. from an accredited law school, strong academic record, and bar admission in at least one U.S. state
2 – 5 years of relevant cybersecurity experience, including with investigations, incident response activities, and law enforcement requests; experience working with or in high tech industry preferred; experience working in government a plus
Must be effective at working with others in a fast-paced environment, with the ability to multi-task and manage a large volume of concurrent projects
Extremely well organized and detail-oriented
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to interface effectively within all levels of the organization and to gain the trust and confidence of colleagues, business leaders, and executives
Excellent legal and business judgment, high standards, and impeccable integrity
Ability to think strategically and to give practical legal advice in the face of ambiguity or uncertainty
Proficient at reducing large amounts of information to a critical few important themes/issues and clearly communicating these to senior management
Creative, practical, entrepreneurial, and pragmatic
Travel may be required from time-to-time
“This job requisition is not eligible for employment-based immigration sponsored by VMware.”
Category : Legal
Subcategory: Legal Counsel
Experience: Manager and Professional
Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time

We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

JobTitle: Bookkeeper (Virtual Remote PART-TIME Accounting) – Los Angeles, California
Text:
Overview:

Are you an experienced accounting professional who would love a part-time, virtual position that would allow you to achieve the optimal work/life balance that you have always dreamed of? Would you enjoy using your bookkeeping expertise to remotely help small businesses thrive, all from the comfort of your own home office? Tired of commuting through nightmarish weather compounded with 50+ hour work weeks? If you’re interested in working between 20-30 hours a week during traditional daytime business hours for an award-winning organization leveraging cutting edge technology to pioneer the work-from-home revolution, then we may have the perfect opportunity for you!
About Supporting Strategies
Since 2004, we have been empowering business owners by taking bookkeeping and operational support functions off their plates allowing them to focus on their core business. Supporting Strategies’ experienced professionals use our cutting-edge cloud-based platform, virtual infrastructure and proven process to deliver a full suite of outsourced services, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, bookkeeping, financial reporting, controller level services and payroll administration.
Supporting Strategies has over 100 offices throughout the U.S. and is continuing to grow rapidly! This momentum has created fantastic opportunities for accountants who thrive on providing exceptional client service while seeking optimal work-life balance as well as the strength of a network community of over 400 employees nationwide.
Why Work for Supporting Strategies?
SOUGHT AFTER FLEXIBILITY!
MEANINGFUL WORK/LIFE BALANCE – Our unique, virtual, work-from-home opportunities allow you to harmoniously balance your family obligations, passions, and love of ‘getting into the numbers.’
DISTINGUISHED REPUTATION – Supporting Strategies has received the distinction of being a Top 50 Franchisee Satisfaction Award winner by Franchise Business Review for the past 4 years running. Franchise Business Review has also named Supporting Strategies as one of the Best Franchises for Women consecutively over the past 3 years.
LEADING EDGE TECHNOLOGY – Opportunity to advance your technical skills using the latest and most innovative cloud-based platforms.
Responsibilities:

The responsibilities associated with this role are organized into areas that are very important to Supporting Strategies as an organization. We have purposely chosen the word “delight” when defining these responsibilities because it appropriately captures how passionate we are about these initiatives and we naturally hope you will share in our sentiment.
Client Delight – Building Great Client Relationships
Provide exceptional accounting and operational service to our clients.
Demonstrate thorough understanding of professional accounting and bookkeeping practices.
Keep abreast of the latest developments in technologies to deliver outstanding quality service.
Support client onboarding process for all assigned client engagements in accordance with defined process.
Execute, as applicable, processes related to accounts payable and accounts receivable management, bookkeeping entries, closing the books monthly as well as preparing financial reporting and analysis. May also include payroll, HR administration and special projects as assigned.
Collaborate with your manager and other Associates on your team to ensure all clients are delighted with our services through timely and effective communication, delivery on deadlines and stellar accounting support.
Manage day-to-day relationships with clients while performing within established processes and budget parameters.
Identify and recommend to your manager areas where Supporting Strategies may be able to provide additional services or tools to drive additional client value and efficiency.
Team Delight – Creating a Satisfying & Collaborative Virtual Environment
Complete virtual training with guidance from your manager in accordance with established Supporting Strategies procedures.
Communicate with your manager regarding your established schedule, desired hours and any potential capacity issues.
Participate in recurring team and one-on-one check-in meetings to ensure you are aligned for success.
Embrace coaching and feedback provided by your manager and implement changes as needed to help meet team and client goals.
Qualifications:

Does everything you have read so far sound appealing? We hope so! If you meet the qualifications below, we would absolutely love for you to apply!
A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related field.
5+ years of demonstrated ability to provide detailed level bookkeeping support – accounts payable, accounts receivable, closing books on a monthly basis and preparing financial reporting and analysis for small businesses.

A passion for and sense of personal satisfaction in delighting clients and helping small businesses succeed.

Experience in developing strong remote team relationships based on trust, accountability, integrity, and sharing of best practices.
Commitment to maintain the highest level of confidentiality while working with client data.

JobTitle: Global Practice Principle Recruiter – Data Science/e-Commerce
Text:
Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for a Global Practice Principle Recruiter – Data Science/e-Commerce. This role can be located in New Brunswick, NJ, Tampa, FL, Los Angeles, CA or San Francisco, CA with consideration for remote work within the United States. Work location is flexible if approved by the Company except that position may not be performed remotely from Colorado.
Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 130 years. We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. At Johnson & Johnson, we believe good health is the foundation of vibrant lives, thriving communities and forward progress. That’s why for more than 130 years, we have aimed to keep people well at every age and every stage of life. Today, as the world’s largest and most broadly-based healthcare company, we are committed to using our reach and size for good. We strive to improve access and affordability, create healthier communities, and put a healthy mind, body and environment within reach of everyone, everywhere. Every day, our more than 130,000 employees across the world are blending heart, science and ingenuity to profoundly change the trajectory of health for humanity. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Summary:
The Global Practice Principle Recruiter will be responsible for the delivery, execution, and assessment of our newly envisioned Talent Acquisition Practice Model that will provide Johnson & Johnson with a competitive advantage. You will utilize Data Science/eComm industry & business acumen as an active, strategic, trusted advisor to Business Leaders and Human Resource Partners. You will bring deep expertise and market knowledge while staying on top of trends and market changes and knowledgeable about talent competitors. You will be a Talent Advisor as you translate the Data Science/eComm enterprise and business strategy to craft the talent priorities for a particular Practice. At this level, you will have a greater degree of impact on the implementation of strategies aligned to business priorities of a supported Data Science/eComm Practice.

Responsibilities:
Translate the strategies of Global Practice model into deliverables- building, innovating and improving recruiting,Utilize a deep understanding of J&J's long and short-term strategies, with special focus on its different growth drivers and innovation pipeline. Apply deep technical acumen, including knowledge of industry and functional/therapeutic area to coach and influence hiring managers in the most critical talent insights.Stay largely connected with the external Data Science/eComm practice community, positioning oneself as an established professional with deep technical expertise, strong business network, significant social media presence, knowledge production and attendance of events and seminars.Cultivate a high level of candidate care & service during all stages of recruiting process. Craft long-term relationships by acting as a career coach and becoming part of his/her network while building a consistent pipeline of passive talent for future opportunities.Lead a portfolio and guide internal clients in the best recruiting standards. Serve as a strategic talent advisor and as an ambassador for the Global D&I Strategy.Collaborate in a culture of agile thinking through a fast, adaptive and iterative recruiting approach.Utilize business data, technology, and other operational metrics to "sell" qualified diverse candidates to hiring managers and to "sell" J&J to passive and active talent. Integrate internal talent availability and external trends into a compelling talent narrative to drive data-based decisions while observing emerging talent priorities.Build the Talent Sourcing plan to ensure the Company will find elite talent utilizing Global Talent Management strategies.Help others understand internal and external digital platforms to develop & execute sourcing strategies, build sustainable candidate pipelines and cultivate relevant prospect/candidate relationships.
Qualifications
Required skills:
A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree is required. Master’s or other advanced degree is preferred.A minimum of 5 years of relevant business experience.Recruiting experience in a corporate environment or in recruiting executives in either a retained search firm or agency.Validated ability to recruit diverse individuals and supporting DEI recruitment efforts.Ability to negotiate and advise on complex compensation packages.Excellent communication (both written and verbal), influencing and negotiation skills.Strong project management, analytical and critical thinking skills with thorough attention to detail.Expertise in utilizing metrics regularly to track and maintain performance.Excellent assessment and interviewing skills and a strong command of assessment and selection methodologies, instruments, and processes.Up to 10% travel may be required as business demands.
Preferred skills:
Experience in a specialized Practice field (i.e. Data Science, E-Commerce, etc.)Understanding of legal issues that impact global recruiting activities; namely employment contract law and restrictive covenants.Proficiency with various applicant management and applicant tracking systems.Global talent perspective and experience working in a highly matrixed environment.Knowledge of disruptive technologies that impact the healthcare industry and their implications in the business and talent landscape.
Do you strive to join an outstanding team that is dynamic and ever-changing? Is career growth and opportunity appealing to you? Apply to this opportunity today.
Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Job Title: Product Manager, Reproductive Health Microarray
Requisition ID: 147937BR
Location: US - Remote

What will you do?
When you are part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like improving products and services for reproductive health, genetic screening, the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals.
The Reproductive Health Microarray Business Unit is highly mission-driven, committed to advancing solutions around the world to ultimately make the world healthier focused on genetic testing including pre and post-natal diagnosis. The team works to ensure the voice of the customer is brought into product portfolio. The business utilizes multiple platforms to provide complete solutions designed for meeting the customers’ unmet needs.
The Product Manager will serve as the product champion and be responsible for the product introduction, training, support and life cycle management for our pre-natal and post-natal reproductive health products. This person will develop business cases and own product management responsibilities for the growing portfolio of products.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
The Product Manager will play a vital role in the success of the organization by driving the strategy and product portfolio (including the entire CytoScan portfolio) focused on the pre-natal and post-natal markets.
Customer Centric
Manage a portfolio of new and existing products and ensure their commercial success
Define market requirements and synthesize customer input by conducting VOC and market research to understand key market trends, use cases, customer requirements, user and buyer personas, and competitive activities across geographies and market segments
Work closely with global market development to define go-to-market strategy including support for global product launch activities including positioning, value proposition, sales training, collateral and demand generation strategies.
Develop relationships with key opinion leaders that can become product advocates, provide business insights, identify market needs and trends, and become beta testers for new products.
People Leadership:
Be the voice of customers guiding cross-functional product development teams to ensure the team can deliver the product solutions that meet or exceed customer’s expectations.
Inspire, influence, and empower employees across the matrix (both direct and indirect teams) to over-achieve objectives. Proven capability to work within a highly-matrixed environment effectively and efficiently.
Operational Excellence:
Leverage the classical four P’s to continue to strengthen our leadership position in the pre-natal space.
Partner with global commercial organization to ensure the successful commercialization of new products.
Creative, independent thinker capable of recognizing the most effective and efficient way to get things done.
Strong initiative and ability to take ownership of challenging problems involving disparate parties. Demonstrated problem solving skills in situations involving conflicting constraints and pressure.
How will you get there?
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in a life science discipline required. Masters, Ph.D. or M.B.A degree a plus.
Experience:
6+ years of product marketing in Life Sciences, or Genomics
Experience in defining product requirements and working with cross-functional teams to ensure the development of products based on business requirements.
Track record in interacting with customers and various internal organizations.
Experience developing and achieving regulatory approval for diagnostic products is a plus
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:
Demonstrated success in new product development and commercialization of Genomics reagents and consumables.
Ability to effectively influence customers, partners, vendors, and internal staff as required
Demonstrated success working in a global matrixed-environment.
Ability to influence and promote enthusiasm and support through verbal, written and presentation communications skills
Willingness to travel up to 25%, both domestic and internationally, as required
Demonstrates and drives the Thermo Fisher values – Integrity, Intensity, Involvement and Innovation (The Four I’s)
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $25 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 75,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.

Job description

Who will you be working for?
Our partner is a trusted brand for traders and investors all around the world. With over 40 million unique users per month they belong to the top financial portals worldwide.
Their core mission: keep their readers updated in real time.

What is this job about?
In this position as Web Content Manager you understand the Japanese financial market like no other. You will be responsible for the content, quality, promotion and community of the Japanese edition.

On a daily basis, you write articles on various financial topics in Japanese and English. Although the position is remote, you need to be in the right time zone to work during the hours of the Japanese stock market.

Your tasks may include:

Website content management
Editing and localization
Traffic maximization
Traffic monitoring and analysis

Promoting the company's web tools to other sites
Social Media Management
PR and brand awareness activities
Ensuring quality standards for language and technical functionality
Supporting users visiting the website
Acting as the moderator on forums

Your job is key for the company’s growth! Great content means growing visibility – worldwide!
Profile
Who is this job made for?
For passionate writers with great interest in the financial/investment sector.
For freelance writers with previous experience in financial content creation.

What do you need to apply?
Language skills: native level in Japanese & proficiency in English
1 year of experience as a journalist or outstanding copywriting skills
In-depth knowledge of Japanese online media
First experience or deep knowledge of the financial and investment sector
Experience analyzing traffic
Knowledge of digital marketing and digital performance activities
Business and goal oriented outlook
Excellent organizational and time-management skills
Excellent interpersonal skills
Ability to work independently but also as part of a team
Experience with CSS

This brings you extra points:
Previous experience in SEO and Social Media Optimization
Networking skills to search for growth opportunities (in the future)

Are you ready to keep the world updated about real time activities on the Japanese stock market? You can also share this offer with a friend whom you think is the perfect fit .

SALARY - USD 60,000 per year
