JobTitle: Manager, ESG Reporting - Opportunity for Working Remotely Los Angeles, CA
Text:
Job Title: Manager, ESG Reporting
Role Location: USA, Remote office
Reports to: Director, Sustainability & ESG
Job description
VMware’s Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) sits in the Office of the CTO. The ESG Office oversees and manages all ESG reporting, ratings and rankings. The Office facilitates ESG Steering Committees at the management and executive levels, as well as leads on VMware’s 2030 Agenda.
The position will lead and manage all of VMware’s ESG reporting. This role is both strategic and pragmatic; requiring that we execute on our annual reporting commitments, as well as continue to mature our reporting processes and outputs. You will be responsible for evolving VMware’s sustainability/ESG reporting and supporting in the development of meaningful public disclosure strategies. You will be responsible for gathering data and information, shaping and developing our sustainability stories, and translating key sustainability messages into mediums for different target audiences (e.g., investors, customers, employees, etc.).
Key responsibilities include:
Annual reporting & assessments
Manage, oversee and complete VMware’s ESG Indicators & Metrics
Manage, oversee and complete VMware’s Global Impact/ESG Report
Manage, oversee and complete CDP’s Climate response
Support Finance with ESG disclosures in Form 10-K
Respond to key ESG surveys, inquiries and ratings agencies (DJSI, EcoVadis, MSCI, JUST and others) and perform ongoing due diligence and regular monitoring of VMware’s ESG scores.
Support Investor Relations for all investor and board reporting of ESG including materials, reports, and presentations.
Continue to deepen alignment with GRI, SASB and TCFD
Partner with risk management and finance on TCFD
Lead on future materiality assessments
Build relationships across functions and business units to enable opportunities for improvement
ESG communications expert
Ensure ESG reporting and monitoring communication is aligned with VMware’s strategy, brand and purpose.
Play a leadership role in partnering with Marketing and Communications to develop communication strategies for internal and external stakeholders.
Drive internal and external communication and reputation of ESG progress, leveraging external partners, ESG awards, and other influencer initiatives.
Key requirements
5+ years of experience as a sustainability/ESG practitioner, with direct experience leading sustainability reporting projects.
Skilled at leading and managing without authority.
Ability to work at and navigate all levels of an organization, driving decisions and direction through influence, including executive and senior business stakeholders.
Highly organized with strong project management skills.
Strong interpersonal skills, with ability to lead complex stakeholder processes.
Strong execution skills, with ability to work independently while pursuing organizational and team goals.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; with demonstrated experience presenting to large, high-profile audiences.
Bachelor’s degree (advanced degree preferred) or equivalent experience

Category : Business Strategy and Operations
Subcategory: Project Management
Experience: Manager and Professional
Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time
Posted Date: 2021-02-03
VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

JobTitle: Technical Digital Applications Specialist - US Remote
Text:
Company InformationAbout Thermo Fisher Scientific

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with revenues of $17 billion and 70,000 employees in 50 countries. Our mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We help our customers accelerate life sciences research, solve complex analytical challenges, improve patient diagnostics and increase laboratory productivity. Through our premier brands – Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific and Unity Lab Services, we offer an unmatched combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and comprehensive support. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.
Job DescriptionJob Title: Technical Digital Applications Specialist

Reports To: Senior Operations Manager

Group/Division: Instrument Enterprise services
Position Location: Remote US
FLSA Status: Exempt
As part of the IES global operations, the Technical Digital Applications Specialist is responsible for providing onsite and digital remote support for internal and external customers on Thermo Scientific Liquid/Ion Chromatography and Mass Spectrometers. The Technical Digital Applications Specialist will partner within IES and drive digital, remote applications support and the One Thermo Solution. This candidate will be responsible for IES Digital Hardware & Applications to collectively and remotely deliver services utilizing digital training, augmented reality, virtual integration, thus improving the customer experience. The ideal candidate will possess technical expertise in driving the overall One Thermo Solution.

Key Responsibilities:
Uses technical expertise, digital tools to guide FSEs and customers in resolving instrument issues.
Support of the One Thermo system Solution with hardware and applications support in delivering the workflow solutions to Thermo customers. Working with multiple Business units in driving work streams for faster, easier service deliverables.
Partner in delivery of digital training within IES Specialists teams globally.
Transitioning from onsite FSE support to content, digital, augmented reality support of applications.
Virtual Integration with Product Support Engineering enhancing services within IES global field service.
Support of the One Thermo system Solution with hardware and applications support in delivering the workflow solutions for our customers.
Working with multiple Business Units in driving work streams for faster, easier service deliverables.
Uses technical expertise, digital tools to guide FSEs and customers in resolving instrument issues.
Works in collaboration with the factories and Knowledge Base administrators to create knowledge articles and troubleshooting guides based on current field service experiences and instrument issues.
Partner with colleagues’ divisions in driving digital work stream solutions and system integration.
Brings issues and recommendations from the field to the Service Integration Group (SIG), Quality/Product Support/Manufacturing Engineering groups.
Partner with the team in driving digital application and hardware solutions.
Works with the IES Training Department, collaborating on material with the factories, service integration and the IES specialists’ teams to conduct virtual training.
Minimum Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor of Science degree: Science related, technical or other relevant degree, or equivalent experience
Minimum of 5-10 years of technical experience in service operations and/or commercial environment
Non-Negotiable Hiring Criteria:
Proven ability to recognize and understand problems on sophisticated electronic, mechanical, and optical instrumentation maintained in a laboratory environment
Ability to manage deadlines accurately, effectively, and efficiently.
Ability to work independently.
Capable of influencing peer group to deliver required changes.
Demonstrate Thermo Fisher Scientific values – Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement.
Self-starter, with a high level of motivation and strong interpersonal skills.
Great sense of urgency and an ability to inspire others.
Solid communication skills, oral and written, and an ability to listen and process information.
Basic instructional abilities (training).

THE THIRD FLOOR is the world’s leading visualization company with offices in Los Angeles and London as well as on location with productions around the world. Since 2004, the studio has helped clients visualize and maximize content by producing computer-animated blueprints, known as “previsualizations”. The Third Floor is a fun, creative company founded by artists, for artists. We work on extremely high-profile projects, while maintaining a small studio feel. Recent examples of our work include Spiderman Far From Home, Avengers Endgame, Godzilla King of the Monsters, Detective Pikachu, and Game of Thrones.

Assets are built quickly and must be highly optimized for real-time workflow in Maya. Our Previs Modeler must be able to take artistic direction from a wide spectrum of sources to produce environments, props, and characters that best represent the director's vision. The ideal Previs Modeler will have a strong sense of design and feel comfortable filling in the gaps of information to ensure each asset looks its best.

Strong Knowledge of low-polygon modeling is a must and as well as good knowledge of real-time OpenGL techniques for lighting and FX.
Project based work remote position. Must be in the state of California, Georgia, Texas or Oregon for remote position.
Responsibilities:
Design accurate models from storyboards, concept art, and/or script pages.
Build lower resolution assets for both organic and hard surface - characters, creatures, props, and environments
Texture, rig, and light models quickly and efficiently.
Transfer and/or create lower resolution models from higher resolution models.
Understand concepts that are used heavily in previs such as the creation alpha/transparency cards and animated UV's for visual effects.
Possess an artistic eye for detail and understand the technical specifications for each project.
Work well on a team and successfully take direction from a supervisor.
Adapt quickly and accept change – often have to toss out ideas and start fresh.
Maintain high consistent standard of quality and speed

Essential Skills:
Autodesk Maya
Photoshop
Substance Painter
Autodesk Motion Builder (a plus)
Mudbox (a plus)
ZBrush (a plus)
Unity or Unreal (a plus)

Application Requirements:
To be considered: include your resume, demo reel/ portfolio link (and password, if needed), and demo reel breakdown (or, alternatively, a written detailed breakdown/contribution) with your application.
The modeling work shown should include characters, props and environments. Wire frames and textures must be shown for proper consideration. Here is a guide to help understand what TTF is looking for in a demo reel.
Asset Builders are part of TTF’s very agile creative teams, sometimes working at various production locations for our major studio clients. Willingness to travel is a plus. This is a great chance to work on-site with some of the biggest names in the industry!

U.S. Applicants only: TTF participates in E-Verify and we will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization. All documents provided for proof of work authorization must be current and unexpired. We cannot accept expired proof of identity.
IMPORTANT: If the Government cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, TTF is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact DHS and/or the SSA before taking adverse action against you, including terminating your employment.

Performance Media Buyer
b spot is looking for an experienced Performance Media Buyer to join our marketing and user acquisition team. You will acquire and retain profitable players through various mobile and online ad platforms (including Facebook). You will be an individual contributor in a growing team of driven online marketers with unique experience in real money gaming, working to expand our reach across programmatic, search and social channels.
In this role you will manage, grow, and optimize user acquisition and retention campaigns for the b spot iOS app and bspot.com.
Your Responsibilities

Campaign Planning: Collaborate with marketing and product teams to define goals, develop strategy and set targets.
Campaign Management & Optimization: Launch and manage UA campaigns via programmatic, search and social channels. Monitor and optimize cross channel campaign performance. Test, test and retest.
Campaign Reporting: Analyze campaign performance and ROI, provide regular analytics reports with KPI analysis.
Coordinate with design teams on creative assets to maximize performance.
Monitor industry news & updates to be fluent in the applicable Ts & Cs of ad channels and potential UA partners and report on their availability/viability for the real money gaming industry in our markets.
What You Bring to the Table

8-10 years of experience in media buying / user acquisition / performance marketing, preferably with real money gaming.
Hands-on-keyboard experience managing and optimizing advertising campaigns directly.
Experience with major UA partners (Facebook, Apple Search Ads, Liftoff, Applovin, etc.)
Experience with mobile and online DSPs and RTB exchanges.
Experience with CPI/CPA buying.
Experience with A/B testing.
Experience coordinating with artists to create assets.
Experience with marketing analytics & MMPs like Kochava.
Experience building and managing relationships with ad channels and other partners.
BA/BS in Marketing/Finance or equivalent.
Strong data analysis and Excel experience.
Tableau knowledge a plus.
Solid presentation and communication skills.
Location
Los Angeles/Remote
The marketing team is based out of the Los Angeles corporate HQ. Currently, as with the rest of the company, the team is working remotely. We are open to Los Angeles-based and remote applicants.
About Us
b spot operates at the explosive intersection of gambling and mobile games. Our corporate HQ is located in Los Angeles, in the heart of Westwood. We offer full benefits and flexible working conditions. Our founders are successful serial entrepreneurs who created the legal online gambling market in the United States. We’re a team of creative, driven, quirky people that love solving problems and seeing projects through to success. Are you one of us?

This is a remote position.

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $25 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them.

Location / Division

Rochester, NY or Remote U.S. / Laboratory Products

How will you make an impact?

If bringing new products to life excites you, then read on to learn more about the Program Manager role in our Laboratory Plastics Essentials group. The position of Program Manager provides an exciting opportunity for an experienced, highly motivated individual. The role is accountable for delivering to budget, scope, timeline and quality commitments established for development of liquid handling equipment and plastic consumables.

The successful candidate will be expected to demonstrate exceptional facilitation, organizational, communication, and influencing skills. They must also have a proven track record in managing a range of complex, high-impact projects simultaneously.

What will you do?

Leads project core teams
Collaborates with team members to develop detailed project plans (scope, milestones, roles & responsibilities, timing, budget, communication and interface with any external alliance or collaborator partner organizations, etc.)
Oversees and prepares project team budget including resources and costs, collaborating with Finance and other cross-functional departments
Communicates, documents and archives project team activities and decisions
Acts as primary contact for project team related information
Facilitates project team meetings, cross-functional communication and decision making, ensuring alignment with internal and external stakeholders
Manages projects within established scope, schedule, resources and budget
Identifies any program-related issues, concerns or challenges proactively
Facilitates tradeoff decisions and removes obstacles
Conducts proactive risk management: communication of needs, mitigation plans, and requirements relevant to internal/external stakeholders
Reviews project team progress regularly and uses processes, tools and other related resources to ensure effective team dynamics and decision-making, as well as effective interactions with all internal and external collaborators
Builds high morale and team commitments to goals and objectives by creating a compelling sense of common purpose and direction
Acts with a sense of urgency

How will you get here?

Education

BS in business, engineering or science discipline
Experience
5 years multi-disciplinary knowledge of the life sciences or biomedical industry
3 years direct project management
Proficient with project management principles (e.g., resource allocation, cost estimation, risks analysis).
Proficient with project management tools and applications software to manage complex project timelines and resources

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
Persistence to overcome project obstacles and drive work to completion
Courage to make issues transparent to all levels of leadership, drive consensus and forge solutions
Management of concerns and conflicts productively and effectively within core and extended teams
Comfort with ambiguity and uncertainty
Interpersonal savvy that enables the formation of strong and trusting relationships with customers and key stakeholders
Business acumen to translate strategy into action
Results and detail-oriented; self-motivated
Outstanding orientation to teamwork and works collaboratively
Financial acumen; capable of planning and oversight of project budgets and product valuations; understanding of portfolio management concepts.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; able to effectively articulate complex concepts and ideas to broad audiences.
Strong presentation skills; highly effective at summarizing and presenting decision points and key considerations.
Strong influencing skills; proven ability to get things done without formal authority.
Strong negotiation skills; can effectively drive discussions and decisions toward desired results.
Proficient with Microsoft Office applications (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Visio, Project).
Ability to travel 10-20% (majority of which would be within the United States)

Preferred Qualifications
Professional Project Management (e.g. certified by PMI®, Program Management Institute)

Our global team of more than 75,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com

Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Social Media Marketing Manager | Job Description


Everytable is on a mission to transform the food system to make fresh, nutritious food affordable and accessible to everyone, everywhere. We are a VC-backed social enterprise headquartered in Los Angeles, and after closing our Series B funding round, we’re laying the foundation for rapid national expansion.

Our innovative business model has been featured in The New York Times, CNBC, Shark Tank, Fast Company, Forbes, etc. because it’s unlike any other food business. It all starts with our central kitchen where chefs prepare meals efficiently and allow us to price our menu according to what each community can afford. Our ready-to-eat meals are then delivered through a variety of channels: grab-and-go storefronts, home delivered subscriptions, SmartFridges vending machines and institutional food service partnerships. We’re passionate about making a positive impact in the communities we serve through food access, as well as economic empowerment. Through our pioneering social equity franchise program, we fund and train disenfranchised entrepreneurs from marginalized communities to open Everytable franchises. We’re looking for team members who are both mission and results driven to help us make the world a more equitable place.

Everytable is looking for a Social Media Marketing Manager with the drive and confidence to truly own the brand’s social presence and drive business objectives across all our digital media channels. Our ideal candidate is a natural visual storyteller, a data-driven marketer and relentless in staying on top of the latest social marketing trends. This is a position for a highly-organized, dependable self-starter who is committed to food justice and is passionate about our mission. If you believe health food is a human right, then we’d love to hear from you.

Reporting to: VP, Brand Marketing

Working in Collaboration With:

Head of Growth
Creative Marketing Manager
Community Manager
Freelance Creatives

Key Result Areas: (% weighted in accordance of importance) Broken down into the following categories:

Content Creation 30%

Social Media Calendar Building/Posting 30%

Engagement 20%

Partnerships/Collaborations 10%

Admin Support 10%

Total 100%

Responsibilities

Lead and execute social media strategy to multiply social following 2x in the next 6-8 months, increase engagement rate up to minimum of 2% and support growth objectives
Lead efforts to acquire subscription customers (30-50 per week) and drive qualified leads for Institutional Services team (10-20 per week)
Own the social media calendar, including planning out content themes for a minimum of month in advance; responsibilities include writing captions, choosing photography and videos and directing photographers/content creators on shot list to build out the calendar
Take photos and create videos to build out social calendar as needed.
Help manage external creative resources on projects, including photo shoots, video shoots, etc. and work closely with Creative Marketing Manager on needed graphics.
Help to refine Everytable brand voice and content strategy specific to each social channel.
Achieve 100% response/engagement rate on all guest messages questions, comments, within 24 hours; 48 hours if weekend inquiry.
Develop strategy for finding/following/engaging with existing customer and potential new customer in the communities we serve and across greater LA.
Follow and engage with like-minded organizations, businesses, and influencers to build network of mission-aligned connections.
Manage cross-promotions with partners and influencers, in collaboration with Community Manager
Manage digital listings, including Yelp, Google, Facebook, etc. for existing and new stores.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in marketing, advertising or a related field preferred
3+ years executing social media campaigns, either at an agency or in-house
Excellent writing and communication skills with very little editing required
Photography and/or short video, and basic editing skills required
Passion for social media – you’re the first to know about new trending hashtags, pop culture slag and events that make sense for Everytable to embrace
Background and passion for the restaurant/food industry is desirable
Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup culture on a tight budget (we all roll up our sleeves and get stuff done!)
An outgoing, connecting personality capable of educating and inspiring others
Ability to execute on multiple initiatives/projects with close attention to detail
Mission-driven
Bilingual in English/Spanish is a plus

Benefits

Competitive salary
Health + dental + vision insurance
Energetic team environment at a purpose-driven company
Remote position with occasional team meet-ups
Mileage compensation for any business travel around LA
Team discount on fresh, delicious Everytable meals

Everytable is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We encourage women, people of color, and LGBTQ people to apply. Everytable is a Fair Chance employer and will consider qualified applicants with arrest and/or conviction records for employment.

Los Angeles, CA
Product Manager - REMOTE

**Must currently live in the United States**

Friendbuy is reinventing the oldest marketing channel ever known: word-of-mouth. While technology has completely transformed the eCommerce landscape, the process of discovering new brands from your friends has largely remained the same since the dawn of retail. By using technology to modernize this natural consumer behavior, Friendbuy has given marketers a powerful new tool to drive customer acquisition and growth.


Friendbuy is the leading platform for referral marketing. Our clients are disruptors such as Dollar Shave Club, Casper, Away and Outdoor Voices, as well as Fortune 100s such as Walmart, Intuit, Disney and Nestle. If you’ve ever referred a friend to any of these amazing brands, you’ve used Friendbuy. We are technology-first and we believe in success through innovation, a core philosophy prioritized by our Founder & CEO who graduated from MIT.

The Opportunity

Friendbuy is rapidly growing and expanding our Product team. Reporting to the Head of Product, you’ll be an integral member of our company.

As a Product Manager, you’ll bridge communications between technical and business stakeholders. Your primary focus is to combine product acumen with relevant e-commerce and SaaS technology experience to help Friendbuy deliver stellar solutions for our world-class customers. With a passion for understanding business problems, and a data driven approach, you’ll conduct research and gather requirements to take Friendbuy’s platform to the next level.

If you’re motivated to join a fun team in a great work environment with a market leading product, and make a huge impact, we want to hear from you! We’re hitting our stride with amazing clients and rapid adoption, and looking for the right product manager to be a part of the core team.

Job Responsibilities:

Partner with sales, customer success, design and engineering to develop functional requirements based on market research, competitive offerings, customer feedback, user experience, and architecture and implementation considerations
Gather requirements and develop detailed functional specifications through exceptional verbal and written communication
Work closely with design to create intuitive & compelling user interfaces/experiences for the Friendbuy platform
Work closely with engineering to communicate user stories, identify project priorities and dependencies, and manage the flow of information to internal teams (Sales, Customer Success, Product and Engineering) using the agile development methodology including sprint planning and backlog grooming
Communicate with project stakeholders and other appropriate parties on a project-level basis to ensure that business requirements are being met and projects are completed to specifications, on time, and with all appropriate approvals
Assist on identifying, troubleshooting, and coordinating resolution of issues on the Friendbuy platform and other related systems
Work closely with the strategic partners team to identify requirements for new and existing integrations with market-leading technology partners
Develop and maintain detailed functional specifications, user guides, and API documentation
Become a subject matter expert in Friendbuy’s platform, market trends, and competitive landscape

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree required
Minimum 4+ years experience in product management in eCommerce or with a SaaS B2B company
Background in software engineering preferred
Experience working closely with Engineering and Design
Experience in Agile development methodology (ScrumMaster certification preferred)
Experience with JIRA
Understanding of different web technologies, databases, and basic query tools
Excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must
Detail-oriented with strong project management, critical thinking, and organizational skills
Comfortable in a fast-paced start-up environment
Can collaborate seamlessly across Sales, Customer Success and Engineering

Compensation, Benefits & Perks

Competitive Salary & OTE compensation
Attractive equity packages to those who are interested
Excellent health insurance options, plus dental & vision coverage
Flexible vacation policy
Family leave
Continuing education assistance
Laptop of your preference and 1 or 2 monitors with standing desk
A fun and collaborative work environment

Friendbuy is an equal opportunity employer. We’re looking for smart, creative people of diverse backgrounds and perspectives to join our remote team of innovators. At Friendbuy, individual personalities shine in a culture of collaboration. We believe work-life balance is the way to get stuff done and be happy doing it. We hire exceptional talent and give our people the opportunity to develop and grow. Our bar for hiring is high and we want you to help us raise it even higher.

Now that we are a fully remote company, we stay connected through regular happy hours and fun virtual company events.

Friendbuy uses your applicant information in accordance with CCPA.

Company Description

Jetfuel.agency is a digital marketing agency specializing in paid ad acquisition and email marketing for e-commerce clients that are between $5M - $500M in size. Clients rave about our agency’s ability to drive measurable performance, our no BS get stuff done attitude and our innovative, groundbreaking digital marketing strategies.
Apply jet fuel to your career – read the below and if it gets you excited, apply. You won’t regret the opportunity to learn from some of the nation’s best in digital marketing. We are a small, fast growing agency and if you want to make an impact here and help us build the next best agency, this is the right place for you.
If you have a track record of building strong rapport and relationships with clients and a willingness to do whatever it takes to hit client goals, keep reading!

Job Description

As an email marketer, you will be responsible for strategizing, executing, and optimizing direct-response marketing solutions. You will oversee all aspects of email marketing campaigns, including market research, content creation, and the dissemination of copy.
The ideal candidate has the ability to write content that is accessible, engaging, and memorable. This person also thrives in environments without much management and red tape and is a highly self-motivated, proactive force of nature.
This position is fully remote and will involve regular weekly and monthly calls.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Assist in formulating email marketing campaigns/flows for e-commerce businesses
Execute, monitor, and troubleshoot the aforementioned strategies
Collaboration with our Design Team to produce quality campaign artwork that aligns with our clients' brand style
Leverage CRM & analytics platforms to support campaign execution (Google Analytics, Shopify, Retention Science, Klaviyo, etc.)
Assist in developing targeting strategies based on customer lifecycle segmentation & predictive analytics
Analyze and track data to maximize the performance of email campaigns to achieve engagement, conversion, revenue and growth goals
Create monthly reports
Manage client communication through established channels
Launch and QA email marketing campaigns to ensure they're 100% error-free
Determining, managing, and reporting email marketing KPIs to hit client revenue goals
Gather and analyze competitor email programs for insights around email strategy, targeting, promotional offers, and cadence/delivery timing
Continuous improvement of our service offering with updated strategies
Develop and update our internal knowledge & training depository

Qualifications

1-3 years of experience in email marketing, ideally for a digital agency
1+ years of experience working in a fully remote environment
Strong analytical and strategic copywriting skills, understanding of A/B testing practices, ability to draw conclusions from data and take action accordingly
Hands-on experience with email platforms such as Retention Science, Klaviyo, and Iterable
Expertise in email best practices, including segmentation, deliverability, copy and design approaches.
Working knowledge of HTML/CSS for email coding
Additional Information

BENEFITS
Learn 3x more here than at any other job

Text: Description: As a Medical Office Billing Assistant in Los Angeles, California you will be responsible for reviewing medical procedures as documented by physicians. JOB DESCRIPTION
Brafton is looking for a talented consultant who has a track record of successful paid and organic YouTube campaign creation and management.
Specific to YouTube campaigns: The ideal candidate will have experience pitching and landing prospects, analyzing a client's existing strategy, ideating on an impactful campaign, executing on a successful strategy, and reporting on progress. This person should feel comfortable in a client-facing role at all points in the sales and rebuy process.
This is currently envisioned as a contract freelance/consulting position that reports to our Boston team. There's the potential for this role to turn into a full-time opportunity based on performance and business needs. This role is remote and location-independent.
It's imperative that candidates have demonstrable experience (3+ years) and SME in the following areas for both B2B and B2C clients:
YouTube Channel Optimization.
YouTube Channel & Subscriber Growth (organic and paid).
YouTube Ad Creation and Management.
YouTube Content Ideation.
Expertise in PPC is helpful but not imperative or required.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Creating and presenting compelling YouTube management proposals for interested prospects.
Successfully executing on planned YouTune campaigns/scopes of work.
Regularly reporting on results internally and externally.
Effectively collaborating with the client, account manager, project manager, social media manager, and all other Brafton stakeholders as is necessary.
KEY SUCCESS FACTORS
Strong working knowledge of:
YouTube Channel Optimization.
YouTube Channel & Subscriber Growth (organic and paid).
YouTube Ad Creation and Management.
YouTube Content Ideation.
Strong working knowledge of AdRoll, Google AdWords, Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Bing Paid Ads, and the ability to learn new software quickly.
Excellent client-facing communication skills (via phone, email, and in-person).
The ability to craft a compelling proposal.
The ability to create clear reports with a riveting ROI narrative.
Strong interdepartmental and interpersonal skills.
The ability to work at a computer during standard working hours.
Meeting scheduled and proposed deadlines.
SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s degree preferred.
Minimum 3+ years of relevant work experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to adapt to new software and changes in the paid environment quickly
Ability to meet deadlines
This is a 100% remote working contract role, so location is not important. Your immediate supervisor would be based out of our Boston office, however you’ll be able to operate day to day in your local time zone, but on occasion be able to adjust your schedule to cover meetings or calls with staff and clients in Australia or the UK.
As such you must be setup to operate effectively from your own work-space and be comfortable with pure remote / home-based working. Brafton’s core business is heavily remote focused - and was so well before the COVID-19 pandemic, as such the business is extremely agile and well adapted to such working practices.

Remote contractors are responsible for providing and maintaining at their own cost and expense their own computer infrastructure, internet connection and any industry-related hardware.
EQUAL OPPORTUNITY | E-VERIFY: Brafton is an Equal Opportunity employer. In addition to federal law requirements, Brafton complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfers, leave of absence, compensation and training.

Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Brafton (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).

Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.
**This is a Remote position**
The primary purpose of this role is to manage and track the productivity of the account team and to ensure the health of the client's Accounts Receivable. The position supports the company's overall Operations and Client Services by efficiently and effectively providing management, oversight and assurance that clients' cash collections and AR is in good standing and communication with client is timely and proactive. In order to provide the appropriate level of RCM management for the company and our clients, the RCM Manager must be well-versed in the details of all levels and functions within the full scope Revenue Cycle.

Responsibilities:

Exhibits exceptional customer service skills; answering client calls; prompt return and follow up to all interactions; prompt response to requests for information, both internally and externally
Initiates and maintains direct contact with CHMB clients, engaged in proactive resolution of issues and timely response to questions and concerns.
Clearly documents issues and resolution, as well as documents AR issues/status for client presentation.
Participates in client workgroups, if needed, to address AR issues.
Maintains a schedule of client meetings either monthly or quarterly depending on the size and scope of client.
Professionally interacts with clients and patient to resolve questions and concerns.
Delivers timely required reports to the Director of Operations; initiates and communicates the resolution of issues, such as payor denial trends, collections accounts, inaccurate or incorrect charges, vendor input and implementation.
Identifies and provides timely resolution of process issues
Track clients' AR productivity (charge, payments, collections, adjustments) on a daily, weekly and/or monthly basis; as needed to ensure the client and company expectations are met
Provide training and mentoring to staff; ensure standard operating procedures (SOP) are followed and improvements occur
Stay current with company's policies and procedures regarding AR activity such as, reviewing month end reports to guarantee the AR is below 20% over 90 days, identifying trends
Analyze reports to determine when, how and why decrease in clients' AR; includes denials, unbilled, credit issues; holds; communicate with client and staff to resolve
Review work performed by outside vendors for accuracy and production
Hires, retains mentors and manages staff to achieve organizational goals.
Meets regularly with staff; in-person and as a group to confirm the status of client accounts, effectively prioritize AR activities for staff holding them accountable for work performed.
Provides support, training and oversight to build and enhance team to meet current and future business needs supporting our clients.
Analyze and address staff performance, conduct and other problems in a timely and professional manner, offering counseling, correction and discipline as appropriate.
Performs period reviews to mentor and give constructive feedback to improve performance.
Handle and manage internal staffing issues regarding daily matters, including but not limited to such items as timekeeping, coverage, workflow, and training.
Achieve goals set forth by supervisor, CHMB and compliance requirements
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

Academic and professional qualifications:

College or University degree preferred

Experience:

3+ years of experience on the Epic platform
Minimum of 5 years experience working AR.
Managerial experience along with good communication skills.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Technical: Extensive knowledge on use of email, search engine, Internet; ability to effectively use payer websites and Laserfiche; knowledge and use of Microsoft Products: Outlook, Word, Excel. Can easily learn and adapt to various billing systems, knowledge of EMR's and interfaces. Preferred experience with various billing systems, such as NextGen, Pro and Allscripts. Epic.

Personal: Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills; Ability to present ideas in business-friendly and user-friendly language; Highly self-motivated, self-directed, and attentive to detail; team-oriented, collaborative; ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment. Strong leadership and ability to delegate and provide direction. Extremely flexible – quickly shifts from/to clients and projects as the needs arise with efficient hand offs to others. Ability to effectively and appropriately manage a remote work force.

Communication: Ability to read, analyze and interpret complex documents. Ability to respond effectively to sensitive inquiries or complaints from employees and clients. Ability to speak clearly and to make effective and persuasive arguments and presentations.

 Math & Reasoning:

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to use critical thinking skills to apply principles of logic and analytical thinking to practical problems.

Physical and Environmental Elements:

This is primarily a sedentary office classification and employees work in an office with moderate noise levels, controlled temperature conditions and no direct exposure to hazardous physical substances. Clear speaking voice is necessary, as well as finger dexterity to access, enter and retrieve data using a computer keyboard, typewriter keyboard or calculator, and to operate standard office equipment. The position occasionally bends, stoops, reaches, pushes and pulls drawers to retrieve and file information and lifts and carries reports and records that typically weigh less than 20 pounds.

Special Requirements:

Accounting skills preferred

#LI-ALL
At Allscripts, our greatest strength comes from bringing together talented people with diverse perspectives to support the technology needs of 180,000 physicians, 1,500 hospitals and 10,000 postacute organizations across the globe. Allscripts offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package, including holidays, vacation, medical, dental, and vision insurance, company paid life insurance and retirement savings.

Allscripts' policy is to provide equal employment opportunity and affirmative action in all of its employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category. Applicants for North American based positions with Allscripts must be legally authorized to work in the United States or Canada. Verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire.

Thank you for reviewing this Allscripts opportunity! Does this look like a great match for your skill set? If so, scroll on down and tell us more about yourself!

Company Description

When you join Renaissance®, you join a global leader in pre-K–12 education technology!
Renaissance’s solutions help educators analyze, customize, and plan personalized learning paths for students, allowing time for what matters—creating energizing learning experiences in the classroom. Our fiercely passionate employees and educational partners have helped drive phenomenal student growth, with Renaissance solutions being used in over one-third of US schools and in more than 100 countries worldwide.
Every day, we are connected to our mission by exemplifying our values: trust each other, win together, strive for the best, own our actions, and grow and evolve.

Job Description

A Renaissance Consultant delivers high-quality, onsite or virtual/remote Professional Development and consulting services to promote best practices with Renaissance solutions. A successful candidate has experience with Renaissance solutions, has utilized data to inform instruction and is an experienced facilitator of professional learning, who understands how to work with educational stakeholders. The successful candidate is available to accept virtual/remote or onsite assignments, on a regular basis throughout the year. Additionally, the expectation is to continue professional learning through internal opportunities.
In this role, you will:
Provide high quality on-site and remote professional learning for new and current users
Facilitate engaging, personalized, professional learning on best practices for product usage, utilizing adult learning strategies
Guide educators in using data to accelerate student learning
Maintain accurate records and complete all required documentation
Communicate effectively with internal teams and external stakeholders

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree or higher in Education or related field
Classroom and/or administrative experience
Superb consultative, facilitative and analytical skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills, customer service and relationship building at all levels within the school system
Bonus points for:
Successfully implementing Renaissance Solutions (Freckle, myON, Star 360, Accelerated Reader, myIGDI’s, or Schoolzilla)
Experience planning and delivering professional learning
Bi-lingual (Spanish, French)
Deep knowledge of multi-lingual programs
Early childhood education experience
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Note: This job can be performed anywhere in the US except for Colorado.
At Renaissance our mission is: “To accelerate learning for all children and adults of all ability levels and ethnic and social backgrounds, worldwide.” Many of us choose to work at Renaissance because we are driven by this mission.
Inherent in a mission that strives to serve “all children and adults” who represent “all ability levels...and backgrounds,” is the need to recognize the importance of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) in our culture, in our work, and in our products.
Frequently cited statistics show that women and underrepresented minorities will only apply to roles if they feel they meet 100% of the qualifications. At Renaissance, we encourage you to break through that statistic. Roles evolve over time, especially with innovation, and you may be just the person we need into the future. NO ONE ever meets 100% of the qualifications. We hope you're open to learning new skills in order to grow with us. Make our team, your team!
For information about Renaissance, visit: https://www.renaissance.com/

JobTitle: Entry Level Advertising Account Manager Trainee
Text: Paid training, company car, home office, medical, dental, vision, 6% 401K matching, promotion from within...what a great way to start a career in sales!Naked Lime Marketing, a division of Reynolds and Reynolds, is seeking motivated and hard-working Entry Level Advertising Account Manager Trainees to join our growing team. The goal of this position is to prepare you for your own territory as a Sales Professional. Our sales team has been an essential part of Reynolds’ success over the last 150 years. If you are ready to join the exciting and rewarding career path of outside sales, with opportunities for travel, training, unlimited earning potential and growth, this is the ideal opportunity for you!Training: As an Entry Level Advertising Account Manager Trainee, you will enroll in our strategically designed training program that will consist of on-the-job and classroom style training. Throughout our 12 month training program you will shadow seasoned sales representatives as they visit clients and sell our marketing, advertising and digital media solutions. The travel will vary based on your training territory. This field based training will assist in your education of our industry and solutions as well as allow you to observe the sales skills taught in the classroom training. You will also receive world class training on sales techniques, negotiations, dealership operations, and in-depth product training at our Headquarters in Dayton, OH. Throughout the training program, you will complete progress checkpoint assessments to help you identify areas for improvement and to ensure that you are on the right track.Once you complete the training program, you will be relocated to your assigned territory and become a Sales Specialist. Relocation assistance to this new territory will be provided by the company. In this role you will be responsible for achieving designated monthly and annual quotas by selling Naked Lime Marketing solutions and services to new and existing customers. You will perform lead generation, gather competitive intelligence, complete product demonstrations, operation analysis and proposals to customers. You will also participate in team sales presentations, as well as plan and implement sales strategies and programs within your region. As a Sales Professional (and Trainee) you will have a home office and will be provided a company car, laptop, iPhone, and other office equipment.Requirements: Bachelor's degreeAbility to build strong customer relationshipsExcellent oral and written communication skillsSelf-starter with good time management skillsAbility to relocate after training (relocation assistance provided by the company)Benefits: We strive to offer an environment that provides our associates with the right balance between work and family. We offer a comprehensive benefits package including:Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance401(k) with up to 6% matchingCompany car for business and personal useWorking remotely with an iPhone, laptop, and other provided home office equipmentProfessional development and trainingPromotion from withinReferral bonusesAssociate discounts for cell phones, cars, computers, entertainment, and much moreReynolds and Reynolds promotes a healthy lifestyle by providing a non-smoking environment. Reynolds and Reynolds encourages applicants of all ages and experience to apply, as we do not discriminate on the basis of age.Job Type: Full-timePay: $50,000.00 per year

Latham & Watkins, a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world, is currently seeking an Administrative Manager – Business Development to join our winning team in any of our California offices, located in Los Angeles, San Francisco, Menlo Park, San Diego, or Costa Mesa or our Chicago or Houston offices The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our clients with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation and collaboration.


As an Administrative Manager, you will be expected to apply your organizational and communication skills while displaying a positive, high-energy attitude. The successful Administrative Manager must have excellent leadership and team-building skills, the ability to lead multiple teams (i.e., organizing, planning, problem-solving, and decision making) necessary for effective management, and knowledge of project management principles with the demonstrated ability to develop, implement and manage large, long-term projects. The ideal candidate will also have the advanced ability to facilitate discussion and consensus-based decision making, to work in a team environment with a customer service focus, and to manage work of others to ensure compliance and accuracy.


The Administrative Manager will serve as a central resource for the Business Development Leadership Team. You will be responsible for providing administrative, operational, project management, and communications support to the Chief and Director Leadership team, including the coordination and status of inter-departmental projects and initiatives. You will also lead the implementation of new administrative procedures and strategies that are consistent with the goals and objectives of the firm. In this role you will also:


Act as a trusted advisor and a resource for the BD Chief and Director Leadership team.
Serve as a project manager to the BD Chief and Director leadership team for special projects, including projects that may require cross department coordination and regularly update the Global Project Management Tool
Be a point-of-contact to others at the firm regarding the administrative responsibilities of the BD Department, including but not limited to managing department calendar and department SharePoint site, drafting agendas and managing deliverables for BD leadership meeting, drafting announcements and other department communications.
Consult with key stakeholders, preparing analysis, proposals and recommendations including reports, financial/ budget (OPEX and Headcount) reports, and presentations to senior management in the department.
Serve as a project manager to the BD Chief and Director Leadership team for special projects, including projects that may require cross department coordination and regularly update the Global Project Management Tool.
Provide logistical support which includes coordinating meeting materials, recording meeting minutes, and providing follow-up on agreed actions.
Develop and maintain strong, interactive relationships with all members of the department and other administrative groups, particularly Finance, Technology, Attorney Development, and Human Resources for training programs and roundtables, and relying on these positive relationships to identify areas where firm resources can be leveraged in new and creative ways to implement the strategies and plans.
Promote effective work practices, working as a team member, and showing respect for co-workers


The Manager must have advanced communication skills, both written and verbal, strong analytical skills, and the ability to define problems/issues while using a logical approach to develop and implement appropriate solutions. The successful candidate will have the ability to perceive and analyze complex problems, and a capacity to make or recommend sound decisions, as well as advanced organizational skills needed to manage time well, prioritize effectively, and handle multiple deadlines. The candidate must also have excellent computer and technical skills, including PowerPoint, Excel, and other programs necessary to complete thorough analyses and reports.


The Administrative Manager – Business Development will receive a generous total compensation package. Bonuses are awarded in recognition of individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham's comprehensive benefit program including healthcare, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a 401k plan, and more! In addition, employees receive 10 paid holidays per year, and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure.


A minimum of five (5) years of management/supervisory experience at a professional services organization is desired. A Bachelor's degree is required.


As the global outbreak of COVID-19 continues to unfold, Latham has taken precautions to help protect our people, clients, and the communities where we live and work. This includes a temporary shift to remote working for the majority of our lawyers and staff. This role will likely start remotely while the firm continues to evaluate the situation.


Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by clicking the ‘Apply Now’ link.


Latham & Watkins is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our commitment to diversity, equal opportunity and sustainability enables Latham & Watkins to draw from a remarkable wealth of talent to create one of the world's leading law firms.


Latham & Watkins LLP will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance (FCIHO). Please click the link below to review the Ordinance.


Please click here to review your rights under U.S. employment laws.

Los Angeles, California, United States
Department
Business Development
Position Type
Full-Time/Regular

When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals.
Location/Division Specific Information
This position is a remote home-based position and can be located anywhere in the United States as long as there is easy access to a major airport to accommodate travel, when necessary.
How will you make an impact?
This position is responsible for sales and related support activities for all Thermo Fisher Scientific Western Workflow products to specified academic, government, or industrial accounts in the assigned territory. Primary responsibilities include sales coordination via telephone, email, and some travel. Key internal partners for this role include the marketing, product management and R&D teams.
What will you do?
Achievement of assigned territory sales and profit goals within the expense budget plan by proactively calling on existing and potential new customers by telephone and email outreach
Work closely with sales counterparts and Distribution reps to develop specific account growth strategies, account mapping and penetration; includes identifying and mitigating competitive barriers
Generate and qualify sales leads by building a strong pipeline, focused on protein extraction, western blotting, imaging and immunoprecipitation
Perform complete western workflow demos of extraction, electrophoresis, transfer, immunoblotting, detection and analysis as needed. Demonstrations are to be remotely performed, if possible.
Maintain appropriate records and process demos, quotes, and sample requests per Company guidelines
Gather, process, and disseminate competitive intelligence and market feedback
Refer customer complaints/product quality problems to the appropriate business functions
Provide forecasting and reporting as required on a weekly/monthly/quarterly basis
Participate in trade shows, vendor shows, and related activities as deemed necessary
Deliver technical seminars on western blot techniques and optimization; may provide after sales technical support and customer service
How will you get here?
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Life Sciences or Biochemistry; advanced degree preferred
Experience
Must have hands-on experience with western blotting and cell biology via prior work experience and education
Preferred lab, selling and/or customer contact experience in the life science research industry serving academic, industrial, hospital, government, biotech and biopharmaceutical accounts
Experience with SFDC preferable
Experience developing analytics tools for sales force effectiveness
Outstanding relationship management and influence capabilities
Experience working in a multinational company with demonstrated ability to lead effectively and drive results in a matrixed management operating environment
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
TSS is a highly technical position and requires in-depth knowledge of Western Blotting products and services to support both sales reps and distribution
Must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to handle multiple tasks in parallel and balance workload based on priority of assignments
Ability to work effectively in a heavily matrixed and team environment, and possess a positive attitude and desire to succeed
Organized, detail oriented, and results driven
Exhibit a high degree of flexibility in adapting to a rapidly changing business environment
Must be proficient in using MS office, and experience in using a contact information management system
Must be available to work various times during the workweek to accommodate multiple NA time zones
Ability to lift up to 50-100 lbs. frequently, walk and or stand up to 8 hours a day, and travel to meet with customers
Overnight travel up to 20% of the time, based upon territory
Valid driver’s license, acceptable motor vehicle, car insurance and acceptable driving record
