JobTitle: Associate Director of Network Contracting - Telecommute Los Angeles County
Text:
UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)
The time has come to raise your game and help us raise ours. You've learned to lead. You've built a deep expertise in health care network operations. You've set your sights on having more impact in more ways. Now it's time to join our leadership team and help UnitedHealth Group meet the challenge of shaping where health care will go. As an Associate Director within our network contracting team, you'll guide the development and support of provider networks as well as unit cost management activities through financial and network pricing modeling, analysis and reporting. As you do, you'll discover the resources, backing and opportunities that you'd expect from a Fortune 7 leader.
If you are located in the state of California, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.
Primary Responsibilities:
Guide development of geographically competitive, broad access, stable networks that achieve objectives for unit cost performance and trend management
Develop functional, market level and/or site strategy, plans, production and/or organizational priorities
Apply network configuration and incentive-based payment models as appropriate to improve quality and efficiency
Identify and resolve technical, operational and organizational problems
Direct work that impacts entire functions and/or customer accounts (internal or external)
Are you ready to put your skills to the test? In this high-impact role, you will need to be a strong leader and have the proven ability to establish trust and build relationships with leaders and experts across an organization
You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience
5+ years of supervisory level experience in a network management-related role handling complex network providers with accountability for business results
2+ years of experience developing product pricing and utilizing financial modeling in making rate decisions
2+ years of experience managing a medical cost and administrative budget
Expert level of knowledge of Hospital and Medical Group contracting including Capitated Commercial and Medicare arrangements, Medicare Resource Based Relative Value System (RBRVS), DRGs, Ambulatory Surgery Center Groupers, etc.
5+ years of experience with provider contracting
Able to attend in-person meetings as needed
If you need to enter a work site for any reason, you will be required to screen for symptoms using the ProtectWell mobile app, Interactive Voice Response (i.e., entering your symptoms via phone system) or similar UnitedHealth Group-approved symptom screener. When in a UnitedHealth Group building, employees are required to wear a mask in common areas. In addition, employees must comply with any state and local masking orders
Creating and fine-tuning provider networks helps improve access to health care for millions. It's an outstanding opportunity to have more meaning and purpose in your career. Join us. Find out how you can start doing your life's best work.(sm)
Careers with UnitedHealthcare. Let's talk about opportunity. Start with a Fortune 7 organization that's serving more than 85 million people already and building the industry's singular reputation for bold ideas and impeccable execution. Now, add your energy, your passion for excellence, your near-obsession with driving change for the better. Get the picture? UnitedHealthcare is serving employers and individuals, states and communities, military families and veterans where ever they're found across the globe. We bring them the resources of an industry leader and a commitment to improve their lives that's second to none. This is no small opportunity. It's where you can do your life's best work.(sm)
*All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.
Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.
Job Keywords: Associate Director of Network Contracting, Network Management, Network Providers, Provider Contracting, Network Contracting , Product Pricing, Financial Modeling, Medical Cost, Administrative Budget, Hospital and Medical Group, Capitated Commercial, Medicare, Medicare Resource Based Relative Value System, RBRVS, DRGs, Ambulatory Surgery Center Groupers, Leadership, Management, Los Angeles, CA, California, Work At Home, Remote, Work From Home, Telecommute, Telecommuter, Telecommuting, UHG, UnitedHealth Group, UHC, UnitedHealthcare

SDMS Robotics is hiring a full-time sales representative. We are a young company based in Southern California, who are now undertaking our first round of full-time hires. The sales representative position is responsible for the sale of our turnkey machine tending robot solutions to local manufacturers, predominantly mostly within the CNC space. This position reports to the company CEO, and will involve both the development of prospective accounts and retention of current customers.Essential Job FunctionsBelow is a list of the responsibilities of this job. We are looking for a salesman with a proven track record of being able to do the following:Building and fostering customer relationships.Conferring with Applications Engineers to assess equipment needs, and develop or respond to proposals satisfying specific customer requirements.Upselling value-added functionality and improved machinery to customers.Proactively visit customer facilities in person, looking for sales opportunities for up to, but not limited to, a minimum of 25 visits per weekRecognize outstanding engineering issues at customer facilities and identify solutions we can offer.Report requirements: Weekly sales meetings will be mandatory.Develop strategic and tactical plans in order to accomplish yearly sales goals.Partner with engineering staff for demonstrations.Other duties as assigned.Minimal Requirements2-5 years in B2B industrial sales.Experience in machining environments, either job shops or in-house manufacturing environments strongly preferred.Existing book of business or company relationships strongly preferred.Work EnvironmentDaily travel throughout Los Angeles county will take up the majority of your time, the rest being spent in a general office environment. There will be daily exposure to manufacturing environments which may present possible hazards such as noise, electricity, chemicals, heavy equipment, and other automated and manual machinery.Physical DemandsFrequent: Traveling, operating a vehicle, sitting at desk, utilizing computers and phones, standing and walking.Periodic: Repetitive foot, leg, hand, arm, shoulder, and torso movements.Occasional: Bending, squatting, stooping, and reaching. Pushing, pulling, and lifting objects.Job Type: Full-timePay: $40,000.00 - $55,000.00 per yearBenefits:Health insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Commission payEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Sales Experience: 1 year (Preferred)License/Certification:Driver's License (Preferred)Work Location:On the roadPaid Training:YesManagement:Key LeaderTypical start time:8AMTypical end time:4PMThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Aggressive -- competitive and growth-orientedOutcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance cultureCompany's website:sdmsrobotics.comWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

Who We Are
Core Digital Media is a leading digital marketer and provider of online solutions that enable people to save money across a variety of personal finance products. Our products are fueled by an industry-leading marketing platform that connects tens of millions of people with a wide range of financial institutions that can help improve those people’s lives.

We are looking for a proactive Video Content Creator to help us build upon recent gains with several of our websites through production of personal finance videos that are engaging, unbiased and accurate, true to our brand voice, and as actionable as they are informational.
Who You Are
As Video Content Creator, your main objective will be to produce high-quality, audience-growing videos that build trust in our brand and empowers people to make more informed financial decisions. You will work closely with in-house Video and Content teams and management to grow the video presence for several of Core Digital Media’s brands. You will own individual video projects from pre-production all the way to post, ensuring accuracy, SEO optimization, and adherence to brand guidelines. This is an exciting opportunity to impact the future of several of our owned and operated websites.
Responsibilities:
Perform video production and motion graphics editing, maintain quality thresholds subject to manager for sign off, utilizing a video creation process that meets business objectives, as well as priorities for product, SEO, social, partner, and other stakeholders.
Research and develop video creative briefs, scripts, and other production tasks to improve video performance.
Support improvements to video workflows, asset management, guidelines, and results through optimizing processes in collaboration with manager.
Track trends in the digital landscape to support the continual growth of Core Digital Media’s web properties by keeping an ear out for new modes of storytelling to test and suggesting ways to optimize our current video offerings.
Facilitate communication upward and across project team, provide expectations and potential solutions to project stakeholders on any variances or roadblocks.
Understand the importance of Core Digital properties and the representation of content hosted on platforms, strive to ensure all video adheres to branding.
Take on other responsibilities as needed.
Qualifications:
1-2 years in a corporate environment required
At least 2 years hands-on video, audio, and motion graphics editing experience
Knowledge of Adobe CC Premiere Pro and After Effects required
Experience using Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Fundamental knowledge of video production and post-production process
Experience using content management systems and/or project management apps like Monday.com, Trello, DivvyHQ, or Kapost
Demonstrated interest in YouTube and social media marketing
Strong work ethic, attention to detail, and communication skills with a collaborative mindset and sense of curiosity about making videos that perform
Ability to multi-task and work on several high-priority projects simultaneously
To Apply, Submit:
A cover letter that addresses what you’d bring to the Core Digital Media team
A resume detailing your qualifications for this role and accomplishments
A video portfolio that showcases your video experience - please include any necessary notes regarding roles involved in sample videos
Core Digital Media an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.
Core Digital Media is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees. CDM provides employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.
The health and safety of our team members is paramount and we are currently working in a remote environment. We hope to return to the office at some point, in some capacity, and will only do so when it is safe.

Join a Legacy of Innovation 110 Years and Counting!

Daiichi Sankyo Group is dedicated to the creation and supply of innovative pharmaceutical therapies to improve standards of care and address diversified, unmet medical needs of people globally by leveraging our world-class science and technology. With more than 100 years of scientific expertise and a presence in more than 20 countries, Daiichi Sankyo and its 15,000 employees around the world draw upon a rich legacy of innovation and a robust pipeline of promising new medicines to help people. In addition to a strong portfolio of medicines for cardiovascular diseases, under the Group’s 2025 Vision to become a “Global Pharma Innovator with Competitive Advantage in Oncology,” Daiichi Sankyo is primarily focused on providing novel therapies in oncology, as well as other research areas centered around rare diseases and immune disorders.


Job Summary:

The primary responsibility of the National Payer Accounts Executive (NPAE) is to develop and execute strategy and tactics for key national and select regional accounts. The NPAE will position DSI products for optimal access within select market segments to drive growth and market share. This individual will be the primary point of contact having complete business ownership for assigned accounts to facilitate access and reimbursement for DSI products across multiple channels. In conjunction with the Director, Payer Accounts, the NPAE is responsible for gaining and protecting access, driving growth of existing products, and maximizing the value and potential of new launch products and indications.

This is a remote, field-based role that can be done from anywhere in the US West.

Responsibilities:
Develop business relationships with assigned accounts to deliver access and medical policy coverage that accomplishes company objectives for DSI’s existing portfolio, new launches, and indication expansions. The primary focus is on payer pharmacy decision maker and influencer relations, contract negotiations, and delivery of clinical and economic value. It requires strong networking and relationship building capabilities with key account influencers to identify and impact potential opportunities.

Serve as the primary contact between DSI and the assigned payer customer. Develop a comprehensive business plan which includes objectives, goals and tactics for assigned accounts. Maintain an accurate account profile of all key customer contacts and an overall profile of the account including; competitive messaging and contracting, key business priorities/insights, unique or innovative contract offerings, and sphere of influence/associations within the payer marketplace.


Understand the customers’ business needs and deliver product value propositions and key resources in order to secure and grow/maintain product portfolio and indication access. Demonstrate expertise as the subject matter expert on the assigned key payer accounts and serve in that capacity when collaborating with internal DSI stakeholders.

Master the market landscape, disease state, product clinical value, competition value, pricing, buy & bill end user provider business and reimbursement, payer and provider pathway impact and patient financial responsibilities and assistance programs impacting market access for DSI products. Use this mastery to appropriately build access through impact on policies, pathways, guidelines, and contracts.

Partner with key internal DSI stakeholders (ROAMs, FRMs, HOLs etc.) as appropriate to ensure proper and effective implementation of all company and customer initiatives.

Communicate and collaborate effectively and consistently in the CARE Team model to support key payer account knowledge and product access opportunities/challenges.

Monitor and analyze account utilization and market share data for DSI products and develop tactics to enhance sales. Collaborate with key cross-functional stakeholders to develop strategic revenue access opportunities for national implementation.


Coordinate and manage the entire process for assigned key accounts at various stages of development and growth. Collaborate with internal stakeholders to identify and facilitate pull through initiatives, track performance, and increase utilization of DSI products.
Partner with Contract Pricing & Strategy team to conduct financial modeling/analysis that supports sound business cases and develop appropriate PCSC requests in conjunction with contracting managers to support those key business cases.

Attend key DSI sales and Market Access meetings to deliver payer account updates and insights. Attend national and/or regional payer conferences/conventions to engage with priority account customers.


Develops and maintains contacts within the industry to provide key payer account insights and information, understand the competitive landscape and gather information on specific laws, regulations or legislation.

Perform routine administrative duties and special assignments properly and on a timely basis while maintaining compliance with all DSI policies and procedures.


Qualifications: Successful candidates will be able to meet the qualifications below with or without a reasonable accommodation.

Must have a valid driver’s license with a driving record that meets company requirements.

Education/Experience:

BS degree. MBA preferred.

Minimum of 7 years pharmaceutical experience. Strongly prefer candidates who have a minimum of 3 years account management experience or a combined minimum 5 years account management and/or sales management experience. Payer Market Knowledge experience is strongly preferred.

Proactively builds strong collaborative relationships with critical customers

Innovative mindset – creatively and consistently networks with key customers to uncover the key decision makers and influencers and connects them with the appropriate resources to impact business

Strategic thinking, planning and problem-solving skills to identify novel business opportunities that will have a high-level impact on DSI revenue

Excellent oral/written communication skills, including a high sense of urgency and demonstrated timely follow up skills with key customers (external/internal)

Strong teamwork skills to build collaborative cross-functional relationships

Strong ability to identify and meet internal/external customer needs.

Daiichi Sankyo, Inc. is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Overview:

Are you looking to take your career from good to great? As an employee of PenFed, every day is an opportunity to thrive, and be part of a team working to ensure our organization is providing world class service to our members, employees, and our communities. We exist to help our members realize their full potential, educate and encourage their dreams, and make every effort to follow our mission and help our members “do better.” Joining PenFed is more than being an employee; it’s about being a part of the PenFed family.
PenFed is hiring a Remote Member Experience & Escalation Analyst in Los Angeles, California. The primary purpose of this job is to play a pivotal role in finding solutions for member escalations while working collaboratively with senior staff on the team and across the mortgage division. The incumbent will be responsible for ensuring timely responses for member escalations, researching issues and making recommendations. This position will be responsible for de-escalating member anxiety and communicating with internal and external partners.
This position is remote and can be located anywhere in the United States
Responsibilities:

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of job duties and the position will perform other duties as assigned.
Analyze, document, negotiate and assist the senior analysts to close the communication loop between member, referral source and business while meeting all regulatory guidelines, fair lending and compliance.
Act as the point of contact for members and business partners who are requesting service or reporting problems. Provide excellent customer service while fulfilling requests and providing support, which frequently involves simultaneously processing calls, working tickets, instant messaging with an internal customer and processing e-mail correspondence.
Research and assist to resolve problems and fulfill requests in a timely manner and facilitate first contact resolution utilizing technical expertise and knowledge base information. Escalate in a timely manner when first contact resolution is not possible.
Assist with tasks involving our Business Control Process Owners, Gallup and NPS survey vendor to streamline process, analyze feedback, create trending analysis, and provide updates to Senior Member Experience and Advocacy staff.
Maintains a medium level of understanding of the loan process to efficiently handle member inquiries.
Assist Sr Member Experience and Advocacy staff to aggregate, interpret, and consolidate root cause of escalation and create a succinct member response.
Enhance and manage the member experience process by working with PenFed’s survey vendors.
Assist in preparing root cause analysis and trending analytics for escalations and survey results through various channels.
Aid in the creation of a customer centric journey map that can be used cross departmentally to enhance the member experience.
Provides a detailed analysis of all communications with the member to provide a clear picture of all resolution attempts. Keep records of customer interactions and transactions, recording all details of escalations as well as writing responses to member escalations.
Obtain and examine all relevant information and work collaboratively with the research team to understand possible cause of escalation.
Work escalations and assist with outcomes to identify member experience opportunities.
Provide input to and participate in writing Help Desk team documentation.
Execute on service strategy for the Member Experience Center and ensure key operational and performance targets are met.
Aid in alignment, consistency, and cohesiveness in process, policy, and member service to achieve department and company goals.
Collaborate on assigned projects/teams with cross-functional groups to find opportunities for improvement and work together to better serve the member.
Qualifications:

Equivalent combination of education and experience is considered.
Associate’s Degree or combination of experience and education preferred.
Minimum of two (2) or more years of financial services experience required; Mortgage experience is highly preferred.
Excellent writing skills geared towards end member/customer.
Some experience with writing responses for member or customer escalations in financial services sector preferred.
Understanding of survey methodology and process is desirable.
Experience working in a fast-paced environment collaboratively.
Some experience aiding with trend analysis.
Mid-level knowledgeable with MS Office with focus on Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.
Sound decisions and independent problem resolution escalating issues appropriately required.
Supervisory Responsibility
This role will not supervise employees
Licenses and Certifications
N/A
Work Environment
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to an indoor office setting with moderate noise.
*Most roles require working in an office setting with moderate noise and the ability to lift 25 pounds.*
Travel
Ability to travel to various worksites and be on-call may be required.
Special Message Regarding COVID 19
PenFed is continuing to hire and train exceptional individuals to help us serve our 2 million members both here and around the world. In light of the current situation with novel coronavirus (COVID-19), we have modified our hiring, onboarding, training, and deployment protocols in order to comply with current local and state guidance around social distancing.
About Us:

Established in 1935, PenFed today is one of the country’s strongest and most stable financial institutions with over 2 million members and over $26 billion in assets. We serve members in all 50 states and the District of Columbia, as well as in Guam, Puerto Rico and Okinawa. We are federally insured by NCUA and we are an Equal Housing Lender. We are available to members worldwide, via the web, seven days a week, twenty-four hours a day.
We provide our employees with a lucrative benefits package including robust medical, dental and vision plan options, plenty of paid time off, 401k with employer match, on-site fitness facilities at our larger locations, and more.
Equal Employment Opportunity
PenFed management will maintain and observe personnel policies which will not discriminate or permit harassment or retaliation against a person because of race, color, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital status, military or veteran status or obligation, the presence of a physical and/or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, sexual orientation, and all statuses protected by applicable state or local law in all recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, overtime, position classifications, work assignments, facilities, promotions, transfers, employee treatment, and in all other terms and conditions of employment. PenFed will also prohibit retaliation against individuals for raising a complaint of discrimination or harassment or participating in an investigation of same.
PenFed will also reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with a disability so that they can apply for a job or perform the essential functions of a job unless doing so causes a direct threat to these individuals or others in the workplace and the threat cannot be eliminated by reasonable accommodation or if the accommodation creates an undue hardship to PenFed. Contact human resources (HR) with any questions or requests for accommodation at 240-224-4256.

The Testing Company, LLC established the first private molecular COVID-19 testing lab in Orange County, CA in March of 2020. Partnering with an independent lab, we acquired instrumentation and supplies, established protocols, and validated two RT-PCR protocols for COVID-19 identification. Recently, The Testing Company, LLC launched a fully automated high throughput CLIA-certified lab to perform molecular and immunological testing with a goal of testing 10,000 samples per day. Your work will have a direct impact on people's lives by helping to scale up the accessibility of COVID-19 testing.
We are currently seeking a talented Client Services Manager to join our Team.
Responsibilities:
Record and Document all client interactions: Provides weekly updates on current shows/clients and evaluates current standing with the client..
Determine Testing Needs of Current Clients: Strikes a balance between the testing needs of the client and the capacity of the lab and the staffing of the field. Immediately delivers memos to field appropriate channels about any potential changes in testing (increase/decrease, times, dates, locations).
Provide Customer Service: Interacts with client Health & Safety Managers (HSMs) and Testing Administrators to ensure testing needs are being met. Will confirm testing needs on a daily basis with HSMs and Testing Administrators and report any daily changes to Testing Manager and Field Scheduler. Gather feedback on the testing process and report to appropriate personnel.
Address and Resolve Client Issues: Able to effectively communicate with client about field testing, lab testing, and results delivery issues, and be able to resolve these issues with the client.
Create a Smooth Process for Estimating Weekly Testing: Ensures that estimates for the following week of testing are submitted to Testing Manager, Testing Coordinator, and Field Scheduler on Friday by 3pm every week. Ensures confirmation of testing for the following day is submitted to lab team by 9am, one business day prior to testing.
Qualifications:
1-3 years of experience in entertainment/production environment.
Strong problem solving, interpersonal and time-management skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and G-Suite, especially Excel.
CRM experience preferred, but not required.
Benefits:
A competitive benefits package is available, which includes:
Health, vision, and dental insurance
Life and Disability insurance
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: DOE
This role can be remote.

About GLS:
General Logistics Systems (GLS) is an established provider of time-critical package and freight shipping solutions that has been operating in more than 40 countries across Europe for over 30 years, generating annual revenue totaling well above $4 billion.
We've taken our unique but proven business model stateside, where we intend to shake up the market with a truly combined express parcel, premier less-than-truckload (LTL), dedicated and freight brokerage offering that's faster and more flexible than our competitors'.
We passionately believe that our success depends on our customers' success, which informs the 'why' and 'how' of everything we do. At this pivotal stage in our growth journey, we are looking for like-minded individuals to help us build a new kind of logistics company...one that makes customers' lives easier and plays an active role in their achievements.
Does this sound like you? If so, please apply to join GLS-US and keep an eye out for future openings as we expand!
Are you ready to play a fundamental role in achieving the ambitious customer acquisition and revenue growth objectives by leading and continuing to scale our sales organization? As the Regional Sales Manager, you have mastered the art of selling and managing a team in a remote environment but are ready to join sales calls in person as soon as the environment permits. Reporting to the Director of Sales you will lead a team of Sales Account Managers located in Southern California, Nevada and Arizona and work closely operations, inside sales, and customer service to grow market share and continuously elate our customers.
What You'll Do
Lead, motivate, and develop a high-performing sales team focused on the small to medium enterprise (mid-market)
Reinforce and improve upon our current SME mid-market sales model, including but not limited to, KPIs, productivity metrics, and performance management
Proactively identify and drive initiatives to increase new business development, share of wallet growth and account retention
Track and analyze sales activities to understand and capitalize on trends and patterns
Achieve monthly, quarterly, and annual revenue targets
Provide detailed analysis and performance reviews on the sales team's performance
Effectively collaborate with other departments to achieve success
What You'll Need
Minimum of 3 years of experience in a similar role managing a high-performing sales team
At least 2 years of experience within the logistics/transportation industry (parcel and LTL)
Strong understanding of pipeline management and new business development best practices
Exceptional verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Superior attention to detail and will demonstrate that by including a picture of a dinosaur in your cover letter briefly outlining why you are the best candidate
Proficiency in Salesforce and MS Office Suite
Ability to identify gaps and offer solutions to problems and growth opportunities
Bonus points if you have a network of superstar sales professionals that would follow your leadership
About You
You are passionate about the development of others and enjoy interacting with customers. You are looking to build on your existing skill set and want the opportunity to move up with an organization that is growing quickly. Your decisive nature, problem solving skills and ability to navigate change and ambiguity is under-utilized in your current role and some of your greatest strengths.
About GLS-US
We are a regional carrier offering small parcel and LTL solutions to businesses of shapes and sizes. We are in hyper-growth mode with each person wearing multiple hats to expand our services, geographic footprint and technology. Our parent company is in Europe and primarily owned by the Royal Post. More information can be found at www.gls-us.com.
EEO Commitment
GLS US is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and is committed to a diverse workforce. We welcome all qualified applicants to apply to at GLS US and we strive to select the best qualified applicant for each position in our organization. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, color, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic data, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion or other legally protected status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. GLS US complies with all laws and regulations relating to employment discrimination and are always committed to doing what's right.

JOB INFORMATION

Position Title: Risk Manager (Full-time, Permanent)

Position Location: Canada or United States (Home-based)

Position Reports To: Director, Clinical Operations

Department/Unit Name: Clinical Research > Clinical Operations > Risk-based Quality Management

JOB SUMMARY:

The Risk Manger (RM) will provide strategic leadership and oversight of end-to-end delivery of study risk management and central monitoring services within Alimentiv. The Risk Manager will work cross-functionally to optimize resources as well as to harmonize risk management and central monitoring strategies, activities, processes and tools. Responsible for operational responsibilities and targets including hiring, staff performance, utilization, retention, process improvements and business projects for the Risk-based Quality Management (RBQM) group. Participates in industry events related to risk management and central monitoring and acts as an RBQM champion and SME who will provide cross-functional training & consultation. May perform Risk Lead functions as required.

AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY:

Operational Management


Ensure operational efficiency and excellence by leading and/or assisting in the creation and documentation of new or revised department procedures.
Analyzes performance and quality metrics to assure achievement of quality and compliance.
Establish objectives to drive the RBQM program that support company strategy and address emerging business needs and operational challenges.
Participate in project and department budget development and responsible for effective management of budgets for risk management and central monitoring teams
Acts as a subject matter expert and point of escalation for risk management and central monitoring teams.
Partner with internal and external stakeholders to optimize risk management and central monitoring technology, processes and standards.


Service Delivery and Oversight


Represent the department at client meetings, project kick-off meetings and project meetings (where applicable), assisting with project education on risk management and central monitoring tool development.
Support Business Development with RFIs, RFPs and project pricing.
Develops and supports customer relationships, manages customer expectations and escalates more serious issues, as required.


Team Management and Engagement


Plans and manage resource to meet current and anticipated project needs, ensuring the risk management and central monitoring teams are adequately staffed with qualified personnel.
Contribute to the financial success of the department and company by effectively managing the risk management and central monitoring teams.
Supervise, mentor, provide leadership and oversee development of direct reports by setting individual development objectives that align with department and company strategies and objectives.


QUALIFICATIONS:

The ideal candidate will possess a Bachelor’s Degree and at least 7 years of relevant experience. In addition, the candidate will have knowledge and previous experience with RBQM concepts, proficiency in MS Office, strong written/verbal communication skills, highly refined interpersonal/organizational skills including facilitation, negotiation, and persuasion. Further, the successful candidate will have previous direct people management experience and possess the following attributes: pro-active, detail-oriented, critical thinker, task-driven, and highly organized. The candidate should also be able to demonstrate the critical elements of GCP/local regulations and be capable of working in a global environment and cross-functional team. Demonstrate an understanding of the workflow process, role and responsibilities of multiple functional areas, and ability to work across those functional areas. Ability to understand, explain, and communicate project concepts and put into detailed plans. Ability to teach, train, and mentor employees of all levels to achieve project, departmental, organizational, and personal goals.

WORKING CONDITIONS:


Occasional travel
Home-based

Company: Kinney Custom Signs, Inc., dba Signarama
Text:
Experienced Sign Sales Representative
LOS ANGELES, CA

LOVE SALES? READY FOR UNLIMITED EARNING POTENTIAL?

Signarama is the world's largest sign franchise. As an Essential Business in this $54 billion industry, signs are needed more than ever during this COVID-19 crisis and we are expanding our sales team in West Los Angeles and the South Bay.

We are seeking experienced sign sales representatives driven to excel in developing territories throughout Los Angeles, CA.

If you are an aggressive self-starter who can nurture business relationships and close sales, we are the place for you!

PREVIOUS SIGN INDUSTRY SALES EXPERIENCE REQUIRED

The Outside Sales Representative (OSR) is a key role within a Signarama location. The OSR personally represents the Signarama brand among our clients and prospective clients and is responsible for ensuring that each client’s branding requirements are fully met and accurately conveyed to our production team.

Our culture is focused on supporting each other as a team while promoting individual growth. As an OSR, you can count on the fact that we differentiate ourselves by producing quality signs; on-time, every time!

Our compensation is competitive, our workplace is safe and we provide full medical benefits after a probationary period.

And, when it comes to our sales representatives, we put NO CAP on earnings and also offer the flexibility of working from home.

REQUIREMENTS:
A confident, self-motivated, aggressive self-starter driven to succeed
High energy and an engaging level of enthusiasm
An ability to maintain a professional yet personable rapport with clients
Professional demeanor, selling style and appearance
Consistent follow-through with clients and projects
Demonstrated Sign Industry Sales Success
A Joy for Sales
A Joy for working in the sign industry
Attention to Detail
A Positive Attitude
A Competitive Nature
A Closer
A Team Player
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:
Revenue Generation & Our Signs EVERYWHERE
Respond to client and prospective client inquiries
Ability to identify, pursue and close sign project opportunities
Advise clients and prospective clients on best sign and branding solutions
Generate and present estimates for sign and branding solutions
Convert estimates into Orders
Follow through with clients and projects
Compensation: Base plus commission

Benefits after 90 days of full-time employment.

ABOUT US: Signarama Santa Monica | West LA | South Bay serves as the premier brand building and visibility expert throughout Los Angeles county. We don't just sell signs... just about anyone can do that. We sell on-time quality! We deliver multiple products and services to serve as solutions for businesses to increase customers and build brand awareness. Every Signarama store is independently owned and operated by highly trained experts who serve their local community. Signarama Santa Monica, West LA and South Bay are owned and operated by Kinney Custom Signs, Inc.

High-performing Associates that help entrepreneurs take the next stepAre you the social animal and online marketer who connects well with entrepreneurs? Highly capable of using social-selling and network-nurturing skills to help them achieve their goals? All this, while working from home and with the prospect of a 1% commision (with a minimum of 10k and a maximum of 20k euros) for every deal that you have helped come to fruition?Then you could well be one of UMAC’s high-performing Associates.This is whyUnited Mergers & Acquisitions Company (UMAC) is a global platform uniting high-performing professional dealmakers who focus on four investment themes with the best long-term opportunities for asymmetrical growth – Sustainability, Ageing Population, Human Resources, and Outsourcing & Efficiency. UMAC aims to help entrepreneurs in these industries with either a profitable exit, a growth strategy, or a turnaround in case of a struggling business.If you join us, you will be a UMAC Associate taking a fair share of the rewards that each deal will provide.This is youYou’re an exceptionally orderly and industrious A-player ready to work long hours according to a fixed format, setting up contacts with entrepreneurs and following up on their initial response. Your army-inspired sense of discipline is only matched by your risk-taking and creativity. You need to be able to think out-of-the-box, as every deal comes with its specifics, and instead of a fixed salary you have the will to go all-in and reap the massive benefits towards the end of the line.It pays to have a warm personality, as you will need to be able to build a rapport with the prospective seller, and give them a sense of assurance that UMAC is a safe pair of hands. It’s mostly down to persistence and your powers of persuasion, as you will be UMAC’s initial calling card for dozens of prospective sellers, getting them ready to engage in a discovery call with one of UMAC’s partners.This means that: You have true entrepreneurial spirit and a personality capable of stepping back from instant gratification. Payday comes further down the line, so you are financially independent up until the first pay-out.It’s preferable for you to have experience in one of UMAC’s four directions of investment – Sustainability, Ageing Population, Human Resources and Outsourcing & Efficiency.You have excellent skills in online marketing and social selling as well as network nurturing, combining these to create valuable inbound leads for UMAC’s partners to work with. Having some experience in the hospitality industry would be plus, but is not required.You have a hands-on mentality, and are willing to be assessed for the right mindset, work ethic, and capabilities in order for you to join UMAC.This is what you doAs a UMAC associate working from home as an independent you are responsible for laying the first bricks in adding value for entrepreneurs ready to take the next step. You do this by creating a LinkedIn network of entrepreneurs looking for explosive growth, a lucrative exit or profitable turnaround, using our relevant content to lead them towards your first 15-minute call. You reach this point by creating thought-provoking posts and socially engaging in discussion groups, before personally connecting with relevant entrepreneurs. Your first calls should allow you to qualify each lead and get them ready for a discovery call with one of our partners.It helps to have a sizable LinkedIn network before starting as a UMAC associate, and you must be prepared to adapt your profile to UMAC’s needs. We are not looking for the slick and smooth-talking second-hand car-salesman type, but instead we aim for the creative soul with thriving interpersonal skills.Your creativity and compassion must be bolstered by a fixed daily routine of sending messages and making calls while waiting no less than 24 hours before following up on any sign of life from within your network. Discussing with prospective sellers, you are able to quickly visualise solutions that will help them move forward – which means that you have a good grasp of what it takes to run a successful business.It’s obvious that your command of the English language is near-perfect, while also being well-versed in at least one other language – such as (but not limited to) Spanish, German, or French, is a huge benefit.This is our dealYou will work with one or more of UMAC’s partners, each of them fully capable of quickly closing a profitable deal. You are part of that deal as well, since you will earn 1% of each deal’s transaction value, with a minimum of 10,000 euros and a maximum of 20,000 euros. In case of a turnaround with stocks changing hands at a symbolic value, you will equally share in the management fees and/or dividends as soon as those are paid out.An online education platform will help to improve your social selling skills, while there is every opportunity to grow into a position as a UMAC partner. UMAC is renowned for being a team – if we win, we all win. UMAC’s international network of partners and associates continues to grow in Europe, Asia, the Americas, and the Middle East. We invite you to be part of that.Are you ready to join us?Great! For more information please feel free to contact us.Benefits:Work from home opportunitiesJob Types: Full-time, CommissionSalary: $100,000.00 - $200,000.00 per yearLanguage:English (Required)

Core Digital Media is a leader in online marketing and online consumer acquisition. Our websites LowerMyBills.com, MyWalletJoy.com and PolicyPilot.com are fueled by an industry leading marketing platform which operates across a variety of financial and education markets working with more than 1000 unique partners. We operate in a fast paced, dynamic environment where everyone on the team “comes to win”. Our work environment is highly entrepreneurial and our success comes from our employees who voice their points of view and ideas to facilitate growth to our bottom line. Core Digital Media rewards hard work, promotes from within, supports career development and cultivates a fun and friendly work environment.

We are seeking an Email Marketing Manager to build out consumer engagement strategies for our mortgage and insurance verticals. This strategic, creative, and analytical role calls for a metrics focused marketer with demonstrable experience in email efforts specifically for financial services. You will work closely with other members of the CRM team to understand where our customers come from, figure out their motivations, and to develop strategies to re-engage them. It will be critical for the Email Marketing Manager to coordinate across teams across the whole company. You must be able to think strategically, make metrics-driven decisions, and value collaboration and communication above all else.
Responsibilities:
Manage email marketing, including strategy, creative, calendaring, implementation, execution, optimization, monitoring, reporting and analysis to increase revenue.
Optimize email programs through continual testing of creative, cadence, offers, targeting, etc.
Monitor and optimize deliverability and ensure CAN-SPAM compliance to maintain high deliverability, data hygiene, and channel health.
Work closely with other team members to analyze and monitor results, maintain high inbox delivery rates, define business and data requirements for email campaign implementations when it comes to building journeys, triggers, and dynamic emails.
Proactively evaluate branding, design, messaging, and functionality of email to develop the most effective email campaigns.
Requirements:
3+ years email marketing experience in a financial services industry
Experience in developing and maintaining excellent Gmail delivery and reputation
Experience in email best practices, including segmentation, deliverability, copy and design approaches, CAN-SPAM, and list health
Ability to work independently as well as build effective working relationships with cross-functional teams.
Impeccable attention to detail, deadlines and accuracy with minimum supervision.
Proven track record of building, implementing and optimizing email programs to meet business goals.
HTML experience to implement emails, landers, links, etc working with other front-end developers.
Strong analytical skills, understanding of A/B testing, and ability to interpret and analyze data from multiple sources and take action accordingly
Willingness to innovate and challenge the status-quo.
Core Digital Media an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.
Core Digital Media is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees. CDM provides employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.
The health and safety of our team members is paramount and we are currently working in a remote environment. We hope to return to the office at some point, in some capacity, and will only do so when it is safe.

BBTV is a media-tech company advancing the world through the creation, distribution, management and monetization of content. We provide end-to-end solutions to content owners including proprietary tech, leading services and enhanced distribution & monetization.

We have built proprietary VISO technologies leveraging machine learning, digital signal processing and big data to power our platform and ecosystem and our key revenue streams represent the most relevant and scalable opportunities for monetization of digital IP across advertising, SaaS/content management, mobile apps and other revenue streams. We are the second largest video property worldwide in terms of unique viewers following only Google, reaching tens of billions of monthly impressions!

About Opposition and the Role

In an industry often favoring major labels and traditional music deal structures, Opposition stands in the corner of the artist, offering the tools and support that allow artists to maintain control of their music and creative journey. Opposition works with artists to diversify their revenue through a suite of tailored services, including distribution & label services, rights management, e-commerce, mobile apps, brand sponsorships, influencer marketing, and more. We are looking for a Sync Licensing & Publishing consultant to further our artist’s revenue.


Opposition has released tracks from TisaKorean, Vancouver Sleep Clinic, Zaytoven & Lil Yachty, KILLY, Terror Jr etc. which provides a diverse and high quality catalogue to pitch for Sync Licensing opportunities across TV, film, advertising, videogames and other media markets. We’re looking for a candidate with existing relationships to leverage for placements. An ideal candidate also has strong knowledge in collecting Publishing revenue as they will assist in that in addition to driving Sync Licensing opportunities.

Please note this is a remote consultant position

Responsibilities:

Pitch and secure revenue for Opposition’s songs through placements in TV, film, advertising, videogames and other media markets
Establish, maintain, and grow effective relationships with key industry creative contacts, such as music supervisors, licensing staff, advertising agency executives, sync houses etc.
Strategize to set pitches apart from competition including anticipating

and understand the music requirements media markets ahead of production
Maintain and organize prospects, pitch and results lists and reports
Assist and oversee the execution of all contracts related to Sync Licensing and Publishing initiatives
Improve system process tracking and administration for Licensing (synchronization for master use and music publishing, mechanicals, other third-party licenses, etc.)
Assess potential strategic partnerships to with various music companies to help expand and grow our Sync Licensing revenue and awareness of tracks
Develop digital campaigns to expose our artist’s music to new audiences while securing licensing revenue
Additional focus on outbound sales, reaching out to artists/labels and signing sync rights for placements
Develop new Publishing revenue stream for Opposition’s artists
Assist in registration and collection of Neighboring Rights and backend royalties with PROs
Maintain pitching catalog organization (internal company sheets and third party pitching platforms - ie: DISCO) along with regular pitching playlist creation and updates

Qualifications:

+3 years experience in the music industry; preferably Sync Licensing but experience in Administration in Music Publishing or related industry is acceptable.
Vast knowledge of Publishing and Licensing (synchronization, mechanical, print, arrangement, performance, etc.)
Strong relationships and connections with music decision makers and key influencers in U.S. film, television and media
Strong knowledge of TV & Film production schedules and overall licensing landscape
Knowledge on registering and looking up info for PRO's (namely in North America)
Experience with music or publishing-based royalty systems
Experience with performing contract reviews and extracting key terms and clauses
Mastery of Office Suite (MS or Google), in particular with Word and Excel
An ongoing commitment to sustain a strong knowledge of digital marketing and relevant music platforms while adapting to the ever changing music business landscape
Ability to take the initiative and drive excellent results
Must be able to work independently and communicate effectively
Ability to adapt in a quickly moving working environment and to stay collected in stressful situations
Dedicated work ethic with a proactive mindset
Positive attitude fueled by ambition to drive results


About BBTV

At BBTV, our team is everything. We offer competitive compensation packages, flexible hours and operate on a horizontal management structure that rewards creativity and values transparency.
From our commitment to giving back (support for everyone to volunteer with a charitable or community initiative), our culture committee (social events, team-building, diversity and inclusion), and our support for personal and career development through our learning & development program, we’re not your typical 9-5 gig.
BBTV is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our goal is to foster a diverse workforce that is representative, at all job levels, of the individuals we serve and to provide employees with a meaningful and inclusive work environment, free of discrimination and harassment.


BBTV believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company. We seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Indigenous people, people of color, people of all genders or non-genders, and people with disabilities of all types are encouraged to apply.


We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
To all recruitment agencies, BBTV does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, BBTV employees or any other company location. BBTV is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Current employees can apply directly through the Internal Careers Center online for Prospect Medical job openings in California. For a streamlined application process, all you need is your four-digit employee ID number and a digital copy of your résumé handy before you apply.


Regional IT Operations Administrator - Remote

We are hospitals and affiliated medical groups, working closely together for the benefit of every person who comes to us for care. We build comprehensive networks of quality healthcare services that are designed to offer our patients highly coordinated, personalized care and help them live healthier lives. Through collaboration, we strive to provide all of our patients and medical group members with the quality, affordable healthcare they need and deserve.

Perform contract maintenance, purchasing-invoice handling, budgeting-accounting duties, support a variety of activities as well as coordination of duties to support the Information Services Department. Additional scope includes assisting with activities that are needed to define, develop, and deploy initiatives related to the IT infrastructure and system. This position works under the direction of the IS management team and reports to the Directors of IT on the West Coast.

Job Responsibilities/Duties
Initiate, maintain, track & process all department maintenance and other contractual agreements.
Follow-up on the progress of purchase orders with vendors, purchasing department and Accounts Payable. Check that all invoices to be paid are correct and not duplicated before submitting to IS management for final approval.
Maintain, track & produce a department expense budget monthly including a portfolio of capital purchases by account and designated projects.
Schedule in-service classes and mandatory programs, workshops, meetings and conference rooms for staff and follow through to re-schedule when needed as well as arrange & schedule travel for staff attending systems training, classes, user groups, site visits and seminars.
Maintain department supplies, order as necessary and reconcile supply charges on accounts payable and stores distribution reports.
Print, up-date and correct when necessary, staff’s weekly time keeping hours.
Establish collaborative relationships with IT and all other departments within the organization and its affiliates.
Coordinate schedules and activities and facilitate client and vendor meetings.
Track project action items and minutes from critical meetings as directed by IT management team.
Performs other related duties as required.
Qualifications

Minimum Education: High School Degree – Some Office Administration college courses preferred.
Minimum Experience: Three to five (3-5) years prior experience in Order/Contract management. Ability to carry out routine assignments with minimal direction. Excellent customer service skills, and excellent oral and written communication skills. A good working knowledge of Microsoft Office. Customer Service expertise to be applied to IS users and vendors. Professional presence to project a professional image to visitors and users. Utilize basic computer skills in order to access and use Healthstream to complete mandatory training; to access e-mail notices and other systems as needed. Must demonstrate appropriate time management skills and the ability to meet customer service deadlines. Perform automated functions that fall within job responsibility. Maintain an ongoing collaborative working relationship with all members of the IT team and its customers. Working knowledge of budgeting and purchasing.

Req. Certification/Licensure: None.

Employee Value Proposition

Prospect Medical Holdings, Inc., is guided by a diverse and highly experienced leadership core. This group maintains the vision that has made Prospect a needed difference-maker in the lives of so many patients today, and many executives contribute to our continued efforts. As a member of our highly effective team of professionals, benefit eligible positions will receive:

Company 401K

Medical, dental, vision insurance

Paid time-off

Life insurance

How to Apply

To apply for this role, or search our other openings, please visit http://pmh.com/careers/ and click on a location to begin your journey to a new career with us!

We are an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to veteran status, disability, race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or other protected characteristics. If you need special accommodation for the application process, please contact Human Resources.

EEOC is the Law: https://www.eeoc.gov/

Before you read further: This is a for-credit, unpaid internship.About New Celebrity EntertainmentNew Celebrity Entertainment is a brand new digital publication focusing on the professional journey of social media influencers. Encore is an interactive live music app launching soon.

Our mission is to help more artists make a living from their music by empowering them with new ways to directly monetize, engage and grow their fanbase. Artists can drop new music, chat with fans and host live shows right from their phones, and anywhere in the world. Encore also enables unique live music experiences for fans, with opportunities to connect with their favorite musicians and discover new music.

Co-Founded by Kid Cudi, Jon Gray and Ian Edelman, we're backed by global investment firm Battery Ventures. You can read more about us in Rolling Stone, Billboard, and Complex and sign up to join our private beta at www.clapforencore.com.
ABOUT US:

We're a team of music addicts and artist advocates.
We build fast and laugh hard.
We believe everyone on the team is part of the solution.
We are learners who love exploring new technologies and experiences.
We work remotely in SF and LA but collaborate closely.
We believe that diverse people and perspectives yield the best ideas.

WHAT YOU'LL DO:

Plan, implement and manage all public relations programs
Identify opportunities for creative storytelling and campaigns
Arrange interviews and press releases to promote our company and its products/services
Cultivate and maintain relationships with media and influential professionals
Help oversee brand content, including social media channels and marketing materials, to ensure consistency
Measure and provide reports on PR efforts

QUALIFICATIONS:

7+ years experience of in-house or agency Public Relations focused on a combination of music/entertainment/tech, ideally working with consumer startups
A strong industry network and relationships with senior press contacts
Polished presenter, exceptional writer, and adaptable team member
Proven track record of successfully implementing PR campaigns for clients in the music/entertainment/tech space
Cultural thought-leader with insight into future-facing music and trends; expertise with emerging social media networks and technologies
You bring an entrepreneurial mentality: as a one-person PR powerhouse, you are creative, results-oriented and resourceful
Must be located in CA with ability to work remotely in 2021

Text: About SHIFT We believe car buying should be fun, fair, and accessible to everyone. We’ve set out to transform an industry, using technology to bring transparency and convenience to the car buying process.And we aren’t stopping there. We seek to bring that same openness and simplicity to car ownership too, with payments, maintenance, and insurance in one easy app. At SHIFT, we’re building the tools that empower people to buy, own, and sell the cars that make life go. We’ve recently entered the public markets (Nasdaq: SFT) and are experiencing rapid growth. This is a great opportunity to join a hyper growth company changing an industry!SHIFT is looking to hire high performing F&I Specialists! Being an online marketplace, communicating the benefits of F&I products over the phone vs. in person at a traditional dealership setting has its challenges & benefits. You will be responsible for providing exceptional customer service, while helping customers select products that protect their vehicle purchase. In addition, you will also make credit decisions, submit deals to our lenders for approval and help bridge disconnects in the sales process. With your background in automotive sales or finance, you’ll help us find the right finance and insurance solutions for every customer.What we offerCompetitive pay and commission structureBenefits package (401k, Health, Dental, Vision, Life etc that starts day 1 on the job!)work-life balancePaid time offLaptop providedWhat you'll doContract new business, sell F&I products, and close dealsMaintain good working relationships to secure competitive interest rates and financing programsAim to generate finance income from every customerUnderstand all programs and rate options offered by our lendersBe an internal advocate and expert on extended service contracts, GAP policies, etcHelp customers choose protection packages for their vehicle by presenting all products and their benefitsMaintain a follow-up system that encourages repeat customers and referralsUnderstand and comply with federal, state and local regulationsWhat you'll have2+ years F&I experienceMust have Automotive Finance experience working at a dealershipPrevious sales experience preferredProven ability to provide exceptional customer experience to drive loyaltySelf motivated with the ability to set and achieve targeted goalsDemonstrated communication, consultative, interpersonal and organizational skillsExperience and desire to work with technologyWho We Are At Shift, we’re all about growth - which means people who are eager to grow, who are ready to roll up their sleeves and learn new things. We were founded by a scrappy group of visionaries who were by no means “car experts” - so we don’t expect you to be one, either! We’ll take the open-minded go-getter over the pure subject matter expert any day. In that spirit, we also care about building a diverse and inclusive workplace and company. To put it simply, cars are meant for everyone, so we believe our company should be, too. We never discriminate against any candidate on the basis of gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, race, ethnicity, religion, color, national origin, marital status, veteran status or disability status. We welcome and encourage people of all backgrounds and walks of life to apply, even if you’re unsure if you meet all the requirements. (Even if this particular role isn’t the right fit, chances are we will have the right one soon!)Why Join Now? Having gone public in October 2020, we are at the beginning of our journey and hope you join us for the ride! Shift is a leading end-to-end auto e-commerce platform transforming the used car industry with a technology-driven, hassle-free customer experience. Shift’s mission is to make buying or selling a used car fun, fair, and accessible to everyone. We provide comprehensive, digital solutions throughout the car ownership lifecycle: finding the right car, having a test drive brought to you before buying the car, a seamless digitally-driven purchase transaction including financing and vehicle protection products, an efficient, digital trade-in/sale transaction, and a vision to provide high-value support services during car ownership.Job Type: Full-timePay: Up to $16.75 per hourBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayWeekendsSupplemental Pay:Commission payEducation:High school or equivalent (Preferred)Experience:Sales Experience: 1 year (Preferred)Dealership Experience: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligible

It is a systematic and automatic approach that ensures every sales lead gets consistent follow-up, while enabling service technicians to set more leads for the sales department on every residential service call.Rehash Leads’ founder, Weldon Long, is a successful entrepreneur, residential services sales expert and author of the NY Times Bestseller, The Power of Consistency – Prosperity Mindset Training for Sales and Business Professionals. Our sales coaches are dedicated to your success and will work with you to give you all of the knowledge and tools you need to reach your financial and career goals (realistic path to make 100K+ in the first year!).We have structured our training and coaching in a way so that you can…Learn everything you need to know about the StressOS product offering and our proven sales process and tools so that you can work autonomously and have UNCAPPED earning potentialCreate your own scheduleHave a team to collaborate with constantlyReceive constant support and guidance from your own dedicated Performance and Accountability coaches through personal and group coaching sessions. You will need a Web-Cam enabled computer or laptop, a strong WiFi connection, and a suitable space to work from at home.Technologically proficient; not necessarily an expert, but knowledgeable.Excellent written and verbal communication, especially listening skills.CRM experience is a HUGE plus (HubSpot).Other InformationCompensation: 100% commission - High Six Figures is achievable ($160K+), anything less than Six Figures would be considered a failure. There is no ceiling to your compensation plan.Work from anywhere in the world!Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, ContractPay: Up to $160,000.00 per yearBenefits:Flexible scheduleSupplemental Pay:Commission payEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Sales Experience: 1 year (Preferred)Contract Length:VariesFull Time Opportunity:YesWork Location:Fully RemoteHours per week:Less than 1010-1920-2930-39This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Achievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might failAutonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little directionCompany's website:https://rehashleads.com/COVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

LIQUI MOLY is a leading manufacturer of OE type high quality motor oils, additives and other lubricant products with our headquarters located in Ulm, Germany. Since 1957 we have supplied the German market place plus over 120 countries with innovative quality oils and additive products for the automotive, motorbike and industrial markets.
In early 1992 we began our sales effort in the United States. Within the past 12 years sales have increased significantly in the US and Canada and we need more team members with solid skill sets to join our team and continue the success.
LIQUI MOLY USA currently seeks a qualified candidate for the Los Angeles North region. (north of I-10 Freeway) Join our team and you will work with people who think positive about the future and are upbeat about life. In this position, you will take an active part in the successful growth of our company. Throughout this region, you will be responsible for sales growth, marketing efforts and business expansion. With the opportunity to work independently, you are responsible for your own success.
This job provides a competitive salary D.O.E., plus bonus. Also included is travel expense reimbursement, car allowance, laptop, cell phone, 401K, health insurance, HSA account, paid vacation and holidays.
**This position is a home office-based assignment with expectations of a north LA area address.
Your area of activity:
You will be responsible for the following tasks:
Develop sales strategies and increase the overall sales of LIQUI MOLY products
Build new business relationships with business owners in the automotive aftermarket with distributors, service shops, fleets.
Manage current customer partnerships with all channel levels and add new accounts.
Record customer data into a CRM tool on a daily basis to then submit weekly reports
Facilitate product and sales training for members and their dealer customers.
Primary territory: North Los Angeles – north of Highway I-10
Requirements:
A minimum of 5-7 years experience in field sales management (preferably in lubricant products or automotive aftermarket)
Self-motivated and enthusiastic with an upbeat selling style and energetic attitude
Possess an entrepreneurial mindset in developing accounts in a consultative manner
Ability to influence/negotiate through excellent verbal and written communication skills
Efficient time management and exceptional organizational skills are required
Must have strong presentation abilities to customers and to group audiences
Have social media marketing skills or capability and desire to learn
Be able to periodically work weekend industry events. Occasional overnight travel.
Must reside within the Los Angeles North metro area (north of I-10)
Must haves:
Team player, trustworthy, reliable, respectful, confident, strong ethics-(professional/ personal)
Valid and clean driver’s license record
Ability to use MS Office applications (Outlook, Excel, Word and Power Point)
This is a full time position.
Please send your application via the online form.

Commvault is a worldwide leader in delivering backup and recovery for the progressive enterprise. Commvault enables you to protect, manage, and use your data, while managing it in a consistent, compliant way. Our automated solutions work on-prem and in the cloud, and work with the digital tools and procedures you’re already using. Keep your data accessible and actionable with a single solution that ensures your data is always available — no matter what.

Metallic, the SaaS division of Commvault, is seeking an experienced Campaign Marketing Manager that will be primarily responsible for the development, execution and optimization of marketing campaigns to support the growth and expansion of the Metallic business. The ideal candidate would be comfortable managing multiple growth marketing projects at one time, and has proven track record executing integrated lead generation and adoption campaigns that drive demand, acquire new leads, increase product adoption, and grow brand awareness.

This is a remote position based in the US.

How you will make an impact:

Develop and optimize integrated campaigns focused on key GTM initiatives that are designed to generate Metallic leads for sales.
Utilize the customer journey to creative innovative, multi-channel engagement programs, leveraging marketing vehicles across digital, events, partner marketing, ABM, and direct mail
Create innovative strategy for incentive marketing and direct mail programs, and execute flawlessly to accelerate Sales Qualified Opportunities.
Work across a dynamic ecosystem of stakeholders to define, develop, and implement integrated campaigns
Manage program budget with accountability for campaign ROI.
Partner with external agencies in support of campaign asset creation and execution, where required.
Ensure proper execution of all activities, inclusive of gathering proof of execution (POE) post-campaign, measure success, and provide recommendations for optimization.
Provide visibility into marketing campaign results, measure campaign effectiveness, and influence future decisions to optimize campaign strategies.

What you need to be ready:

5+ years managing integrated (digital and traditional) campaigns and programs.
Knowledge and use of CRM (Salesforce), marketing automation software (Marketo), direct mail software (Sendoso), and other MarTech enablement tools a strong plus.
Advanced knowledge of marketing principles and program development, and demonstrated knowledge of effective engagement processes and tools.
Ability to effectively collaborate and develop campaigns that drive leads and engagement.
Strong ability to craft compelling, audience relevant messages and stories.
Results-oriented, decision-making, and creative Campaign Marketer with strong business acumen & effective communication skills while driven by operational excellence in a hyper-growth environment.
