JobTitle: Sales Specialist, Monitoring as a Service (West Zone)
Text:
Job Title
Sales Specialist, Monitoring as a Service (West Zone)
Job Description
If you are a Colorado resident and this role is a field-based or remote role, you may be eligible to receive additional information about the compensation and benefits for this role, which we will provide upon request. You may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.
In this role, you have the opportunity to:
The Sales Specialist, Monitoring as a Service will provide sales leadership to our sales and marketing teams to increase our market share in a defined geography. The role will earn the trust of the customer by providing them consultation around XaaS (Anything (or everything) as a Service) that will allow them to deliver better and more accurate care to their patients to improve outcomes. The role will also earn the trust of the assigned account management team by constantly providing value through the sales cycle.
You are responsible for:
Create and execute key sales and business development initiatives to increase sales pipeline
Qualify opportunities and navigate prospect organizations to earn time with key decision-makers and executive sponsors (C- and SVP-level individuals) by using influence and connections, a consultative approach, and a keen understanding of Philips innovative solutions.
Land 1-2 strategic accounts while pursuing new logos
Participate in weekly, monthly, and quarterly customer business reviews
Drive market share in a defined territory or industry vertical
Meet or exceed quarterly targets.
Develop and execute against a comprehensive account/territory plan.
Create & articulate compelling value propositions around MaaS offerings
Accelerate customer adoption
Work with business unit partners to extend reach & drive adoption
Manage contract negotiations
Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts
Ensure customer satisfaction
Expect moderate travel
Win executive sponsorship at prospects by assembling and delivering compelling presentations that introduce Philips value proposition and points of differentiation.
Manage multiple prospect stakeholders through in-depth discovery, evaluation, proposal, and closing processes.
Engage pre-sales personnel and other matrix internal resources to develop and align on a specific, compelling value generation argument for selling and delivering XaaS solution.
Build qualified targeted funnel and maintain realistic forecasting around individual sales pipeline.
Dynamically adapt to changes in the sales engagement model to incorporate the latest developments and improvements in the selling story.
You are a part of:
This role will have the exciting opportunity to help drive the growth and shape the future in the exciting world of managed services. You should be a self-starter who is prepared to develop and execute against a territory coverage plan and consistently deliver on quarterly targets.
To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience:
All candidates considered must have experience selling Managed Services, Consulting Services, or Healthcare software into the payer or provider space.
10+ years’ experience selling software, hosting, or managed services into healthcare clients.
General healthcare industry experience is a must (HIMSS attendee, knowledge of key providers and suppliers, track record of selling into healthcare)
Broad and deep knowledge with understanding of XaaS offers, commercial implications and customer’s environment.
Understand the Patient Monitoring environment, Professional and Managed Services, and/or IT Solutions practice area. Be conversant in Managed Services related topics, methodologies, industry trends, and core technologies.
Must show demonstrable experience as a true Hunter in establishing C-level credibility : demonstrate business acumen in presenting solutions on an ROI basis, strategies, successful penetration of new accounts, and building successful client relationships (trust, experience and relatability) across an entire spectrum of buyers, influencers and C-Level decision makers across a broad spectrum of outcomes.
Highly developed stakeholder management selling, customer relations and negotiations skills with the ability to effectively communicate with C-level executives, with finance and line of business representatives.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team-based environment and execute upon agreed strategy
Commercial acumen and the ability to understand the key differences between purchasing options and the relative benefits to the buyer
Experience participating on high performance teams with the focus and ability to lead a diverse cross-functional team to close a deal
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience required, Master’s in Business or related field preferred
A technical or clinical background in engineering, computer science, MIS or nursing a plus
Direct field experience in working with IDN accounts
Extensive customer network and expert level hunting skill
Proven history of meeting and exceeding quota
Effective pivot on constructive feedback to aid in growth and development
History of successfully marshaling internal resources in a highly collaborative environment without formal authority
Must reside within the territory, with the ability to travel approximately 50%
Preferred Qualifications / Behavioral Profile:
Promoter: Master of influence who orchestrates group momentum around ideas
Collaborative: Pursues impact by winning sponsorship (both internally and externally); gracious and happy to share credit
Others-Focused: Interested in understanding others’ goals; naturally asks questions and listens intently; finds ways to connect others’ goals to personal goals
Idea-driven: Comfortable promoting an innovative vision that requires customers to think differently about how they achieve their goals
Craftsman: Passionate and treats sales as a professional craft
Diligent: Naturally consults a repeatable playbook and attends to details to ensure thoroughness throughout a complex sales cycle
Consistent: Relentlessly puts in the effort daily, fueled by a passion for sales; puts setbacks in perspective and maintains confidence
Critically Engaged: Always looking for ways to improve, enhance the sales story, etc.; realistic about his/her forecasting and prioritizes efforts accordingly
In return, we offer you:
Sharpen your talents with new challenges in our dynamic organization. As a market-driven company, we’re used to listening to our customers & apply the same thinking to our employees. We offer a competitive salary, outstanding benefits and flexibility in a career with a positive and supportive atmosphere in which to develop your talents further.
Why should you join Philips?:
Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways.
To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.
It is the policy of Philips to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, pregnancy/childbirth, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or perceived disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran or military status or a person’s relationship or association with a protected veteran, including spouses and other family members, marital or domestic partner status, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.
As an equal opportunity employer, Philips is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants that require accommodation in the job application process may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.
Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran
#LI-PH1

Contact
If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it.
If you have any other questions regarding the recruitment process please refer to our FAQs. In case of technical difficulties with the website, please send an email to careersite@philips.com.

Please do not submit resumes or applications to this email, as they will not be reviewed. Only applications received through the online application process will be considered.)

We’re Ada. We’re an ambitious team based out of Toronto that enables businesses around the world to provide incredible customer service. Our AI-powered platform has automated more than 120 million+ conversations for companies like Shopify, TELUS, Upwork, and Zoom – and we’re just getting started.
You can learn more about the founding of our company here. Just as the field of machine learning continues to advance, so do we. And it is the passion of our people and dedication to our craft that continues to drive our dramatic growth.
We are inspired every day by the opportunity to pioneer a new industry, and welcome those who want to join us.
As our Enterprise Sales Manager you will have the opportunity to lead a group of Enteprise Account Executives responsible for charting unfounded waters. Your team will be responsible for working with some of the most exciting and innovative digital companies in the world to define the future of Automated Customer Experience and impact how consumer and brands communicate on a regular basis.
This is no small task. We are looking for an impeccable leader capable of managing 5-8 Enterprise AEs and developing and scaling strong Enterprise Sales practices. You will be accountable all of our Enterprise organization’s new business growth and will be a key player in winning meaningful deals, understand signal from the market and helping us get better everyday.
Should you choose to pursue a career at Ada, you will be backed by an incredibly intelligent and hardworking team, a supportive and caring organization and North America’s most prestigious investors.
About You
5+ years of experience leading high performing SaaS sales teams
2+ years of experience managing an enterprise sales team (preferably in the Customer Experience space)
You love being in deals supporting your reps. You have a strong executive presence that will help your team win meaningful deals and new logos.
You are super process driven. The results of implementing and scaling new sales plays/processes is something you truly enjoy.
You have experience hiring, coaching & retaining top end enterprise talent.
You’re scrappy and you know it. You like working in environments where you have creative control to make it happen. You are OK with the fact that the process, tools or assets might not always exist and look forward to contributing to their creation.
Outcomes
Manage, grow and develop a team of experienced Enterprise Account Executives.
Consistently deliver your quarterly and annual revenue targets.
Continue to scale and improve our sales plays, processes and motions.
Partner with sales, product and marketing leadership to continue to improve and iterate on what’s required to win in Enterprise.
Coach and develop the next leaders of Ada. Help our team hit their personal and professional goals and foster a culture of leadership and growth across our sales organization.
Work closely with sales leadership to continue to design and scale our sales organization as we continue our growth
#LI-AN1
About Us
Ada is a rapidly growing digital first company in a thriving AI ecosystem. We optimize our communication, collaboration and generally, the way we work for the digital world instead of in-person. With flexible working hours, together we'll determine a schedule that fits your style and the requirements of your role.
We are backed by world-class investors, including Accel, FirstMark, Bessemer Venture Partners and Version One. We provide our employees with competitive compensation, great health benefits, and ownership in our company. Our work is rooted in authenticity, courage, empathy, and simplicity. We use these values to create a culture that encourages groundbreaking results, career progression, and community investment.
Ada is an equal opportunity employer. In fact, diversity is what drives our success – it’s at the core of how we hire, communicate, and work. Like our Platform, we are inclusive to all, and combine our diverse backgrounds, skill sets and thinking to build the best experiences for our clients and their customers.

Sales Associate (Full Time)DOC Preschool is an education company selling approved preschool curriculum to preschools across the United States. Seeking a full time Sales Associate to increase sales in our Florida territory. The successful candidate will be responsible for establishing contact with schools, identifying new opportunities, and following up on leads. Encore is an interactive live music app launching soon.

Our mission is to help more artists make a living from their music by empowering them with new ways to directly monetize, engage and grow their fanbase. Artists can drop new music, chat with fans and host live shows right from their phones, and anywhere in the world. Encore also enables unique live music experiences for fans, with opportunities to connect with their favorite musicians and discover new music.

Co-Founded by Kid Cudi, Jon Gray and Ian Edelman, we're backed by global investment firm Battery Ventures. You can read more about us in Rolling Stone, Billboard, and Complex and sign up to join our private beta at www.clapforencore.com.
ABOUT US:

We're a team of music addicts and artist advocates.
We build fast and laugh hard.
We believe everyone on the team is part of the solution.
We are learners who love exploring new technologies and experiences.
We work remotely in SF and LA but collaborate closely.
We believe that diverse people and perspectives yield the best ideas.

WHAT YOU'LL DO:

Full ownership of the technical recruiting process
Collaborate with hiring managers to outline roles and reqs and creatively identify the most effective hiring strategies
Attract candidates via sourcing and job description placement
Identify candidates and assess qualifications through screening and interviews
Connect qualified candidates with hiring manager and organize interview and post-process
Extends and negotiates offers including background and reference checks
Maintain contact with candidates to keep them apprised of their status
Keeps talent database updated
Facilitates contacts by creating and maintaining a presence in the technical industry

QUALIFICATIONS:

5+ years experience with fast-paced, high-volume, full-cycle hiring for technology positions (ideally within a startup environment)
Experience in the continual development of talent pipelines and sourcing potential candidates using a diverse toolkit
Firm understanding of technical terminology, tools and platforms in order to speak knowledgeably to candidates
Proven implementation of recruiting metrics to drive decision-making
Experience with a variety of ATS platforms
Experience working with a diverse team and striving for fairness in hiring all races, genders and ages
You bring an entrepreneurial mentality: as a one-person recruiting powerhouse, you are self-driven, results-oriented, and communicative
Must be located in CA with ability to work remotely in 2021

JobTitle: Technical Account Manager - West Coast Region
Text:
Technical Account Manager -

California,
CA 90036

Exline, Inc., a leader in providing diversified products and services to the natural gas, petro chemical, power generation, mining, plastics and other industries for more than 140 years is seeking a high energy, experienced Technical Account Manager (TAM) in our Ignition and Automation division.

The Technical Account Manager is responsible for managing the relationship between Exline, Incorporated and our most strategic account within our West coast territory of California, Arizona, Nevada, Utah, Oregon and Washington State. Ideal candidate will be located in this region.

The Technical Account Manager will develop and maintain relationships with key customer personnel across several functions. The TAM is responsible for protecting Exline’s share position, identifying opportunities for sales and margin growth, and providing guidance to leadership and other internal functions to help align company resources in a way that creates value for Exline and its strategic accounts. The candidate must be a result driven sales professional, with a record of achievement demonstrating initiative and ownership of their business.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Establish relationships with key contacts within the customer's supply chain, engineering, field services and quality departments, among others. Frequent visits to customer/distributor locations are required.

Understand and align to the market drivers and strategy of major customers, while also providing feedback to the management team that will help inform the company's strategies for growth.

Work closely with internal sales, external sales and engineering functions to develop and deliver commercial proposals to customers, providing guidance on requirements when needed.

Protect Exline’s position within account by creating and monitoring key performance metrics and managing customer sentiment. Coordinate across functions to quickly correct complaints when they arise, enhance our position as problem solvers.

Grow revenue and deepen position within account by implementing product technology upgrades and executing on share gain opportunities.

Deliver business level projections to Exline’s finance and operations group on a regular basis.

Coordinate periodic meetings between Exline, Inc. and customer supply chain, engineering and new product development departments among others to drive close communication and align Exline department priorities with needs of key accounts.

Create and manage customer contact map on a regular basis, ensuring that relationships are built between the appropriate people at Exline, Inc. and the customer accounts.

Support technical needs of customer, which includes performing periodic training events and assisting in technical troubleshooting when needs arise.

Maintain an understanding of competitive landscape and position and implement the appropriate pricing strategies.

Assist in supporting smaller accounts as required.

Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in engineering or other relevant, technical field experience required.

A minimum of five (5) years' experience in sales of highly engineering products required.

Experience with sales in rotating equipment (pumps, compressors, turbines, etc.) is preferred.

Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain long term customer relationships.

Must be a mature, confident, technically astute self-starter.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Must have excellent written and oral communication skills coupled with the ability to manage a consultative sales process.

Experience in an environment of continuous improvement that includes the use of tools such as process analysis and Lean techniques.

Demonstrated ability to inspire and develop collaboration amongst cross-functional teams.

Possess excellent computer skills, be proficient in all Microsoft Office Products.

Extensive knowledge of PLC and Microprocessor based equipment.

Be willing to travel to customer and end user sites in the US (75-85%).

Prepare and present commercial presentations and business reports to all levels of management.

Demonstrate professional integrity and manner.

Responsible for all company owned equipment, automobiles, computers, credit cards, keys, phones.

Comply with Exline, Incorporated business ethics policies.

Comply with non-disclosure for all Exline, Inc. intellectual property.

Working Conditions:
This is a position with extensive travel. Requires traveling via company issued vehicle with overnight stays. Business to be conducted via phone and/or computer from remote locations and home office.

Salary will be commensurate with skill and experience.

Exline, Inc. offers an excellent benefit package.

Grow with an industry leader by submitting your resume to s.vance@exline-inc.com or apply online at www.exline-inc.com.

Exline, Inc. is an E.O.E. of Minorities, Women, Protected Veterans and Persons with Disabilities and provides consideration to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, veteran status, any other characteristics protected by law.

Details of position

Education: 5 + Years

Experience: 5 + Years

Job Type: Technical Account Manager

Category: Engineering Sales

In compliance with U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services, Exline, Inc. runs all applications through E-Verify upon submission. Also, please be aware that all racial information voluntarily provided is submitted to the the U.S. Equal Opportunity Commission.

About Guaranteed Rate Companies:
The Guaranteed Rate Companies, which includes Guaranteed Rate Inc., Guaranteed Rate Affinity, LLC, and Proper Rate, LLC, has more than 8,000 employees in over 700 offices across the U.S. Headquartered in Chicago, Guaranteed Rate Inc. is one of the largest retail mortgage lenders in the United States funding $37 billion in 2019. Founded in 2000 and licensed in all 50 states and Washington, D.C., Guaranteed Rate Companies has helped homeowners nationwide with home purchase loans and refinances. The company has established itself as an industry leader by introducing innovative technology, offering low rates and delivering unparalleled customer service. 2017 marked the launch of Guaranteed Rate Affinity, LLC, a mortgage origination joint venture between Guaranteed Rate, Inc. and Realogy Holdings Corp. (NYSE: RLGY), a global leader in residential real estate franchising and brokerage. In 2020, the company launched Proper Rate, LLC, a mortgage origination joint venture between Guaranteed Rate and @properties, one of the nation's largest residential brokerage firms. Collectively, the companies have earned honors and awards including: HousingWire ’s 2020 Tech100 award for the company’s industry-leading FlashClose SM technology; Top Lender for Online Service for 2018 by U.S. News & World Report ; No. 3 ranking in Scotsman Guide 's Top Retail Mortgage Lenders 2019; Top Lender 2016, 2017 and 2018 by Chicago Agent Magazine ; Chicago Tribune 's Top Workplaces list for seven consecutive years; and Best Online Mortgage Lender, Best Mortgage Lender for VA loans and Best Conventional Mortgage Lender by NerdWallet in 2019. Visit rate.com for more information.

What’s the Role?

The Production Manager position was created to effectively manage the processing pipelines of VPs who have achieved a predetermined volume threshold based upon the VP’s previous year’s loan volume. The PM will be responsible for ensuring the movement of VP units from the Sent to Processing milestone through funding. The PM will manage the POD and their capacity, interact with Guaranteed Rate support departments as needed, ensure the continued education of the POD regarding performance and adjustments to compliance and company policy; engaging the ROM as needed. The PM will work alongside their ROM, VP, and Sales Management to fulfill Regionally coordinated strategies.

Responsibilities:
The Processing Manager will complete the following tasks daily:

Operational ownership of the VP’s transaction:
Utilize the functionality of reporting tools to audit the pipeline and loan level detail daily

Manages 90% process related issues for the VP

Proactively manages the VP pipeline to ensure on time closings

Monitor the tasks performed by MCs, LC, and OAs utilizing the YBR to ensure that loans are happening within time to task

Follow up immediately with POD members on tasks outside of expected turn time

Determine opportunities and trends for team improvement

POD management and development:
Training and integration of new team members

Determine opportunities and trends for team improvement

Leverage reporting data to provide both real time and routine coaching

Ensure proactive communication with customers and referral partners from all POD members

Customer Satisfaction and Experience

Customer escalation point to identify solutions

VP escalation point for loan level and POD related issues

Additionally, the Production Manager will provide valuable input to their Regional Sales and Operations Managers in all areas involving:

Training & Performance Management

Compliance training

New hire training

Continuing education

Performance/deficiency training

Work on the front lines of a growing educational brand interacting with customers and their families. A perfect role for a candidate who loves helping people and working in a fast-paced, close-knit, startup environment. Customer support is the “voice” of Raddish for members and prospects, and we’ve cultivated a reputation for providing personal, responsive support. This role is for up to 20 hours a week and can be remote.

Beyond this individual touch, the Customer Support Specialist (Part-Time) has a measurable impact on acquisition and retention rates, so we seek someone motivated to unlock the true ROI of this critical company function. You’ll use your skills as a communicator, researcher, problem-solver, and systems-organizer to work collaboratively across multiple areas – marketing, operations, website product, and policy – to support the company’s mission to deliver culinary experiences that nurture kids’ confidence in the kitchen and beyond. The Customer Support Specialist reports to the Customer Support & Retention Manager.

Specific responsibilities include:

Become an expert on Raddish products, prospects, and customers developing a sixth sense for member and prospect needs across email, phone, and social media platforms
Proficiency with Zendesk or similar CRM software
Answer incoming customer phone calls and responding to voicemails
Respond to questions via Live Chat function on website or social media
Available to monitor customer inquiries off-hours including evenings, weekends and high volume periods such the holiday season, responding to most urgent requests and guarding against the buildup of an unmanageable backlog
Monitor social media and reply to inquiries; help administrate thriving Facebook Group community of over 30,000 members
Create transcripts or templates for customer service inquiries, seek automated solutions and technical implementations when possible
Quickly and thoroughly solve problems for customers when deliveries, renewals, transactions or experience don't go 100% as planned
Demonstrate an empathetic understanding of the customer’s question/problem, strive to completely answer the inquiry with a minimum of back and forth messages, and utilize a tone and voice that reflects the Raddish brand.
Provide thoughtful communication that is clear and well-written, free of grammatical errors, spelling mistakes, etc. and echoes our company tone and philosophy
Assist with administrative tasks including charter school data input and invoicing, donation requests, etc.

Qualifications

This position requires a creative and highly detailed self-starter responsible for innovating, implementing and executing across multiple teams and areas. As a start-up celebrating creativity, food, and family, we expect the same from our team. We seek team players with an infectiously positive attitude and a strong desire to learn and improve.

The ideal candidate will:

Have genuine passion for our mission to inspire the next generation through edible education, and enthusiasm for growing a business – both strategically and tactically.
1-3 years CRM and/or Help Desk experience in a position directly interacting with consumers.
Have exceptional organization, operational, and detail-oriented traits.
Succeed as a collaborative team player, while being motivated to multi-task independently and proactively on projects from start to completion. You’ll be a resourceful and flexible part of a nimble team.
Thrive in fast-paced environments and enjoy working on developing projects
Be a personable, entrepreneurial, honest, problem-solving decision maker, comfortable operating in the unknown and excited about what lies ahead.
Have proficient Google Suite and MS Office skills and working knowledge of basic business systems with ability to work within multiple platforms concurrently.

About Raddish

Raddish is an educational company based in Los Angeles that creates original, delicious, hands-on learning experiences. We’re on a mission to bring families together in the kitchen and at the table, and deliver culinary experiences that nurture kids’ confidence in the kitchen and beyond. Raddish aims to be the world’s premier kids cooking brand through subscription products. Our team is friendly, supportive, customer-driven and focused on approaching daily challenges with care, accuracy and efficiency. Our mission statement defines our strong beliefs in not only the product we create, but also what it provides in building strong, healthy families and confident, independent, growing children. Our membership and revenue has grown over 100% for three years running.

Kitchen Kid, LLC / Raddish is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status.

If you're interested in working for Raddish, please send your resume and cover letter to: work@raddishkids.com

Carter Controls Systems, a Lummus Group Co., is a leading provider and integrator of automated material handling and industrial automation solutions to customers around the country. Our company is built on four key principles – Cooperation, Responsibility, Communication, and Quality. These principles are embedded in everything we do and drive us to help our customers transform their operations.

Headquartered in Frederick, MD, we provide a full range of equipment, controls and software that helps customers address all aspects of their material handling and industrial automation needs. We serve a wide variety of customers in the distribution, e-commerce, fulfillment, mail/parcel and government sectors. Our focus is always on the customer, and we take great pride in helping our customers realize their material handling goals.

Summary
The Regional Sales Manager for CCS, Inc., an integrator, use their experience as an accomplished industrial equipment or material handling sales professional to exceed key performance indicators. RSM’s own the process, to develop, implement, monitor, and further develop sales strategies for their regions. Candidates with existing stakeholder relationships in material handling markets are encouraged to apply. Base salary with uncapped commission potential. RSM roles are remote and work from their in home office when not with customers. REGIONS are open through out the United States - if qualified apply today to learn more!

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Work both independently to develop customer relationships, and collaboratively with internal teams to exceed sales goals and analyze new market opportunities.
Using knowledge and understanding of warehouse, material handling / intralogistics and distribution operations, develop innovative solutions by applying material handling and automation technologies to address customer needs.
Provide input to the development of timely robust proposal packages that include costs and initial solution designs.
Work with Project Management to make sure projects are completed successfully with high customer satisfaction scores.
Provide ongoing customer relationship cultivation and new opportunity identification.
Work with Marketing team on the development and implementation of marketing & sales initiatives.
Travel percentage: 40% or more to US customer locations – includes local day travel. Large amounts of overnight travel is not required if region has sufficient customer base.
#LI-TC1

Basic Requirements
5+ recent years of developing new and expanding existing business in material handling markets
2+ recent years’ experience selling integrated conveyor and other material handling equipment or systems
Knowledge of material handling systems, equipment and conveyors used in industrial environments such as distribution centers, 3PL’s, warehouses etc.
Knowledge of automation solutions, palletizing or de-palletizing robots and picking technologies and/or warehouse control software
Must be responsive to requests, solution driven, resilient and appropriately optimistic
Partnership builder who effectively communicates the applications, features and ROI of proposals to stakeholders at all levels
Must have demonstrated ability to excel working in cross functional, matrixed environments
Robust user of Customer relationship management (CRM) software who utilizes it to manage and analyze the customer lifecycle, improve relationships, reduce cost, and improve sales
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with above average presentation experience

Equal Opportunity Employer

SUMMARYAcross North America and all over the world, Mathnasium Learning Centers are committed to teaching kids math the way that makes sense to them. Mathnasium@home is a new service allowing families to experience Mathnasium’s transformational program remotely using online learning technology. The Mathnasium@home systems analyst will be responsible for supporting the education delivery and share responsibility for analyzing and testing online system tools. The impact is longer customer retention and the ability to serve unreached families.* Establish platform tools and instruction delivery methods to ensure students effectively learn the Mathnasium way, parents become satisfied loyal customers, and employees work productively as a team.* Manage and revise the operating instructions to empower franchisees to deliver an outstanding service and expand their local base of customers.* Grow this new aspect of the Mathnasium model while maintaining the quality of the Learning Center experience that has made us successful.DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES  Support all aspects of the Mathnasium@home projecto Support franchisee participation and performance in the program.o Document the impact of the program on applicable metrics.o Manage communications for Mathnasium Matters to share platform updates and release plans. Support the improvement of the platform-tools and experience for students, parents, and staff. o Evaluate and implement platform tools to enhance center management processes. Research, evaluate, and develop Mathnasium’s operating processes for offering the at-home service.o Research industry practices, competitor analysis, and current leading franchisees’ best practices. Organize testing and feedback groups with franchisees and company-owned stores.o Create detailed (“step-by-step”) operations instructions and business materials.o Measure the effectiveness of all processes and identify growth opportunities. Support liaise between users in the field, internal Education, Operations, IT, and Business Systems teams. o Support communication and program support across teams.o Coordinate with Mathnasium Franchise Support team on upcoming releases and updates.o Manage knowledge base and specialize as Mathnasium’s remote instruction expert.o Measure the effectiveness of all features and identify opportunities for improvement. Ensure changes achieve operational efficiency and are intuitive to users.o Test new developments before and after a system release.o Submit significant support cases to the platform vendor.REQUIRED SKILLS* Bachelor’s Degree, preferred in education, business, engineering, or related field.* Must have experience teaching or experience delivering online learning.* Experience with product management, business operations/implementation, and/or clientcommunication, ideally in a service industry or franchise.* Experience implementing technology tools.PREFERRED SKILLS  Experience as a Learning Center Director. QUALITIES* Ability to understand existing processes and adapt them into new environment.* Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.* Work collaboratively as a team, with other departments and franchisees.* Can partner with all levels of people regardless of title or function.* Are persuasive as well as sophisticated in the presentation.Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceEmployee discountHealth insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Online learning: 2 years (Preferred)technology tools: 2 years (Preferred)Work Location:One locationBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Mortgage Loan Processor II

A Mortgage Loan Processor II ensures all residential loan files are packaged accurately and timely. As an experienced Mortgage processor, they work with and have comprehensive knowledge of the documents required for a conventional and/or government loans as well as all conforming and non-conforming loansl. A successful Mortgage Loan Processor II is self-motivated, has strong time-management skills and is able to process a high volume of loans in a fast paced work environment.

What You Will Be Doing
Receiving loans from Underwriting
Calling or writing customers and/or any other interested parties to obtain conditions of loan.
Calling specified companies to obtain property abstracts, surveys, appraisals.
Indexing documents in the file to ensure they are marked properly.
Clearing conditions to the level of authority available.
Submitting mortgage loan application file underwriting condition clearing.
Working with the Appraisal Management Company to order appraisal corrections.
Printing and mailing approval and denial letters to applicants.
Submitting approved mortgage loan file to Mortgage Loan Closer for settlement.

High School diploma or general education degree (GED)
A minimum of two (2) plus years' related work experience and/or training required
A minimum of three (3) years' experience working in a financial or banking mortgage department a plus
A minimum of three (3) plus years working with and/or comprehensive knowledge in conforming & non-conforming loans, Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac Guidelines, and any government and/or conventional, FHA or VA loans required
Proficient PC skills in a Windows based environment required; mortgage-processing software a plus
Detail oriented, minimal supervision, with excellent communication and analytical skills strongly preferred

JobTitle: Business Development Manager II - New Business
Text:
Latham & Watkins, a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world, is currently seeking a Business Development Manager – New Business to join our winning team in either Los Angeles, Orange County, San Francisco, or Silicon Valley. The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our clients with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation and collaboration.

As the global outbreak of COVID-19 continues to unfold, Latham has taken precautions to help protect our people, clients, and the communities where we live and work. This includes a temporary shift to remote working for the majority of our lawyers and staff. This role will likely start remotely while the firm continues to evaluate the situation.

The Business Development Manager II – New Business is responsible for leading the New Business Team members located across California. The BD Manger II will be focused on executing the team’s mission: To help our partners win business by acting as strategic advisors and aiding them in communicating our firm’s value proposition and key differentiators and to foster a work environment that brings out the best in our team, to be collaborative with our partners and peers, and to challenge our team to reach higher.

As a member of the Global Leadership Team and in close collaboration with the Business Development Senior Manager, the BD Manager II will develop and deliver firm communications and presentations to share pitch metrics and trends. The successful candidate will deploy their leadership and project management skills to oversee a team dedicated to leading all proposal documents from receipt of work request to follow-up, tracking, and metrics. The BD Manager will have excellent leadership skills (i.e. planning, problem solving, and decision making) necessary for effective management and have strong written and oral communication skills. The ideal candidate will be a high-performing team player, fluent in a matrix environment with a strong ability to positively and proactively influence others, including multiple stakeholders.

Responsibilities include:

Leading the New Business Team members located across California and being responsible for the day-to-day workflow, training, and performance management feedback of the team.
Developing and delivering high-quality proposal documents, such as credentials statements, pitch documents, and responses to RFPs.
Driving strategic new business priorities through a comprehensive understanding of the lawyers, clients in the market, and new business team metrics.
Helping partners prepare for client meetings, including developing scripts, talking points, and additional supporting pitch documents. Providing one-on-one partner coaching as needed.
Developing a deep understanding of the competitive landscape to contribute to the strategic planning and implementation of the goals and objectives of the firm.
Coordinating with global BD resources to maintain and update standard materials such as templates, content, and experience within the firm’s proposal management system and databases.
Ensuring that best practices in the preparation of proposal documents are maintained and shared across departments.
Coordinating and delivering training to new business team to ensures team skills are maintained at a superior level.
Maintaining an active professional network to hire and recruit top talent.

Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by clicking the ‘Apply Now’ link.

Latham & Watkins is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our commitment to diversity, equal opportunity and sustainability enables Latham & Watkins to draw from a remarkable wealth of talent to create one of the world's leading law firms.

Latham & Watkins LLP will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance (FCIHO). Please click the link below to review the Ordinance.

Please click here to review your rights under U.S. employment laws. #LI-JR1

Los Angeles, California, United States
Department
Business Development
Position Type
Full-Time/Regular

ABOUT LOANPAL
We provide friendly financing options for those who dream of living a more sustainable lifestyle and want to save money using modern technology. Our collective mission is to make a positive impact on the planet, build lasting relationships with our valued partners and customers, and deliver a tech-enabled lending experience that is simple, fast, and frictionless.
We are creating a financial ecosystem that connects billions of dollars of capital to millions of homeowners that want to convert their outdated houses into modern, smart, energy-efficient homes. By unlocking access to numerous products that help people achieve better sustainability, we are revolutionizing the $350B+ home improvement industry and protecting our only planet.
As part of our world-positive initiative, we are also the official sponsor of GivePower – a foundation that uses solar-based solutions to power life’s basic needs for people in developing regions of the world.
If you have an unstoppable desire to make a meaningful impact on our planet, and help mission-driven businesses and consumers achieve a more sustainable future, join us.
Competitive pay
Comprehensive benefits package
Premier training programs. We invest in your professional development.
The Role:
Review and evaluate borrower profile including all income documentation, tax returns, credit reports, preliminary report, judgments, bankruptcy documents and appraisals.
Analyze and calculate Income Documentation such as personal and business income statements; ensure all necessary documentation is requested to support final loan decisions.
Exercise good judgment, conduct reasonableness tests and issue quality decisions
Determine accuracy and completeness of files; ensure consistent processes
Demonstrate proficiency in automated underwriting systems
Maintain established service level standard of decisions within a 48-hour timeframe
Communicate regularly with sales team, processing department and management
Requirements:
2 or more years of residential mortgage Underwriting experience required
Experience with Encompass preferred
Strong working knowledge of DU, LP and FHA Connection preferred
High School diploma required
Bachelor’s degree from a 4-year college or university a plus
Proficiency with all MS Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.)
Proven success working in fast-paced, high volume environments
Excellent communication and customer service skills
Precise attention to detail
Professional demeanor and attire

Onica, a Rackspace Technology company is hiring a Product Client Executive to join our Enterprise Sales team, focused on selling AWS professional and support services.
This role drives the full sales cycle to both win and grow share of wallet in strategic accounts for Rackspace.
Responsibilities - What will you be doing?
Seek out, explore, and qualify business opportunities at senior levels with Enterprise scale clients across the Northeast market and beyond.
Own, nurture, and saturate named accounts: both in cloud services consumption, as well as ensuring an outstanding client experience delivery.
Deliver against challenging but realistic sales targets in a market that's expanding at a frantic pace with a Tier 1 service offering.
Work with internal Cloud Consultants, Architects and Engineers to ensure projects closed and prospects pipelined have the resources and progress necessary to deliver world class service levels.
Connect and collaborate with AWS to ensure the best partnership experience is delivered and commercial opportunities maximized.
Requirements - Is this the job for you?
12+ years of experience selling strategic Technology Services, either from systems integration or other SaaS / Cloud related services.
Experience understanding a client's business strategy and how services can create change and transformation.
Able to articulate and demonstrate a structured approach to solution selling.
Ability to hold high level technical conversations with key decision makers to qualify the opportunity initially. Able to understand the technology involved at a conversational level.
Previous Enterprise service or software sales experience is also essential. Able to navigate companies that operate at scale both nationally and globally.
Excellent written and verbal communication
Travel up to 50%
Driven by success, highly personable, well organized with a strong ability to deliver to senior decision makers within globally recognized corporations.
Onica, a Rackspace Technology Company
If you’re looking for AWS experts – you’ve found them! With 14 AWS competencies and 1600+ certifications, Onica is the dedicated AWS business at Rackspace. Whether you’re looking leverage the cloud for innovation, agility, cost savings, operational efficiency, or all of the above, our dedicated AWS team focuses on bringing the most cutting-edge AWS capabilities to our customers, all backed by our Fanatical Experience™. With deep expertise and capabilities in cloud strategy, cloud-native development, containers, application modernization, AIML, IoT, and workload management we help customers accelerate innovation with AWS. #onica

Are you a Racker?
Rackers thrive in fast-paced environments built to inspire learning, growing, and innovating.
They are mission-inspired, values-grounded, culture-focused and dedicated to making a positive impact in everything they do.
Rackers are inherently wired to solve problems and share ideas in small, nimble teams.
As experts in what they do, Rackers are serious about delivering a Fanatical Experience™ to our customers.
Rackers are valued members of a winning team on an inspiring mission and we want you to come join the Racker family!

Why work at Rackspace Technology?
Find your fanatical. We deliver the best customer experience in the industry to businesses that perform life-saving research, power cities, and feed millions.

Come as you are. Cultivating inclusion is not just the right thing to do, it enables us to win. Our Executive Inclusion Council and Racker Resource Groups (RRGs) partner to enable an inclusive workplace and drive initiatives such as Rackspace’s participation in the annual Texas Conference for Women.

Satisfy your curiosity. No matter where you are going, we can help you get there. Our internal learning department, Rackspace University®, provides training and development to Rackers – from Microsoft™ certifications to effective leadership training – our goal is to help you grow.

Make a difference. At the core of every Racker is a drive to leave the world better than we found it, and we are passionate about giving back to our communities across the globe. While Rackers can leverage paid volunteer time off for any cause, our Rack Gives Back program creates opportunities for Rackers to give our time and talent to others.

Live life completely. We offer a well-rounded suite of health and wellness programs that help our Rackers achieve a healthy and balanced life-style. So while our Rackers are busy taking care of our customers, we take care of our Rackers.

Named a best place to work, year after year according to Fortune, Forbes and Glassdoor, we attract and develop world-class talent. And we embrace the notion that unique perspectives fuel innovation and enable us to best serve our customers and communities around the globe. Gas Media Group (GMG) is the next generation network specializing in adding fuel to creators and partners. With Multi-Platform Asset Protection (MAP) at our core, we help artists, creatives, and brands maximize their digital revenue streams and viewership.
Our mission is to fuel to the next wave of audiences and creators by breaking down the traditional barriers and fires standing between them through developing newfound opportunities in technology, partnerships and innovative solutions.

Bring in new talent into the GMG network

An focus on listening, learning and improving
A positive, problem-solving attitude, and a willingness to use all available technological tools to aid in the recruitment process.

Based upon experience
Talent managers will earn commission from their talent in addition to salary

About Guaranteed Rate:
Guaranteed Rate is the 5th largest retail mortgage lender in the U.S. By offering industry-leading tools, low-rate mortgages and unparalleled customer service, we’ve become the Home Purchase Experts®. At Guaranteed Rate, we think big—pushing beyond what most people believe is possible. We strive to work with the best of the best, building business with the best referral partners and hiring the best employees—allowing us to deliver world-class customer service. Our goal is to make sure every customer has a great experience. Headquartered in Chicago with 5,000+ employees in 300+ offices across the U.S. and licensed in all 50 states, we’ve helped thousands of homeowners with more than $24 billion in home purchase loans and refinances in just the past year alone.

What's the Role?

We are currently seeking a hard-working, dedicated Underwriter to join our innovative and passionate team.

Responsibilities:
As an Underwriter you will be responsible for but not limited to the underwriting of residential loans ensuring compliance with appropriate company and investor standards

A Mortgage Underwriter will be responsible for examining loan documentations for accuracy and completeness while working with loan originator or production staff to secure all required documents

Mortgage Underwriters may be involved in one or several types of mortgage lending (conventional, government-backed, etc.)

You may be required to work with more senior mortgage underwriters on loan exceptions having the authority to withdraw and decline loans

You may also be required to respond directly to individual and investor audits

Includes all levels of underwriting authority and exception levels

Requirements:
5+ years of mortgage underwriting experience

3+ years of FHA/VA, Conventional, and USDA/RD underwriting experience

Experience with underwriting to multiple lender guidelines and requirements

Knowledge of Fannie Mae/DU and Freddie Mac/LP guidelines and automated underwriting systems

Critically examine credit, income and asset documents and review title policy and appraisals

Encompass and GUS experience are preferred

Guaranteed Rate is an Equal Opportunity Employer that welcomes and encourages all applicants to apply regardless of age, race, sex, religion, color, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital or parental status, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy or other reason, as protected by law. #LI#LI-JB1

We’re Talking Rain, and we’re so much more than water. We build flavorful brands, like Sparkling Ice, Sparkling Ice +Caffeine, and Talking Rain Sparkling Waters. We’re also excited that our affiliate company, Beverage Innovation Corporation, Inc. has been shattering expectations in the hard seltzer category with the 2020 launch of Sparkling Ice Spiked.
When it comes to success, we know we’re only as strong as our team. We empower our Rain Makers to forge the way—finding opportunity at the intersection of what they love, what we need, and where they thrive.
We're creating connections with every sip! Want to get to know us better? Check out our Careers page! You can also follow us on LinkedIn, Glassdoor, Instagram, and Facebook.
What You’ll Do
Drive, not ride. With a mindset of service, our Sales team goes out and executes in the market. Flawlessly. Now that’s how you build relationships.
You’ll drive performance at designated key accounts through strategic planning and selling. This is the perfect opportunity for a strong leader to own regional retailer volume and profit/share performance. As well as field responsibility dedicated to evaluating the effectiveness of our plans, collaboration and alignment, and identifying future growth opportunities for our new Spiked Offering with our DSD partners.
Location: Remote #LI-Remote
This role will manage accounts in our West Region (WA, OR, MT, ID, NV, UT, NM, AZ, CA, HI and AK).
Reports to: Director of Sales, Emerging Markets
Direct Reports: NA
Note: This job requires that you have easy access to LAX, John Wayne, or San Diego airports.
Own annual volume, forecasting, budget, marketing and profitability targets for designated retailer and key accounts.
Successfully manage DSD network in meeting market plans and execution, while also securing DSD contracts for our network.
Develop and sell-in customer programs that exceed volume and profit objectives.
Create and execute business plans and strategies in a collaborative work environment that encourages cross-functional participation.
Ability to facilitate strong customer relationships with retailers and distributors, providing thought leadership on industry/category dynamics, innovation and opportunities.
Manage, track and execute all retail distributor programming.
Regular in-market work with distributors to ensure all programming is executed, to evaluate the effectiveness of our plans, and to identify growth strategies.
Maintain and update market and industry trends with BIC sales team and distributor partners.
Work with and develop partnerships with all levels of management across BIC, Talking Rain and assigned Distributors.
Accountable to manage day to day BIC sales process which includes setting objectives, chain calls, managing individual budgets along with weekly and monthly progress reporting.
Ensure food safety, quality, and SQF practices are followed at all times, notifying immediate supervisor of any food safety and/or quality issues.
Complete other responsibilities as assigned.
WHAT YOU BRING
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or related field required.
Minimum of five (5) years of progressive experience in sales and key account management in the consumer or direct store delivery industries.
Experience in the alcohol beverage industry.
Proficient with the Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word, Power Point), CRM, IRI, VIP, and Concur.
This job requires that you have easy access to LAX, John Wayne, or San Diego airports.
Remote role - Ability to work from home and travel in the West Region.
Integrity is at the core of who you are. You earn people’s trust, with the ability to maintain the confidentiality of sensitive information as you field inquiries.
You drive, not ride. You’re stellar at prioritization, time-management, and troubleshooting.
You exude curiosity, approaching each situation with a desire to learn.
You’re approachable, actively listening, and adapting your style to the audience.
You’re flexible. You pivot on a dime and embrace the change.
Critical thinking skills with the ability to analyze and dive into customer data to build compelling stories for designated retailer accounts.
You are diplomatic, professional and exercise great judgement in developing and maintaining excellent business relationships.
Exceptionally high attention to detail.
Self-directed to work independently.
Professional, business-like appearance and demeanor.
This role is safety sensitive. This means that as part of your core responsibilities you will be regularly responsible for your own safety and/or the safety of others (e.g., driving on behalf of the company, working in a warehouse/plant environment). To help ensure a safe, positive work environment, this role may be subject to random drug testing (including alcohol, cannabinoids, cocaine, methamphetamine, opiates, phencyclidine).
WHAT WE OFFER
Nothing makes a great job even better than throwing in a few perks, and we want to equip our Rain Makers with everything they need to maintain their health and well being. That means things like...
Three Weeks of Vacation. And that's just to start. Spend some time with us, and you could get to six weeks!
Six Weeks of Paid Parental Leave. Moms and dads get to spend time at home bonding with their new addition (whether it arrives by birth, fostering, or adoption). We also have great short term disability coverage for birth mothers!
401k with Immediate Vesting. With matched contributions and investment customization, we'll help build a plan to reach your goals.
Race Reimbursements. We're all about going the extra mile, so we provide reimbursements for community events and competitions like fun runs, triathlons, and cycling tours.
BYOD Stipend. You Bring Your Own Device (aka cell phone) and we provide you with a stipend each month since it helps us keep in touch with you when you're on the road.
Medical/Dental/Vision. Not only we do we offer it, but our plans are excellent. Each is a PPO, and one is even free for Rain Makers!
Please note, eligibility for our full benefits package is based on an average of 30+ hours per week in regular (not temporary) positions.

Text: About SHIFT We believe car buying should be fun, fair, and accessible to everyone. We’ve set out to transform an industry, using technology to bring transparency and convenience to the car buying process.And we aren’t stopping there. We seek to bring that same openness and simplicity to car ownership too, with payments, maintenance, and insurance in one easy app. At SHIFT, we’re building the tools that empower people to buy, own, and sell the cars that make life go. We’ve recently entered the public markets (Nasdaq: SFT) and are experiencing rapid growth. This is a great opportunity to join a hyper growth company changing an industry!SHIFT is looking to hire high performing F&I Specialists! Being an online marketplace, communicating the benefits of F&I products over the phone vs. in person at a traditional dealership setting has its challenges & benefits. You will be responsible for providing exceptional customer service, while helping customers select products that protect their vehicle purchase. In addition, you will also make credit decisions, submit deals to our lenders for approval and help bridge disconnects in the sales process. With your background in automotive sales or finance, you’ll help us find the right finance and insurance solutions for every customer.What we offerCompetitive pay and commission structureBenefits package (401k, Health, Dental, Vision, Life etc that starts day 1 on the job!)work-life balancePaid time offLaptop providedWhat you'll doContract new business, sell F&I products, and close dealsMaintain good working relationships to secure competitive interest rates and financing programsAim to generate finance income from every customerUnderstand all programs and rate options offered by our lendersBe an internal advocate and expert on extended service contracts, GAP policies, etcHelp customers choose protection packages for their vehicle by presenting all products and their benefitsMaintain a follow-up system that encourages repeat customers and referralsUnderstand and comply with federal, state and local regulationsWhat you'll have2+ years F&I experienceMust have Automotive Finance experience working at a dealershipPrevious sales experience preferredProven ability to provide exceptional customer experience to drive loyaltySelf motivated with the ability to set and achieve targeted goalsDemonstrated communication, consultative, interpersonal and organizational skillsExperience and desire to work with technologyWho We Are At Shift, we’re all about growth - which means people who are eager to grow, who are ready to roll up their sleeves and learn new things. We were founded by a scrappy group of visionaries who were by no means “car experts” - so we don’t expect you to be one, either! We’ll take the open-minded go-getter over the pure subject matter expert any day. In that spirit, we also care about building a diverse and inclusive workplace and company. To put it simply, cars are meant for everyone, so we believe our company should be, too. We never discriminate against any candidate on the basis of gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, race, ethnicity, religion, color, national origin, marital status, veteran status or disability status. We welcome and encourage people of all backgrounds and walks of life to apply, even if you’re unsure if you meet all the requirements. (Even if this particular role isn’t the right fit, chances are we will have the right one soon!)Why Join Now? Having gone public in October 2020, we are at the beginning of our journey and hope you join us for the ride! Shift is a leading end-to-end auto e-commerce platform transforming the used car industry with a technology-driven, hassle-free customer experience. Shift’s mission is to make buying or selling a used car fun, fair, and accessible to everyone. We provide comprehensive, digital solutions throughout the car ownership lifecycle: finding the right car, having a test drive brought to you before buying the car, a seamless digitally-driven purchase transaction including financing and vehicle protection products, an efficient, digital trade-in/sale transaction, and a vision to provide high-value support services during car ownership.Job Type: Full-timePay: Up to $16.75 per hourBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayWeekendsSupplemental Pay:Commission payEducation:High school or equivalent (Preferred)Experience:Sales Experience: 1 year (Preferred)Dealership Experience: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligible

Text: Client Success Specialist About the Company: We are the fastest growing CPA firm focused on the cannabis industry in the United States. We’re bootstrapped and profitable, have amassed over 300 clients in under two years, and have an annual compound growth rate of 125%. Unlike most CPA firms that are bound by geolocation, our clients are remote and spread throughout all legalized states: the market we serve is limited only by the laws restricting marijuana legalization.Cannabis is one of the most exciting and rapidly growing industries in the United States, exceeding $13B in sales in 2019 and projected to surpass $30B by 2025. GreenGrowth CPAs has positioned itself as the leading expert in tax, financial, and audit services for cannabis companies. We’ve done this by hiring smart people who reflect our values and leveraging their deep and varied experience to provide best-in class services to our clients, all while continuously growing and learning in tandem with the industry.Role Description: The Client Success Specialist role is a great opportunity to demonstrate your relationship management and organizational skills. This role will provide excellent service to our clients and the GreenGrowth CPAs service team by ensuring the sale and onboarding process is professional and error free. This role will be expected to complete tasks pertaining but not limited to the responsibilities and expectations listed below.Role Responsibilities and Expectations: · Contact clients via phone and email to discuss questions, concerns, and service information· Administrative duties included but not limited to; document management, report tracking, and tasks relevant to meeting company goals· Partner with internal teams to ensure client's needs are being met promptly· Input and track client notes and activity in Hubspot, Canopy/ProConnect, and QuickBooks Online, and accurately log outcomes of customer discussions· Gather customer feedback and share with Management, Sales and Marketing teams· Work as part of a collaborative team to ensure our client’s needs are met quickly and with great careQualifications: Our ideal Client Success Specialist is enthusiastic about solving problems and answering questions. A candidate that can show they have the following skills will be considered:· Completion of an undergrad program relevant to our industry· Comfortable talking to clients throughout the day (via phone and zoom) and the ability to critically think through their issues to problem solve effectively· Highly organized and able to multi-task· Naturally self-driven and proactive· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills· High computer literacy and the ability to learn new software quickly· Knowledge of customer success processes· Experience in document creation and retention· Patient and active listener· Passion for serviceWorking here: The GreenGrowth CPAs team is composed of perpetual learners, constant collaborators, and driven owners. We’re a CPA firm gone modern: we are mostly remote and espouse people-first principles that aim to provide an amazing employee experience and dynamic company culture. We’re small, so our employees have an immediate and measurable impact on the company’s direction, operations, and our clients’ businesses. The way we work is infused with a high level of trust and autonomy: we hire folks who take initiative and let them run with their ideas.We’re excited about people who are missionary, values-driven, and interested in this dynamic and growing industry we’re serving. If being a part of this phenomenal opportunity to work in cannabis finance interests you, we’d love to hear from you!Hourly Salary: $20/hourHours per Week: 25-40Work Location: RemotePosition Type: Contract with the possibility of full time after six months of proven success in roleJob Types: Part-time, ContractPay: From $20.00 per hourSchedule:8 hour shiftEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Customer service: 1 year (Required)Customer relationship management: 1 year (Preferred)Full Time Opportunity:YesWork Location:One locationHours per week:20-2930-39Company's website:https://greengrowthcpas.com/careers/Company's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/greengrowthcpaWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

In reporting to the Sales Director the Regional Sales Manager role is to expand the company's customer base and achieve sales quotas for the US West Region. A successful candidate in this role will have a solid experience selling complex interconnect solution to Tier 1 contractors and Key Accounts in military, aerospace and avionic markets and supervise/ train a network of representatives.

Having strong and excellent communication skills with a strategic mindset and is comfortable working remote.
Duties & Responsibilities
Management:

Manage and oversees day-to-day sales activities of a network of sales representatives in his Region.

Sales

Meet and surpass sales and revenue targets as set by the company for both the Region and Key Accounts.
Accountable for day-to-day sales activities including but not limited to forecasting, web requests assignment and timely response, bid/quote delivery and pipeline accuracy.
Oversee the on-boarding process to meet company short-term and long-term sales and revenues objectives.
Increase the company presence in the Region by making recommendations to the Vice-President Sales International to recruit and develop new sales reps.
Develop a solid and trusting relationship between Key Accounts and the Company.
Plan and present reports on Key Accounts progress, goals, and monthly/quarterly initiatives to share with team members, stakeholders.
Provide detail annual review (strategy, forecast, issues) and quarterly updates for each Key Account.
Coordinate with the management team and company personnel including Industry Managers, Sales engineers Manager, and senior management to meet Key Accounts.
Proactively address customer issues and make sure they are closed to the customer satisfaction.

Marketing

Make recommendations and participate at sales events, trade shows, conference, seminars, and webex to promote the company products jointly with local representatives.
Manage and ensure processes are in place to respond, qualify and follow-up leads and requests from sales events, (trade shows, conference, seminars, and webex), marketing activities (publication, social media and other) or other activities.

Reporting:

Provide monthly reporting on sales KPI’s for the Region and Key Accounts and makes recommendations to Senior Management as needed.

Recruit:

Recruit new representatives as needed to ensure optimum coverage of the Region and meet the objectives for the Region.
Diversity & Inclusion
We believe that different perspectives and backgrounds are what make a company flourish. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, economic status, disability, age, or any other legally protected characteristics. We are proud to be an inclusive company with values grounded in equality and ethics, where we celebrate, support, and embrace diversity.
The Individual
Proven work experience of 10+ years as a Sales Account Manager/Region Manager, selling high-speed interconnect solutions to Tier 1 contractors in defence, avionic and aerospace market in the Region.
Comprehensive understanding of aerospace and/or military and/or avionic industry interconnect technologies and trends.
Excellent communicator, both written and verbal.
Experience of managing multiple systems and projects.
Efficient and process driven approach.
Proven track record in sales growth and Region/Key Accounts management.
Able to rapidly learn Reflex products/solutions, competitive advantages and provide technical training to representatives and customers in the Region.
Strong track record of customer relationship management.
Results Driven, taking ownership of achieving a desired outcome.
About Smiths
At Smiths we apply leading-edge technology to design, manufacture and deliver market-leading innovative solutions that meet our customers' evolving needs, and touch the lives of millions of people every day. We are a FTSE100, global business of around 23,000 colleagues, based in 55 countries. Our solutions have a real impact on lives across the planet, enabling industry, improving healthcare, enhancing security, advancing connectivity and supporting new homes. Our products and services are often critical to our customers’ operations, while our proprietary technology and high service levels help create competitive advantage. We welcome colleagues with a curious mind, who are happy with responsibility, enjoy a challenge and are attracted by the idea of working at a business with an almost 170 year history of innovation, and five global divisions, all experts in their field.
About Smiths Interconnect
Smiths Interconnect is a leading provider of technically differentiated electronic components, subsystems, microwave and radio frequency products that ensure high speed, secure connectivity of critical applications in the defence, aerospace, communications and industrial markets. Our microwave technology is used in radar, communication and surveillance systems that are mission-critical and operate in extreme environments in aerospace and defence. Our microwave components and connectors ensure optimal performance, durability and safety of space satellites. Our semi-conductor test products are used to test highly sophisticated semi-conductors and electronic circuits in communication systems, gaming products and computing devices. Our in-flight antenna systems give passengers internet connectivity gate-to-gate on planes around the world. Our connector and cable solutions ensure reliability of critical medical equipment, and safe operation of trains and transport systems.One of five divisions of Smiths Group, Smiths Interconnect employs over 2000 people. We have a global presence selling our products in over 50 countries with manufacturing facilities in nine countries and offices across North America, Europe and Asia.

JOB DESCRIPTION:
We are looking for dynamic, and engaging teachers who can teach kids ages 2-6 in a wide variety of subjects spanning STEM, niche topics like “Monster Trucks,” different languages, etc. Responsibilities include developing curriculum for our asynchronous learning, mapping decks and narratives for live online classes, and fostering strong parent-teacher relationships. You will help manage all things learning to provide a fun and creative experience for our students and families.

WHO WE ARE:
We’ve been known to be described as “the perfect blend of virtual education and unplugged learning designed for children ages 6 months - 7.” Yes, in those words exactly. More than that, we’re a tight-knit team of spunky educators who believe that learning should be dynamic, interactive and inclusive.
BümoBrain supports parents in need of options aside from traditional schools. Our platform is built based on the following principles: creativity, critical thinking and exploration, backed by 350 years of educators’ experience from around the globe. We offer daily age-specific and unplugged activities that are flexible, accessible, and family-friendly.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Teach small, intimate online Zoom classes of 6 students maximum
Work closely with our education team to design and develop age-specific curriculum
Manage the learning process from start to finish via ideation and execution
Establish strong relationships with students and parents
Have FUN!

REQUIREMENTS:
Fluent in BOTH English AND Vietnamese
Someone who can roll with the punches, and think on their feet
Preferably has a background in education, teaching credentials, or relevant experience working with kids
Tactful communicator who is tech-savvy & proficient in Zoom, Seesaw, or willing to learn!
Flexible & capable of quick turnaround for tight deadlines
Strong organisational and time management skills
Multitasker who can juggle multiple responsibilities as once
Has the ability to make anything FUN!
Los Angeles, CA preferred but remote ok (US - Based)

BENEFITS:
Work directly with in an emerging startup with an accelerated growth pattern
Potential for rapid promotions if results delivered
Directly make an impact as part of our innovative, tight-knit community
