Text: ARCHITECTURAL SURVEYOR / 3D SCANNING SPECIALIST (NOT A LAND SURVEYING POSITION)Since 1992, Field Services Unlimited, (FSU) has been delivering architectural as-built surveys to retailers, architects, restaurant owners/franchisees, health care providers, financial service companies, and facility managers across North America. We provide the cornerstone for renovation and construction projects by precisely documenting existing conditions. We provide our clients with Revit and AutoCAD as-built drawings, site evaluations, customized architectural as-built and facility assessment surveys. Our surveys, facility assessments and site due diligence provides our clients with the information and confidence needed to make their facility renovations run smoothly. At FSU, we do everything within our power to ensure the job is done right, saving our clients time and money down the road.FSU is seeking to fill a full-time position for an Architectural Surveyor/3D Scanning Specialist. This position includes on-site documentation of existing conditions of commercial /retail spaces using a LeicaBLK 360 to create a point cloud. This individual will be fully trained to use the scanning equipment, however, previous experience in traditional architectural surveying is required.Surveyor Requirements – The successful candidate will have a general understanding of building construction, architectural drafting using AutoCAD, the ability to read construction documents and experience documenting existing conditions for commercial spaces. Timely communication with team members is critical in delivering complete and accurate survey documents within the scheduled deadline. This position will involve extensive weekday travel and occasional weekend travel. Compensation: $15.00/hour
Intern, Social - Marketplace:
Our newsroom is seeking an individual who has an active interest in journalism and social marketing. We are seeking a creative and data driven intern to provide support to the social team. Are YOU that person? If so, you will have an opportunity to work alongside social producers with a focus on finding engaging ways to tell stories across platforms. You will learn how to strengthen skills in writing, content creation, analytics, video, design and marketing.
Key Learning Goals:
This would be a great role for someone interested in the intersection of editorial and social marketing.
The culture and business of a nonprofit media organization
Insight into the journalism industry and Marketplace’s properties. The social team touches everything from On-Demand, Shows, Digital, Giving, Brand, etc.
Develop campaigns and posts that drive connection to our brand and help further our mission to raise the economic intelligence of the country
How to look at data responsibly and draw actionable insights from them
Tangible experience in social marketing for a journalism organization
Responsibilities:
Help create engaging posts to grow Marketplace’s social footprint
Work with team members to bring strategies to life through clear, mobile-first and creative presentations
Monitor conversations across platforms
Assist in ideation, social content planning, scheduling
Help aggerate social data to gain insights into analytics that drive traffic and engagement
Conduct research on key industry trends and competitive insights
Source photo and video and music stock footage as it pertains to projects
Research story ideas; help storyboard ideas; contribute to scripts as needed
Benefits:
Partial subsidy for onsite parking or public transportation
Eligible to accrue sick time off
Eligible for health insurance as required under the ACA
Programming:
Participate in robust on-boarding experience
Professional development: on-the-job training, intercultural development assessment, formal performance review feedback sessions, etc.
Participate in brown bag sessions to gain broader perspective of the organization
Required Qualifications:
Enrolled Senior in an undergraduate or Master’s program OR have earned a degree within the last 12 months
Strong working knowledge with social media platforms
Working knowledge of Photoshop is a must
Self-starter with an interest in journalism and how economic news intersects with people’s lives
Strong organizational and communication skills
Ability to meet deadlines and work both independently and collaboratively
A team player who is accountable, proactive, and solution-oriented
Preferred Qualifications:
Coursework or experience in journalism
Graphic design experience
Working knowledge of Adobe Premiere, Adobe After Effects and Illustrator
Next Step in the Application:
In addition to your skills and knowledge, we want to get to know you in the application process. In addition to your resume, please include a cover letter (of no more than 1 page) with answers to the following:
What professional skills would you like to add to your toolbox in the months and years to come to grow in your career field?
Where do you see yourself professionally in five-years and how will this role help you achieve that goal?
Physical Demands and Working Conditions:
Must be able to perform the essential duties of the position with or without reasonable accommodation.
Physical Demands:
Required to move about in an office environment and sit for extended periods of time.
Required to move about in the community.
Frequent use of hands for data entry/keystrokes and simple grasping.

*Scroll down for application link. Submissions through Indeed will not be reviewed*The Biddyco Creative Department has one goal, to help our clients stand out in a very crowded sea, and it will be your job to make that happen! As a Digital Content Designer at Biddyco, you will be responsible for bringing our clients’ products to life. Working closely (but not too close, don’t worry we’re anti micro-managers) with our Creative Director, you will create a library of Images, GIFS and Videos for advertising on Facebook, Instagram and more.50% of the time we’re working with pre-made assets and 50% of the time we are creating everything from scratch. If you’re looking for a hyper-creative environment, with very little red tape and restrictions, this is it. Things move fast in the world of social and you have to be willing to commit to a 90% done is good enough attitude. We’re looking for someone who appreciates details but isn’t limited by perfectionist habits.Motion Graphic Experience is a must. You will be working in after effects 75% - 95% of the time. This is not a role for someone who is looking to learn after effects, we’re looking for someone who is already there.We hit deadlines and follow brand guidelines (if provided), but otherwise everything else is free game. It’s the golden ticket opportunity for anyone who craves creative freedom, prefers the unconventional option, gets bored easily and loves social media. Did we mention that on any given day you’ll be working with multiple different (fun, up & coming e-commerce) brands? If you crave routine, stop reading now.We produce more content in a month than many big brands create in an entire year. With that said, we have strict work/life boundaries and don’t believe in working through the night, working on weekends or overworking anybody. We’re efficient like WOAH and if that excites you we can’t wait to see your work!What we expect from you:Be able to work with multiple clients. If your dream is to work with a single client for an entire year, you’re gonna hate it here.Ability to turn around simple updates quickly. Tweaks, variation, and flexibility are vital in our industry.Be able to take direction from our CD/Sr. AD and make it your own.A desire to have fun within design, challenge traditional design conventions, find new ways to do things, take design risks and push the envelope.To be focused on creating designs that will convert the best, not just look the best (but we always find a way to do both)The belief that ‘creative blocks’ are B.S. Even when we aren’t inspired it’s our job to come back to the table and find a way.To not take design so seriously that you struggle to find the fun in it. Our clients are fun, the content we get to create is fun, so you’ve got to be lighthearted about your work.To have thick skin. Revisions are part of the job.Feel a commitment to honoring deadlines. We do not take deadlines lightly and neither should you.Tools to be familiar with:Fierce After Effects and Photoshop skillsFamiliarity with video editing tools like PremiereiPhone and MacBasic advertising conceptsYou Must:Have 1+ years of motion graphics experience. Preferably with a brand but if you’ve just completed a motion graphics program we’re happy to see your portfolio. We will not consider any portfolios that don’t feature some motion.Understand major social platforms and be familiar with digital ad platforms.Be detail-oriented.Have a genuine desire to learn and evolve. Our industry changes every day and so must our approach. You must constantly be seeking out people and brands that are creating cool work.Be well versed in pop culture and design trends. Our job is the internet.Be on Facebook & Instagram. We envy that off-the-grid lifestyle, but there’s no way to stay competitive in this field without being where the action is.Live in Southern CA (open to anywhere in the US for the right candidate)Know how to work independently and structure your time effectively, but also enjoy working with a team to get things done.Have motion graphics experience and be good with details.Pay:This is a salaried position with pay depending on experience. There are also ample opportunities for bonuses depending on your performance and the performance of our clients.Benefits:Health & DentalOne Medical Membership optionPaid holidays off401k & company contribution10 days vacation per yearSick? Stay offline. If you’re able to handle a few things from the comforts of your bed, go for it. Otherwise, rest up.Extended flex work hours around the holidays & extended holiday break.Mac laptop, laptop stand, keyboard, mouse, and monitor + home office stipend.To apply:Submit an application here: https://forms.gle/9cvyBasrpyaJ71HX6Applications submitted through Indeed will not be reviewed.Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insurancePaid time offParental leaveVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Bonus payCOVID-19 considerations:We're working from homeEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Graphic Design: 1 year (Preferred)Motion graphics: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteCompany's website:biddyco.comCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

Text: Sunnova Energy Corporation is currently seeking a Field Service Supervisor to join our team!About: Sunnova is a leader in residential solar, battery storage and system protection services, with customers across the U.S. and its territories. We are your source for clean, affordable, and reliable energy, with a simple mission: to power energy independence so our customers have the freedom to live life uninterrupted™.Founded in 2012 and headquartered in Houston, Texas, we work to attract and retain only the best people who have the potential to make us better than we are today. We are always looking for talented and motivated individuals who thrive in a fast-paced, continuous improvement environment and want to change the world of energy.Job Summary: Sunnova Energy Corporation is currently searching for a Field Service Supervisor for our Maintenance and Service group. Sunnova owns and maintains a distributed fleet of residential solar systems across 22+ states and several U.S. territories. All monitoring and inbound customer service calls are handled in-house, and we utilize third-party service partners to complete all field work required. The Field Service Supervisor's primary responsibility is to support the O&M activities to maintain the performance of the solar systems, track conformance to contractual obligations, provide excellent customer service to our Customers and ensure a smooth workflow and optimally performing solar systems.Benefits: Work from homeCompany vehicle providedEarn up to 10% annual performance bonusMedicalDentalVisionCompany pays 75% of premiums401K matching .50 cents on the dollar up to 4% match.PTO 3 weeksUniformsWork boots and all tools provided.Solar and OSHA 30 training and certification.Responsibilities: Manage team of solar electricians and repair crews to complete all system warranty repairs and service requests within service levels and costProviding first and second level troubleshooting for all solar system service requestsCoordinate materials, inventory, fleet vehicles, technicians, and maintenance requirements to achieve service level targets for system repairsCoordinating field activities to service the systems, either by internal resources or partner technicians.Processing all customer warranty and insurance claims.Providing product and service training to customers and partners.Management of service orders.Communicating opportunities and recommendations for modification or improvements to processes to assure optimum efficiency of the company assets.Perform any other duties as assigned.Qualifications: A Bachelor’s Degree in related discipline, or equivalent combination of education and experience; Text: DESCRIPTIONSummary: Well established, highly profitable CPA firm offers an exceptional work from home career opportunity for two Audit Managers. One should be a generalist who has experience managing audits for both SEC and closely held clients in a variety of industries. The second Manager should be a specialist in government and non-profit clients. May work from home with flexible hours, officially working out of either West Los Angeles, Irvine, Riverside, or Woodland Hills, CA. Following the end of the Covid crisis, candidates may relocate to the base office or potentially consider working from home.We offer a very reasonable work / life balance, fast track promotions, and above market compensation packages. Prefer Manager candidates currently (or recently) at an Audit Manager level with a Big-4, national, or large local CPA firm,with expertise in either SEC and/or government / non profit audits. Will consider relocation assistance.The Manager is the liaison between the Partner, the client, and the professional staff. Managers are responsible for managing multiple auditing and accounting projects and client engagements simultaneously, and scheduling, staffing and coordinating engagement workflow. Managers develop and train staff, and make associations to develop new business for the Firm. Managers play a lead role in maintaining client relationships.Essential Functions: · Responsible for all phases of an audit, compilation, or review engagement· Maintains contact with clients throughout the year; possesses a thorough knowledge of the client and all facets of client’s business· Demonstrates thorough knowledge and proficiency in advanced technical skills necessary for carrying out assurance engagements and advising clients· Plans, schedules and staffs engagements using Firm policies and procedures· Maintains familiarity with qualifications of all staff members; reviews staff assignments for appropriateness· Prepares engagement letters for approval by Partner· Evaluates internal controls and work programs prepared by staff· Adheres to engagement time budgets· Supervises staff and provides on-the-job training; reviews work papers and reports prepared by staff· Anticipates problem areas of engagement and questions that will arise· Keeps Partner informed of all the important developments on engagement; analyzes problems and recommends solutions· Adheres to accurate and timely billing and collection processes· Ensures that financial statements, reviews, and other documents or deliverables are prepared in accordance with professional and Firm standards· Communicates progress of engagements, problems and resolutions to clients· Works to develop responsible, trained staff by assisting in performance evaluations· Prepares invoices to clients, communicates details of fees to clients, and assists in collection of overdue accounts· Possesses a complete knowledge of the Firm’s philosophy and its opinions on financial matters· Maintains knowledge of general economic and political trends of possible audit or other legislation that could affect the business climateNonessential Functions:· Works to develop responsible, trained staff by assisting in recruiting, developing training aids, and acting as an instructor in professional development programs· Participates in the Firm’s practice development efforts· Promotes the most efficient operations of the Firm and supports compliance guidelines in managing others· Prepares other reports and projects as requested from time to time by the Partners· Performs such other duties as may be assignedSupervisory Responsibilities: · Responsible for the development, coaching and training of senior, semi-seniors and staff accountants· Must be familiar with the qualifications of all Assurance & Advisory staff members for the development and instruction of their training needs· Participates in performance reviews and evaluations of accounting professionalsMinimum Qualifications: · Managers generally a minimum of five years’ experience in public accounting, demonstrating a proven progression in complexity, scope, and number of engagements managed· Minimum of one to two (1-2) years’ experience in a management position· Bachelor’s degree in accounting, or Master’s degree in accounting· Minimum of forty (40) hours of continuing professional education is required each year to maintain and develop technical and business skills· A current and valid CPA license is required for Manager level employees· Experience auditing government and/or non-profit clientsSuccess Factors: · Participates in career development programs to improve managerial, communication and interpersonal skills· Outstanding oral and written communication skills· Excellent interpersonal skills· Ability to manage multiple engagements/multi-task· Desire to mentor/train staff· Desire to do business development· SEC and/or government / non profit experience highly preferredJob Type: Full-timePay: Up to $140,000.00 per yearSchedule:8 hour shiftAbility to Commute/Relocate:Los Angeles, CA Auditor (Preferred)Benefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:Yes

When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals.

Position Location: this position can sit remotely in any state.
How will you make an impact?

Global Professional Services is seeking an energetic, engaged and creative professional with experience in molecular platforms with an emphasis on Next Generation Sequencing (NGS). In this position you will be responsible for project management and execution of customer-facing projects, as well as development of value-added services on molecular biology platforms in regulated (e.g. clinical and pharmaceutical) and non-regulated markets. This particular position has an emphasis on Oncology Analytical Validation services. You will also co-lead and develop value-added professional services for the organizations instrument platforms in collaboration with product managers and other key global field-based personnel. Efficiency, accuracy, a keen willingness to learn, and the ability to work effectively with multiple stakeholders in a multi-cultural and geographically distributed environment are essential to success in this job.
What will you do?
Interact with external stakeholders at all levels including laboratory scientists, laboratory technicians, laboratory directors, IT, QA as well as regulatory staff and/or consultants globally.
Marshal internal resources including field service engineers, field application scientists, remote technical support personnel, technical sales specialists, product management, manufacturing and R&D scientists.
Identify opportunities in laboratory workflows where the company can offer value-added services to speed production deployment of platforms, increase customer retention and prohibit competitive entry.
Develop and pilot value-added services at customer sites and support commercialization of services.
Work effectively in a structured product and service development process.
Work effectively in an FDA regulated and/or ISO compliant environment.
Identify areas for process improvement in the development, training and delivery of services.
Additional and incidental work related to the primary duties may be required for company business needs from time to time.
Manage the laboratory testing for the support of new service products and custom engagements.
Project manages customer-facing engagements, on-site and off-site, to ensure timely execution and customer success.
Execute customer-facing engagements and marshal internal resources including field engineers, field application scientists, remote technical support personnel, technical sales specialists, product management, manufacturing and R&D scientists
Assist in the development of instrument qualification protocols (IQ/OQ) based on capabilities and applications of instrument platforms as well as US and international regulatory requirements including GxP, CLIA, IVD and the requirements of ISO and other standards bodies.
How will you get there?
Minimum of a Bachelor's Degree required.
4+ years of molecular biology laboratory experience with an emphasis on NGS and real-time PCR in a clinical setting required.
Proven experience leading projects (global project experience preferred).
In-depth knowledge and experience with techniques, applications and data analysis of NGS, Sanger sequencing and real-time PCR.
Customer-facing support and troubleshooting experience with real-time PCR platforms.
Strong abilities in Microsoft Office (especially Excel).
Excellent communication (verbal and written), negotiation, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working with R&D on product development.
Knowledge of and experience with current CLIA/CAP/New York State regulations.
Experience with method validation on molecular biology platforms.
Working knowledge of statistical methods.
At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 75,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

Essential Functions
Leads in creating original video/audio content for our university and nonprofit clients on social media, digital, broadcast, podcast and radio platforms.
Manages a team of 2 videographers and partners with the rest of the creative team (Creative Director, Associate Creative Directors, Art Directors, Copywriters and Designers) to develop exceptional videos for campaigns and internal corporate communications.
Utilizes expertise, creativity and independent discretion during every phase of production including storyboarding, filming, editing, sound design, animation, etc. to ensure that the final deliverables exceed client expectations.
Manages non-linear editing software and multiple camera platforms. Records and remasters footage and audio as necessary, utilizing lighting, lens choice, composition, and camera movement to shoot interviews.
Operates and recommends the purchase of production equipment and ensures proper storage and maintenance of all assigned equipment, including camera, editing, lighting and other live technology including in-broadcast studio as needed. Trouble-shoots equipment problems as needed.
Directs talent at photo and video shoots including faculty members and alumni students.
Organizes the media management of all audio/video content on our servers and hard drives.
Partners with the Traffic Supervisor to oversee project schedules to ensure that the video team meets deadlines.
Comfortable with selecting outside vendors and additional video crew members for larger productions.
Serves as Line Producer on smaller video projects and collaborates with external Line Producers on larger campaign projects.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Reasonable and consistent attendance to fulfill requirements of the position.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Solid working knowledge of media production best practices, technologies and processes, including proficiency in shooting, lighting and audio for commercial (non-newscast) productions; familiarity with editing systems and post-production facilities.
Advanced familiarity with working on Apple computers.
Advanced knowledge with Adobe Premiere, Adobe Creative Suite, and After Effects.
Knowledge of DaVinci Color, Cinema 4D and/or Maya is a plus.
Proficient in multiple camera platforms: Drone technology, Black Magic, URSA Mini, Canon SDLR, Canon ID, Canon C-100 and MacPro Hardware.
Expert knowledge of emerging video trends on social media and digital platforms.
Actively seeks opportunities to influence, build effective relationships and gain alignment with peers, functional partners and/or external partners to accomplish business objectives.
Accepts personal accountability, proactively seeks resolution for personal limitations head-on; and supports honesty and respect towards others, the company and oneself.
Develops new insights into situations; questions conventional approaches; encourages new ideas and innovations; designs and implements new or cutting-edge programs/processes. Ability to generate and/or recognize imaginative or creative solutions that generate successful outcomes.
Ability to communicate media technology information and limitations to non-technical staff and internal clients.
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively communicate with a wide range of individual of constituencies in a diverse community.
Work independently and foster a cooperative spirit within a large and/or small team of diverse cultures, while working in a fast-paced environment with multiple deadlines and frequently changing priorities
Proficient with Microsoft Word and other applications in the Microsoft Office suite
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in communications, film, journalism or related field, preferred.
7-10 years of relevant video production experience at an agency or production house.
Knowledge and interest in education/nonprofit organizations is a plus.
Leadership and project management experience required.
Experience in higher education preferred
Experience working in a technology-driven enterprise preferred
All skills, abilities and education will be considered for minimum qualifications
Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a team member to perform the essential functions of this job successfully. The physical requirements for performing the essential functions of this position require the team member to be able to:
Able to sit, stand, kneel, walk, and reach.
Able to lift, push, pull, and/or move up to 20 pounds.
Hear well enough to communicate with others.
Read a computer screen and written material.
Write, type, and use phone system.
Working Conditions
This position operates in a remote, home office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.
Good working environment with the absence of disagreeable conditions.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
Regular and reliable attendance is required.
NEP will not sponsor applicants for work visas.

Who We Are
National Education Partners (NEP) provides premier online program management (OPM) services for leading educational institutions. NEP offers a rich history of delivering traditional academic operations support in areas such as finance, human resources, enrollment, financial aid, marketing, information technology and much more. Today, NEP is the OPM of record for Northcentral University (NCU), which offers doctoral, master’s and bachelor’s degrees in business, technology, education, and psychology, as well as doctoral and master’s degrees in healthcare and marriage and family therapy. NEP also provides online services to John F. Kennedy University. Both NEP and NCU are part of the National University System, a system of nonprofit universities with its headquarters in La Jolla, California.

Meet Your Next Favorite Place to Work!
Beckman Coulter Diagnostics, an operating company of Danaher, is recruiting for a Regional Sales Manager (Microbiology) for our West Region.

You will lead a team supporting growth in the Microbiology Capital Equipment space! Driving incremental growth in the laboratory testing market focused on ID/AST (identification / antibiotic susceptibility testing) instrumentation. This includes funnel management, budget attainment, financial reporting, coaching & development of the team, and other leadership tasks within Beckman Coulter Microbiology.

Leaders at Beckman Coulter focus on the growth and development of our associates, so if you’re looking to grow and take that next step in your career, we invite you to read on.

Wondering what’s within Beckman Coulter? Take a closer look.
Join a team where you can be heard, be supported, and always be yourself. At Beckman Coulter, a Danaher company, we’re building a culture that celebrates backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of all our associates.

Our work helps improve millions of lives. We hope you’ll see yourself here, too!

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:
Accurately anticipate the needs of customers and execute on a sales strategy to help us become the technical vendor of choice by directing and developing the sales team.
Use your experience in sales effectiveness to effectively position our solutions (hardware, reagents, systems and applications) in the Microbiology space.
Drive and own core growth by both footprint expansion and retaining and growing base business by working with your team to implement sales strategies with excellence.
Lead a team of sales associates that all manage laboratory customers within their territory, prioritizing sales activities that focus on innovative “Challenger” messaging that maintain existing business and drives incremental growth.
Manage the teams account planning process as well prepare and execute business reviews through established standard work
Implement and own the sales plan designed to achieve established sales and financial goals
Work remotely in your home office; and work with customers in the field jointly with your sales associates
Travel to customer locations where you will have to stay overnight.
Through solid market and competitive knowledge, develop and execute creative strategies to influence the decision criteria and utilize winning tactics to close the sale.
Effectively link Beckman Coulter’s Microbiology solutions to the customers’ technical, financial and business needs.
Strategically leverage internal and external resources including Service, Applications, Field Product Specialists, Leadership and Client Services to build and execute agreed upon strategy.
Manage sales funnels through Salesforce.com, track metrics, and report analytics on Region Performance

Essential Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree with 9+ years exp. OR Master’s degree with 7+ years exp.
Experience directly leading a sales team in a complex selling environment (Hospital and/or Laboratory Experience Preferred) with documented results.
Four plus years of direct sales experience in a hospital or laboratory.
Must be willing to travel 50% of the time and have excellent time management habits.
Strong ability to coach/manage account plans weekly, lead the team diligently within the sales cycle activities, prepare for and deliver business reviews effectively (both with customers and internally).

It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:
Solid understanding of tactical sales skills: prospecting, qualifying, closing, and growing existing customers; we strongly prefer this experience in laboratory diagnostics.
Strong executive presence, communication and presentation skills; demonstrated ability to clearly, concisely and accurately conduct a technical presentation.
Highly organized with strong program and sales management skills.
Has strong follow up and follow through skills and highly motivated and success driven within a team environment.
Individuals who have had direct experience selling to or working as a laboratory technologist in clinical microbiology is a plus.

#LI-GC1
#LI-Remote

Beckman Coulter, a Danaher company, offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to associates’ and their families’ lives. Whether it’s a health care program or paid time off, our programs contribute to life beyond the job.

At Beckman Coulter, we’re driven by a sense of wonder for what we can create—and what we can become. Here, you’ll accelerate your career while driving innovation that improves lives. You’ll work hard and try new things, with guidance from committed leaders, powerful DBS tools Danaher Business System , and the support of a global organization. As part of the Danaher family of 67,000 associates across the globe, your possibilities for growth and development are unparalleled.

We believe that creativity and innovation thrive when the most diverse set of voices are heard, and that’s why we’re taking concrete steps to ensure that we’re fostering an inclusive and engaging workplace for our team. If you’d like to learn more, read stories from our associates on our Careers Blog or contact one of our recruiters.

AllVoices is a workplace tool that promotes diversity, equity, and inclusion by providing employees a safe place to speak up about issues in real-time without fear of mistreatment or retaliation. This always-on listening tool, coupled with an encrypted communication channel and case management system, empowers companies to address issues proactively, improving culture, increasing productivity, and mitigating the risk of reputational damage and lawsuits. Customers include Zillow Group, Electronic Arts, Instacart, GoPro, MongoDB, FabFitFun, and TrueCar.*About AllVoicesThe EEOC has found that 75% of incidents of harassment go unreported. In part, this is because employees lack a way to speak up in a way that feels comfortable for them. AllVoices’ mission is to create safe and healthy workplaces for all by giving everyone a voice and companies a platform to listen at scale.AllVoices has a strong team of advisors and investors including Sukhinder Singh Cassidy (Boardlist/StubHub), Susan Fowler (Uber whistleblower), Spencer Rascoff (Zillow), Adam Miller (Cornerstone) and more.Our TeamWe’re a small, female-founded, fast-growing, culture-focused, venture-backed startup dedicated to building products that shape the future of work.As a team, we practice what we preach: we work to cultivate an environment in which people feel comfortable bringing their full selves to the office every day.About The RoleWe’re looking for a Content Marketing Manager with the ability to execute in an early stage and fast-paced environment. The Content Marketing Manager will take on an integral role in the company and is responsible for the planning and creation of branded content to drive customer acquisition, retention and sales growth in anticipation of a Series A raise in the next 12 months.In this role, you will be partnering with customers and internal stakeholders to create results-oriented content focused on thought-leadership and education. You will help strategize and create scalable content for owned channels and develop content campaigns — from conception to execution — that deliver measurable business results. Cures of Colors is a non-profit organization. This organization came together as parents had to quickly adapt and became full-time parents, teachers, after-school day care workers, and employees when the pandemic hit. The overarching theme revolved around the difficult conversations with children, including the topics of COVID-19, and then the Black Lives Matter Movement, and eventually culture, bullying and mental health, diversity, poverty, failure, and many others.We are committed to creating coloring books with real-life age-appropriate narratives, to allow children the freedom to color their own stories while being inspired, empowered, and connected.Cures of Colors Nonprofit Organization is currently seeking enthusiastic interns willing to learn and gain experience in a professional setting.The Cures of Colors illustration internship will provide opportunities to make contributions in our projects as well as being mentored by current professional artists. Interns will gain insight to professional coloring book creation as well as contribute to the creative pipeline.Interns will also be instructed in lectures that focus on professional and creative development, story techniques, portfolios, networking, and how to get creative professional projects ready for editors and agents.This is an unpaid volunteer Internship for a Non-Profit organization. Due to the volume of applications we receive we cannot provide individual feedback to applicants at this time. JobTitle: Global Market Development Manager - Biotech Loyalty
Text:
When you are a part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work to help make the world healthier cleaner and safer, like helping researchers find cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and support to help you achieve your long-term career goals.

How will you make an impact?

We are looking for a talented and results-driven Global Market Development Manager - Biotech Loyalty to join the Biosciences Division’s (BID) Integrated Marketing Programs team. This dynamic, strategic and creative individual will be responsible for retention and advocacy marketing focused primarily on the Biotech market. Their charter will be to develop multi-channel marketing programs that leverage an enticing customer loyalty program to drive increased product adoption, repeat demand, life-time value and incremental revenue primarily from the Biotech market for Thermo Fisher Scientific.
The appointed Marketing Manager will use their comprehensive marketing experience targeting or working in the Biotech market, scientific knowledge and customer-centricity to identify and execute against the most effective go-to-market strategies to gain new customers and grow share of wallet. This highly collaborative individual will need to work effectively across multiple marketing, sales and operations functions, leading and influencing cross-functional teams to drive results.
The successful individual will enjoy working with intensity, can drive strategy to action, have exceptional organization and communication skills with a diverse marketing skill set. A scientific education is a necessity with a background in cell, protein or molecular biology a plus, combined with solid business acumen to achieve goals on time.
Their ability to prioritize and manage multiple parallel projects and work comfortably in a highly matrixed environment will allow them to demonstrate that they are a keen team player while being able to complete projects independently that make a positive impact on the business and customers.

What will you do?
Develop and execute against tactical marketing plans to drive customer acquisition, retention and advocacy for primarily but not limited to BID consumable products
Create and deploy marketing content across multiple on and off-line channels for both acquisition and retention marketing
Utilize analytical tools and revenue reporting data to make sound marketing decisions to exceed financial and marketing performance objectives
Develop sales and marketing training material to excite and activate commercial and Business Unit teams to be successful in target segments
Lead, without direct authority, dynamic cross-functional project teams to complete tasks on time and within budget
Develop product and application workflows to drive cross-sell and up-sell activities within loyalty program
Interact with varying levels of leadership to report on progress and escalate challenges
May perform other related duties as required and/or assigned
What skills will lead to success?
Identifies problems, answers questions, gain cooperation of others and implement efficient solutions.
Exceptional project management skills, attention to detail, strong time management skills and deadline driven
Fast and self-starter learner, with ability to work in a dynamic team adapting quickly to a changing environment
Strong understanding and experience with digital media and how they influence customer behavior
Customer journey mapping
Analytical and able to make justifiable data-driven decisions to drive growth, maintain a designated budget and provide metrics to ensure strong return on investment
Ability to lead and provide functional area guidance and expertise to the broader team.
Provide regularly oral and written communication of metrics, successes, failures, best practices etc. to improve the overall operating efficiency of the team.
Must be willing to learn and take coaching from peers and supervisors/superiors, both in success and failure.
Must have a can-do attitude, as well as the ability to overcome failures to produce success with a “never give up” approach.
How will you get there?
6+ total years of marketing experience with a minimum of 3 years successfully and independently developing and implementing marketing plans
Experience in life sciences, biotech or related field required, with intimate knowledge of the North America market
Demonstrated knowledge and experience of retention and advocacy marketing, particularly through digital marketing channels
Collaborates easily and effectively with an ability to influence without direct authority
Minimum Education:
Bachelor's Degree

This position may be remote for the ideal candidate.

The Project Manager will organize, manage, and plan projects for the Human Resources department. In this role, you will lead process, communication, manage day-to-day operations and provide analytics for all HR initiatives. You will partner with internal teams, provide support, guidance and work cross functionally with employees across the USA. You will own the Vaniam Group compensation strategy and ensure the agency is strategic and competitive within the industry. You will be a key strategic addition to the future of our Company and People Operations team.

A day in the life:
This role will excel in project planning and organization of HR initiatives. You will successfully initiate, plan, monitor timelines, provide guidance to internal teams, help execute projects and assist in agency launch and communication for each HR initiative. You will do this by partnering with the Generalist team for a successful outcome. Your attention to detail and organizational skill set will ensure a high level of work output.

This role will collaborate with internal departments to provide guidance to employees, partner on employee relations and talent engagement initiatives and own relationships with the Leadership team to help grow the HR practice within Vaniam Group. This role will oversee the compensations strategy and provide guidance internally to ensure Vaniam Group is rewarding talent and remaining competitive within the industry.

What you have:
8+ years’ experience within a Human Resources Function in a small company environment (100 – 500 employees)
Bachelor’s Degree
Good working knowledge of Human Resources Information Systems
Experience within a project management function
Strong compensation knowledge and experience
Ability to communicate clearly and work collaboratively in a dynamic, virtual environment
Ability to manage ambiguity and confidential information
Detailed and organized
Self starter, problem solver, and creative strategist

What you might have, but isn’t required:
Experience in the pharmaceutical, biotech, or healthcare industries
Advanced HR Certification, such as PHR, SPHR
Has experience working across all HR functions.

The team you will work closest with:
You will report into the Associate Director, People Operations and be part of the Talent pillar within the People Operations department. In addition, you will be the point of contact for HR issues throughout the Company, so you’ll get to know all the internal Leadership, Managers, and Employees!

Why you will love us:
100% Virtual Environment – Work from Home! Travel 1-2 times a year to attend meetings
Fantastic Culture – Evergreen 7Ps https://www.tugboatinstitute.com/what-is-evergreen/
Health Benefits – Medical, Dental, and Vision
Focused on Your Financial Future – 401(k) with Company Match
Investment in You – Ample opportunity to grow your career
Work/Life Balance – Paid vacation time for rest and relaxation, Volunteer Time Off for community involvement
Passion in what we do – Serving clients focused on Cancer and Blood diseases

JobTitle: District Service Lead - Los Angeles District
Text:
District Service Lead
We are looking for a District Service Lead to join our legal team in one of today’s most exciting technologies! This individual should be a dynamic professional who is looking for a rewarding future in one of today’s most exciting technologies.

Location: Remote Field Office (US > Southwest Region > Los Angeles District)

Roles and Responsibilities:
Plan, schedule, and perform maintenance operations on Bloom Energy fuel cells to include ancillary equipment and associated infrastructureManage complex site repairsCreate efficient daily workflows for regional technicians from a large and diverse queue of open tasksManage new site acceptances through collaboration with construction teamsMotivate fellow Field Service Technicians and rally teams toward company goalsNurture new and existing Field Service TechniciansFulfill supervisory and safety observer roles for fellow technicians, as well as assist in two-person maintenance operations as neededAct as an advocate for Field Service Technicians to managementManage an On-Call watch-bill for Field Service TechniciansInterface/communicate with customers, subcontractors and other teams within Bloom Energy as needed to accomplish open work within the assigned districtOperate a service vehicle safely and maintain a driving record in good standingMaintain service vehicle and spare part inventoryManage on-site preventative maintenance, repair, test, and diagnostic tasksFollow company procedures/policies and encourage/enforce others to do the sameDiagnose errors or technical problems and determine/implement proper solutionsInterface with a technical team and share information across the organizationComprehend and respect customer access requirements, as well as manage service profiles for 100+ operational sitesBuild and maintain positive relationships with customers and teammates. Be available and responsive through email, instant messaging, text, and cellular during working hoursProduce timely and detailed service reports as requiredOther responsibilities as assignedRequired to reside within the Service DistrictTraining: Two initial training sessions of up to four weeks each in San Jose, CA IF NOT ALREADY QUALIFIED

Education and Experience:
The following MINIMUM levels of experience and or education are required:High school diploma and 12 years’ experience in electrical field
- OR -
Technical diploma, Journeymen Certification, Electrician Certification in a technical field and relevant industry experience of 10 years (electrician, electronics technician, field service, technician, test engineer, etc.)
- OR -
10 years electrical related military experience (e.g. Navy Nuclear Electronics/Electrical Technician, Naval Electrician, Gas Turbine Electrician) and 6 years of relevant commercial electrical experience

Skills and Experience:
Team player who exhibits a high level of integrity and professionalismCommunicates written and verbal English effectively. Professionalism is critical in this role which interfaces regularly with customer representatives, sub-contractors and other teams within Bloom EnergyElectrical experience required, troubleshooting & repair skills necessaryStrong mechanical aptitude and troubleshooting/repair skills; understanding of mechanical systems, piping, plumbing and valve operationPrior experience as an electrician in any of the following: three-phase systems, UPS (back-up power) systems, maintenance, electrical generation and distribution systems, power electronics, Automatic Transfer Switch Systems, and microprocessor based control platforms is highly beneficialFamiliarity with commercial power system infrastructure, Method of Procedure (MOP) protocols, Lock Out / Tag Out, Local Area Networks (LAN), Controller Area Networks (CAN), and Human Machine Interfaces (HMI)Experience with various test and measurement equipment, electrical codes and personnel safety products and proceduresMust be able to read and interpret electrical single line diagrams and blueprintsFamiliar with safety standards, especially those related to electrical work (OSHA & NFPA 70E)Experience with monitoring/operating systems in operationStrong understanding of requirements for working safelyAble to identify and resolve complex problems and apply problem-solving skillsHighly motivated and able to work independentlyDemonstrates sound judgmentAble to follow procedures and execute sequenced work instructions from either written and or verbal communicationsAble to regularly handle equipment up to 50lbs., occasionally may lift up to 70 lbs.Able to facilitate 24X7 on-call dutyAble to facilitate shift work as neededAble to regularly work alternative schedules (one week/month of Wednesday-Sunday, for example)Able to regularly support overtime to achieve quarterly goalsAble to regularly travel (drive) throughout a large Service District (e.g. “Southwest Region”)Able to travel occasionally to other US and international destinationsAble to maintain a driving record in good standingAble to start work early in the day to prepare a work schedule for all technicians in the DistrictAble to lead people and set a good example of professionalismStrong sense of ownership
About Bloom Energy:
Bloom Energy is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. We are committed to compliance with all applicable laws providing equal employment opportunities. All qualified applicants, will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability. Bloom Energy makes reasonable accommodations, consistent with applicable laws, for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified applicant or employee with a disability, who can perform the essential job functions, unless undue hardship would result.

Gunderson Dettmer is the only business law firm of its kind - exclusively serving the global venture capital and emerging technology marketplace. With more than 300 attorneys in nine offices - from Silicon Valley to Singapore - we innovate for innovators, accelerate entrepreneurship, and help build companies at every stage of the growth lifecycle. We are committed to being the employer of choice by working together to create an environment, in which each of our people can grow, take initiative, and develop a fun, fulfilling and financially rewarding career.
Job Description
Gunderson Dettmer has an opening for a Venture Fund Paralegal in our Los Angeles office. Currently, we are working remotely and remote work will be required until the Los Angeles office reopens. The Venture Fund Paralegal will perform duties supporting activities related to fund formation and organization of funds. Responsibilities include maintaining fund formation checklists, tracking investor responses, filing Certificates of Formation/Limited Partnership for general partner, main fund, side fund (s) and management company, distributing closing documents to limited partners and preparing closing volumes.
Job Requirements
Prior experience in the Venture Fund practice area.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel.
Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills.
Good judgment, initiative and flexibility.
Educational Requirements
BS/BA degree.
Status
Full Time, Non-Exempt.
Benefits
In addition to offering competitive salaries, we also offer an excellent benefit package, which includes full medical, dental and vision coverage; 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan; Flexible Spending Account and Paid Time Off.
Gunderson Dettmer is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

JobTitle: Platform Services Solution Lead - Opportunity for Working Remotely Los Angeles, CA
Text:
Purpose of Role
Dedicated person to partner with the services sales, (Tanzu Labs Sales - TLS) and Customer Success Manager (CSM) teams to identify and scope work for the platform services sales pipeline. They will do this by being the face of platform services for our existing and potential customers and will be responsible for technically supporting our field and customers to ensure the inclusion of the right level of Platform Services. They will be eloquent on the value of our services and how clients’ desired business outcomes and/or existing platform needs can be achieved with our service offerings.
About VMware
VMware is the leader in cloud infrastructure, business mobility and virtualization software. A pioneer in the use of virtualization and automation technologies, VMware simplifies IT complexity across the entire data center to the virtual workplace, empowering customers with solutions in the software-defined data center to hybrid cloud computing and the mobile workspace.
About MAPBU
At VMware’s Modern Application Platform Business Unit (MAPBU) we believe that Kubernetes and Modern Application Platforms will transform the next generation of enterprise infrastructure and applications the way Virtualization and Java have in the past. Customers will look to containers to avoid lock in with public clouds and the industry has aligned around Kubernetes as the orchestration engine for these containers. VMware is investing in building a modern stack that focuses on this next generation of enterprise computing incorporating both traditional workloads and cloud applications with our core platform. For these reasons, we believe no one is better positioned than VMware to win in the multi-cloud era.
About Platform Services
The VMware Tanzu Labs Platform Services team’s vision for client engagement is based on our belief that our customers’ success is our success. We strive to make our customers’ use of platform technologies successful and it turns out that successful use of technology requires some changes in people and process. We help our customers use a product-centric mindset to build a balanced team and a streamlined pathway to production, leaving application product teams unencumbered to deliver value to their customers. Our Product Managers and Solution Architects work with customer counterparts to transfer knowledge, culture and practices while achieving measurable goals. Feedback loops and frequent iterations to continuously improve outcomes are key to our delivery methodology.
About You
You love delighting our customers
You are solution oriented and take pride in helping our customers build modern application platforms
You have hands-on experience deploying and optimizing complex systems, architectures, and platforms
You help advance customer thinking and awareness within the container space
You are action-oriented, collaborative, a continuous learner, have a strong customer presence and must have a desire to contribute to VMware’s intent to capture modern application workloads
Solution Lead Responsibilities
The Platform Services Solution Lead tightly aligns and collaborates with the Balanced Account Team (BAT) responsible for positioning the right products and services at the right time to drive the desired outcomes for our customers. As the Solution Lead (SL) you will be the primary point of contact for a set of TLS representatives helping them focus on supporting our customers’ platform journey with appropriate services. You will be expected to be the expert in the room who is able to translate the business problems of a customer into services solutions that will help them overcome those challenges. We often find that customers need us to help them uncover what they don’t know and rely on the leadership qualities of our team to divine a path to their intended outcome. Successful candidates in this position will understand the overall sales cycle and the role they play in future opportunities. Our team evangelizes outcomes and serves as a conduit to “what is possible'' for our customers via our delivery organization. They must also assist in enabling the sales community to do the same wherever possible.
Solution Leads need exceptional consulting skills and must be able to articulate the value proposition of professional services. It’s critical that they evangelize a holistic view of services engagement alongside software solutions that drive better outcomes for our clients’ strategic and tactical efforts. The Solution Lead team is made up of people with an opinionated consultative mindset based on past experience, case study, collaboration, and deep understanding of client challenges. They are responsible for scoping the work and shaping the requirements of solution development for professional platform services. Members of the team should also be capable of communicating objective and sometimes painful truths to all audiences as well as be comfortable facilitating discussions and presentations with groups of any size. Solution Leads should inspire confidence in our customers that we can help them to achieve their incredibly challenging goals, goals they more often than not do not have the experience or personnel to solve themselves. You need to be relationship-oriented as you will serve as the bridge between core sales, specialist sales, TLS sales, and services delivery teams.
Having a consulting mindset is essential, which means listening to a customer’s questions and requirements, asking clarifying questions, and providing constructive feedback based on expertise in deployment, management and governance of complex systems. Most importantly, members of our team need an inquiring mind that asks relevant and probing questions to ensure we build the best solution to meet the customer’s requirements.
In brief we need someone with significant consulting experience, a propensity for selling and evangelizing, and a willingness to bring a number of disparate parties together in order to ensure our customers’ success.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
Understand and articulate the complete Platform Services Portfolio for all MAPBU Products
Serve as the primary point of contact for pre-sales and sales in a region for VMware TLS Representatives
Identify and drive qualified opportunities to closure
Oversight of real-time information on all pipeline opportunities where platform services could/should be sold
Collaboratively scope the level of effort for platform services during Discovery Workshops and be able to pull in SMEs to assist with the Discovery Workshops as needed
Ensure the right services are positioned at the right time to meet customer business use cases
Support the sales teams to develop and drive territory and account sales strategy
Learn and understand the customer's business model and primary business challenges in order to match the VMware solution to their needs, challenges, and technical requirements
Execute a Top Down/Bottom Up customer engagement strategy while strengthening existing relationships to elevate VMware to a more strategic position
Ability to craft compelling proposals and communicate the business value and/or return on investment of proposed solutions to the customer
Foster a sense of collaboration through activity and presence
Report and manage time with minimal oversight
Work effectively with a remote and distributed team
Utilize VMware EPIC2 values (Execution, Passion, Integrity, Customers, Community) to conduct day to day business
 Desired Skills:
Deep understanding of the “Platform Journey” and how the platform services portfolio supports customers moving along that continuum
Expert at conveying how platform services support business outcomes and successful consumption of our commercial product offerings
Domain expertise in infrastructure or programming concepts and general SDLC practices
Domain expertise in enterprise change management, compliance, and governance
Knowledge of tools required to drive solution relevance and scale
Familiarity with application developer challenges, interests and cloud native deployment patterns.
Sufficient technical competencies in container orchestration and cloud native application development platforms to drive customer confidence in our team and our offerings
Experience defining and maintaining business and technical strategies and roadmaps
Demonstrated ability to challenge the status quo across large enterprises including strategy and adoption of platforms, processes and modernization initiatives
Strong presentation skills and presence in front of executive stakeholders
Ability to resolve conflict and remain calm in heated situations
Understand the importance of and demonstrate active listening
Ability to understand political dynamics of an organization
Leads by doing
Other Requirements:
5+ years of experience in a technical presales, support, or consulting role
Ability to travel up to 30% of the time
Location: Remote

Ontrak is hiring for an LMS Administrator!
Bring your technical savvy and LMS experience to a fast growing company!

This individual has responsibility of taking care of the operational performance of a Learning Management System. The LMS Administrator will define user roles, and work collaboratively across the organization.
We are looking for a tech savvy individual passionate about employee development to the OntrakU team. OntrakU is an organizational learning approach in a mission driven AI and technology-enabled healthcare company.

 Joining the team provides an opportunity to advance our training and development while expanding your career in a rapidly growing environment. The ideal candidate will be able to implement, design and manage our LMS system. his role offers opportunity to influence and continuous evolve our learning environment. Working with a team instructional designer, the ideal leader has experience with eLearning & design software.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Implementation and maintenance of educational technology platforms
Research, evaluate, integrate, and release educational technology platform
Coordinate with vendors on escalations
Coordinate with vendors on enhancement requests
Ensure that proper configuration, monitoring, and documentation are in place to support LMS and integrated applications. Manages the LMS and third-party e-learning vendor relationships
Document educational technology platform processes and procedures
Provide training as needed for educational technology platforms
Complete special projects as assigned by leadership team
Ensure the LMS works properly, identify, track, and resolve system issues.
Create and manage user structures including the creation of user groups and learning cohorts
Develop and update tools and reporting for ongoing access to learning information; generate standard and custom reports
Miscellaneous duties as assigned

REQUIREMENTS
Technical certification in LMS coursework, instructional design
At least three years of proven experience as a System Administrator, Network Administrator, or similar role. Experience implementing an LMS
Advanced working knowledge of MS Office Suite (Word, Excel and PowerPoint)
Experience managing LMS platforms and running analytic reports on performance
Knowledge of design software such as Camtasia, Adobe Captivate and other e-learning software
LMS Admin Certification
In lieu of degree, equivalent education and/or experience may be considered

PREFERRED
Possess a bachelor’s in information technology, computer science or a related discipline
5 years’ experience with managing LMS
Trainer certification

Excellence: We persistently strive for greatness with tenacity and resilience, holding ourselves accountable to consistently exceed expectations for each of our valued constituents.
Teamwork: We foster an environment that enables collaboration, diversity, and inclusion, empowering each team member to boldly make impactful contributions to the company’s greater mission.

Ontrak, Inc. is making a positive impact on people’s lives every day. We use predictive analytics to identify health plan members with unaddressed behavioral health conditions that worsen chronic disease, then engage, support, and guide these members to better health with a personalized, human-centered approach. This has led us to where we are today: growing fast and saving lives as we do.

To support our explosive growth, we’re looking for compassionate, hard-working people-lovers to join our team. If innovating in the field of patient care is something you’re passionate about, we encourage you to join our mission to improve the health and save the lives of as many people as possible.

Impact lives in so many ways

The new face of mental health

Career options

Excellent compensation

Public Goods is a DTC e-commerce company, a digitally native, membership-driven, one-stop-shop that offers high-quality, sustainable essentials across grocery, household, and personal care. Public Goods' mission is to make premium-quality, healthy and sustainable products more accessible. We value the environment, and we believe that together our small choices can make a big impact.
We need your help to scale and grow our b2b department! Whether it is a retailer stocking our products, or a hotel using our product, we are in need of someone who is interested in forming new relationships on behalf of Public Goods. We are looking for eager people interested in consumer products, e-commerce, and building a brand. More specifically, scaling either our retail & hospitality partnerships sounds like an exciting opportunity for you.
You'll collaborate directly with our CEO (Morgan), our Head of Partnerships (Chris), and with the rest of the B2B, team to activate & engage new partners and connect with opportunities from our increasing inbound interest.
What’s in it for me?
The opportunity to join a well-funded, fast-growing startup as a core member of the partnerships team.
The ability to own the process from pitching a new account to closing the account. This is a unique structure that provides an opportunity to deepen relationships & keeps you in control of the partnership. We won’t be asking you to only set up meetings like a traditional sales dev. role.
The ability to be creative in thinking through the best ways to climb toward our collective goal
A chance to hone your leadership skills in a role that’s essential to the success of our entire business.
What you’ll be working on:
You will be helping us in our expansion into either retail or hospitality specifically
Prospecting, inbounds & outreach
Vetting and finding potential partners and crafting unique entryways to get our foot in the door
Manage inbounds and creating a successful trajectory for them to become a partner
A/B testing your own strategy to measure what is effective and what is not
Who you are:
1-2 years working experience working closely with partners in a similar role (BD, sales, etc).
Strong familiarity with the Shopify ecosystem.
Proven experience with partnerships or sales (deals, accounts, etc) and the associated tech stack (HubSpot)
Project management & cross-department communication (operations and marketing)
Experience in Excel
You’re eager to learn fast and stay curious
You can wear lots of different hats and learn a new skill quickly if it means helping the team
You’re able to own your process, step-up, and manage projects. Rather than look for doers, you can be one yourself
You work smart. It’s easy to waste time on things that don’t drive results. You need to be laser-focused on the activities that have the biggest impact.
Personal and Professional Attributes:
Motivated by growth, driven by more than just a paycheck
Passionate about our mission
Self-reliant and comfortable working without much guidance
Focused on the customer, not the competitor
Kind, compassionate, and willing to roll your sleeves up

This is a remote position.
Benefits
Competitive compensation package salary + equity.
100% covered Medical/Dental/Vision/telemedicine services for employees
Public Goods lifetime membership and monthly credits to both Public Goods and a monthly stipend for books of your choice!

About Songbird

Songbird Therapy is a modern and technology-enabled provider of in-home autism care. We're a team of clinicians, technologists, and designers building a new model for home-based autism care, including:

Telehealth supervision and technology to reduce driving, paperwork, and burnout for our BCBAs.
Integrated and coordinated care for children across a full team of diagnosticians, OTs, SLPs, and BCBAs to drive better outcomes and access.
Parent training and wraparound support, including through technology (mobile app to access messaging, counseling, community, parent coach, and more).
Leading ABA research advisors, including researchers at the University of Houston Clear Lake, University of Pennsylvania, and University of Florida.

The Opportunity

We're looking for an experienced and passionate BCBA to join our growing team. You'll help bring Songbird Therapy to a new city, setting best practices, building team culture, and pursuing clinical excellence. You will:

Lead and supervise an ABA program
Conduct Functional Behavior Assessments
Develop and implement parent training and support programs
Provide virtual (and sometimes field) supervision for RBTs
Provide compassionate training, support, and mentorship to RBTs
Develop, manage, and oversee progress reports and treatment plans
Partner with coding, billing, and insurance teams to meet payer requirements
Lead the growth of an ABA program through RBT hiring and client on-boarding

The Skillset

Masters or Doctorate in Applied Behavioral Analysis, Special Ed, Psychology, or related field
Valid BCBA Certification
Applicable licensure to practice within the state hired
Minimum 3 years experience of clinical supervision, with 7+ years in ABA preferred
Strong leadership skills
Strong oral and written communication skills

Benefits of working at Songbird

Highly-competitive salary or hourly rates
Compassionate, fun and mission-driven culture of clinical excellence and innovation
Many advancement opportunities
Work from home, remote job; flexible schedule
Paid time for administrative work, drive time, and other non-client facing tasks.
Paid holidays and vacation time; paid sick time
Highly-competitive benefits packages

If you consider yourself a data detective, this job is for you! The Data Forensics Analyst is responsible for researching and reporting on issues with any data involved in Ontrak operations. This would include but not be limited to:
Performing root cause analysis to identify and troubleshoot system and data errors.
Demonstrated ability to quantify impact analysis across business and technology ecosystems.
Researching and documenting data discovery and investigative processes to improve overall data integrity and quality across disparate sources.
Researching and documenting the integrity and quality issues for externally received data researching and documenting data inconsistencies across the Ontrak technical ecosystem including data ingestion, transformation, storage and reporting functions. Working with cross-functional stakeholders and technology teams to design appropriate data quality assurance processes that can be run on inbound data
Defining data requirements and developing reports to support core business operations for customer acquisition and retention that are extensible and sustainable. Working with the data ingestion, architecture, and quality assurance teams to confirm that solutions that address data issues have been correctly applied and mitigate risk.
WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE

Experience:
Healthcare data experience working with claims, medical records, or HIE systems.
Ability to work cross-functionally and gain alignment
Ability to identify and define project data dependencies as needed
Strong consultative, listening and analytical skills; able to be forward-thinking and engage in innovative problem solving and solutions development.
2+ years of business analysis experience, preferably in a large data- oriented company or clinical research function.
Proven experience with SQL and NOSQL data.
Experience in a systems operation support function and familiarity with issue management methodologies and solutions.
Skills:
Proven experience writing both SQL/NOSQL queries
Familiarity with data privacy and security regulations.
Demonstrated experience in a lean/ agile development environment.
Great communication skills, both verbal and written
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Attention to detail.
Inquisitive; able to exhaust every avenue of investigation as necessary
Command line is a plus
Excel experience (basic formulas, pivot tables, vlookup, etc)
Able to learn new tools and understand various data flows quickly

Education:
A Bachelor's degree in a relevant field
In lieu of a Bachelor's degree, equivalent education and/or experience may be considered

Our remote opportunities require:
A quiet, private, distraction-free home office work environment
A reliable high-speed internet connection (cable, DSL, or fiber) with speeds of at least 10Mbps download and 5Mbps upload. Most positions will require that you be hard-wired to your internet access and Wi-Fi will be disabled. Traveling with your computer is not allowed unless travel is required for the position.
Discipline to work from home while following a set schedule
Background check clearance

Our model is research-based, and we are invested in staying on the leading edge of treatment. You'll help us break down barriers and stigmas associated with mental health.

Career options
Our ongoing strong growth and evolution, we are looking for people who want to do their best at work. Join our team and take your career to the next level with Ontrak. We are committed to promoting from within.

Excellent compensation
In addition to a competitive wage, we offer comprehensive benefits including medical, dental and vision insurance; a 401(k) plan; paid holiday, vacation and sick time; flexible spending accounts; Basic Life/AD&D, Employee Assistance Program and Travel Assistance Program and more.

We are looking for a highly qualified and highly motivated Hyperion / PBCS EPM Lead to work in the Financial System / Enterprise Application Group. The Hyperion / PBCS EPM Lead will be responsible for customizing and administering our planning and budgeting system which supports the Finance organization at J2 Global®.
The ideal candidate will have 5+ years of hands on technical experience with Hyperion, Essbase, Planning and/or PBCS, with at least one full cycle PBCS implementation.

Job Duties:
Development and administration of PBCS / Hyperion budget and planning tool in support of the Finance organization
Development duties include implementation of BSO/ASO cubes in PBCS environment
Support of budget / planning income statement and workforce planning PBCS cubes
Administration of current state PBCS environment in support of rolling budget / forecast models
End user training, report writing (Smartview, HFR) and support
Analyzing requirements, writing functional specifications, conducting tests, troubleshooting issues and interfacing with business users
Build complex reports using Oracle reporting tools and other BI/Analytic tools against Oracle Fusion Cloud ecosystem
Expanded role in business intelligence / analytics & data warehouse for future state reporting solution
Job Experience and Requirements:
5+ years of hands on functional and technical experience with Hyperion, Essbase, Planning and/or PBCS, with at least one full cycle PBCS implementation
Deep functional and technical knowledge of financial systems and business processes, especially around planning, budgeting and forecasting
BA / BS or Master’s Degree, preferably in Information Systems
Oracle's Enterprise Planning & Budgeting Cloud Service (EPBCS) or Planning & Budgeting Cloud Service (PBCS) or Hyperion EPM tools (Hyperion Planning, Essbase, Smartview, FDMEE, EPM Automate, other) -> development and administrative capacity
Oracle's reporting tools including Smartview, Hyperion Financial Reports (HFR), OBIEE, BI Cloud, Oracle Analytic Cloud preferred
Experience in automating PBCS operations using EPM Automate and Data Management (FDMEE module)
Development experience including end-to-end implementation lifecycle to include requirements gathering, configuration, design, build, test and go-live stages
Able to work in a fast-paced environment with a diverse team; work independently under minimal supervision and flexible to participate as a team member in other projects regarding Oracle Fusion ERP, BI/Analytics, Salesforce, other
Understanding of P&L, balance sheet and cash flow development across multiple industries
Ability to advise users on best practices in planning, budgeting and forecasting
BI / Analytic experience using packaged software (i.e. Tableau, Business Objects, Cognos, Other) preferred
Data warehouse experience using Oracle, Teradata, AWS, other preferred
