When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, and you’ll be valued and recognized for your performance. With talented managers and inspiring coworkers to support you, you’ll find the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world.
Position/Division Specific Information
The Marketing Manager position for Biosciences is a member of the North American Market Development team and is responsible for implementing the Go-to-Market strategy and demand generation plans for a consumables and instrumentation portfolio within the Bioscience division of Thermo Fisher Scientific. S/he will lead the development and execution of regional marketing plans to support the Bioscience sales force that sells the Biosciences portfolio in a dynamic market environment.
How will you make an impact?
The successful candidate will consider his/her marketing strategy, while coordinating and working closely with the Bioscience Global Market Development team, Corporate Marketing, Marketing Operations, and Executive Management to guide and execute integrated marketing programs designed to help reach North American sales, marketing, and revenue goals.
The successful candidate will assume the role of a project leader and liaison to internal and external customers in order to facilitate the conversion of marketing ideas and messages into effective marketing programs leading to sales, enhanced customer satisfaction, and market growth in a dynamic environment.
This individual contributor role is a high visibility position, working in a cross-functional organization. The successful candidate should be able to contribute to the tactical marketing goals of their product portfolio and be productive and additive to the vision of the leaders of the North American Commercial Operations and the Bioscience business within 120 days.
What will you do?
Partner with cross-functional teams as an individual contributor to help develop digital marketing and sales enablement marketing plans that drive growth in key channels and customer segments
Develop and drive messaging and tools that communicate the value proposition directly to our customers through many different channels, including multiple sales teams, digital marketing, distributors, and events.
Achieves financial and market goals for designated product portfolio. Perform and present detailed analyses & routine reporting around business performance and segmentation
Provide Voice-of-Customer and Voice-of-Sales to business partners to maintain the most effective product positioning and strategy
Provide product, positioning and go-to-market strategy training and communication to direct sales teams on a regular basis
How will you get here?
Required: Bachelor’s degree in molecular biology or related biological laboratory science discipline
Preferred: Master’s degree in life sciences or experience in biology labs/applications and/or related-marketing role; MBA in marketing or business
3+ years experience in a marketing role, responsible for product or portfolio marketing, go-to-market strategy & execution
A proficient understanding of customer value proposition and demand/lead generation strategies
Experience with marketing planning and strategy; familiarity with life science research markets and competitors
Supporting lead generation and lead maintenance efforts with either reagent or instrumentation products
A collaborative ability to work on problems of routine to diverse scope; influence cross-functional peer groups without direct authority; and identify problems, answer questions, and gain cooperation of others to implement efficient solutions in a fast-paced, matrixed environment
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
Business analytical skills with the ability to interpret business problems and identify business needs from data
Ability to provide strategic and tactical guidance and expertise to the broader marketing team
Provide business partners with regularly oral and written communication of key business metrics, successes, failures, best practices, etc. in order to optimize strategies and tactics to achieve targets
Ability to proactively and effectively participate in teams working through various levels of internal and external operating mechanisms to achieve goals of the company, customer, and colleagues
At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 65,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.
Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com
Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Paid training, company car, home office, medical, dental, vision, 6% 401K matching, promotion from within...what a great way to start a career in sales!Position Description: Reynolds and Reynolds is seeking motivated and hard-working Entry Level Software Sales Trainee to join our growing team. As an Entry Level Software Sales Trainee, you will enroll in our 12 month training program. This program is comprised of both field based and classroom style training. The classroom training is located at our award winning Reynolds University in Dayton, OH. Every month you will travel to Dayton for 1-2 weeks of courses covering a variety of topics, including dealership operations, sales techniques, and negotiation skills. When you are not in Dayton, you will be working with your assigned Sales Mentor in the field, observing the sales process and assisting them on their calls. You will also be given the opportunity to travel with our customer service and installation teams to enhance your knowledge of our products. During the 12 months of training, you can expect to travel up to 75% of the time.Once you complete the training program, you will relocate to your assigned territory and become a Sales Professional. Relocation assistance to this new territory will be provided by the company. In this role you will be responsible for achieving designated monthly and annual quotas by selling Reynolds software products and services to new and existing customers. As a Sales Professional (and Trainee) you will have a home office and will be provided a company car, laptop, iPhone, and other office equipment.Requirements: Bachelor’s degreeMust be a self-starter with good time management skillsAbility to build strong customer relationshipsExcellent oral and written communication skillsWilling to relocate after successful completion of the 12 month training program (relocation assistance provided by the company)Ability to travel (overnight) approximately 75% during trainingBenefits: We strive to offer an environment that provides our associates with the right balance between work and family. We offer a comprehensive benefits package including:Medical, dental, vision and life insurance401(k) with up to 6% matchingCompany car for business and personal useWorking remotely with an iPhone, laptop, and other provided home office equipmentProfessional development and trainingPromotion from withinReferral bonusesAssociate discounts for cell phones, cars, computers, entertainment, and much moreCompany Information: Founded in 1866, Reynolds and Reynolds provides print, marketing, and software solutions to the automotive industry (www.reyrey.com). We offer solutions for each area of the dealership including parts, service, accounting, and sales.Reynolds and Reynolds promotes a healthy lifestyle by providing a non-smoking environment. Reynolds and Reynolds encourages applicants of all ages and experience to apply, as we do not discriminate on the basis of ageJob Type: Full-timePay: $50,000.00 per year

Clinical Management Consultants is now hiring for a Remote Nurse Recruiter. This is an exciting opportunity for ambitious Recruiters and Sales minded individuals looking to work from home.

CMC is seeking new and ambitious people to join our team of like minded individuals. In this role, the recruiter is in the driving seat of a full desk of recruitment. From sourcing, to placing, to managing and developing new client accounts, this person should be comfortable and excited by relationship building and have the desire to grow their own book of business. CMC gives recruiters the tools, training, and support our teams need to find success for the taking.

The Remote Nurse Recruiter will specialize in filling Healthcare Management, Advanced Practice, Health Plan, and specialized nursing roles throughout their territory. The right fit will get the opportunity to make long lasting placements with some of the biggest hospital organizations in the country. The Nurse Recruiter helps healthcare professionals find their next positions and in turn helps those hospitals find the best people to provide quality care to their patients. For those seeking a financially and personally rewarding career path on the business side of healthcare, this is one of the best opportunities to do so.

Compensation is competitively structured and top performers enjoy six-figure earnings and profit-sharing bonuses. The Remote Healthcare Recruiter will earn a base salary, uncapped commissions, sales incentives, full health insurance, and other benefits.

Bachelor's or advanced degree in business or sales preferred. Agency/Third party recruiting or Account Manager/Inside Sales experience highly preferred. Must have experience in a professional environment. The Remote Healthcare Recruiter must be self driven to succeed out of the office setting, and must have a secure and quiet environment to conduct business between 9am-5pm local time.

From sourcing, to placing, to managing and developing new client accounts, this person should be comfortable and excited by relationship building and have the desire to grow their own book of business. CMC gives recruiters the tools, training, and support our teams need to find success for the taking.

The Remote Nurse Recruiter will specialize in filling Healthcare Management, Advanced Practice, Health Plan, and specialized nursing roles throughout their territory. The right fit will get the opportunity to make long lasting placements with some of the biggest hospital organizations in the country. The Nurse Recruiter helps healthcare professionals find their next positions and in turn helps those hospitals find the best people to provide quality care to their patients. For those seeking a financially and personally rewarding career path on the business side of healthcare, this is one of the best opportunities to do so.

Compensation is competitively structured and top performers enjoy six-figure earnings and profit-sharing bonuses. The Remote Healthcare Recruiter will earn a base salary, uncapped commissions, sales incentives, full health insurance, and other benefits.

Bachelor's or advanced degree in business or sales preferred. Agency/Third party recruiting or Account Manager/Inside Sales experience highly preferred. Must have experience in a professional environment. The Remote Healthcare Recruiter must be self driven to succeed out of the office setting, and must have a secure and quiet environment to conduct business between 9am-5pm local time.

Job Title: MarTech Analytics Manager
Requisition ID: 146035BR
Location: US - Remote or EMEA

What will you do?
The primary purpose of the Marketing Performance Manager is to deliver marketing processes and technologies governance that will allow the MSD (Materials and Structural Analysis) marketing teams to focus on delivering value. This role will ensure that marketing data flows in an effective manner resulting in an efficient and impactful marketing planning and analytics framework.
The Marketing Performance Manager leads a team that supports marketing ROI, sales enablement, leads management, and marketing analytics. Additionally, this role will work across functions to align with owners of project management, content management and marketing automation tools to maximize data health and integration. These efforts will drive efficient collection and processing of marketing qualified leads — leading to a higher conversion rate of sales qualified opportunities.
This role reports to the Senior Manager of Marketing Planning and Analytics and will lead a team of leads management and marketing analytics specialists. This team works directly with business unit market development managers, sales representatives, sales operations and information technology teams to tailor processes as needed while maximizing process alignment across the division. Also under the scope of this team is the development and maintenance of marketing analytics dashboards for a variety of stakeholders.
Responsibilities:
Develop, implement and maintain effective and scalable marketing processes
Research and recommend new marketing technologies
Own the integration between marketing automation, CRM and other solutions in the marketing tech stack to ensure a seamless experience for customers moving from one stage of the customer value journey to another
Manage lead flow and data processes including lead capture, data enrichment and cleansing to increase commercial opportunities through lead generation between the CRM and marketing automation platforms
Own the marketing database management strategy that ensures data quality, supports audience segmentation and data hygiene
Establish KPIs and design and maintain marketing performance and campaign-specific dashboards and reporting to support decision-making
Train and support marketing staff on martech solutions
Perform data privacy, compliance and security reviews where required
Collaborate with Market Development Managers and digital marketing experts to optimize the reporting of marketing campaign effectiveness through KPI management
Draw insights from marketing data and share recommendations with the BU market development teams.
Own marketing performance reporting at the division level
Drive functional best practices as well as innovative thinking through practical process improvement
Mentor Marketing Analytics Specialists in ability to provide the right data and analysis to make campaign optimization decisions
Display strong time management and organizational skills to drive project timelines and remain within budgetary requirements
How will you get there?
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree required or equivalent experience in related field; Master’s preferred
Experience:
7+ years of marketing leads and analytics management
2+ years leading a team
Exceptional organizational skills, including the ability to effectively prioritize
Strong experience in digital marketing operations
Experience collaborating with agencies
Experience within a B2B marketing environment. Scientific instruments industry experience preferred.
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:
Proven track record of successfully connecting marketing technologies
Expert in marketing analytics reporting and data visualization
Self-motivated, engaged, and accountable
Excellent project management skills with experience using project management software
Ability to build relationships and work seamlessly in a global team environment
Strong team player with excellent verbal, written, presentation and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to take direction, pay attention to details and work independently and proactively
Demonstrated Thermo Fisher Scientific values – Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement.
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $25 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 75,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.

Evolus is a performance beauty company with a customer-centric approach focused on delivering breakthrough products. We are seeking a driven, outgoing and seasoned aesthetic clinician. This field-based individual is someone who will increase awareness and education of Evolus products, respond to unsolicited training requests, develop professional relationships with thought leaders, identify research and grant opportunities, as well as provide timely, accurate, unbiased, fair-and-balanced product information. This person will disseminate technical and scientific information to critical internal and external stakeholders. If you are looking for an opportunity to exhibit your knowledge and technical abilities in a unique environment, then look no further! In this role, you will be challenged to drive the success of Evolus in an effort to build a brand like no other.
Let’s talk about some of the key responsibilities of the role:
Disseminating scientific information and responding to clinical questions deriving from unsolicited requests for information that sales representatives or the company may receive from health care professionals (HCPs).
Provide HCPs education on best clinical practices with education and training programs.
Build relationships with thought leaders and locally influential providers.
Maintain a high level of compliance with company standard operating procedures, training records and administrative documentation.
Develop peer-level relationships with medical and scientific experts, interpret and effectively communicate relevant medical and scientific literature and present complex medical and scientific ideas fluently to internal and external audiences.
Identify and oversee investigator-initiated research and educational grant requests.
Attend conventions, symposiums, congresses and advisory board programs to provide medical and scientific support to internal and external customers.
Work cross-functionally with marketing and sales teams by providing medical and scientific expertise.
Support and facilitate medical communications and act as the main point of contact for HCPs requesting data.
Facilitate the recruitment and evaluation of appropriate investigators for post-marketing investigations and assist with the development and review of scientific marketing presentation materials.
Contribute to the development of databases of medical and scientific information regarding products and similar/competing products.
Skills and Qualifications Required for this Dynamic Team Member:
Aesthetic injector (RN, NP, PA degree required).
Minimum 3+ years of clinical aesthetic experience.
Superior injection skills and solid grasp of facial anatomy.
Experience working with dermatologists and/or plastic surgeons.
Strong problem solving and communication skills.
Results driven individual who is able to work independently.
Excellent decision making and leadership capabilities.
Adapts to change quickly and calmly.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Software including: Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, etc.
 A Few Other Items Worth Mentioning:
Evolus is headquartered in Newport Beach, CA.
The position is remote with need to proximity of a major airport.
Reports directly to the VP of Medical Affairs.
Ability to travel up to 60%.

Evolus takes pride in being a company on the forefront of innovation, while being committed to conducting its business with the highest degrees of integrity, professionalism, and social responsibility. We are also committed to complying with all laws and regulations that apply to our business. Employee welfare is no different. Here at Evolus, we don’t just work together, we’ve built a culture of inclusion! Because of this, you’ll find yourself immersed in an environment that not only promotes respect, collaboration and team building, but a community too. And that’s just the tip of the iceberg. Join our team and see for yourself! EOE M/F/D/V. For more information, please visit our website at www.evolus.com.

Ontrak is looking for a Billing and Reporting Guru!
Bring your analytical skills to an exciting and fast growing company!

The Billing and Reporting Analyst at Ontrak will be a champion for collecting data from different systems and existing reports to analyze and help support the billing revenue cycle management for the Billing Team. The Billing and Reporting Analyst will be instrumental in reviewing the current state and helping to create future improvements to the billing delivery process through the use of report generation. This individual needs to be a strong and independent thinker and able to partner with operations, billing, accounting, and other organizational stakeholders to ensure information is organized and disseminated in an accurate and timely manner.

KEYS TO SUCCESS!

To be successful in this role you must have excellent organizational skills, high attention to detail, be able to coordinate tasks across multiple team deliverables, the ability to troubleshoot, problem-solve, and be very comfortable working with ambiguity. In addition, the individual in this role needs to have the confidence in billing analysis (design, issue identification, root cause analysis, and solutions) to take an advisory posture. The right individual will have a growth mindset and commitment to following the organization's standard of behaviors related to our Mission, Vision, and Values.

Essential Functions
Design Data Management and Reporting Tools – design and develop reporting processes, systems, and tools for inputting, managing, and securing medical billing data.
Gather and Input Data – maintain a wide array of billing-related data, business processes and reporting. This involves both entering information into existing databases and creating new processes and programs to accurately input and store critical data.
Analyze Information – take an active role in analyzing and interpreting data to ensure a high level of accuracy, timeliness, and usefulness for operational and business use cases.
Collaborate with Business Teams and Leadership – work across business lines, conferring with managers and executives to gather requirements and specifications while developing enhanced data and reporting tools. Work with Director of Operations to gain a better sense of the current shortcomings in reporting technology and devise solutions to enhance reporting and data management.
Help coordinate department special project requests, as needed. Serve as a “back-up” to current billing staff and assist to ensure billing, collections, and accounts receivable are meeting department goals and project deadlines.

REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Technology, Healthcare Administration or equivalent experience
Demonstrated understanding of best practices related to medical billing and reporting functions
Prior experience with complex data
Demonstrated experience with billing systems, Medicare billing, and Insurance Billing
Prior experience with complex data, root cause analysis tied with solutions.
End to end revenue cycle experience – understanding how data feeds (APIs) work
Prior experience in root cause analysis that drives resolution
Stakeholder management
Advanced Excel proficiency (v/xlookups, pivot tables, macros, etc)
Ability to improve and make recommendations to improve data analysis, reporting
Hold report design discovery calls that lead to quality reports that meet user expectations and needs
Ability to work cross-functionally
PREFERRED:

IT, Medical Billing, A/R Experience, and Experience with obtaining reporting from Medical Billing and Practice Management systems
Demonstrated experience creating/writing reports.
Some macro and SQL experience
Office 365 (Word, Excel, PPT)
Minimum two (2) years Business office or IT Experience in a Clinical Healthcare Environment

In addition to, the requirements above, we seek those who can champion the following Ontrak, Inc Values:

Integrity: Ontrak is built on a solid foundation of unwavering ethics, transparent communications, honoring our commitments and always striving to do what is right.
Member Focus: We commit to improving each member’s total health and well-being, delivering care with compassion, and rooted in agility, innovation, determination, and grit.
Innovation: Through creativity and ingenuity, we continuously develop novel solutions to critical problems that improve healthcare for all of those we serve.
Excellence: We persistently strive for greatness with tenacity and resilience, holding ourselves accountable to consistently exceed expectations for each of our valued constituents.
Teamwork: We foster an environment that enables collaboration, diversity, and inclusion, empowering each team member to boldly make impactful contributions to the company’s greater mission.

Our remote opportunities require:
A quiet, private, distraction-free home office work environment
A reliable high-speed internet connection (cable, DSL, or fiber) with speeds of at least 10Mbps download and 5Mbps upload.
Most positions will require that you be hard-wired to your internet access and Wi-Fi will be disabled.
Traveling with your computer is not allowed unless travel is required for the position.
Discipline to work from home while following a set schedule
Background check clearance
ABOUT US

Ontrak, Inc. is making a positive impact on people’s lives every day. We use predictive analytics to identify health plan members with unaddressed behavioral health conditions that worsen chronic disease, then engage, support, and guide these members to better health with a personalized, human-centered approach. This has led us to where we are today: growing fast and saving lives as we do.

To support our explosive growth, we’re looking for compassionate, hard-working people-lovers to join our team. If innovating in the field of patient care is something you’re passionate about, we encourage you to join our mission to improve the health and save the lives of as many people as possible.

Impact lives in so many ways
You'll be an integral part in supporting people coping with their unique life challenges. Every member of the Ontrak team contributes to accomplishing our goals and upholding our people-centric values.

The new face of mental health
Our model is research-based, and we are invested in staying on the leading edge of treatment. You'll help us break down barriers and stigmas associated with mental health.

Career options
Our ongoing strong growth and evolution, we are looking for people who want to do their best at work. Join our team and take your career to the next level with Ontrak. We are committed to promoting from within.

Excellent compensation
In addition to a competitive wage, we offer comprehensive benefits including medical, dental and vision insurance; a 401(k) plan; paid holiday, vacation and sick time; flexible spending accounts; Basic Life/AD&D, Employee Assistance Program and Travel Assistance Program and more.

JobTitle: Global Marketing Manager - Water & Lab Products
Text:
Position can me remote US
Job Description
When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals.

How will you make an impact?
Are you passionate about creating integrated marketing campaigns for B2B customers? We are seeking a Global Marketing Manager for our Water & Lab Products business unit, focused on driving growth through e-Commerce and channel partners. The Global Marketing Manager will create and execute comprehensive marketing plans to develop compelling multi-channel marketing collateral and sales enablement tools. S/he will collaborate with product management and regional market development partners to support new product introductions and sustaining marketing awareness for our business. Working in collaborative, cross-functional teams, the Marketing Manager will drive all aspects of the downstream marketing effort for water and laboratory products.

What will you do?
Develop strategic, multi-channel integrated marketing plans for areas of responsibility, including customer segmentation, competitor analysis, business trends, market opportunities, sales funnels, and staging and pacing of tactical programs
Guide the development of copy and creative content for identified markets, appropriately positioning products within compliance guidelines, while conveying strong value propositions and clear product differentiation
Create and implement appropriate marketing content across multiple channels, including web, social media, video, print, and more
Develop sales force training and customer education material in collaboration with product management, R&D, regional marketing, and commercial teams
Develop and manage a robust lead generation funnel
Coordinate with global functions to ensure consistency with brand profiles and company standards
Collaborate and ensure alignment of marketing plans and sales training materials among Product Management, Regional Market Development, Commercial Partners, and other business units
Successfully engage with advertising agencies and marketing program managers to deliver high-quality assets, including, but not limited to, creative direction and content for print and digital collateral, PR, social media, customer-facing presentations, global tradeshow properties and promotional materials
Maintain campaign metrics dashboards to measure the effectiveness of marketing activities
Maintain knowledge of the trends and competitive activity
Manage marketing budgets and optimize the promotional mix on campaigns to achieve a high return on investment
Act as a brand ambassador, understanding, upholding, and communicating our multi-brand strategy in all aspects of our marketing programs
Interact with varying levels of internal and external personnel including direct customer communication and public presentation
How will you get here?
Required Qualifications:
5+ years of experience developing marketing strategy and successfully implementing marketing plans in B2B environment.
Exceptional communication skills as well as analytical, project management and planning skills necessary.
Demonstration of digital marketing expertise with proven campaigns in display advertising, search engine marketing, social, video and automation approaches.
Experience with product area marketing plans, general knowledge of operating plans or industry practices for promoting and selling similar products.
Strong business acumen and customer focus are essential.
Must be able to manage project scope, budget and schedule to achieve timely completion of project deliverables
Bachelor’s degree in business, science, engineering or related degree.
Desired Qualifications:
Knowledge of the following key competencies: 4Ps and marketing mix, marketing communication, communication channels, channels-to-market, segmentation, value proposition and marketing program development and execution.
Prior experience in scientific instruments, industrial equipment or molecular biology reagents highly preferred
Experience in developing successful lead generation programs using multi-channel strategies to drive funnel fulfillment.
Experience with marketing and voice of customer VOC.
Travel may be required. (up to 25%)
MBA strongly preferred.
Adept at building and maintain relationships with customers and key opinion leaders
Strong creative intuition on design and messaging that resonates with customers and an ability to learn from previous campaigns to improve on performance

Latham & Watkins, a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world, is currently seeking a Quality Assurance Analyst to join our winning team, located in our Global Services Office in downtown Los Angeles. The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our clients with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation and collaboration.

As the global outbreak of COVID-19 continues to unfold, Latham has taken precautions to help protect our people, clients, and the communities where we live and work. This includes a temporary shift to remote working for the majority of our lawyers and staff. The Quality Assurance Analyst will likely start remotely while the firm continues to evaluate the situation.

The Quality Assurance Analyst will receive a generous total compensation package. Bonuses are awarded in recognition of individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham's comprehensive benefit program including healthcare, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a 401k plan, and more! In addition, employees receive 10 paid holidays per year, and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure.

As a Quality Assurance Analyst at Latham, you will be responsible for maintaining a high standard of accuracy and reliability regarding technology applications. You will assist Team Managers, Supervisors and various Technology Department teams to ensure applications and reports are developed and implemented at their expected levels. You will assist the Technology Department with performing quality assurance procedures for software implementations, upgrades, custom application and report development while accomplishing these and other critical functions:

Receives guidance from the Team Manager and Supervisor in order to test, document, and maintain applications and reports for the firm
Assists with isolating, troubleshooting and resolving problems and issues with technology projects.
Develops and executes test plans with guidance from the Team and Project Manager.
Keeps abreast of legal industry applications, operating systems, firm data, data relationships and user experience needs. Writes SQL to validate testing results under the manager’s guidance.
Develops productive and collaborative relationships with project team members and requestors to help ensure that applications and reports are developed and implemented at their expected levels.
Communicates with the Team Manager and Supervisor regarding testing status in accordance with project management procedures.
Assists with special projects regarding various issues as needed.
Promotes effective work practices, works as a team member, and shows respect for co-workers.

As a Quality Assurance Analyst, you will be expected to apply your organizational and communication skills while displaying a positive, high-energy attitude. The successful Analyst must have strong knowledge and proficiency in a wide variety of software programs, including Windows, Microsoft Office, Microsoft Project, Exchange and Document Management Systems, as well as knowledge of reporting tools (e.g. Crystal Report, Business Objects), server hardware/software configuration, data warehousing concepts and processes, and systems analysis and design methods. The ideal candidate should have strong analytical skills needed for all primary duties of position, including comprehending and communicating data. The successful candidate must have well developed and professional interpersonal skills, including the ability to interact effectively with people at all organizational levels of the firm.

A Bachelor’s degree in Technology or a related field is required. A minimum of three (3) years Quality Assurance experience is required, including experience using relational database systems (e.g. Microsoft SQL). Experience with the testing of web, client server, and n-tiered systems, as well as experience with data modeling, customization, and data conversion is preferred.

Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by clicking the ‘Apply Now’ link.

Bulletproof Overview:
Bulletproof is an omni-channel content driven consumer products company. Our vision is to tap into the unlimited power of being human and we do this by holding true to our mission of creating products that radically improve lives. Bulletproof helps people live better by providing information and products that help them use fat for fuel, say goodbye to sugar and supercharge mitochondria increasing their energy.

Bulletproof is a team of experienced professionals working to make high performance a daily reality for everyone on the planet. While our culture is casual and our workplace flexible, the team is passionate, customer driven, meaningfully connected, smart, and results focused.

Our customers know that our coffee, beverages, food, and supplements are the purest you can get anywhere, and you can expect to feel a difference in how you perform the first time you experience them. Environmentally conscious and ethically sourced products build a sustainable foundation for future generations to thrive. Bulletproof coffee has developed a cult following across the nation as a drink that provides sustained energy, while also programming your body to burn fat for energy. In addition to providing convenient access to products through eCommerce, brick and mortar retail stores (e.g. Whole Foods Market) and Bulletproof Cafes, Bulletproof has developed a specialized diet, which is based on eating high amounts of healthy fats, moderate amounts of high-quality protein, and tons of organic vegetables eaten at the right time in order to create unbelievable levels of energy and weight loss.

At Bulletproof 360, Inc. (“Bulletproof”), we welcome employees and candidates with different backgrounds and perspectives. We value and trust each other – including our differences – while remaining true to our mission of radically improving lives. We encourage a corporate culture of self-expression, asking employees to be authentic to themselves. Our team brings together their unique perspectives, experiences, and passions in the work they do because we believe diversity makes us stronger, together.

Bulletproof aims to create a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our employees at all levels of the workforce without regard to age, race, color, sex, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity and/or expression, disability or any other laws. We strive to take steps in our recruiting practices by promoting diversity and fostering inclusion throughout our interview and hiring process, working toward the goal of a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Position Overview:
Bulletproof is looking for a Art Director to help create innovative, fully integrated ideas and campaigns across multiple channels. The ideal candidate has a passion for world class creative work; and, is talented and passionate at solving business needs in a fast-paced, creative environment.

Key Responsibilities:
Grow the Bulletproof brand through omnichannel marketing campaigns.
Develop and execute original creative concepts to meet business objectives.
Develop engaging creative concepts and have the design skills to bring them to life.
Help define and evolve the Bulletproof visual identity across all channels.
Bring a unique point of view and help elevate the creative bar for the company.
Work cross-functionally to understand business needs and collaborate with stakeholders.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree
5+ years’ experience at an advertising agency, preferably as an Art Director; or in-house creative departments
Experience across channels (online video, digital advertising, social media, e-commerce, etc.)
Able to ideate concepts, but also have the design skills to execute.
Familiar with marketing trends, especially on social media and digital channels.
Excellent presentation skills – both within the department and to stakeholders.
Great attention to detail, excellent art direction and design sensibility.
Think and act both strategically and tactically.
Self-starter that understands how to be proactive.
Experience working at fast-paced organizations in growth mode.
Expert in Adobe Creative Cloud.
After Effects and motion graphics skills a plus.
Must have an online portfolio.

Professional traits that are not unique to this position, but necessary for all Bulletproof employees:
Exhibits excellent judgment
Entrepreneurial problem solver with strong troubleshooting skills
Vocally self-aware and curious
Results oriented
Ability to effectively manage time, multi-task, and prioritize projects to meet established deadlines
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both verbally and written
Has relentlessly high standards
You love learning, and it’s one of the things you do to make yourself better every single day
This is a full-time position that is open to local Seattle-area candidates, as well as remote candidates throughout the West coast; regardless, the position will start in a remote capacity.


Maximum fun, maximum knowledge, and maximum performance are a part of the job description, and you’ll get to work with the team on a regular basis to upgrade your game, your mental performance, and your life. This is a great opportunity to grow with a company.

Think you’ve got what it takes? Let’s talk!

JOB DESCRIPTION:
We are looking for dynamic, and engaging teachers who can teach kids ages 2-6 in a wide variety of subjects spanning STEM, niche topics like “Monster Trucks,” different languages, etc. Responsibilities include developing curriculum for our asynchronous learning, mapping decks and narratives for live online classes, and fostering strong parent-teacher relationships. You will help manage all things learning to provide a fun and creative experience for our students and families.
WHO WE ARE:

We’ve been known to be described as “the perfect blend of virtual education and unplugged learning designed for children ages 2- 6.” Yes, in those words exactly. More than that, we’re a tight-knit team of spunky educators who believe that learning should be dynamic, interactive and inclusive.

BümoBrain supports parents in need of options aside from traditional schools. Our platform is built based on the following principles: creativity, critical thinking and exploration, backed by 350 years of educators’ experience from around the globe. We offer daily age-specific and unplugged activities that are flexible, accessible, and family-friendly.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Teach small, intimate online Zoom classes of 6 students maximum
Work closely with our edteam to design and develop age-specific curriculum
Manage the learning process from start to finish via ideation and execution
Establish strong relationships with students and parents
Have FUN!
REQUIREMENTS
Fluent in BOTH English AND Cantonese
Someone who can roll with the punches, and think on their feet
Preferably has a background in education, teaching credentials, or relevant experience working with kids
Tactful communicator who is tech-savvy & proficient in Zoom, Seesaw, or willing to learn!
Flexible & capable of quick turnaround for tight deadlines
Strong organizational and time management skills
Multitasker who can juggle multiple responsibilities as once
Has the ability to make anything FUN!
Los Angeles, CA preferred but remote ok
BENEFITS
Work directly with in an emerging startup with an accelerated growth pattern
Potential for rapid promotions if results delivered
Directly make an impact as part of our innovative, tight-knit community

ServiceTitan is looking for a senior marketer and product manager to join our Demand Generation team. This position plays a key role as a product owner by leading the management of website strategy and development - including identifying strategic opportunities through the use of data and analytics to grow traffic and build new experiences, to overseeing development, testing, launch and post-launch management with the dedicated engineering team and direct reports.

The best person for this role is forward-thinking, customer-obsessed and understands the needs of every prospect and customer visiting the ServiceTitan.com site. In addition, he or she understands the market space, is a champion for the brand, recommends strategies to continually enhance and optimize digital presence via search and conversion optimization tactics, while collaborating with key stakeholders across Marketing, Customer Support, Operations, Sales, and more. This person is also an effective project manager and can lead a team through all stages of development, ensuring successful deployment and the best user experiences.

You'll know you're doing a great job when you are exceeding your performance goals - from traffic growth and website build, to user experience and feedback metrics, to pipeline and revenue. You'll be customer-obsessed, strategic, analytic and detailed.

As our Manager, Web Marketing, you will:

Own and manage all aspects of website development, including ideation development, testing, launch and post-launch management
Measure, track and optimize ongoing website performance from a traffic and revenue perspective
Maintain and optimize all lead flows originating from the website into systems of record and subsequent transfers to sales
Lead and grow a team of web marketing specialists including CRO lead, UX designers, website engineers and CMS editors
Partner with internal teams across the globe such as Marketing, Creative, Customer Support, and Operations to understand business requirements and build standard or custom solutions based on priority and need
Own the website development roadmap, working with leadership to recommend and prioritize new features or campaigns
Manage the relationship with the internal development and engineering teams
Research, review, recommend and implement new technology solutions to optimize and scale the website martech stack - both front-end, and back-end
Own optimization and testing strategies to improve ServiceTitan.com website performance - both from a traffic and revenue perspective
Oversee an enterprise web analytics implementation, training and tag management via internal and external teams
Manage ServiceTitan's CMS system and deploy scalable strategies to ensure a unified brand experience through CMS user experience, and page template and element design.
Champion the brand by ensuring every piece of content displayed on the ServiceTitan.com represents the company's position and values

To be successful in this role, you'll need:

A sense of intellectual curiosity, and excitement to be part of something big!
A proven track record for increasing conversion rates of a large scale website and delivering results from a CRO program.
Experience managing and working with engineering teams to deliver customer-facing experiences
Deep understanding of web analytics methodology and platforms including Segment, Google Analytics, Amplitude and Google Tag Manager
Understanding of large websites with 1000+ pages utilizing highly customized CMS platforms like Acquia, Adobe Experience Manager, and Contentful CMS (preferred)
Proficient with Marketo or other marketing automation tools
Strong foundation in CRM, including custom data warehouses and Salesforce
Bachelor's degree
Legally eligible to work in the United States
Location preference for this position is in our Glendale California office once we return but remote candidates may be considered based on experience
3+ years experience leading teams of 3 or more people
7+ years experience in digital marketing, product management, or similar roles

Friendbuy is reinventing the oldest marketing channel ever known: word-of-mouth. While technology has completely transformed the commerce landscape, the process of discovering new brands from your friends has largely remained the same since the dawn of retail. By using technology to modernize this natural consumer behavior, Friendbuy has given marketers a powerful new tool to drive customer acquisition and growth.

Friendbuy is the leading platform for referral marketing. Our clients are disruptors such as Dollar Shave Club, Casper, ClassPass, Away and Outdoor Voices, as well as Fortune 100s such as Walmart, Intuit, Disney and Nestle. If you’ve ever referred a friend to any of these amazing brands, you’ve used Friendbuy. We are technology-first and we believe in success through innovation, a core philosophy prioritized by our Founder & CEO who graduated from MIT.

The Opportunity

Friendbuy was recently named by Segment.com as the fastest growing referral platform in the industry, and we’re in the lead to power referral & loyalty for all of e-commerce. We’re looking for an experienced UI/UX Designer with strong visual instincts to join our team and help us dominate the market. Reporting to the UX Lead, you’ll collaborate with our CEO, Head of Customer Success and the Engineering team to craft engaging visual experiences for our enterprise platform. Our ideal candidate is passionate about visual design with an eye for great UX. We strive for simplicity, beauty and usability.

This role is high impact at high velocity. You must be very comfortable with collaboration, iteration and high standards. We believe our next generation UIs can redefine how e-commerce marketers perform their daily functions. Your opportunity is to extend our market lead through innovative user experiences. Compensation is highly competitive and we can offer attractive equity packages to those who are interested.

What You’ll Do

Design user experiences that are intuitive and visually appealing
Collaborate with Customer Success and Product to craft feature definitions
Seek knowledge about client use cases; ask lots of questions
Present designs to your colleagues and iterate based on feedback
Maintain and expand our design system
Conduct usability studies to identify areas for improvement
Build trust through execution
Raise our bar for quality

Requirements

3-5 years of experience in design of digital products that have been released to market
Recent portfolio demonstrating the latest design trends, a thorough design process, strong UI capabilities and high fidelity interactive prototypes
Bachelor’s Degree - Design, Art or related discipline highly preferred
Experience in user research and analysis to inform designs
Basic understanding of front-end development and responsive design
Experience designing in Figma, Invision or Sketch
Ability to move fast & iterate in a high growth startup (including the ability to discard)
B2B SaaS design experience highly valued (but not a deal breaker for the right person)
Ability to solve complex problems
Intrinsic desire to help your colleagues and make your team better

Compensation, Benefits & Perks

Competitive Salary & OTE compensation
Attractive equity packages to those who are interested
Excellent health insurance options, plus dental & vision coverage
Flexible vacation policy
Family leave
Continuing education assistance
Laptop of your preference and 1 or 2 monitors with standing desk
A fun and collaborative work environment

Friendbuy is an equal opportunity employer. We’re looking for smart, creative people of diverse backgrounds and perspectives to join our remote team of innovators. At Friendbuy, individual personalities shine in a culture of collaboration. We believe work-life balance is the way to get stuff done and be happy doing it. We hire exceptional talent and give our people the opportunity to develop and grow. Our bar for hiring is high and we want you to help us raise it even higher.

Now that we are a fully remote company, we stay connected through regular happy hours and fun virtual company events.

Friendbuy uses your applicant information in accordance with CCPA.

JobTitle: Digital Sports Social Media & Audience Development Producer
Text:
The Digital Sports Social Media & Audience Development Producer will package and program content for Bally Sports' new social media accounts launching this Spring. The Producer also will provide strategic and tactical support for social media producers and marketers throughout our 21 regional sports networks across the U.S.
The right person for the role will have creative flair, publishing chops, and a strong understanding of social media monetization and campaigns. We are looking for a great colleague with superior communication and relationship-building skills. The job is remote (from home) with evening and weekend work as dictated by events.
RESPONSIBILITIES:


Bally Sports Digital News audience engagement
Help launch national social channels which don't exist yet: inform our strategy, aspirational voice, and structure
Update channels with engaging content and lead staff on sports' national desk in doing the same
React to breaking news
Drive strategic KPIs
Manage freelancers and partners as needed
Manage accounts by becoming the primary point of contact for social media partners, including Facebook and Twitter
Campaigns
Collaborate with the sports national sales team to ideate on revenue-generating opportunities
Build campaign elements and coordinate execution across national and regional production teams
Manage campaign budgets
Manage audience insights and reporting
Syndication partners including Regional Sports Networks
Be our resident expert in social media content production, audience engagement, listening and reporting tools, Facebook business manager and other account backend platforms â€“ a go-to whom colleagues can count on for help with managing their local accounts and businesses
Surface videos and other local content with national impact for use on sports' national social platforms, and vice versa
Identify and facilitate content sharing for local and national accounts
ATTRIBUTES:
The right person for this role will be:
Deeply knowledgeable and passionate about sports, particularly the NBA, MLB, NHL teams for which Sports broadcasts and streams live games
A self-starter requiring little oversight while maintaining excellent attention to detail and quality control
Willing to work odd hours as dictated by the digital news cycle and sports, including evening and weekends
Collaborative and passionate with a team-first attitude toward building a next-generation sports digital media business
REQUIREMENTS:
Minimum five years of professional experience engaging sports fans on social platforms on behalf of brands
Familiarity with Facebook's Business Manager, Twitter Media Studio, YouTube, and other social media management platforms (established personal relationships a plus)
Bachelor's degree in journalism, communications, or a related field
Demonstrable mastery of social publishing tools and native platforms
Experience with Google Analytics and Sprout preferred
Strong grammar, communication and presentation skills
Ability to work cross-functionally with Sports stakeholders, Regional Sports Networks and partners
Experience in creating visual content using Adobe Suite
Ability to work fast under pressure but not at the expense of accuracy
Writing skills and working knowledge of Associated Press Style a plus

About Us
Make your mark in Broadcasting and Digital Media. Sinclair Broadcast Group and Sinclair Digital Solutions are dedicated to making Sinclair a communications powerhouse! BuzzFeed
BuzzFeed is the world's leading independent digital media and tech company, with a cross-platform news and entertainment network that reaches hundreds of millions of people globally and spreads Joy and Truth across the internet.
Our portfolio of brands are household names that people rely on to inform and entertain, including: BuzzFeed, BuzzFeed News, Tasty, Nifty, Bring Me, Cocoa Butter, Pero Like, Worth It, and Unsolved to name a few! These properties and their Creators reach over 134M people a month through articles, lists, videos, animations, quizzes, podcasts, original series, newsletters and more.

The Role

We are looking for an intern to join our product analytics team this summer. If you want to apply your love of statistics and digital media to product development and business decisions this might be right for you! To qualify, you must be enrolled & returning to school upon completion of the internship. You will most likely be writing SQL during this internship, so please bring knowledge of the main principles and a desire to learn more. Experience with Python or R could also be helpful but is not required. This is a paid internship.

BuzzFeed's data team is diverse, coming from varying backgrounds, experiences, & skill sets. We are true hybrids - software engineers, statisticians, mathematicians, domain experts & analysts - who specialize in translating questions into methodical approaches, experiments, & products. We think deeply about the limitations of data, & communicate our output coherently. Product analytics as part of the data team focuses on using data-driven methods and experiments to power decisions, inform strategy, build robust data products, and identify opportunities for innovation across the company. We make data-informed recommendations to our partners in product, engineering, business, and content to help them understand our web & app products, and how users journey through them.

You Will

Work with a mentor on the product analytics team to identify a project (or set of smaller projects), that will have a real impact on our product strategy. Some possible areas of application may be in user segmentation, predictive modeling, retention analysis and/or experimental design (A/B testing).Learn about BuzzFeed's data summer internship program here!

You Have

You must be legally eligible to work in the US.
You must be graduating in 2021 or later. Please note- you must be enrolled & returning to school upon completion of the internship.
You will be paid fairly, in line with tech industry standards.
This will be a completely remote position. Approved remote work locations include the following states - California, Colorado, Connecticut, D.C, Delaware, Georgia, Illinois, Kentucky, Maine, Michigan, Minnesota, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Texas, Washington.

To Apply

Please submit an article that you have written (blog, project report, etc.) or a piece of code that you've used to analyze data (code snippet or GitHub repo).
Please also submit a short description of projects that you might imagine doing as an intern at BuzzFeed.

All job applications must be received through the official BuzzFeed Jobs board (https://www.buzzfeed.com/about/jobs), including referrals. It is BuzzFeed's practice to not schedule job interviews until after an application is submitted through our jobs board.

Life at BuzzFeed

At BuzzFeed, we believe our work benefits from the diverse perspectives of our employees. As such, BuzzFeed celebrates inclusion and is committed to equal opportunity employment. At BuzzFeed, you can expect:

A supportive, inclusive atmosphere on a team that values your contributions
Opportunities for personal and professional growth via work experience, offerings from our in-house Learning @ BuzzFeed team, our Employee Resource Groups, and more.

BuzzFeed is the world's leading tech-powered media company, with a cross-platform news and entertainment network that reaches hundreds of millions of people globally. The company aims to spread truth and joy across the internet by producing articles, lists, quizzes, videos, original series; lifestyle content through brands including Tasty, the world's largest social food network; original reporting and investigative journalism through BuzzFeed News; strategic partnerships, licensing and product development through BuzzFeed Marketing; and original productions across broadcast, cable, SVOD, film and digital platforms for BuzzFeed Studios.

BuzzFeed is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on age, race, gender, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability or any other protected category.

JobTitle: Client Marketing & Deployment Strategist - Mixed Reality
Text:
SUMMARY

This role is a unique opportunity to help define and grow Trigger’s capacity to help our clients achieve the biggest possible impact with the XR solutions that Trigger creates for them. Our clients often look to us for help optimizing traditional and emerging marketing and media channels to effectively deploy their XR campaigns & solutions. You’ll help define the implementation strategy and service offering to deliver an innovative, industry-leading approach to support and amplify these client marketing and deployment efforts.

You’ll be an ideal candidate if you have extensive experience with multiple media channels and are comfortable crafting customized client marketing and deployment plans for software-oriented product launches. Your ability to communicate with and shepherd our client’s teams (internal, PR, media, and other agencies) will be a crucial component of servicing these clients. You’ll have demonstrated high-level strategic thinking that has been applied to data-proven, on-the-ground tactics that leverage your expertise and industry relationships. There will be ample opportunity for you to innovate as you leverage our strategic partners to shape creative approaches that make the most of new technologies, ad platforms and trends.

This role will begin in a consultant capacity with a goal of transitioning into a full-time position. Remote US and Canadian candidates will be considered.

RESPONSIBILITIES


Define, plan and document an XR Client Marketing & Deployment service offering and how it will roll out externally for Trigger’s clients, as well as an internal implementation strategy
Partner with Trigger account teams, their clients and internal project teams to develop XR marketing & deployment plans across multiple projects simultaneously
Recommend industry channels that will capitalize on reach for client campaigns; Measure reach to optimize and capture learnings
Collaborate internally across Trigger’s departments throughout the client campaign cycles to create, enhance and guide campaign deployment strategies that will amplify reach and impact
Identify key insights and themes from existing social and app data, competitive analysis and knowledge of brand marketing to guide future deployment strategies and offerings
Research industry XR deployment trends, perform market and competitor research and compile this research in support of project-specific and company-wide deployment goals

REQUIREMENTS


Consultative media planning and ad buying experience for social, mobile and web on the agency side
Deep understanding of target audiences for product marketing, how brands spend across various platforms and which methods prove most effective for software-oriented product launches
Ability to tell a story with data to emphasize the importance of a strong marketing and deployment strategy for our client’s XR solutions, plus the creation of compelling client-facing presentations that relay that data
Proven track record of deploying successful marketing and media campaigns that fulfill key client needs
Experience with augmented reality, mixed reality and/or virtual reality is a plus
Strong writing and presentation skills
Strategic and analytical mind but willing to “get hands dirty”
Creative, motivated, self-starter with strong organization, time management and prioritization skills
Experience with a DSP (or ad buying platform), Google Suite (with strong understanding of Slides, Sheets, Docs), PowerPoint and Keynote

ABOUT US

Trigger is a full-service agency that creates innovative and impactful XR solutions for the world’s top brands, employing emerging AR and VR technology that push the boundaries of what is possible in XR across entertainment, sports, e-commerce and enterprise. As a leader in the industry, our team combines R&D with world-class creative & technical execution - providing prototyping, concepting, design, asset creation, development and performance measurement. Our team - HQ’d in West Los Angeles - has delivered over 200 XR projects and counting.



OUR VALUES & CULTURE

At Trigger, we care deeply about maintaining a positive culture, as emphasized in our Core Values:


Foster innovation and embrace change
Take action and work hard
Strive for excellence
Value individuals
Work better together
Commit to integrity
Enjoy the work
Be kind, be considerate, do good


We also have some fun perks:


Variety of Medical insurance plan options (including fully covered plans for you and your family if based in CA)
Fully covered Dental, Vision, and Life insurance for you and your family
Generous PTO plan that includes Vacation, Sick, Company-Wide Holidays, Floating Holidays, and Civic Engagement time off, with additional flexibility during the holiday season
Monthly gym, yoga, or fitness membership reimbursement
Paid parental leave for all new parents (including adoption and foster placements)
401(k) retirement plan through John Hancock
Remote-friendly culture with frequent virtual events like Jackbox Happy Hours and our ongoing Dungeons & Dragons campaign


OUR DIVERSITY & INCLUSION COMMITMENT

At Trigger, we know that justice, diversity, equity, and inclusion add a real and measurable value to our culture, our employees, and our work. We are committed to taking action that will create diverse representation at all levels of our organization and ensuring that Trigger is a safe, equitable, and supportive environment for all marginalized groups. We believe in the power of innovation and commit to embracing forward-thinking changes so we may become DE&I leaders and take action well ahead of what might be considered "the norm."

We highly encourage women, POC, and LGBTQIA+ candidates to consider themselves for our open roles. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.

HIPGive U.S. Partnerships Location:  Oakland, CA or Remote ( Arizona, California, New York, Chicago, Miami, or Washington, D.C., preferred)Reports to: Senior Program Manager, HIPGiveArea:  HIPGive ProgramPosition Type: 100% FTEOrganization OverviewHispanics in Philanthropy (HIP) is a 501c3 non-profit organization working with a transnational network of grantmakers committed to strengthening Latino communities across the Americas. HIP connects and convenes funders, nonprofits, researchers, and other leaders to identify emerging needs among Latinos as well as best practices for responsive and effective funding of social change. HIP pioneers new philanthropic models by leading collaborative initiatives and has provided grants and training to help build the capacity of more than 600 organizations and leaders.In 2014, HIP created HIPGive; the only bilingual crowdfunding platform serving Latino nonprofits in the U.S. and the Americas. Through HIPGive, organizations raise funds, gain unmatched visibility, and get access to customized resources and tools for effective crowdfunding. In recent years, HIPGive has been expanding beyond crowdfunding to provide different technology platforms and capacity building for Latinx serving nonprofits.Position SummaryThis is a U.S.-based position that will report directly to the HIPGive Senior Program Manager and be a part of the HIPGive team that is based in Mexico City. The HIPGive U.S. Partnerships Associate will play a key role in promoting the work of HIPGive across the U.S. with nonprofits, foundations, local businesses, and the corporate sector, and representing HIPGive at different events, creating meaningful and long lasting partnerships to expand the reach and increase the impact of HIPGive.The ideal candidate is proactive, creative, results-driven, flexible and a positive team player who is passionate about HIP’s mission and is able to design creative solutions to work with different types of nonprofits across the Americas.Core ResponsibilitiesCo-design the marketing communications strategy of HIPGive in the U.S. to allow HIP to expand its reach and involve more agents of change as well as public and private actors;Support the branding strategy of HIPGive in the U.S. to raise brand awareness about the platform;Co-plan and implement campaigns about the differentiators and benefits of the HIPGive platform, including the available support services, to increase the use of the platform by both foundations and donors;Collect user success stories;Identify new spaces to promote the work of HIPGive and as well to provide training opportunities for different nonprofits to develop their skills;Develop and cultivate alliances with key HIPGive partners in the U.S.;Create a partnership plan to outreach and engage with foundations, nonprofits and the corporate sector to identify potential crowdsourcing campaigns and funding opportunities, trainings, or specific projects;Research new potential relationships that should be developed and establish effective partnerships with new key corporate partners, nonprofits, foundations, Latinx professional associations, and universities for the different features of HIPGive;Effectively communicate to partners about HIP and HIPGive goals and successes;Serve as key liaison with local committees of funding partners;Innovate and explore opportunities and offer new ideas and approaches to expand HIPGive in the United States by building relationships with prospective corporate partners and employee, nonprofit networks;Track U.S. based partnership and U.S. based fundraising from corporate partners; andTrack nonprofits user metrics and design surveys to determine satisfaction.Qualifications*Two or more years of experience in building partnerships and alliances, or business development;Passion for social impact initiatives;Experience with Salesforce, or other donor databases and CRMs;Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both English and Spanish;Proven track record of successful relationship building with diverse stakeholders;Ability to work remotely with virtual teams across the U.S. and in Mexico City;Ability to remain focused and detailed oriented under pressure, juggle multiple tasks and consistently meet deadlines;Work as part of a team, while maintaining the big picture;Ability to be self-directed and work independently in a multicultural context;Ability to develop fresh approaches and innovate as appropriate;Storytelling skills;Client management experience;Ability to prioritize and provide quick response;Ability to travel as needed; andExperience working in the nonprofit sector is preferred.**Physical Demands and Work Environment*Daily use of computer and phone for regular communications with staff and team members. This position may be a remote position or based out of the Oakland office. Some travel will be required.BenefitsHispanics in Philanthropy offers a range of benefits for full time employees including medical, dental, vision, 401K matching, commuter check benefits, discounts on services, as well as sick, vacation, and paid holiday time.How to ApplySubmit an application (https://forms.gle/SN8F3tTbSWjP2UkZ6) to be considered for this position. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis with preference to applications received by February 26th. Required materials include a cover letter (English or Spanish) and a resume. Incomplete applications will not be considered. Three references will be requested of those continuing through the interview process.Hispanics in Philanthropy is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.Application Deadline: 2/26/2021Job Type: Full-timeWork Remotely:Yes

Location: Cincinnati, OH or Remote (within United States)
About Integral Analytics: Integral Analytics (IA) software harnesses data science to change how energy utilities build and manage an increasingly digital renewable electric grid. We offer talented individuals the opportunity to lead this change through contributing to our mission to tackle highly complex problems and solve them through scalable software. Join our team!
Job: As the Director of Sales and Marketing, you will primarily develop relationships with potential and existing clients to try to sell them IA’s software products and answer their questions. You will work with leadership to develop a sales strategy and make weekly calls to potential clients. You will develop and maintain a CRM. Additionally, as time and skill allow, you will either work on marketing tasks or manage the delegation of marketing tasks to subcontractors (e.g., Social Media strategy, content development, conference planning, etc.).
Required Skills/Experience:
A Bachelor's Degree
Outgoing – enjoys developing relationships with clients and making phone calls
Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills
Experience with Microsoft Office (Word, Teams, Excel, Powerpoint, etc.)
Self-directed “doer” – sees what needs to be done and does it with little guidance
Flexible – doesn’t mind working on a small team and doing “a little bit of everything”
Preferred Skills/Experience:
Experience developing and using a CRM
Experience in the energy/utility sector
Knowledge of Distribution Power System Basics for Planning and Analysis
Use of Kanban boards and familiarity with other project management techniques
Website and/or video experience
Conference planning
Hiring Process: Selected candidates will initially participate in a brief phone screen. Qualified candidates will be invited to an in-depth interview (currently virtual) to discuss their background along with pertinent job/company details and the chance to meet with the IA team.
Benefits
Competitive salary
Competitive health care, dental, and vision coverage
Unlimited PTO
Excellent 401(k)
Flexible spending plans
Life, short term and long term disability, supplemental, and AD&D insurance
Flexible, collegial, informal work environment
Collaboration with leading innovators in the electric grid technology space
