Phillip Jeffries is looking for an Outside Sales Representative in the North Los Angeles market!

We are currently accepting resumes for an Outside Sales Representative to call on the Residential Interior Designer community in the North Los Angeles market. The ideal candidate must be self-motivated and have a broad base of existing relationships with key influencers within the industry. This position will report directly to the Regional Sales Manager.

What you will be doing:

Be a PJ ambassador and GROW Residential business in the territory of North Los Angeles (includes West Hollywood, the Valley, East Side, Downtown & Santa Barbara).
Exceed weekly/monthly HPA and sales goals.
Manage sales through existing Phillip Jeffries clients.
Increase clientele base by actively seeking out new business.
Create and close sales; follow up on all client and project leads and turn quotes into orders.
Interact with NJ support staff in determining territory needs and to keep a pulse on the order pipeline.
Schedule product presentations for both new collections as well as existing product.
Provide sample and book tools to clients.
Update and maintain PJ presence in client libraries'.
Create weekly call reports.
Generate monthly synopsis of territory
Provide account updates for direct marketing programs.
Be a CRM expert; communicate client reaction and needs, and keep account information up to date.
Utilize social media to create leads and grow relationships with clients.
Get involved in industry events, specifically networking opportunities within architectural/interior design community.
Represent and sell Phillip Jeffries at local industry trade events and possibly regional trade shows.


Must have:


Candidate must live within a 5 mile radius of West Hollywood, California territory
Must have 4+ years Sales and/or Interior Design experience
BA degree preferred

Upbeat, energetic, can-do attitude
Ability to work from a home office
Reliable transportation with space for sales material
Social Media savvy
Leadership
Team player
Organization
Strong analytical skills
Excellent customer service
Track record for providing fast response times
Customer-centric mentality
Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal
Proficient in MS Office
Ability to travel outside of territory (tradeshows, events at headquarters, etc.)
Well versed with ERP/CRM systems


Why Phillip Jeffries?

As a purpose-driven organization, we truly believe that where you work matters. We are committed to creating an organization with a higher purpose, a place where our talented team can truly flourish. Phillip Jeffries believes in creating an environment with opportunities to grow personally and financially, offering volunteer opportunities that support our community and environment as well as extending a rich benefits package to care for our most valuable assets, our team.

Benefits:


Competitive salary
Commission/Bonus program
Paid time off (PTO)
Paid holidays

Medical, dental and vision benefits
Tax advantages through Flexible Spending Accounts that allow you to pay for specific healthcare and dependent care expenses with pre-tax dollars
Financial protection through Accident, Short Term Disability, Hospital and Cancer Insurance
Identity theft protection
Retirement Plan in which company automatically contributes approximately 10% of your annual compensation


Perks:


Unique culture that includes an annual Spirit Week with a focus on our core values, team building and having fun!
Frequent team building activities
Paid time off for community service with the ability to take (3) paid days off per year to volunteer during a work day and (3) days per year on a weekend earning you an additional (3) days of comp time


Phillip Jeffries, the world’s leader in natural, textured and specialty wallcoverings, has been providing award winning designs to the architectural and interior design community for over 40 years. With a diverse collection of product, Phillip Jeffries has provided luxury goods that grace the walls of properties such as the Wynn Hotel in Las Vegas and the Barney’s New York stores as well as luxurious homes throughout the world.

To learn more about Phillip Jeffries, please visit us at www.phillipjeffries.com.

Acker Merrall & Condit, America’s oldest wine merchant and the global leader in fine and rare wine auctions is looking for highly motivated team players with an entrepreneurial spirit and a strong desire to achieve. Successful candidates have a strong, proven track record in fine and rare wine sales, and will take company directives and immediately put them into action.


We are looking for candidates specifically on the West Coast, Mid-West, and Texas. This is a 100% Remote position.


Job Description:


Account Managers for Acker Merrall & Condit are responsible for establishing, maintaining, and cultivating new relationships with prospective and existing consignors within a sales territory. Account Managers will be given goals and targets for their territory in advance of each quarter. Industry experience with a sharp focus on sales are essential. A solid background and understanding of wine, the wine auction market, and the logistical implications of moving wine will help Account Managers hit the ground running.


The ideal candidate will:


Have the ability to build and maintain quality relationships with clients
Have previous, proven, and strong sales experience with at least 3-5 years in fine/rare wine
Create and follow sales leads
Organize and host special wine related events within territory
Be willing and able to organize, inventory and pack up wine cellars
Be the point person for logistical planners and consignors alike
Have entrepreneurial experience
Possess an understanding and working knowledge of the wine auction market
Be able to work independently and take ownership of assigned duties and meet deadlines while managing multiple priorities as directed by management
Be computer literate with the ability to read and manipulate spreadsheets and other office documents
Be comfortable utilizing CRM software and reporting as needed
Be able to lift 40lbs cases of wine as needed
Be 21 years of age or older with a valid driver’s license
Be willing and able to travel as needed, often on short notice

Our Company
ProSites provides digital marketing technology and services to community-based professionals in verticals such as the dental, medical, accounting and veterinary industries. Across the ProSites, CPA Site Solutions, and PracticeMojo brands, we make it easy for these small businesses to maintain a web presence, attract new customers through digital marketing channels, and communicate with existing customers across the web, texting, chat, and email.
Working at ProSites
The people at ProSites are passionate about their work and are driven by innovation. Each and every day we strive for excellence. Our work environment is equal parts casual and professional. We’re serious about our business and delivering the best service to our members, but we also make it a priority to keep things fun and exciting. Join the ProSites team, where innovation is the goal, hard work is expected, and creativity is rewarded.
Position Summary
We are building a world class marketing team and are looking for a manager to own the development and execution of demand generation and campaign programs. You will drive awareness and demand for at least one vertical of the company’s products and services. You will directly impact the company’s revenue goals through online and offline campaigns. You will work closely with our sales leaders, corporate marketing, marketing operations, and product teams in the development of the company’s customer acquisition, upsell/cross-sell, and retention strategies.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Develop, execute, and analyze demand generation campaigns and promotions across a wide spectrum of acquisition and upsell channels to deliver revenue at or above monthly targets
Research and implement recommendations for direct response marketing programs and channels including, but not limited to: email campaigns, webinars, and online events
Deliver detailed reporting and analytics that show how marketing programs impact revenue on a channel by channel basis; define and track key metrics, deliver ad-hoc analyses as needed
Drive A/B testing and optimization into all aspects of our marketing
Support the development of content required for campaign deliverables (white papers, success stories, Web pages, etc.) through internal and/or agency resources
Work with sales to track and manage lead flow and increase conversion rates at each stage of marketing and sales engagement
Stay on the cutting edge of marketing best practices by gathering and filtering new ideas from customers, colleagues and other experts; communicate and share best practices
Position Requirements:
3+ years in digital campaign marketing and demand generation with ownership of multiple channels and strategies, along with hands-on experience optimizing websites for conversion of inbound traffic
B2B campaign management and execution experience required

As a Regional Account Manager, you manage the sales process for new business opportunities within the hospital and EMS healthcare market to meet sales goals within a defined territory. You’ll engage in networking and lead generation activities to grow new business sales pipeline in the hospital and EMS space.

Reporting to the Director of Sales you will be part of our Sales team. This is a remote opportunity and will manage the West territory.

What You’ll Be Doing - the day to day
Manage a sales pipeline for a region of the United States.Conduct market and competitive research to develop sales strategies tailored to the prospective hospital or agency.Build and maintain relationships with key client decision makers and industry partners through consistent engagement and onsite meetings; and educate prospective clients, agencies and partners on ESO products through meetings, sales presentations and engagement of subject matter experts.Develop and progress sales proposals that address the specific needs of the client.Accurately forecast sales opportunities.Lead and support contract negotiations; and manage pipeline and forecast in order to drive sales opportunities to closure against a sales quota.Work closely with stakeholders from both EMS and Hospital sectors.

Who You Are - the essentials
Bachelor’s Degree in Business or Health Care or related field, or equivalent, relevant work experienceAbility to meet and exceed quotasA team enterprise sale mentalityThe want and ability to work at a fast growing company that adapts quicklyAbility to travel up to 85%, as needed including to ESO headquarters in Austin, Texas
Benefits & Perks

ESO offers a comprehensive suite of benefits to promote health and financial security for our employees and their families. For full-time employment you this includes:
 Competitive health plans (medical, dental, & vision insurance) PTO (starting at 20 days) & 12 company holidays 401(k) with company match Telemedicine service provided by ESO Savings accounts (FSA, HSA, DCA) Employee Assistance Program (EAP) Annual health and wellness reimbursement Peace of mind benefits such as life insurance, disability insurance, and worksite benefits Paid parental leave, new child program, & flexible parental return-to-work options Casual office environments and unlimited office snacks and drinks

About ESO

ESO is a fast-paced, growing data, technology, and research company passionate about improving community health and safety through the power of data. We pioneer innovative, user-friendly software to meet the changing needs of today’s EMS agencies, fire departments, and hospitals. We’re small enough to be nimble and fun, but big enough to be a great place to work. We serve thousands of customers out of our six US offices and our Belfast, Northern Ireland office.

Are you ready to Make a Difference? At ESO, we believe in bringing your true self to work every single day. If you don’t match all the qualifications on the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway! We are looking for passionate, innovative, and authentic people to help drive our mission.

All offers are contingent upon a successful background check.
ESO is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We invite you to consider opportunities at ESO regardless of your gender; gender identity; gender reassignment; age; religion; race; national origin; political affiliation; sexual orientation; disability; veteran status; or other non-merit factor.

Travel to provide temporary support at multiple customer facilities during scheduled and unscheduled PTO, leave of absence, site training and open positions; in some cases for extended periods of time.

Fork truck

Identify and report quality or compliance concerns to management and the quality function and take immediate actions to remedy.
Complete all planned or unplanned quality & compliance training requirements within defined deadlines

Handle all site operations and duties for optimal outcomes to maintain highest standards of excellence
Operate across a wide variety of services including training and assessment responsibilities with a high level of success

Promote personal growth and development by staying abreast of new policies, procedures and system enhancements without the presence of site trainer and management team

Attend customer required training sessions
Participate in projects and perform all other duties as assigned
Proficient in Microsoft office suite
Strong time management and organizational skills
Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
Possess valid driver’s license and good driving record
Ability to work beyond the normal business hours
Ability to travel extensively 25 - 50% of time.

BuzzFeed

BuzzFeed is the world's leading independent digital media and tech company, with a cross-platform news and entertainment network that reaches hundreds of millions of people globally and spreads Joy and Truth across the internet.
Our portfolio of brands are household names that people rely on to inform and entertain, including: BuzzFeed, BuzzFeed News, Tasty, Nifty, Bring Me, Cocoa Butter, Pero Like, Worth It, and Unsolved to name a few! These properties and their Creators reach over 134M people a month through articles, lists, videos, animations, quizzes, podcasts, original series, newsletters and more.

The Role

BuzzFeed is looking for interns to join our content analytics team this summer. If you want to apply your love of statistics and media to creative and business decisions this might be right for you! To qualify, you must be enrolled & returning to school upon completion of the internship. Tools we often use include SQL and Python/R, it is not a requirement that you have experience with these tools but we hope that you are excited about learning and applying them as you work through the internship. This is a paid internship.

BuzzFeeds data team is diverse, coming from varying backgrounds, experiences, & skill sets. We are true hybrids - software engineers, statisticians, mathematicians, domain experts & analysts - who specialize in translating questions into methodical approaches, experiments, & products. The team uses data-driven methods to power decisions, inform strategy, build robust data products, & identify opportunities for innovation across the company. We think deeply about the limitations of data, & communicate our output coherently. Content analytics as part of the data team focuses on applied questions relating to the strategy and optimization of all of our content from articles to video.

You Will

Work with a mentor on the content analytics team to identify a project (or set of smaller projects), that will have a real impact on our content strategy. Some possible areas of application may be in content categorization, opportunity analysis, content performance analytics and/or building visualizations for content creators to better understand performance.

You Have

You must be legally eligible to work in the US.
You must be graduating in 2021 or later.

This will be a completely remote position, approved remote work locations include the following states - California, Colorado, Connecticut, D.C, Delaware, Georgia, Illinois, Kentucky, Maine, Michigan, Minnesota, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Texas, Washington.

All job applications must be received through the official BuzzFeed Jobs board (https://www.buzzfeed.com/about/jobs), including referrals. It is BuzzFeed's practice to not schedule job interviews until after an application is submitted through our jobs board.

Life at BuzzFeed

At BuzzFeed, we believe our work benefits from the diverse perspectives of our employees. As such, BuzzFeed celebrates inclusion and is committed to equal opportunity employment. At BuzzFeed, you can expect:

A supportive, inclusive atmosphere on a team that values your contributions
Opportunities for personal and professional growth via work experience, offerings from our in-house Learning @ BuzzFeed team, our Employee Resource Groups, and more
An attractive and equitable compensation package
Plenty of snacks (healthy and indulgent), catered lunches, beverages, etc..

BuzzFeed is the world's leading tech-powered media company, with a cross-platform news and entertainment network that reaches hundreds of millions of people globally. The company aims to spread truth and joy across the internet by producing articles, lists, quizzes, videos, original series; lifestyle content through brands including Tasty, the world's largest social food network; original reporting and investigative journalism through BuzzFeed News; strategic partnerships, licensing and product development through BuzzFeed Marketing; and original productions across broadcast, cable, SVOD, film and digital platforms for BuzzFeed Studios.

BuzzFeed is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on age, race, gender, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability or any other protected category.

About TOP Agency
https://topagency.com/
TOP is an integrated agency network providing powerful and full-service solutions for the world. We spread ideas and we help to grow brands. We’re proudly independent and composed of subject matter experts and award-winning thinkers, designers, content creators, digital storytellers and developers. We've become the world's fastest-growing PR, social, and digital agency because of our unique story-based and data-driven approach.

If you want the feel of a fast-growing startup with the variety of client work that comes from a top agency, then you've come to the right place.

Internship Description:

Marketing plays a critical role at Discovery around the world. On the network side, our marketing teams work diligently to create a strong brand presence and drive new and current viewers to tune into our programming. Our corporate functions use marketing to create interest in products and programs we provide at Discovery.


As a Marketing Intern, your adventure could lead you to work on projects and tasks such as:
Assisting the marketing strategy and creative teams on the day-to-day creation consumer marketing campaigns.Help with the ideating, defining, managing and executing deliverables.Interfacing with various departments across the company to ensure effective communication.Creating presentations for senior management using Keynote.Gain an inside look at what it takes to create a marketing campaign from start to finish.Execute duties such as meeting set up, shipping, premium ordering, events etc.

Although our summer internship program will be completely remote (students can apply from anywhere), please be aware that this intern will report into a Los Angeles based manager and therefore should expect to work on pacific standard time.
Requirements:
Must be currently enrolled as a student (proof of enrollment will be required if selected for an internship)Must be a rising Junior, Senior, or Graduate studentMust have at least a 3.0 GPAMust have the legal right to work in the United States.
More About the Intern Program:

Discovery’s internationally recognized intern program attracts the country’s boldest and brightest students for a paid, for-credit, real-world work experience in the entertainment and media industry.

Like other Fortune 500 companies, we believe in immersing our students in all aspects of our business, giving them first hand experience working for the global leader in real life entertainment. So what sets us apart? We’re passionate about investing in our interns- both personally and professionally. Whether our program is in-person or remote, every semester is packed with speaker sessions with executives, LinkedIn profile reviews, recruiter panels, roundtable events and professional seminars- and that just scratches the surface.

Think our program sounds pretty awesome? Our former interns thought so too! This year, we were voted into Vault’s 2021 internship rankings for best overall internships, best media and telecom internships, best sales and marketing internships and best internships for diversity.

Ready to learn more? Here’s what we offer:
Mentorship from some of the industry’s kindest and most passionate entertainment veterans
Professional development seminars, panels with recruiters and former interns, intern-exclusive events, and so much more
Access to top level executives and employees through our Speaker Series and Roundtables
Incredible networking opportunities and a robust intern alumni network
A creative, collaborative and inclusive company culture

What you can expect to take away from the semester:
Opportunity to develop professionally and uncover skills you didn’t know you had
The insider scoop on the TV industry and what happens behind the scenes
Relationships that will go beyond your collegiate career
Real life experiences that will provide you with the confidence to delve into your next adventure
And finally, what to know before applying:
We offer 12 week spring and summer opportunities
Our Summer 2021 program will be fully remote- the program will run from June 2-August 20.
The application deadline for Summer 2021 is March 19th. After this date, we cannot guarantee your application will be reviewed for the position.
Our internships are paid opportunities. Credit is not required; however, we will provide necessary documentation for school credit if desired.
We do not require a cover letter- please do not submit one. Instead, demonstrate your passion for the position through your resume and interviews.
Interviewing will take place from February through mid-April. A Discovery Intern team member will contact you if your experiences and interests match an open internship position. Due to the high volume of applications, we are unable to give individual status updates.

Publish Date: Jan 21, 2021

Location:
Los Angeles, CA, US

Company: Atos

Atos SE (Societas Europaea) is a leader in digital services with pro forma annual revenue of circa € 12 billion and circa 100,000 employees in 72 countries. Serving a global client base, the Group provides Consulting & Systems Integration services, Managed Services & BPO, Cloud operations, Big Data & Cyber-security solutions, as well as transactional services through Worldline, the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. With its deep technology expertise and industry knowledge, the Group works with clients across different business sectors: Defense, Financial Services, Health, Manufacturing, Media, Utilities, Public sector, Retail, Telecommunications, and Transportation.

Atos is focused on business technology that powers progress and helps organizations to create their firm of the future. The Group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and is listed on the Euronext Paris market. Atos operates under the brands Atos, Atos Consulting, Atos Worldgrid, Bull, Canopy, Unify and Worldline.

Title: Business Consultant (WSA)
Location: Remote, US

About Workfront

Workfront, an Adobe company, is the leader in enterprise work management. Together, Adobe and Workfront provide companies a single system to support planning, collaboration, and governance to unlock organizational productivity and create exceptional experiences. Workfront helps people do their best work so companies can thrive in a digital world. Workfront is built for people, effortlessly connecting teams and easily integrating into existing applications and systems. The ability to see, measure, and analyze critical factors such as resources, outcomes, and priorities keeps everyone on the same page, with a clear understanding of why their work matters.

The Professional Services group within the Customer Experience division of Workfront, an Adobe company, is responsible for providing superior implementation, optimization, and Workfront administration services to ensure Workfront platform adoption and customer success.


Role Purpose

The Consultant is responsible for leading the implementation (or optimization) of a customer's Workfront instance. The right candidate will be capable of leading discover, design, configure and launch sessions to produce elegant solutions based on customer requirements. This role requires certification in the Workfront product (that we provide) with an intermediate knowledge of Workfront including an understanding of object relationships, design and configuration leading practices, as well as business process engineering.

The Consultant should have a firm understanding of general and advanced business practices including the ability to identify gaps and issues in processes and systems. Experience with reporting structures, project management, approval workflows, and other typical business functions is required for success. A Consultant must be able to review customer needs and provide solutions by leveraging leading practices. They serve as the subject matter expert to the customer.

The Consultant should be proficient in analyzing and interpreting data sets, assessing needs and determining action. They will be able to make recommendations for solving common organizational pain points, strategize on company vision and guide customers in the appropriate direction. They should be able to accomplish these tasks while staying within the contracted scope of the project. The Consultant will readily identify opportunities for growth and expansion to facilitate the sale of additional packages and services.

The Consultant must maintain high levels of professionalism including demonstration of strong written and verbal communication skills. A strong presence with skills in leading conversations at all levels of an organization and managing multiple personalities is required.

As always, a phenomenal customer experience, through a fierce commitment to customer success, is our most important goal.

What You Will Do:

Work directly with the customer to understand and document their needs and deliver a prescriptive solution to meet those needs.
Lead discovery, design, configuration, and launch of a customer's Workfront instance, following a proven methodology and approach, to successfully enable customer to achieve their unique business objectives using Workfront
Review and analyze complex requirements, respond and satisfy gaps, identify risks & issues, and develop solutions accordingly
Work with other members of the team to deliver solutions within agreed upon timeline
Increase adoption of Workfront to solve problems not yet identified by the client, ultimately increasing the business value and return on Workfront investment
Develop project plans, design documents, roadmaps, templates, layouts, queues, custom forms, reports and other project artifacts that align with the defined requirements and plan created during the implementation cycle.
As a client billable resource, deliver high-quality consulting services, including customer training, to ensure our client's Workfront implementation/optimization and go-live success.
Serve as a workflow/process configuration mentor, coach, knowledge resource, and escalation point for client
Identify opportunities for growth and continuous improvement within your team and the larger Professional Services organization
Perform other duties as assigned

Desired Competencies and Experience:

Bachelor's Degree (or equivalent experience) and proven business process consulting experience
Previous experience (at least 4 years) in a customer-facing consultative role, implementing or delivering solutions or customer-facing projects
Exceptional time-management skills
High Technical Aptitude and hunger to learn
Excellent communication, interpersonal, problem solving and relationship skills
Excellent analytical skills
Ability to work on multiple tasks and able to prioritize personal workload
Willing to travel 50% to 75%
Bonus skills (nice to have but not required) include experience as a Workfront System Administrator, Workfront Certification (or ability to become certified upon hiring), understanding of workflow processes and work management methodologies, experience with SaaS platform administration (with emphasis on data hygiene, reporting, user access/visibility, project management, project templates, custom form creation), process improvement and change management.

Values Fit

To us, company values are more than just words on a wall; they best describe who we are and how we get our work done.

Genuine: We are sincere, trustworthy, and reliable.
Exceptional: We're committed to creating exceptional experiences that delight our employees and customers.
Innovative: We're highly creative and always striving to connect new ideas with business realities.
Involved: We're inclusive, open, and actively engaged with our customers, partners, employees, and the communities we serve.


At Workfront, an Adobe company, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized around the world. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you're looking to make an impact, we're the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog.

Company Description

Seed&Spark is a platform that helps build sustainable careers for diverse creators and amplifies the cultural impact of the work that they make. For most of the past decade, Seed&Spark has cultivated equity and inclusion in entertainment, building an unprecedented pipeline of stories from unique perspectives told by people around the world. Leveraging our exceptional content library, we've created a first-of-its-kind inclusive workplace culture program built around film.
We have a passionate team of smart, creative and purpose-driven experts working hard to change the entertainment industry for the better.

Job Description

About the Role
We’re looking for a passionate, mission-driven Head of Product to own the product strategy and implementation across our organization. This role is responsible for overseeing the innovation and growth of Seed&Spark’s products and all associated day-to-day product-related activities, ensuring that these products meet the needs of our business, our customers and our mission. This role also oversees the engineering team, working hand-in-hand with the engineering lead to ensure resources are properly aligned with priorities.
There is a high degree of cross-functional collaboration needed across the Seed&Spark team as this role listens, learns and shares product insights.
About YOU
You love to understand how products work, how customers engage with them and how you can improve them to align with purpose, customer need and business objectives. As someone who has worked on products big and small, you carry both micro and macro capabilities - extremely organized with attention to detail who can also zoom out and understand the big picture at 30,000 ft. You figure out the right questions to ask to figure out the best solutions.
You are a senior product leader who loves to roll up their sleeves, tackling challenges big and small. A big thinker who is also a team player and can jump in and help out wherever and whenever needed. You believe in asking questions and listening intently, while also being decisive and vocal. Technology excites you, especially when thinking about the ways it can solve the most difficult problems, such as social challenges, and want your work to make a positive impact on hearts and minds. You are excited to grow a product, and to grow your career along side with it!
Here’s what you’ll do in your role:
Own, drive, and execute the Seed&Spark product strategy and roadmap, based on company business objectives (financial and mission-driven), on-going market and customer analysis, forecasting, and resource constraints.
Define product department goals with clearly measurable KPIs
Work closely with the engineering lead to align on quarterly engineering goals and resource needs
Lead and supervise product and engineering team members through the product development lifecycle end-to-end.
Work cross-functionally to ideate and execute platform solutions
Serve as the primary product owner for our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI) products
Create and maintain clear product requirements and documentation
Manage product interaction planning and prioritization
Manage product and technology COGS and OPEX costs
Serve as the hiring manager for open product department positions, as needed
Communicate regularly with stakeholders, the executive team, and the rest of company on product strategy and plans

Qualifications

Preferred skills and experience:
At least 5 years of digital product management experience under your belt, including at least 3 years in SaaS
Strong track record in launching and growing new products. Experience working in a category creator a plus.
People management/leadership experience a must. Managing and supporting remote employees a plus.
Experience driving complex technology projects
Experience with software engineering practices
Adept at communicating with highly-technical engineering teams
Strong analytical and strategic skills
Proven project management success
Excellent communication skills
High emotional IQ
Digital video or content product experience preferred
Additional Information

Worried that you don’t have all the exact preferred experience listed here but really interested in this role? Don’t let that stop you from applying! We know that great talent can come from unexpected places so, in your cover letter, let us know why you’re a great candidate, why you’re excited for this role and how you would excel.
This position may work remotely within the U.S.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Mission and Overview

Focusing on out-bound development and sales, the Account Manager will research, identify, and qualify potential leads, manage select client relationships, draft proposals, internally manage the contracting process, and coordinate efforts between Thinkwell and strategic partner firms. The position, which requires stellar communication skills, has the goal of expanding TWG's network of clients internationally and through new and exciting markets/industries.

This position may be based in Los Angeles or remote in the United States.

The Project Development Department is responsible for generating new business, maintaining relationships with existing clients, and facilitating the onboarding of clients as their projects go into production. The department collaborates closely with other internal departments to craft proposals that clearly reflect our understanding of and approach to each individual project.

Responsibilities

Identify and qualify leads for projects within the assigned market. Introduce TWG to the clients through formal pitching or informal means.
Determine opportunities and scope, and work with the Director to determine the appropriate strategy to close a deal. Research and investigate best practices for new markets.
Create proposals, qualifications decks, etc. for new clients and act as a point of contact through the sales process and through pre-production and kick-off.
Meet quarterly and annual sales goals as assigned by the Director.
Act as the “subject matter expert” for architectural, engineering, interior design projects, and business development, keeping your finger continuously on the market’s pulse.
Maintain contact with past clients through correspondence and personal visits.
Prepare formal presentations including the gathering of information, the composition of text, and graphic layout.
Pitch Thinkwell Group capabilities and projects to potential clients.
In collaboration with the Legal department, prepare contracts for client review and acceptance.
Support the creation of RFP materials in coordination with the Proposal Manager, as assigned by the Director.
Achieve a network within the industry of other industry professionals.
Represent Thinkwell Group at industry functions and conventions.
Investigation and development of new technologies (or new applications of existing technologies) for use in Thinkwell projects;
Participate in the creation of "department-specific" marketing material as required.
Maintain client records in the CRM database.
Other duties as assigned.


Education and Experience Requirements

3+ years in business development, project management, or project development role at an architecture or interior design firm, or for a general contractor, or in the themed entertainment industry, or 5+ years of work experience in a related field.
College degree in business, marketing, construction management, or similar, or equivalent work experience.


Desired Skills

Demonstrated success in acquiring and retaining clients and meeting sales goals.
Must be detail-oriented and have strong organizational skills.
Experience working with international clients, specifically the Middle East, preferred.
Track record of creating successful proposals and RFP responses.
Understanding of the architectural design process.
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Ability to communicate effectively (strong verbal and written communication skills) and work cooperatively.
A willingness to collaborate and excitement to work with creatives.
Working knowledge of Keynote.
Strong understanding of Excel and/or Google Sheets.


Thinkwell is an equal opportunity employer and encourages people from all backgrounds to apply for this job if you find it compelling. We are most interested in finding the best candidate for the job, and encourage you to apply, even if you don’t believe you meet every one of our qualifications described.

JobTitle: Manager, Practice Transformation Liaison (Remote in CA)
Text:
3901 S Western Ave, Los Angeles, California, 80202-5117, United States of America
***This job can be remotely based anywhere in CA***
The Manager, Practice Transformation Liaison will serve as the liaison between the practice and various internal and external stakeholders to help nephrologists achieve value-based targets and objectives, and will utilize DaVita’s core values in all of their interactions. This role will serve as a single point of contact to streamline communication with physician practices and facilitate Quality Assessment and Process Improvement (QAPI) to improve clinical outcomes. The expectations for NCA PTL include: build clinical trust and physician satisfaction, assess quality through practice communication and data synthesis and develop recommendations to improve processes, coach for change management and drive success for value based care programs. The PTL will collaborate with cross functional teams including business development, clinical, operations, and business leaders across DaVita. This position serves as a thought partner and key contributor for activities related to NCA-administered clinically integrated network (CINs), independent practice associations (IPAs), and DaVita Integrated Kidney Care (IKC) programs.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Partner with Nephrologist(s) to build trust and physician satisfaction.Responsible for managing successful relationship(s) with Nephrologists and Nephrologist’s practice staffServe as a trusted advisor and main point of contact for physician practice. All interactions will represent DaVita’s core values and WE CARE qualities.Provides streamlined nephrologist engagement across DaVita IKC and other value-based care programs.Review physician playbook, program updates, and other pertinent documents with physicians. Ensure that physicians have solid understanding of program requirements and expectations.Provide timely follow-up to physician requests and open items related to program objectives.
2. Implement meaningful process changes designed to improve patient outcomes.Perform assessment of physician practice, co-lead the implementation of efficient and effective processes that result in optimal clinical outcomes.Provides analysis of clinical and operational data from multiple sources and determines current trends appropriate for value-based program needs.Teach QAPI principles to practice and help form and maintain a practice QAPI program.Collaboration with clinical leadership on practice’s plans for improvement and monitoring.Partner with DaVita IKC and other DaVita groups to prioritize practice focus areas and identify support resources (i.e. DaVita Home and DaVita Kidney Care).Identify appropriate NCA and IKC resources to help improve office workflows.
3. Facilitates behavior change through practice QAPI teamImplements ongoing meeting schedule for physician champion and practice QAPI team, involving other practice physicians, and practice staff as appropriate.Collaborates with key stakeholders on appropriate meeting attendees and topics for review.Able to put together effective presentations to help illustrate key findings and recommendations.Delivers proactive, timely and accurate communication and resolution for follow-up items with IKC partners, DaVita leaders and Nephrologists.Manages time effectively and able to maintain efficient communication to support process improvement efforts.Provides coaching, feedback, and assistance to practice for change leadership and management.Uses proven techniques of practice facilitation to influence and promote high-value healthcare.Identifies practice educational needs and matches them with available NCA resources, including academic detailing and other learning resources.
4. Data Quality and SynthesisReviews data reporting provided by NCA or DaVita IKC analyst, checks for data accuracy, provides recommendations to improve practice experienceSynthesizes data reports to understand critical focus areas and develops recommendations for practice to improve.Delivers data reports to practice, explains data results, and communicates with analyst team to gather additional data when requested.
5. Other duties as assigned.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Bachelor degree preferred
6 – 8 years of experience preferred

JobTitle: Integrity-Driven Sales Position for Boutique Coaching Co. 100% Remote
Qualifications: High school or equivalent (Preferred)Sales Experience: 1 year (Preferred)
Text: Hi! Our company, Introverted Alpha, helps smart introverted men attract women naturally by bringing out their own unique best. We've been around for over six years, and we are a remote team across the country.*The position we're hiring for is an Alpha Advocate: a name born of ours (Introverted Alpha) and your role: an advocate for “our guys,” as we affectionately call them.**Position Summary: ROLE:  To help clients along the way of enrolling in the right program for them. They reach out to us for support, and as an Alpha Advocate, you simply talk through their options with them on the phone, options they are already aware of: Launch Your Dating Life, Become A Benevolent Badass, and others.LOGISTICS:  This is a remote part-time contractor position, paid on a commission basis. You’ll be taking calls with our guys in the afternoons and evenings during launches (concentrated sales times for a couple of weeks at a time, a handful of times per year), and you may get an appointment here or there when we are not having a launch.COMPENSATION:  Our programs range from $1,800 to $7,000. You’ll be paid on a commission basis: 15% per client enrollment to start, then 17%. This compensation includes surrounding admin and email follow-up.IMPORTANT:  We are hiring for attitude and disposition, not sales experience, as we will train thoroughly in our own ways.Who You Are: These are words that describe you well: warm, insightful, and poised. As such, you feel relaxed and confident in your communication.You compassionately see the best in people. You’d love to support intelligent, kind, good-hearted men, helping them become successful with dating and life in general. You’re pragmatic, and you have a warm and caring nature. You are articulate and well-spoken, and you love to learn.As far as your day-to-day, you’d love to devote the latter part of your day to supporting and talking to people for two weeks at a time every two months, and you are typically available for this in the afternoons and evenings (about 3 or 4pm to 7 or 8pm).Who Is Introverted Alpha: I founded Introverted Alpha in June of 2014, and it has been wonderful to see it become a stable, mature, and a trusted source of wisdom and direction for introverted men.I’ve grown the business substantially each year, and I am very excited for the coming years ahead. It is an adventure every day! There is so much to learn about business, and so much to love about the special men we serve.Our Direction: Right out of the gate back in 2014 and 2015, we were approached by leading experts in the industry asking to get to know us and entail our support and wisdom.We get emails daily from our readers, colleagues, and clients THANKING US from the bottom of their hearts for being here, for making such a difference in their lives.It is an honor to be making an indelible impact in the market, and we look forward to flourishing together in years to come: you, me, our growing team, our clients, readers, and everyone who is positively influenced by the work we’re doing.We are full of positive energy and strategic curiosity over how to support our guys better every day. Joy is what this company runs on, and we are very grateful for that.Who Are Our Clients?They are smart, introverted men who value integrity, adventure, connection, and fun. As entrepreneurs, engineers, outdoorists, foodies, leaders, and wanderers, they are thoughtful, patient, kind, and strong.They are ready to grow and develop to the next level with dating, social leadership, confidence, and more. Many times, they just haven’t found the resources or guidance to do that in a way that feels honest and true to them until they find US.That’s where you come in: helping bridge the gap between them finding us and working together. If it’s a fit. you’ll help them take that step into the best program for them, and along with that, the 1:1 care of a devoted IA Coach.Introverted Alpha is founded on LOVE for these men: genuine love and respect. We are focused on the holistic life-cycle of the client, so nurturing them at every touchpoint is crucial.Your Tasks: 1:1 calls:  This is where you’ll help our potential clients see if this is a fit to work together. Calls take place during the afternoons and evenings. (I will give you lots of guidance and a solid framework for these fun calls and your emails too!)Email and admin:  Before and after each call, there will be some admin and email follow-up. You’ll be following up with potential clients after your calls, as you might have more than one call per potential client.Logistics of expected workload:  It’s important that you’re available in a very quiet, peaceful place for the exploration calls and that you’re able to check and respond to emails a few times daily on weekdays.Your Strengths & Background: You’re a critical thinker and a problem solver. You get to the heart of the matter and ask great questions.You help people feel comfortable to open up and at ease around you.You are professional and clear with your communication.Also, you love helping people. You love handling things with genuine care, clearing their concerns, and supporting them to actualize on the goals they’ve set for themselves.HOW TO APPLY: Visit our website to get a sense of us (introvertedalpha.com).If you like what you see and what I’ve said here, email me with the following email structure:(1) A brief hello / introduction,(2) Your answers to these questions:1. What do you most resonate with about the company?2. What excites you most about being our Alpha Advocate?3. What are your career / life / holistic goals?4. Why do you love people so much?5. What is your greatest strength, and what do you get complimented on most?6. What was/is your biggest challenge in supporting people in a professional capacity (if applicable, otherwise a personal capacity), and what have you done to address that?7. Clinical Diagnostics Division (CDD) - Our group is comprised of several different sales teams for Clinical Diagnostics representing a variety of different product lines: Diagnostic Reagents for drug of abuse screening, therapeutic and immunosuppressant monitoring, serum toxicology, endocrine, specimen validity testing, and sepsis testing; Clinical chemistry and Molecular controls; Particle Technology; and Corporate Accounts.
Location/Division Specific Information
Remote – West Coast - situated with a major airport.
How will you make an impact?
The Account Manager for AcroMetrix is responsible for the promotion of the AcroMetrix Molecular Quality Controls portfolio and achieving sales goals within the defined territory. This role requires a focus on initiating new, professional business relationships and the delivery of customer support/satisfaction as well as managing a business with responsibility for profit and revenue growth.
What will you do?
Direct responsibility for initiating new sales opportunities and relationships with IVD-OEM, Pharma and Clinical Reference labs as well as maintaining existing business with Key Clinical Molecular Customers in the assigned geography.
Achieve annual sales target by selling products to customers within the assigned region.
Develop technical expertise, on-the-job, in Quality Control offerings to effectively sell products
Manage the sales strategy through a progressive pipeline of opportunities, completing basic research on competitive activities, maintaining accurate daily reporting and records, and demonstrating responsiveness to change, willingness to take direction, and initiative to develop new selling skills.
Identify and qualify opportunities by; performing regular sales calls with current customers and seeking business development opportunities through cold calling and referrals
Support a team of hospital sales executives focused on Quality Controls within your same geographical region. Co-travelling as necessary.
Attend tradeshows and represent Thermo Fisher as requested by the Sales Manager.
How will you get here?
Education
BS – Life Sciences or related scientific field – required.
Experience, Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
4+ years of successful field sales, preferable in diagnostic markets/testing – preferred.
Technical expertise in a molecular field specifically using PCR or NGS
Must have an understanding of the various molecular markets, Clinical, IVD, Reference Lab, etc.
Must provide detailed and timely reporting
Demonstrated ability to effectively negotiate resources and work with cross-functional teams
SalesForce.com experiences a plus
Must possess a valid Driver's License
Ability to travel without limitation
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $25 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 75,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.

JobTitle: Field Sales Specialist- Commercial Small Business
Text:
Field Sales Specialist- Commercial Small Business-MAR0001FD
Supervisory Position: No
Description

From our humble beginnings over 100 years ago to our position of leadership in the insurance industry today, CNA continues to build on a long, proud tradition. Our history is a rich story of service, growth, financial strength and stability. For more than a century we have built strong relationships with business partners and customers creating a legacy of innovation and service.
CNA has an excellent opportunity for a Field Sales Specialist to join our team in Los Angeles. This position is a work from home position. The territory includes Los Angeles and the surrounding area.
The Commercial Small Business Field Sales Specialist will focus on sales execution and business development for the commercial small business segment. Under technical direction, provides marketing, technology and underwriting support, as required, to targeted agency (e.g., local or small business) distribution plant. Drives business production and develops profitable growth opportunities with current and new distribution partners.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

1. Establishes and achieves production and profitability goals within the local territory for small business by identifying key agents, new business opportunities, and new agency appointments. AdditionalIy, identifies emerging channels - aggregators, brokers, eBusiness, banks, etc.
2. Promotes the use of CNA Sales & Service Center as a distribution option.
3. Promotes and sells CNA business technology. Acts as local agency advocate for CNA communications, customer feedback, and technology issues.
4. Responsible for the profitability of assigned small commercial agency plant.
5. Performs the following distribution management duties to include: New distributor prospecting, appointing, contract execution, and onboarding. Recommend and communicate corrective action including distributor termination.
6. Performs all or some of the following underwriting duties, as required: Reviews applications and financial requirements for risk selection. Determines acceptability of risk within their letter of underwriting authority.
7. Gathers and relays competitive market intelligence and conducts rate review analysis, as required.
8. Responsible for auditing agents that have underwriting and pricing authority to ensure compliance to company policy.
May perform additional duties as assigned.
Reporting Relationship

Small Business Sales Director

Skills, Knowledge & Abilities


1. Strong technical expertise, sophistication, and independent judgment to manage business relationships with distributors and individual business units.

2. Solid insurance industry knowledge as it applies to business development and determining business opportunity.

3. Strong verbal, written and presentation skills with the ability to effectively interact with internal and external business partners.

4. Creativity in resolving issues and problems.

5. Results-oriented with the ability to develop tactical strategies and business plans which support organizational vision and goals.

6. Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite as well as other business-related software.

7. Ability to travel.

8. Ability to work independently and remotely in the assigned territory to achieve results with limited supervision.
Education & Experience

1. Bachelor's degree or equivalent.
2. Typically a minimum of two to five years multi-line P&C commercial underwriting experience is preferred, in addition to experience in insurance sales or marketing.
3. Requires a basic understanding of P&C commercial lines risk qualification with an insurance carrier or agency.

Internship Description:

Have you ever wondered how television commercials get to your TV? Or about the strategy behind which commercials air on which networks and why? If you ever had an interest in Advertising Sales or Ad Sales Marketing, an Ad Sales Internship could be the perfect fit for you! Advertising Sales is a key revenue stream for Discovery working with national advertisers and their agencies to sell commercial space on our networks.

As an Ad Sales Intern, your adventure could lead you to work on projects and tasks such as:Create client presentationsAnalyze ratings through Nielsen, MRI, Lake 5 and Ad-ViewsReport on trends and complete competitor analysesDevelop marketing plans and/or creative proposalsExecute inventory management & analysisMonitor performance indicators for sales campaignsGet an in depth view of how the advertising industry works!

Although our summer internship program will be completely remote (students can apply from anywhere), please be aware that this intern will report into a Los Angeles based manager and therefore should expect to work on pacific standard time.
Requirements:
Must be currently enrolled as a student (proof of enrollment will be required if selected for an internship)Must be a rising Junior, Senior, or Graduate studentMust have at least a 3.0 GPAMust have the legal right to work in the United States.
More About the Intern Program:

Discovery’s internationally recognized intern program attracts the country’s boldest and brightest students for a paid, for-credit, real-world work experience in the entertainment and media industry.

Like other Fortune 500 companies, we believe in immersing our students in all aspects of our business, giving them first hand experience working for the global leader in real life entertainment. So what sets us apart? We’re passionate about investing in our interns- both personally and professionally. Whether our program is in-person or remote, every semester is packed with speaker sessions with executives, LinkedIn profile reviews, recruiter panels, roundtable events and professional seminars- and that just scratches the surface.

Think our program sounds pretty awesome? Our former interns thought so too! This year, we were voted into Vault’s 2021 internship rankings for best overall internships, best media and telecom internships, best sales and marketing internships and best internships for diversity.

Ready to learn more? Here’s what we offer:
Mentorship from some of the industry’s kindest and most passionate entertainment veterans
Professional development seminars, panels with recruiters and former interns, intern-exclusive events, and so much more
Access to top level executives and employees through our Speaker Series and Roundtables
Incredible networking opportunities and a robust intern alumni network
A creative, collaborative and inclusive company culture

What you can expect to take away from the semester:
Opportunity to develop professionally and uncover skills you didn’t know you had
The insider scoop on the TV industry and what happens behind the scenes
Relationships that will go beyond your collegiate career
Real life experiences that will provide you with the confidence to delve into your next adventure
And finally, what to know before applying:
We offer 12 week spring and summer opportunities
Our Summer 2021 program will be fully remote- the program will run from June 2-August 20.
The application deadline for Summer 2021 is March 19th. After this date, we cannot guarantee your application will be reviewed for the position.
Our internships are paid opportunities. Credit is not required; however, we will provide necessary documentation for school credit if desired.
We do not require a cover letter- please do not submit one. Instead, demonstrate your passion for the position through your resume and interviews.
Interviewing will take place from February through mid-April. A Discovery Intern team member will contact you if your experiences and interests match an open internship position. Due to the high volume of applications, we are unable to give individual status updates.

We’re hiring an Account Executive with successful experience selling to large retailers.

In this role, you’ll build strong, trusting, long-lasting professional relationships with key stakeholders at the largest retailers in the world.

To thrive in this role, you’ll be exceptionally intelligent, trustworthy, reliable, resourceful, have an energetic, positive attitude and be willing to work hard.

This is a full-time position in New York, Austin, Los Angeles or Remote (US or Canada only). Travel, typically within the US, will be required.

ROLE


Generate awareness, educate and build interest in Granify at the largest retailers in the world.
Build and maintain strong, trusting, long-lasting relationships with key stakeholders at these retailers.
Stay up to date on each of your stakeholders' businesses and objectives so you’re able to identify opportunities for us to help them now and in the future.
Stay up to date on our product and how it will evolve in the future so you’re able to determine opportunities for your stakeholders to utilize Granify to achieve their business objectives.
Leverage the strong, trusting relationships you’ve built and the fantastic results your clients see using Granify to generate referrals for new business.


ABOUT YOU


3 years experience selling to enterprise retailers
Proven ability to create and grow trusting, lasting professional relationships with key stakeholders at large enterprise clients
Naturally consultative with exceptional ability to teach complex concepts in a simple way
Exceptional problem solver
Exceptional presentation skills
Excellent time management skills
Energetic and positive
Extremely driven and hard working
Balance your high intelligence with a high level of humility
Unafraid of taking on new responsibilities
Strong professional written and verbal communication
Have a take control and get things done mindset, and activity that reflects such
Familiar with foundational online marketing practices in SEO, Paid Search, Affiliate, Display Advertising, Email Marketing, Conversion Optimization, A/B Testing
Bachelor’s degree in business, commerce, marketing, computer science, engineering or equivalent experience


ABOUT GRANIFY

With our unique culture and How We Work at Granify framework, you’ll develop core skills that will change how you work, how you think and how you live for the rest of your life. We have a clear system in place to help you grow as a person and as a professional and we take it very seriously.

You’ll work closely with an incredible group of the smartest, most interesting, genuinely good people around. You’ll work hard, learn quickly, and have plenty of excitement. You’ll also get a first hand view into the rapidly evolving, exciting intersection of e-commerce, machine intelligence and psychology.

Did you know? Granify is backed by early investors in Facebook, SpaceX, Tesla, Uber, Twitter, Airbnb, Paypal, Pinterest, Palantir and Yelp. Wouldn’t it have been great to get in at one of those companies as they were taking off...

We are creating an outside sales team who can work from anywhere in the world...
As you can imagine, we're growing like crazy and we need motivated and driven, take-charge salespeople to expand on this success.
Our #1 goal for you as a salesperson is to help you live your ideal life, including:
Uncapped Earning Potential- We want you to make so much money you don’t know what to do with it.
Time Freedom- You need to have time to enjoy your financial freedom. What good does it do to make a bunch of money but have no time to enjoy life?
Flexibility- We don’t believe in sales managers… We believe in mentors!!! You will have your own performance coach, accountability coach and onboarding specialist who will be there to support you as you grow. Get things done on your schedule… no more punching a clock.
Industry and Company
Go West Creative, creates engaging purposeful experiences that deliver your message through customized content and unique events with the latest digital technologies. These experiences can be created as a virtual event, an in person event or a hybrid of the two based upon your needs. Our team excels at being experienced and gifted storytellers communicating your message.
We have an enormous amount of support for our sales team including:
Unparalleled Personal and group coaching… designed to take your skills and abilities to the next level.
Technology tools and automation created to allow you to get rid of the mundane, repetitive tasks that bog down most salespeople.
The time to dominate this market segment is now, and it’s time for you to come and show off what you can accomplish!
Key Responsibilities
Respond in a timely manner to all leads.
Initiate outbound efforts (call, text, email) each day to prospects.
Qualify prospects, gauge interest, and schedule sales calls.
Collaborate with the team on improving prospecting strategies.
Ability to identify & source information on prospective clients.
Qualifications
Strong company culture fit.

JobTitle: Payroll Specialist - West Coast Region - Remote Opportunity!
Text:
Position Summary
Responsible for all aspects of quality payroll service for PEO clients. Partners and collaborates with PEO clients with the objective of producing accurate, compliant, and timely delivered payrolls. Liaison with PEOPLEASE cross-functional departments to support various products and services that interact with payroll, within the PEO co-employment platform.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Processes payroll accurately and in accordance with PEO guidelines.
Accurately enters and maintains employee related information in the payroll system, including, but not limited to: personnel changes, wage adjustments, garnishments, child support and liens, tax withholding changes, direct deposit, special withholdings, leave of absence/termination forms, and all other PEO-required forms necessary for payroll processing.
Accurately enters and maintains all client related information in the payroll system including, but not limited to: client demographic changes, billing changes: workers’ compensation and state unemployment codes, client sponsored benefit plan deductions, paid time-off benefit programs, managerial, labor, and other custom reports and related payroll schedules.
Reviews new hire and employee change paperwork and collaborates with client for the objective of producing accurate, compliant and timely delivered payroll.
Trains and assists the client and their representatives on the PEOPLEASE PEO related websites and educates clients on federal and state tax regulations and federal labor laws.
Reviews, researches and assists PEO Accounting, Finance, and Tax departments with reconciliation of general ledger account discrepancies and data integrity issues.
Collaborates with all payroll related internal departments and field client service team to ensure client issues are quickly resolved and documented accordingly; coordinates conference calls between the client and associated departments, promoting PEOPLEASE’ quality service image.
Maintains knowledge of PEOPLEASE/PEO payroll processing system enhancements and changes in wage and tax laws to assist PEO departments with problem resolution on behalf of PEO clients.
Maintains knowledge of all PEO service offerings to assist clients with general inquiries.
Maintains knowledge of PEO payroll policies and procedures to ensure compliance with PEO requirements.
Ensures that quality payroll service is provided to PEO clients by maintaining the highest level of quality service as measured by client satisfaction scores and client retention.
Other duties as assigned to support the general purpose of the position’s function.
Minimum Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities)


A high school diploma, minimum. Associates or Bachelors’ degree in business or accounting preferred.
Prior PEO payroll experience a definite plus
5+ years payroll experience
Experience with HRP/PrismHR a definite plus
Fundamental Payroll Certification (FPC) or ability to obtain within one year of hire. Certified Payroll Professional (CPP) designation preferred.
Physical Demands and Work Environment
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the functions. While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands or fingers, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus. This position will be working primarily indoors and some of the time in an outdoor environment. From this movement, the employee will encounter varying temperatures. The normal auto and air travel hazards will apply.

Title: California Care Organizer

Position: Full Time

Reports To: California Care Campaign Manager

FLSA Status: Exempt

Salary: $55,000 - $65,000

Start Date: As soon as filled

Work Location: Remote, but based in the Los Angeles, Sacramento, or San Francisco area


Overview

About Caring Across Generations:

The way we work has changed, our families have changed - but care hasn’t. With millennials becoming parents and Baby Boomers getting older, the need for care is surging. Yet many people can’t just rely on family for the support they need, and paid caregivers barely make enough to support their own families.

Caring Across Generations is an intersectional campaign working to make care more affordable and accessible at every stage of life, while making sure caregivers are treated with respect and dignity. Founded in 2011 by workers’ rights activists Sarita Gupta and Ai-jen Poo, we’re focused on creating change in three ways: organizing a powerful movement of the Caring Majority, fighting for groundbreaking policy at the state level and federal level, and changing hearts and minds through storytelling and leveraging pop culture. We were behind the historic win to extend federal minimum wage and overtime protections to home care workers, and in 2018, helped Washington state create the nation's first universal public program for long-term care.

About the Position:

The California Care Campaign Organizer will recruit and organize family caregivers, people with disabilities, seniors and other care recipients to join Caring Across Generations in the fight to expand and improve California’s care infrastructure. The Organizer will grow our base of 12 coalition partner organizations to the size and power needed to launch a city-based Universal Family Care (UFC) pilot campaign in 2022. UFC is a new holistic, sustainable framework that ensures every family will be able to afford childcare, paid family and medical leave, AND supports for loved ones who are aging or living with a disability. This position will also bring leaders together at key moments to support the federal Care Infrastructure agenda.

Responsibilities

Recruit, organize and develop a multi-racial, multi-ethnic, multi-generational grassroots base of unpaid family caregivers, people with disabilities and seniors, with a focus on developing BIPOC family caregivers,' to win Care policy.
Build relationships with allied organizations, faith communities, elected officials, and policy-makers.
Mobilize local grassroots leaders to support federal campaign actions and events to move our Care agenda at the federal level.
Monitor and impact local decision-making bodies on programs and policies that directly impact family caregivers.
Run effective and engaging webinar and in-person trainings.
Lead well-planned and executed base-building meetings.
Organize non-partisan Civic and Voter Engagement campaigns as needed.


Qualifications

At least three years of experience in building grassroots membership, identifying local ways to take action, and experience training grassroots leaders on issues.
Communicates well and comfortably among a racially diverse set of people with a strong social justice lens and an appetite to undo racism, sexism, misogyny, classism, ableism, homophobia, xenophobia, and other forms of oppression.
Excellent interpersonal skills (one-on-one and in group contexts), cultural competencies, strong listening skills, patience, and humor.
Ability to work as part of a strong team as well as independently.
Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks in high-paced, low structure organization.
Ability to work flexible hours to meet program requirements and community needs, including evenings and weekends.
Experience working with Voter Activation Network (VAN) desirable.
Experience organizing with people with disabilities, multi-racial constituencies, and/or multi-generational constituencies desirable.


Travel

Must be willing and able to travel. Generally, openness to traveling 1-2 times per 2 month for 1-3 days around California once we begin to allow staff to travel again.


How to Apply

Candidates will be considered and interviewed on a rolling basis until the position is filled.

Please send application materials to this platform. Applications should include:

A resume
Answers to the following questions in lieu of a cover letter:
Why do you want to work on care and caregiving issues? What is your motivation for applying to this role? (suggested word limit: 200)
Describe an experience you had building a committee of grassroots volunteers. What was the recruitment and retention process like? (suggest word limit: 200)
Describe an experience holding a volunteer-leader accountable to an action they said they would do but didn't? How did you use it as an opportunity to deepen the relationship? (suggested word limit: 200)


Benefits

Caring Across Generations is a project of, and fiscally sponsored by, National Domestic Workers Alliance. Bend the Arc offers a comprehensive benefits package including:

Generous Benefits, including 5+ weeks of paid time off annually, including 3 weeks of office closure, most federal holidays, 12 days of vacation, and 12 sick days (prorated to the start date).

ABOUT NuORDER:
NuORDER is the leading wholesale eCommerce platform. Brands &Retailers use NuORDER to deliver a seamless, more collaborative wholesale process, where buyers can browse products, plan assortments and make smarter buys in real-time. The NuORDER platform was engineered with flexibility and scale in mind, empowering businesses of all sizes with enterprise-level technology. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California; NuORDER connects more than 3,000 brands and 500,000 retailers globally, helping them grow and win together. For more information, visit www.nuorder.com
POSITION SUMMARY:
Our clients need people who are dedicated, full of enthusiasm and truly enjoy working with people. NuORDER is looking for a dynamic and diligent individual to provide world-class service to our most premiere clients. This individual will be responsible for retaining customers and negotiating renewals and account growth, providing strategic recommendations on how to best use our tool, and know how to appropriately identify and resolve sensitive customer issues.
The position can be remote/work from home across the United States.
What you'll do:
Manage a portfolio of NuORDER's top clients, specifically in the outdoor/sports space.
Develop long-term relationships with brand clients, including C-Suite. Meeting in-person (when safe) and giving presentations to show the value we are driving and align on company business goals and objectives.
Be an expert in your customers' business; understanding their seasonal cycles, sales goals, GTM strategies and working with them to have our tool support their needs/goals each step of the way.
Operate as the main point of contact for your brands, taking personal responsibility to make sure any questions or issues get resolved.
Track the success of your brands on our tool using hard data, and modify your customer recommendations as needed to maximize the outcome.
Accurately capture customer feedback on the software and translate that into product requirements.
Spearhead renewal conversations with customers, as well as ways we can grow the account (new features etc.).
Work closely with the Enterprise Sales Team/Onboarding post sale to onboard new clients on NuORDER.
Become an expert on our technology solution, and how it can deliver value for marquee wholesale brands.
What you'll need:
A passion for outdoor/sport brands and an appreciation for their products. The ideal person in this role MUST have worked with/for outdoor/sports brand(s).
7-10+ years experience working as an Account Manager or Customer Success Manager role for a B2B, SaaS or eCommerce platform is MUST.
Experience in wholesale or retail that's given you a 360 view of the industry, is a nice to have. Sales, operations, planning, merchandizing, buying - holding multiple roles in the industry preferred.
Experience overseeing/managing the ongoing implementation a B2B software system.
Relevant experience in Account Management/Sales, SaaS/Software, e-commerce, technology start-ups.
EDUCATION: BA/BS Required.
Comfortable multi-tasking and juggling competing/changing priorities in a fast-paced, ever-evolving, entrepreneurial startup environment.
Experience working across/consulting C-Level executives
Ability to think beyond the status quo with a can-do attitude and an appetite for success.
WHY NuORDER?
We’re creative, innovative, and helping businesses become more efficient. Ensuring that each member of our team feels fulfilled and on track to become the very best employee they can be is important - and we encourage our people to discover new ways of achieving specific goals. We fully believe that each and every individual part of our organization provides value, a new perspective and progress to NuORDER’s growth and success. Come join us so we can build together!
BENEFITS:
NuORDER offers a competitive salary and benefits package complete with health, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan, stock options, and flexible PTO.
