Overview:

JOB SUMMARY:

The Manager, Provider Business Development will report directly to the Regional Sales Director VP, Provider Business Development and will be responsible for supporting business development activities which contribute to the achievement of the annual revenue plan. The position is responsible for identifying and contracting large, for-profit healthcare providers Day-to-day activities will entail prospecting, lead generation, conference attendance and exhibiting, RFP responses, presentations and other supporting sales activities from either Philadelphia or their home office.

Responsibilities:

Essential Functions:

Account Facing
This is a new-business focused sales role
Develop and manage sales lead generation campaigns including support for inbound inquiries
Identify and meet key decision-makers for prospective accounts
Consultatively determine optimal solution for prospective accounts
Prepare value analysis reports to substantiate the value of InstaMed and J.P. Morgan
Introduce and engage J.P. Morgan coverage team members for client needs around treasury and credit
Deliver product demos to prospective accounts
Prepare proposals to prospective accounts
Introduce best practices associated with use of InstaMed & J.P. Morgan solutions
Any other duties applicable to the position
Internal
Identify prospective sales targets within market segments
Coordinate marketing activities including presentations and conferences
Support internal RFP and proposal generation process
Regular interaction with Marketing, Product and Professional Services departments of InstaMed
Collaborate with banking and treasury partners
Maintain accurate and timely administrative responsibilities relevant to the position
Adhere to company policies and procedures for proper execution of compliance, training and regulatory duties
Any other duties applicable to the position
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or higher
Minimum of 3 years of experience selling or supporting the healthcare provider market
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proficiency in all aspects of Microsoft Office is preferred
Proficiency in Salesforce is a plus
Healthcare revenue cycle industry experience preferred
Payments industry experience is a plus

COMPANY PROFILE:
InstaMed, a J.P. Morgan company, powers a better healthcare payments experience on one platform that connects consumers, providers and payers for every healthcare payment transaction. InstaMed’s patented, private cloud-based technology securely transforms healthcare payments by driving electronic transactions, processing payments and moving healthcare data seamlessly, and improving consumer satisfaction. Consumers, providers and payers benefit from InstaMed’s exclusive focus on healthcare, integration into any healthcare IT system, robust analytics and proven scale.

HIGH-GROWTH ENVIRONMENT:
At InstaMed, we invest in our people because people are among our most important assets. We currently have open positions for individuals with sales, marketing, customer relationship and technical skills. We offer an exciting and rewarding work environment for people who want to grow their professional skills and gain experience in a high-technology career in the healthcare industry.

BENEFITS:
We are committed to providing a comprehensive set of benefits choices to meet different employee needs and lifestyles. Employees can take an active role in designing a personal strategy to help meet their short-term and long-term “health care and insurance” and “retirement savings” objectives. Benefit plans include medical, dental, vision, spending accounts, short & long term disability, basic life insurance, employee and dependent supplemental life insurance, business travel accident insurance, group personal excess liability insurance, group legal services, and 401(k) savings.

In addition to health & welfare benefits, a variety of employee programs are offered to eligible employees including paid sick, personal and vacation time away, parental leave, back-up child care services, discounts on banking services, electronics, arts and entertainment, fitness programs, travel and more.

COMPENSATION:
Compensation plays a critical role in our ability to attract, retain and motivate our workforce. Our compensation framework is designed to align the long-term interests of our employees with those of our shareholders by generating sustained value and reinforcing personal accountability.

InstaMed is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

THE THIRD FLOOR is the world’s leading visualization company with offices in Los Angeles and London as well as on location with productions around the world. Since 2004, the studio has helped clients visualize and maximize content by producing computer-animated blueprints, known as “previsualizations”. The Third Floor is a fun, creative company founded by artists, for artists. We work on extremely high-profile projects, while maintaining a small studio feel. Recent examples of our work include Spiderman Far From Home, Avengers Endgame, Godzilla King of the Monsters, Detective Pikachu, and Game of Thrones.

Assets are built quickly and must be highly optimized for real-time workflow in Maya. Our Unreal Previs Modeler must be able to take artistic direction from a wide spectrum of sources to produce environments, props, and characters that best represent the director's vision. The ideal Unreal Previs Modeler will have a strong sense of design and feel comfortable filling in the gaps of information to ensure each asset looks its best.

Strong Knowledge of low-polygon modeling is a must and as well as an excellent working knowledge of Unreal Game Engine.

Project based work remote position. Must be in the state of California, Georgia, Texas or Oregon for remote position.
Responsibilities:
Design accurate models from storyboards, concept art, and/or script pages.
Build lower resolution assets for both organic and hard surface - characters, creatures, props, and environments
Texture, rig, and light models quickly and efficiently.
Transfer and/or create lower resolution models from higher resolution models.
Lighting and Shading VR scenes and assets in Unreal
Understand concepts that are used heavily in previs such as the creation alpha/transparency cards and animated UV's for visual effects.
Possess an artistic eye for detail and understand the technical specifications for each project.
Work well on a team and successfully take direction from a supervisor.
Adapt quickly and accept change – often have to toss out ideas and start fresh.
Maintain high consistent standard of quality and speed

Essential Skills:
Must have Inside out knowledge of Unreal for 3D
Proficiency working with Maya asset workflows between Maya and Unreal
Must have experience with Lighting and Shading in Unreal
Photoshop
Substance Painter
Autodesk Motion Builder (a plus)
Mudbox (a plus)
ZBrush (a plus)

Application Requirements:
To be considered: include your resume, demo reel/ portfolio link (and password, if needed), and demo reel breakdown (or, alternatively, a written detailed breakdown/contribution) with your application.
The modeling work shown should include characters, props and environments. Wire frames and textures must be shown for proper consideration. Here is a guide to help understand what TTF is looking for in a demo reel
U.S. Applicants only: TTF participates in E-Verify and we will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization. All documents provided for proof of work authorization must be current and unexpired. We cannot accept expired proof of identity.
IMPORTANT: If the Government cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, TTF is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact DHS and/or the SSA before taking adverse action against you, including terminating your employment.

Company Description
TeamViewer is a leading global technology company that provides a connectivity platform to remotely access, control, manage, monitor, and repair devices of any kind – from laptops and mobile phones to industrial machines and robots. TeamViewer proactively shapes digital transformation and continuously innovates in the fields of Augmented Reality, Internet of Things or Artificial Intelligence. Since the company’s foundation in 2005, TeamViewer’s software has been installed on more than 2.2 billion devices around the world. The company is headquartered in Goppingen, Germany, and employs more than 1,000 people globally.
Job Description
This is an exciting opportunity to own your own territory as we continue to build our Enterprise team across the continent and beyond. You will be an experienced sales professional with a proven track record in enterprise software solutions, willing to work remotely with the backing of our team in the US HQ in Clearwater, FL.
Ultimately responsible for penetrating and winning new Enterprise accounts and growing existing business with Enterprise solutions to meet revenue and profit targets.
Apply both tactical and strategic go to market models aimed at growing the customer base both in the short and long terms to drive higher revenues, customer growth and customer retention.
Build strong partnerships at the senior leadership level, key decision-makers and establish new business relationships
Propel the TeamViewer/Enterprise brand with customers/prospects as well as alliance partners through participation and exposure at various industry events
Manage complex sales cycle to close and identify cross selling and upselling opportunities.
Support weekly, monthly, and quarterly forecast process, including pipeline analysis, data validation, and identify gaps and actions required. Achieve and exceed your quarterly and annual sales targets.
Conduct market analysis to find new project/customer opportunities and create key account plans that ensure customer needs are identified early
Qualifications
This role can be remote and based nationwide.
Proven experience with selling SaaS solutions and software licensing to large enterprises.
A high level of technical knowledge and understanding of the IT market as well as profound skills in solution selling
Several years of professional experience in key account management and enterprise & channel sales with demonstrated track record of meeting or exceeding your sales targets.
Experience in strategic account plan creation and a network of established customer contacts with relevant decision-makers
Proven negotiation and influencing skills at all levels of the business
An independent contributor with an entrepreneurial mindset, self-motivator who is driven to succeed and likes to overachieve
A passionate and positive individual who has strong communication skills across all audiences, is capable of working in a high-growth and dynamic environment with a willingness to be flexible to act in the best interests of our customers and the business
Additional Information
Teams that collaborate and work with each other towards a common goal.
We offer career development and a top-tier benefit plan including medical, dental, vision and 401k match.
This position will start remote until our offices reopen due to the pandemic.

LiveImpact is a cutting-edge technology platform for nonprofits that is at an exciting stage of rapid growth and expansion. It’s our mission to bring the best in class technology solution to social good organizations to increase efficiency, supercharge fundraising, and demonstrate impact. Our real-time social and cutting-edge cloud tools, and mobile apps are built to be secure, reliable, and scalable. Our platform is built to support social innovation around the world. We created LiveImpact to be completely integrated and customizable so nonprofits can focus on what's most important - their Mission.We are a seeking a customer centric Database Lead for our client services team. The ideal candidate has managed nonprofit databases like Raiser’s Edge, Donor Perfect, or Salesforce and understands how nonprofits utilize data to increase fundraising and showcase outcomes. The Database Lead should have extensive experience with data, be an expert in MS Excel and have strong customer service skills. This is a critical role that engages with nonprofits and supports them as they migrate from other products to our platform. The ideal candidate is a tech savvy, problem solver who can perform under pressure and balance competing priorities in an exciting, nonprofit-centric, and results oriented team. Most importantly, you must believe in our mission to help nonprofits thrive. This is a great opportunity for an individual that wants to make long term impact at the intersection of technology and philanthropy.Responsibilities and DutiesGuide nonprofits through the LiveImpact implementation process and ensure key on-boarding milestones are met prior to going live.Review client data and assess readiness for import into our platform.Communicate data issues to the client and help them understand how to prepare their data to be imported in our platform.Communicate our expectations and requirements to clients and help them understand their list of tasks and activities to prepare for the implementation.Host custom trainings for each client as part of their initial setup.Ensure correct account set-up and successful data import and validation.Respond to service inquiries, requests, and questions with the confidence that you are really making a difference.Provide triage to clients as they learn the platform and in their first few months of usage.Approach client engagement with a positive attitude and solutions mindset.Act as an advocate and ambassador for LiveImpact, our platform, applications, and functionality.Concurrently manage a portfolio of client implementations.Cultivate positive working relationships with our clients to help them fall in love with our technology.Provide feedback and QA insight to our product team with the goal of continually enhancing the functionality.Create and publish thought leadership such as white papers about data best practices.Qualifications and Skills4+ years of experience working with nonprofits.Expertise with nonprofit development databases (for example Raiser’s Edge, Salesforce, or DonorPerfect) and understanding of how nonprofits can benefit from accessing their data.Expertise in working with data, databases, and MS Excel.Experience with reporting and data analytics.Motivated and diligent self-starter with a track record of success.Superior written and oral communication skills.Background in program outcomes, grants, and government contracts is a plus.Ability to work in a fast paced and highly collaborative entrepreneurial environment.LiveImpact is an equal opportunity employer.Job Type: Full-timeSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Nonprofit Database: 4 years (Preferred)Microsoft Excel: 4 years (Preferred)Work JobTitle: Virtual Corporate Social Responsibility Internships, Summer 2021
Text:
Opportunity Overview
The WarnerMedia Story
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others. The organization also includes Xandr’s suite of advanced advertising solutions designed to help to improve advertising for brands, publishers, and consumers.

The Job
WarnerMedia Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is looking for dedicated and hardworking intern to support the development of cause related campaigns and initiatives connected to corporate strategy and its business units content. Intern will also support the planning and execution of community screenings and events in addition to assisting all employee engagement projects.

The Daily
Support the efforts and development of cause related campaigns tied to WM and its business units programming and talent.
Assist with the planning of community events; managing guest lists and signage, among other deliverables.
Conduct competitive research and analysis to provide strategic recommendations for CSR team.
Help create and participate in delivering materials such as presentations and one-sheet overviews.
Collaborate with internal teams as well as external partners on current and future campaigns.
Provide pitches for press opportunities and social media projects and activations.
Participate and support all employee engagement initiatives.

The Essentials
Strong communication and writing skills
Detail-oriented, task-driven and organized.
Must be able to multitask and prioritize.
Passion in CSR and PR as well as media and entertainment.
Familiar with social media platforms and WarnerMedia group platforms including HBO, TNT, TBS, Cartoon Network, WB, etc.
Familiarity with the evolving entertainment, media and technology landscape. (Desired)
Interest in nonprofit and relevant cause-related initiatives. (Desired)
Interest in volunteerism and events. (Desired)

Internship Program
Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for full duration of the internship.
Summer 2021 program dates are June 7th – August 13th; must be available for full program duration.
Must be able to accommodate full-time schedule (35-40 hours/week) for full program duration.
Fully remote/virtual experience; company owned laptop provided for the duration of the internship program.
Salary based on office location; relocation is not provided.
This position is targeted toward upperclassmen and graduate students.

The Perks
Hands-on work with passionate, talented team members in your field
Networking opportunities with industry-leading professionals
Engaging events including executive speakers sessions, professional development workshops, and more
Opportunity to join the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands
Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

ABOUT US

RepairSmith is on a mission to deliver convenient auto repair everywhere. The company's at-home service offers car owners complete, convenient repair and maintenance service, upfront prices before booking, and five-star quality service all at an affordable price. RepairSmith delivers repair and scheduled maintenance on-location for fleet owners to maximize vehicle utilization and consolidate costs.
Founded in 2018, RepairSmith is based in Los Angeles and offers service across 550+ cities. All RepairSmith mechanics are employees of the company and are equipped with quality tools and parts to deliver a five-star service experience. The company is backed by Daimler AG.
RepairSmith has been recognized by Built In LA as one of the 'Best Places to Work,' and awarded the 'Business Transformation Award' by the Association for Corporate Growth in Los Angeles. RepairSmith's technicians have been named 'Essential Worker Hero of the Year' by the Consumer World Awards.
To learn more, visit www.RepairSmith.com and follow the company on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest and YouTube.
THE JOB:
Come join a growing start-up! We are looking for an efficient Human Resources (HR) Coordinator to undertake a variety of HR administrative duties as needed. You will facilitate daily HR functions like keeping track of employees’ records, file maintenance, new hire onboarding and being the main point of contact for employees.
The ideal candidate will have a broad knowledge of Human Resources as well as general administrative responsibilities. You will be able to work autonomously and efficiently to ensure the end-to-end running of HR projects and operations. To succeed in this role, you should be familiar using HR software and tools.
WE WILL DEPEND ON THIS PERSON TO:
Responding to internal and external HR related inquires or requests and provide assistance
Redirect HR related calls or distribute correspondence to the appropriate person of the team
Maintain records of personnel-related data (payroll, personal information, leaves, turnover rates etc.) in both paper and the database and ensure all employment requirements are met
Assist supervisors in performance management procedures
Perform orientations, onboarding and update records with new hires
Help in payroll preparation and timecards
Prepare, manage and store paperwork for HR policies and procedures
Answer employees’ questions and provide requested information
Manage monthly HR newsletter and weekly new hire email
Own the HR Instapage and Sapling HR page
Maintain schedule and coordinate calendar activities
Handle all employee verifications, wage verification, unemployment forms
Create reports as needed
Performs other duties as assigned
WHAT YOU BRING:
Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field required
At least three years’ experience working in human resources
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work autonomously
Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate
Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality
Thorough knowledge of employment-related laws and regulations
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software
Proficiency with or the ability to quickly learn the organization’s HRIS and talent management systems
WORKING WITH US:
Competitive salary (DOE)
Generous paid vacation time
Work from home capabilities
100% company paid medical, dental and vision insurance
Casual atmosphere and great people to work alongside
Interviews will take place after resumes have been screened for minimum requirements. Please note that this position is not restricted solely to the responsibilities listed above and that the job scope and responsibilities are subject to change.

Life at ScreenCloud
At ScreenCloud we see the potential where others don't.
Digital screens could one day be as big a part of our lives as the web is today. Our simple digital signage software lifts information out of the places it lives and transforms it into beautiful, screen ready content. Working on everyday consumer hardware, ending clunky digital signage that could only be done by IT. We empower business owners, HR managers and technical teams to create digital signage that changes the way they sell, think and work. It’s quite the adventure.
We’re very proud of our product, but it is our people, and shared values, which will take us where other companies can’t go. We have hubs in London, Belfast, Bangkok and Los Angeles, alongside people working remotely all over the world. This means finding lots of ways to come together, like our annual company retreat, monthly All Hands and weekly WIPs. We treat people like adults as standard, which means freedom to work how, and where, you feel best, and an equal responsibility to do great work.
Coming from different cultural backgrounds (20 nationalities!), we’ve learned to cherish each other’s interests. Some of us enjoy the joy of daily running and looking after our dogs, whilst some of us live for the thrill of boxing, rock climbing or swimming with sharks.

Key experience we’re looking for:
Excellent communicator
Customer focused and target driven
Ability to handle pressure and juggle multiple responsibilities
High degree of flexibility, camaraderie and independence
A passionate problem solver
Ideally, previous experience in a fast-paced Customer Service Environment and a proven technical ability
Requirements
Respond to customer inquiries to ScreenCloud customers around the world
Own customer issues to the point of resolution, keeping our customers updated and ensure all information is logged and tracked
Empathetic customer communication and understanding of their priorities
Work across multiple teams and communicate our customers needs to the appropriate team
Identify key improvement areas

If you also ask yourself these questions, then we should definitely meet!
What are my customers telling me?
How well do I understand my company's business and our end product?
Why do customers find value in us?
Am I constantly developing my skills?
Company Values
TRUSTING
We only employ bright, engaged, ambitious grown-ups with a talent for what they do. The upshot of this? We trust our team’s integrity at all times, which means no “clocking in and clocking out”. We encourage home-working and don’t limit ourselves to our employees who are living within a commutable distance from one of our hubs.
TRANSPARENCY
We pride ourselves on this value, whether it’s sharing our numbers (warts and all) with our employees or giving open and transparent feedback, we aren't in the market for hidden agendas and elephants in rooms
UNCONVENTIONAL
We want to disrupt the world of digital signage and how physical spaces connect with technology and communicate. We don’t conform to what has already been done and we question the status quo - there can be a better way!
BRAVE
In taking on new challenges that might feel uncomfortable, in our thinking and in having open and honest conversations with each other and our customers.
And all of these should be done with utmost INTEGRITY. We are honest, consistent and fair in everything we do.
-
So let’s have a chat!
If it’s not the job you’re looking for, at least it will be an enriching experience, we promise.
Check our founders' podcast for a sneak peek into our culture.

Unlimited Annual Leave
Remote-friendly Working
Flexible Working Hours
401k
Working from Home Fund
Commuter Benefits
Consumer Discounts
Enhanced Parental Leave
Personal Development Fund
Private Medical Insurance (Life Insurance, Dental and Vision)

WHO WE ARE & WHAT WE DO

Truvani is a health and wellness brand that has one clear mission: create products people use in their daily lives with CLEAN ingredients.

Many companies claim it. We actually mean it.

Our co-founder Vani Hari, better known as The Food Babe, started out as an activist who wanted to hold big companies accountable for what they put into their products. And she made tremendous progress with the help of her online following dubbed "The Food Babe Army."

But after years of fighting, she realized that the only way to make a truly lasting change in the food system is to compete with these big companies head-to-head.

So, she launched Truvani. We are a fast paced, high-growth health and wellness company that is looking to work with talented, ambitious people who want to create the best health and wellness products.

ABOUT THE POSITION

Truvani is looking for a skilled Call Center Manager with sales experience. Our Call Center Manager will take the lead on scaling a system and team for outbound sales calls. Our team calls past customers and will have between 10-15 reps at the time this position is filled. Our goal is to have 30-50 reps by the end of 2021.

Our Call Center Manager should have exceptional leadership, communication, interpersonal, and sales skills, as well as comprehensive knowledge of our products and our mission.

OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE


Experienced in leading an outbound sales team.
Strong coaching and leadership skills with a profound ability to motivate employees.
Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and sales skills.
Goal-oriented and results-driven. Lives by the numbers!
Possess an understanding of the Truvani mission, our products, and the issues representatives and our customers are facing.
Experienced with Five9 and Shopify a plus.


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE


Maximizing our systems for outbound sales calls that get results. This includes researching customer base to find the best leads and creating offers that will entice them to buy.
Coaching and leading call center team for outbound sales calls.
Working with our hiring and training team to identify and train quality reps.
Writing scripts and tracking the results for outbound sales calls.
Providing leadership and vision to your team; developing objectives for day-to-day activities, long-term goals, and representative expectations.
Identifying and communicating areas of needed training and/or policy changes to help your team better serve our customers.
Scheduling and leading team meetings to troubleshoot ways to improve processes and performance.
Promoting a positive customer service culture to meet and exceed the needs of customers.
Create and implement a commission structure for our Call Center Representatives


THE NITTY GRITTY


Full time market-based compensation based on experience
Health benefits offered after 60 days
Paid time off and paid holidays
Position is available immediately and will remain open until filled
This is a permanent position with an opportunity to grow within the company (so we would like to hire someone that is awesome and is excited about being a part of our team).

We're looking for an activewear and sneakers Strategist to join WGSN’s Active apparel and footwear content team. The role is an integral part of WGSN Fashion’s content function, it will be based remotely in West Coast America, working with our global team and reporting into the Active Senior Strategist.
The Active Strategist is passionate about the activewear, sports and sneaker market. You'll demonstrate a good understanding of trend forecasting, design, market analysis and new performance innovations. You will be from a fashion design, research, trend concept or buying background and have had a maximum of two to three years’ experience, commensurate with a junior role in a brand, manufacturer or retailer. You will have a clear understanding and enthusiasm of how data and analytics are playing an increasingly important role in trend forecasting.
Key Responsibilities
You'll primarily focus on personal content creation
Researching, creating and delivering world class, visually inspiring, solution driven content, in visual, written, video or presentation format
Forecasting and tracking with quantitative and qualitative data across global markets, demographics and all levels of the active apparel and footwear sector. You should be just as interested in Target as you are in Off White or Salomon
Understanding, covering and delivering visual and written information on a wide range of Active areas including: colour, materials, womenswear, menswear and footwear
Producing presentations of research and analysis, you will be delivering internally and externally to WGSN’s global clients
Working with WGSN’s consultancy business Mindset, when required, to deliver bespoke research, insight and workshops to clients
Travelling nationally and internationally (when possible) to cover industry trade shows, conferences and other events as required
Acting as an ambassador for WGSN nationally and internationally (when possible) by speaking at global conferences, seminars and events when required
Working with the WGSN commercial teams to support client relationships by sharing and presenting our analyses and responding to client input
Delivering traffic growth by consistently evaluating internal data and client feedback to improve content standards and relevance
Contributing to overall content team objectives and accountable for specific personal content goals
Providing quotes for press and broadcast media as required
Brief and manage freelancers on specific projects when required
Your Experience
A strong knowledge of the activewear and sneaker industry, and the ability to pin-point trends that will impact these industries and their consumers
Proficient use of Adobe Illustrator to create CADs for design direction
You will have a strong command of written English and the ability to deliver concise copy, making the complex simple and actionable
Demonstrates an understanding of design processes to drive consumer focused innovation and future trend aesthetics
An understanding of the role data and analytics plays in commercial success, with experience analysing data
An understanding of the role consumer insights plays in trend forecasting, design and commercial relevance and success
Technical knowledge of performance textiles and materials
Ability to take ownership of personal assignments, prioritise workload and provide support to other members of the team when needed
Excellent organisation, communication and collaboration skills with the ability to work within an international team to ensure production standards, reports or outputs are a consistently high standard and submitted on time
An ability to present trend concepts to internal and external audiences
Proven ability to build strong working relationships with Global Sales, Client Services and Marketing to help facilitate sales and engagement
Excellent market knowledge and awareness of customer needs
Technical skills: Google Workspace, Adobe Creative Suite, Social Media platforms
What We Offer
Our benefits package incorporates what we’re passionate about – unlocking your future, overall well-being and sustainability – whilst giving you control over your benefits.
15 days of holiday per year and an extra day for each year of service up to 20 days
401K – Saving Incentive plan
Medical and Dental Insurance plans
Flexible Spending Accounts
Vision benefits
Great learning and development opportunities
Life Assurance and Disability insurance
Option to opt into the Ascential Shares Scheme
Inclusive Workforce
At Ascential, our goal is to create a culture where individuals of all backgrounds feel comfortable in bringing their authentic selves to work. We want all Ascential people to feel included and truly empowered to contribute fully to our vision and goals.
Everyone who applies will receive fair consideration for employment. We do not discriminate based upon race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.
For more information on our culture, visit Ascential.com.
About WGSN
We offer insights and inspiration from around the globe. We help our customers stay ahead and informed through trend forecasting and data science. We believe inspiration comes from the monumental and the mundane.
If you’re passionate about fashion and lifestyle this is a great place to be, giving you the opportunity to work with the world's most creative trend experts, designers, editors, account managers, marketers, product developers, customer service experts and much more in a meritocratic, high performance company.
WGSN is an Ascential brand. Ascential is a specialist, global, information company that helps the world’s most ambitious businesses win in the digital economy.

6crickets is a highly promising high-tech startup with the mission to bring the best K-12 enrichment to every student through advanced technologies for districts, schools, enrichment providers, and parents. 6crickets is founded by top technologists and business professionals who are passionate parents, former program directors, and school volunteers. With tremendous success in serving 2.3M enrichment hours for students in 25 states, we are expanding our out-of-school enrichment solutions nationwide.Job Description: We are looking for a Partnership Development Manager (PDM) who share our mission and core values (6crickets.com/about). A successful candidate should be high-energy, creative, hands-on, customer-obsessed and understand school or school district sales to rapidly interest them and onboard them to adopt 6crickets’ after-school enrichment management solutions and tools. In the process, you will have opportunities to shape our business model design, influence product development directions, fully exercise your leadership skills and become a key leader at 6crickets.The PDM will conduct lead generation activities with a focus on introducing and promoting 6crickets’ enrichment solutions. Additionally, the PDM guides prospects through the initial phases of needs assessment, issue/challenge identification, and demo/trial process. Partnership Development work is primarily through web sessions, email and phone. Infrequent travel may be required for sales meetings, conferences or client visits. The PDM’s primary objectives are lead generation, lead qualification, pipeline development, and closure of new opportunities. They are responsible for CRM maintenance, implementing sales strategy, and communicating relevant feedback to management. Employees will be operating in an atmosphere where the theme is it’s not about me, it’s about us and generosity towards peers, customers, and the community is expected.Cover letter: If interested, please send your resume and cover letter to hiring at 6crickets dot com. Please also answer the following questions in your cover letter:(1) Are you looking for a full-time position?(2) How does a position at 6crickets fit your career ambition?(3) Do you think our enrichment management tool (www.6crickets.com/school-enrichment) could be useful for many schools or districts that you know or through the country? What are the challenges in its adoption at public schools or districts or private schools?(4) If you were to make sales to this service, what would your approach and steps be? How do you envision to manage the long term relationship with the lead?(5) What CRM tools have used before?(6) Could you write a first pitch email to a school or district about 6crickets' after-school enrichment management tool (www.6crickets.com/school-enrichment)?(7) 6crickets is an early stage startup. Company
At Intercare, our mission is to empower families through exceptional care. Intercare Therapy is an autism services health care company that was founded in 1979 and is growing rapidly, with almost 800 employees spread throughout twelve offices across five states. We serve almost 900 individuals of all ages who are diagnosed with autism and/or related disorders, and both our clinical and business operations adhere to learning and behavior management principles based on the science of applied behavior analysis (ABA).

At Intercare, we focus on culture, great clinical work, integrity, communication, and adaptability. We prioritize staff satisfaction and are proud to be the highest rated established ABA organization on Glassdoor.

Position summary
As Intercare continues to pursue our mission and grow into new markets, we are looking for a Strategy and Operations Manager. The Strategy and Operations team works directly with our leadership team to drive forward mission-critical initiatives and shape the strategy for the business. We’re looking for a mission-focused self-starter to join us as we build out our team—someone who can solve big problems while thinking practically to ensure seamless implementation at the ground level. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work closely with the leadership of a fast-growing organization and contribute to our mission of empowering families through exceptional care.

This role would report to VP of Operations and Strategy, with regular exposure to the President/COO, CEO, and executive leadership team. Role will be 100% remote in near term, with potential to transition back to flexible office time based in Los Angeles (when it is safe to do so).

Key responsibilities Drives critical strategy projects based on business needs, ranging from market growth strategy to business development to operational improvement Oversees implementation and adoption of new technology platforms, working closely with other departments to ensure consistent platform adoption Incubates and launch new functions, such as business development, while preparing them for transition into the broader org Gathers and analyzes data to drive business decisions and translate into compelling presentations for stakeholders Conducts user research, designs surveys, and synthesizes insights to inform key strategic decisions and product offering design Conducts internal and external research to identify efficiency gaps and proposes solutions and/or workflow updates to address these gaps Designs complex processes and collaborates with stakeholders to develop an implementation and communications plan Defines and gains cross-functional buy-in for performance metrics to establish project success
 Reviews data post-implementation to measure success and participates in defining standards of improvement success Sets project roadmaps and works across broad stakeholder groups to move projects forward, participating in and leading change management activities

Required skills and experience Bachelor’s degree, MBA or Master’s preferred 3-5 years of experience in Management Consulting, healthcare operations, or similar experience Collaborative approach to problem-solving and ability to work with diverse stakeholders to get to the right answer Comfort with ambiguity and working in a fast-changing environment Experience implementing technology systems and guiding service organizations through change Demonstrated ability to translate data into compelling insights Outstanding written, oral, and presentation skills Experience with tools such as Smartsheet and Asana, and project management preferred Experience and high proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Project
Learn more about us on YouTube!
If you have a BCBA and have experience in any of the following fields, we encourage you to apply:
Behavior Analyst, Autism, Social Learning, Social Skills, Developmental Condition, Psychology, Sociology, Social Services, Children, ABA
Intercare Therapy will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring (Ban the Box) Ordinance.
Intercare Therapy supports a diverse workforce and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

About the Role*Mana is seeking a Business Development and Partnerships manager to join its award-winning (currently remote) animation studio. We’re passionate about creating animated content for brands and agencies that leaves a lasting impression and even though we're small, our creative ambitions for the studio are big.**You will be responsible for Mana’s financial success and growth, but we are not simply looking for someone to do sales. As a core member of the executive team you will take part in all important decision making. You will be strategizing with the studio’s founder and Creative Director how Mana can become the market leader in our specific segments in the US within two years. Ambitious? Sure, but with all the creative and technical knowledge and processes in-house to produce better animations at competitive prices, what else is left than forming a great growth, sales and marketing strategy and executing it with passion?**Your actions and success will directly impact - and be immediately visible in - the growth of our team and those supporting you. We are seeking someone who is eager to learn everything there is to learn about the industry, and is truly committed to the success of the studio. In return, we are committed to your growth and this role comes with the right incentives and growth possibilities to reflect that.**Requirements: A bachelor’s degree.2+ years prior sales and/or business development experience in an agency or creative studio environment.Great networking skills and a friendly, social nature.You know who to target at advertising and marketing agencies as well as at enterprise clients and you know how to approach them.A great sense of responsibility and ownership.You feel comfortable picking up the phone and calling potential clients.A passion for and/or experience with creative productions is a plus.Experience with or knowledge of the animation industry is a big plus, but not essential.Interest in working and growing in a collaborative, creative, and often fast-paced environment.ResponsibilitiesBuild new relations and partnerships with companies and agencies around the US and nurture old ones.Create a business development plan for expanding Mana’s client base and attracting higher-budget clients.Work with the founder to optimize business development processes.Hold discovery (video) calls with potential clients.Maintain and grow a stable inflow of projects that results in cashflow to grow the business.Update lead information and track prospects in our CRM.Brief project managers to make sure they have all the necessary information to kick off projects.Engage in brainstorming sessions with the rest of the management team to solve studio challenges.If this sounds great to you, please apply in the link below: *https://forms.gle/xUhrspNX1zQZbsXK8Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)Flexible scheduleHealth insurancePaid time offSchedule:Monday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Commission payCOVID-19 considerations:This is a remote position.Work Location:Fully RemoteCompany's website:www.mana.tvCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Enterprise Account Executive- South West
Sitecore is the global leader in experience management software that combines content management, commerce, and customer insights. The Sitecore Experience CloudTM empowers marketers to deliver personalized content in real time and at scale across every channel—before, during, and after a sale. More than 5,200 brands––including American Express, Comcast, Chevron, Kraft Heinz, Humana, Procter and Gamble, and Mondelēz - have trusted Sitecore to deliver the personalized interactions that delight audiences, build loyalty, and drive revenue.
Sitecore is currently looking for an Enterprise Account Executive to join our team. This person will help create and manage business development for the Sitecore product’s in the South West region.
Position Summary:
As an Enterprise Account Executive, you will need to understand how to sell web-based solutions, not just software. You will bring value to the sales process through your advanced understanding of key business considerations and challenges and should feel comfortable talking with all levels of a client organization including the C – suite, Marketing, or IT.
This position requires free thinking and self-motivated top performers. Sitecore is in the unique position of being well established and best of breed in our industry while still being young enough for you to have major impact on the rapid and explosive growth of our firm. This position calls for a driven person who thrives on winning new business, understanding the complex business challenges of your prospects and clearly communicating the value of this solution to various client audiences.
Responsibilities:
Develop territory strategies to grow business regionally.
Target and land new accounts in addition to managing existing partners and clients.
Promote the Sitecore suite of solutions through direct and indirect methods
Manage and grow a strong Network and oversee the complete sales cycle
Participate in industry trade shows and conferences
Job Qualifications:
5+ years’ experience selling to an enterprise environment, ideally selling Content Management, Customer Experience, Commerce, or Digital Asset Management (DAM) technologies preferred
Proven Experience in meeting and exceeding quota revenue targets
Ability to demonstrate technology in person and via web presentations
Experience working in a channel sales model with Digital Agencies, System Integrators and Web Development organizations in the South West Region
Possess depth in consultative/solution selling environments
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Required to work well under pressure, adhere to deadlines while maintaining a high standard of professionalism
Work well independently and collaboratively
University Degree/College Diploma or equivalent experience
This role can be located remote in any City in the South West a major airport (i.e. San Diego, Los Angeles, Phoenix)

After an offer is made and accepted, E-verify will be utilized to establish your identity and employment eligibility as required by the U.S. Department of Homeland Security.
Sitecore is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity without unlawful regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other local legally protected characteristic.

Full Job Description
LIVEKINDLY, the premier lifestyle brand focused on sustainability, plant-based foods and conscious consumerism is seeking an experienced Account Executive / Account Director to lead our growing team.

You will report to the Head of Sales & Brand Partnerships and drive revenue generation for the company. You will have proven business acumen, an ability to identify, develop, and negotiate strategic partnerships. You will have a track record of exceeding targets and executing strategic deals, focusing primarily on digital content packages. You will work together cross-functionally to develop new ideas for brand partnerships to help drive revenue growth and hit sales targets.
The ideal candidate can handle stress in the face of challenges and push self and others to excel in a dynamic environment. And be adept at working closely with leaders in operations, marketing, technology and editorial content.
Qualified candidates should be passionate about growing the sustainability and plant-based movement and ideally, have experience working within both a startup culture and mainstream, international digital media company.
This is a remote position (ideally in New York or Los Angeles) making exceptional communication and collaboration skills a must, as well as the ability to motivate, inspire, and support an international team who are passionate, creative, and mission-aligned. Previous experience in digital media and/or content marketing sales is imperative.
Please submit a cover letter and resume in pdf form for consideration. Applicants who do not submit a cover letter will not be considered. Applicants must have the legal right to work in the USA.
Overview
You will drive revenue generation for the company and be responsible for leading the sales team. If you’re a results-oriented and mission-aligned leader who thrives in a dynamic environment and keen to make an impact on our world for the better, this is the role for you.
Core Responsibilities:
Identifying, evaluating and prioritizing opportunities that realize large revenue opportunities
Deal formulation, negotiation and contract execution
Identifying and nurturing long-term partnerships
Prioritizing and managing multiple strategic initiatives concurrently
Build, lead and manage territory strategy
Drives results and manages team performance with accountability against business metrics
Provide a strong link between the company and external partners and other organizations in your market
Serve as a partner in driving overall business performance with the other functional leaders: operations, marketing, technology and editorial content
Exceed sales goals
Qualifications:
5+ years relevant experience in the digital media industry, including 2 to 3 years direct sales experience
Proven ability to meet or exceed sales goals and identify new revenue opportunities
Ability to initiate and lead business discussions and drive ongoing engagements with C-Suite level partners
Ability to support and prioritize multiple projects and complex workstreams
Strong business acumen and financial background
Excellent influencing, decision-making, problem-solving, and conflict resolution skills
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, both via technology and in-person
A passion for the sustainability and plant-based movement required
Digital Media and Content sales experience required
Past experience working within a remote company an asset
Past experience scaling a startup an asset

MetaSense is creating an outside sales team who can work from anywhere in the world...
As you can imagine, we're growing like crazy and we need motivated and driven, take-charge salespeople to expand on this success.
Our sales representative team has a very clear and realistic path to make $100K+ per year ($80K+ in your first year); with a product that almost sells itself. This salesperson model has been created by life-long salespeople, not a CPA or CFO. Together, our team carefully crafted this role and designed it based on creating “the dream” sales role that you’d want to stay in forever.
Our #1 goal for you as a salesperson is to help you live your ideal life, including:
Uncapped Earning Potential- We want you to make so much money you don’t know what to do with it.
Time Freedom- You need to have time to enjoy your financial freedom. What good does it do to make a bunch of money but have no time to enjoy life?
Flexibility- We don’t believe in sales managers… We believe in mentors!!! You will have your own performance coach, accountability coach and onboarding specialist who will be there to support you as you grow. Get things done on your schedule… no more punching a clock.
Industry and Company
If you're not consistently getting website traffic, there could be a number of issues preventing you from growing. Your SEO may be weak, the user experience may not be up to par, or maybe your content may not be attracting your target audience. Metasense crafts an intuitive user experience for prospective customers on your E-commerce store with a key focus on conversion and retention. Regardless of how complex your business needs are, we have the expertise to build a genuine business solution that helps you succeed.

MetaSense Marketing is a Full-Service Digital Marketing Agency that takes pride in creating successful, comprehensive marketing plans and is the only company in the world to offer the patented iMetaDex™ tool. The phenomenal iMetaDex™ tool helps search engines index your site quickly and display your site more effectively in their results. Our work ranges from offering high quality, cost effective, reliable, result-oriented solutions for a global market. Our unique web solutions will ensure increased efficiency and a competitive advantage for your business.

We have a ridiculous amount of support for our sales team including:
Personal and group coaching… designed to take your skills and abilities to the next level.
Technology tools and automation created to allow you to get rid of the mundane, repetitive tasks that bog down most salespeople.
The time to dominate this market segment is now, and it’s time for you to come and show off what you can accomplish!
Key Responsibilities
Respond in a timely manner to all leads.
Initiate outbound efforts (call, text, email) each day to prospects.
Qualify prospects, gauge interest, and schedule sales calls.
Collaborate with the team on improving prospecting strategies.
Ability to identify & source information on prospective clients.
Qualifications
Strong company culture fit.
Ability to receive inbound and make outbound phone calls via cell or internet (wired ethernet) in a quiet environment without interruptions.
Strong listening skills and excellent phone demeanor.
Technologically proficient; not necessarily an expert, but knowledgeable.
Excellent written and verbal communication.
CRM experience is a HUGE plus.
Other Information
Compensation: 100% commission - High Six Figures is achievable ($160K+), anything less than Six Figures would be considered a failure. There is no ceiling to your compensation plan
Bonus opportunities
Working from anywhere in the world
Job Type: Full-time
We appreciate your interest in joining our team!

About us:

The only predictable thing about life is that it’s wildly unpredictable. That’s where we come in.
When life does what it does best, customers turn to goPuff to deliver their everyday essentials, and to get through their day & night, work day and weekend.
We’re assembling a team of thinkers, dreamers & risk-takers...the kind of people who know the value of peace of mind in an unpredictable world. (And people who love snacks.)
Like what you’re hearing? Welcome to goPuff.
The goPuff Fam is committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply. We are an equal employment opportunity employer.
Overview:

goPuff is the go-to solution for immediate everyday needs, fulfilling customer orders of cleaning and home products to over-the-counter medications to food and drinks, and in some markets, alcohol - in just minutes.
We’re seeking a Business Operations Manager to work closely with the leadership team on keeping the wheels of a complex organization turning. Your day-to-day will support aggressive expansion efforts at a rapidly growing, geographically distributed, well-capitalized start-up. You will support process improvement, compliance, research, analysis, strategic initiatives, marketing and user acquisition, corporate finance and the sourcing and procurement of equipment, personnel and materiel.
Your duties will place you across retail and corporate office locations in Austin, TX, meaning you’ll need to execute equally well in the field as well as execute against corporate initiatives. You will become the ‘go-to person’ for the operations team in order to make our operations more effective. We’re looking especially for someone who is willing to roll up their sleeves and get their hands dirty across the operation - if you’re looking for a remote desk job, this is not the role for you!
Responsibilities:
Invent, rebuild, and project manage to successful completion complex work-flows driving, growing, and expanding operations across the country to support an aggressive growth strategy
Become a subject-matter-expert in compliance related to our multi-state/municipal food service operation and execute tasks related to organizational compliance with Federal, State and Local legislation
Coordinate, source, and project-manage the design, financing, buildout, and delivery of Bandit retail assets from conception, design, buildout via third party vendors, and delivery to market
Perform and maintain deep data analysis as directed by the operations team to include: employee retention, cost of employee and customer acquisition, product mix by market, return on invested capital and/or return on deployed capital assets, capital asset serviceability and maintenance, and other projects related to key performance indicators
Support strategic and operational planning with a nuanced understanding of our customer, keen insight into our brand and value proposition, and the ability to translate and operationalize the above
Develop analytical frameworks to support business decision-making
Qualifications:
2 – 5 years as an analyst and/or associate in investment banking or consulting, or within a business intelligence or strategy role in other complex industries.
High-growth operating experience, especially at an early-stage company is strongly preferred.
Strong analytical skills, comfortability with data, and the ability to synthesize quantitative analysis into an effective business case for action.
The ability to connect deeply and empathize with multiple types of people, from a software engineer to a barista.
Comfortable addressing challenges with ambiguous or incomplete information.
Strong organizational skills and extreme attention to detail.
Have the maturity to maintain confidentiality and discretion, and know when to escalate to the right stakeholders, as you will be in the middle of everything.
Honest and direct without any ego.
Demonstrated ability to manage priorities and projects in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Initiative and bias for action, on-time delivery, and operational excellence.
Ability to research, comprehend, and recommend actions on complex compliance issues.
Willingness to travel, especially within the state of Texas
Flexible and very comfortable with ambiguity and change

JobTitle: Remote Outside Sales Representative - Matchstick Marketing
Text: Matchstick Marketing (https://matchstick.marketing/) specializes in branding strategy, viral campaigns and innovative hyper-targeted advertising techniques. Matchstick believes that digital marketing is not just about the creative aspects, but about building a marketing technology infrastructure that dynamically focuses on the brand identity. Matchstick Marketing’s founder, Joshua Feuerstein, has over 2.6 MILLION followers on Facebook and over 4 BILLION video views!As you can imagine, we're growing like crazy and we need motivated, enthusiastic and driven, take-charge salespeople to expand on this success. We are building a team of 100% commission sales representatives!Our 100% commission-based team has a very clear and realistic path to make $100K+ per year ($80K+ in your first year); based on selling as few as 3 agreements per month with a product that almost sells itself. This salesperson model has been created by life-long salespeople, not a CPA or CFO. Together, our founders carefully crafted this role and designed it based on creating “the dream” sales role.Our #1 goal for you as a salesperson at Matchstick is to help you live your ideal life, including:Uncapped Earning Potential- We want you to make so much money you don’t know what to do with it.Time Freedom- You need to have time to enjoy your financial freedom. What good does it do to make a bunch of money but have no time to enjoy life?Flexibility- You can do this job from any location that has an internet connection. No more punching a time clock, get things done on your own schedule. We don’t believe in sales managers, we believe in mentors! You will have your own performance coach, accountability coach and onboarding specialist who will be there to support you as you grow.Key ResponsibilitiesInitiate outbound efforts (call, text, email, LinkedIn) each day to prospects.Qualify prospects, gauge interest, and schedule sales calls.Respond in a timely manner to all leads.Collaborate with the team on improving prospecting strategies.Identify & source information on prospective clients.Participate in negotiations and sales.QualificationsStrong company culture fit.Strong listening skills and excellent phone demeanor.Technologically proficient; not necessarily an expert, but knowledgeable.Excellent written and verbal communication.Web-Cam enabled computer or laptop, Ability to receive inbound and make outbound phone calls via cell or internet (wired ethernet), in a quiet environment without interruptions.CRM experience is a HUGE plus.Previous Digital Marketing experience preferred.Previous cold calling experience preferred.Other InformationCompensation: 100% commission.Work from anywhere in the world.Job Type: CommissionWe appreciate your interest in joining Matchstick Marketing!Job Type: Full-timePay: $38,318.00 - $146,703.00 per yearCOVID-19 considerations:Position is 100% RemoteExperience:Sales Experience: 3 years (Preferred)This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Autonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little directionCompany's website:https://matchstick.marketing/COVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

Job Posting: Western States Program Manager EVHybridNoire is seeking a Western States Program Manager to assist with our organization’s state and local policy and program work across the western U.S. The ideal candidate will have experience and interest in all aspects of e-mobility and transportation advocacy, including communications and public outreach. They will be deeply committed to advancing issues of equity and justice, and have at least some understanding of how those issues intersect with transportation. This position is a great opportunity for an entrepreneurial individual to join a small but quickly growing organization, take on a lot of responsibility from Day 1, and make a difference in one of today’s most exciting issue areas.About EVHybridNoire EVHybridNoire is the nation’s largest network of diverse electric vehicle drivers and enthusiasts. A Black-led organization with a passionate and dedicated team, our mission is to advance EVs and other e-mobility solutions--and ensure those solutions are inclusive and equitable. We engage with communities often left out of e-mobility discussions, advocate for e-mobility solutions in underserved communities, and shift the narrative about e-mobility to be more inclusive of diverse populations. Specifically, our work involves a mix of grassroots engagement, media outreach, research, speaking engagements, and advocacy and decision-maker education. That work spans many aspects of e-mobility and equity, including climate justice, workforce development, public health, multimodal mobility and creative financing of e-mobility solutions. We’re currently focused on growing our organization to meet growing demand for our advocacy efforts and thought leadership.Job Responsibilities The Western States Program Manager, who will be based in California and reports to the Deputy Director, is responsible for the following:Coordinating the development and implementation of multiple e-mobility project and campaign plans in several different cities and statesRepresenting EVHybridNoire at coalition tables, conferences and in meetings with policymakers and partners, and advocating for EVHybridNoire’s prioritiesHelping to facilitate public outreach efforts, including focus groups and listening sessions with target audiences, to understand public awareness and attitudes around e-mobilityDrafting and submitting opinion pieces, research summaries and action alerts to media outlets, online forums and EVHybridNoire’s citizen membersKeeping abreast of policy and e-mobility market developments in multiple states, to help ensure we direct our resources toward where they are most needed and can have the biggest impactWorking with our team, as well as with our partners and decision-maker contacts, to develop policy proposals that advance EVHybridNoire’s prioritiesBuilding and nurturing working relationships with decision-makers, advocacy partners and opinion leaders in the e-mobility spaceDrafting updates and reports on our work for internal and external audiencesQualifications We’re seeking candidates who have:At least 3-5 years of related experience in transportation or a similar fieldKnowledge of transportation electrification broadly, and some understanding of how e-mobility intersects with issues of equity, diversity and justiceExperience applying an equity lens to transportation advocacy and campaignsAn understanding of policy-making processes broadly, and the ability to think strategically about how to navigate those processesExperience in communications and/or grassroots public outreach workSome existing relationships within the transportation and equity arenas, especially in the western U.S.An entrepreneurial and self-driven approach to problem solvingA proven ability to juggle and complete multiple tasks with minimal supervision (ideally in a remote working environment)Fluency in both Spanish and English is preferredExcellent written and verbal communication skills, with a great attention to detailAnnual salary range is $58,000 - $70,000, commensurate with experience. EVHybridNoire is an equal opportunity employer with a justice-centered mission, and we make a particular effort to recruit people of color to apply for open positions.How to Apply Please send a cover letter and resume to Nathan Willcox, Deputy Director. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, and we are looking to fill this position as soon as possible.Job Type: Full-timePay: $58,000.00 - $70,000.00 per yearSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayWork Location:Fully RemoteCompany's website:www.EVHybridNoire.comCompany's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/EVHybridNoireCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

JobTitle: New Business SW Sales AM- SoCal
Text:
Job Title:
New Business SW Sales AM- SoCal

Location:
US, California, Irvine
Role Overview:
Our New Business Account Managers provide a variety industry-leading security solutions found in the McAfee portfolio, where we ensure maximum customer support and satisfaction. Being a part of this sales team, you will partner with our Regional Sales leaders and Global Team to oversee the sales support of McAfee's Enterprise Security product line to Fortune 500 customers within this region. You will grow this territory and maximize revenue, while building future sales pipelines through the demonstration of account and territory planning. This position is located in the Orange County/Irvine area of Southern California and will report to the Director of Enterprise Sales.
About this Role:

Company Overview
From device to cloud, McAfee provides market-leading cybersecurity solutions for both business and consumers. We help businesses orchestrate cyber environments that are truly integrated, where protection, detection, and correction of security threats happen simultaneously. For consumers, McAfee secures your devices against viruses, malware, and other threats, both at home and away. We want to continue to shape the future of cybersecurity by working together to build best in class products and solutions.
Exceed "New Business Only" assigned revenue quota (e.g. exceed quota of 3M +)
Grow your territory, maximizing opportunities and the McAfee footprint
Build future sales pipelines through the demonstration of deep account and territory planning
Partner with the Sales Engineering team and other departments within McAfee in closing complex networking-security opportunities at the C-Level
Partner with our other teams in identifying new opportunities outside your primary product portfolio
You will regularly produce and close both software contract and professional service opportunities in the range of $150K-$1MParticipate in sales conference calls, new customer engagements and provide product demonstrations both virtually and in person, demonstrating how McAfee's solutions can provide value to their needs.
Work with the sales leadership team to strategize on sales approaches
Ensure successful on-site product evaluations
Provide Sales expertise through technical and product presentations, product demonstrations, pilot implementations, beta program administration, and ongoing consultation

About you:

You have a background of success capturing new business customers in the Southern California Region.
You have sold security-focused software, cloud and and related professional services to large enterprise organizations
You are both comfortable and successful growing a business remotely within a virtual environment because of Covid-19's global impact
You have existing relationships, established contacts; and the intimate knowledge of our customers current challenges and needs.
Proven customer-centric selling experience to increase revenues and build lasting value to customers
Success working in a multi-tiered, multi-divisional sales organization.
You have 4+ years combined experienced of the above in a high technology environment
Company Benefits and Perks:
We work hard to embrace diversity and inclusion and encourage everyone at McAfee to bring their authentic selves to work every day. We offer a variety of social programs, flexible work hours and family-friendly benefits to all of our employees.
Pension and Retirement Plans
Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage
Paid Time Off
Paid Parental Leave
Support for Community Involvement
We're serious about our commitment to diversity which is why McAfee prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.
Job Type:
Experienced Hire
Primary Location:
US, California, Irvine

Additional Locations:
US, California, Los Angeles

United Dwelling is on a mission to build high-quality and affordable homes for all. We deliver on this promise with a unique solution: by transforming underutilized garages and backyard space into beautiful, smartly designed rental homes, at absolutely no cost to the homeowner. This creates a new, reliable source of income for the homeowner and new housing opportunities for renters who otherwise were previously unable to afford to live in the area.

About the Role
As the Sales Coordinator, you are on the frontlines of our sales operation. You will be responsible for working with homeowners to understand their needs and discover whether United Dwelling is a fit for them. Sales Coordinators are professional, passionate, and confident communicators who are eager to meet sales goals and help us deliver on our mission of creating high-quality, affordable homes for all.

Responsibilities
Be an expert on the United Dwelling mission and service offering.
Qualify inbound leads through phone calls and email.
Identify sales opportunities and schedule in-person consultations for Business Development Representatives.
Outbound lead generation through phone calls, emails, and in-person events.
Report, track, and manage sales activities and results using HubSpot
Achieve monthly and quarterly quotas of qualified opportunities and HC meetings.

Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree preferred, relevant experience required.
Demonstrated success in a professional sales environment.
Self-motivated, initiative driven, and problem-solving mentality.
Thrive in a fast-paced environment, ability to multitask, wear multiple hats, and pitch in where needed.
Comfortable using marketing automation platforms and CRM – HubSpot experience is highly desirable.
Strong work ethic, and eagerness to meet goals.
Excellent communication, writing, and presentation skills.
Exceptional organization skills and multi-tasking skills.
Ability to efficiently work from home or field office when appropriate.
