Mendix is on a mission to enable anyone in any organization – from the marketing coordinator to the software developer to the CEO – to create things that are transformational for their company. We are fundamentally reinventing the way applications are created and we’re reinventing the future of software development. Sounds ambitious, right? We agree.
Not to brag, but nearly 4,000 organizations worldwide, including KLM, Medtronic, Merck, and Philips, rely on Mendix to build web and mobile applications. Thousands of our customers use our platform to delight their clients and empower their employees. It’s no surprise that we’re a recognized Leader by Gartner and Forrester in a red-hot market expected to exceed $21 billion by 2022. Ok, maybe we did want to brag a little. But we’re proud of what we’ve accomplished…and…we’re humble enough to admit that we need you to make us even more effective.
You'll help us drive digital innovation:
Work closely with our global customers in Europe, USA, Australia, Asia, Middle East and Japan
Troubleshoot, debug and propose bug fixes or architectural changes within the Mendix platform or related to customer sided implementation
Work closely with R&D teams on a tactical level to identify structural improvements and improve the customer experience of our platform
Develop solutions (Appstore widgets/modules) for customer issues without clear short-term solution path in the Mendix platform
Understand customer use cases to be an effective liaison between R&D and customer to solve complex technical problems
Take complete ownership of escalations
Mentor and coach team members as we continue to build them out
Identify opportunities to propose new troubleshooting or performance analysis tools for production operations staff
Participate in after-hours on-call rotation for critical customer escalations
Identify improvements in our support processes and tools, both internal and with our partners including SAP, IBM and Siemens
Work in a smart and dynamic team where innovation thrives, and career opportunities are abundant
You're the innovator we need if you:
Love to engage with the customer to solve any challenges they might face and voice their needs and challenges within Mendix
Have a B.S. in Information Systems, Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent
Mendix Developer Certifications a plus
Strong cloud deployment experience
Have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Are passionate about technology and have strong problem solving and analytical skills
Well-organized, flexible and can keep an overview of all your tasks
Have over 5 years of development experience in object-oriented programming languages. Java/JS focus a plus.
Preferably have experience in mobile app development
#LI-CW1
Our Guiding Principles
While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our “MendixBlue” guiding principles. Being “MendixBlue” means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It’s kind of a big deal.
We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, always…you belong here.
We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long term…you belong here.
We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask “what if?” and work to find a way or make one…you belong here.

We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you’re up for learning from your failures…you belong here.
We hear every voice. Inflated egos don’t last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win – regardless of who they come from…you belong here.
We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it done…you belong here.
We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we’re happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you do…you belong here.
Make your career at Mendix.
There are precious few jobs that let you create the future. But you’ll find one at Mendix. We are at a pivotal time in our company’s existence: where rapid growth meets stable funding. This is the time for industrious people to raise their hands to solve the next generation of problems. Mendix is a place where ambitious people can thrive; where you can identify an issue, propose a solution, and build the structure to make it happen.
Important to know: Mendix is a Siemens business, which means we’re backed by the resources and stability of one of the world’s largest and most forward-looking enterprises. Think: job security.
Since our company was founded in 2005, our aim has been to create a great work environment for people at all stages in their careers. That’s why we are so pleased and honored that we were rated a top Cloud Computing Company to work for in 2019, based on feedback from our employees on Glassdoor. With offices in the Netherlands, the UK, Germany, and the US, (and more coming), we provide an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code.

JobTitle: Regional Market Development - Operations and Sales Enablement
Text:
Job Title: Regional Market Development - Operations and Sales Enablement
Requisition ID: 143614BR
Location: US - Remote

What will you do?
The Regional Market Development Manager will develop and execute sales enablement packages to support market development programs. The candidate in this role will need to successfully work within a matrixed organization to manage tactical execution of multi-channel marketing programs and analyze marketing effectiveness to achieve marketing KPIs and other annual operating plan objectives.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Work with our business units and regions to develop sales enablement packages enabling sales team to work high-value leads
Project manage cross-business unit, cross-regional customer segment programs
Manage marketing tactics through LSG marketing execution tools.
Perform analysis of data from marketing campaigns and optimize for future activities.
Conducts data analysis/data mining on internal and external sources of intelligence to provide timely actionable leads to the commercial team on focus marketing initiatives & key product launches.
Manages bi-weekly training for the commercial organization, commercial email newsletter & new inside sales training initiative. This includes working with the North America marketing team & global team to set the schedule; sending invitations; proactively promoting the sessions to maximize attendance; hosting the sessions and following up post-training.
Ensure all sales functions have appropriate tools and training to achieve their goals
Ensure all functions are fully trained (How to position, how to sell and how to handle objections + technical)
Communicates with the appropriate sales function on new products/new tools available, ensuring alignment between Sales channel and BU strategy
Adhere to strict deadlines while keeping projects well organized and optimized.
May perform other related duties as required and/or assigned.
Travel up to 25%.
How will you get there?
Education:
Bachelor's Degree and 4-6 years of prior experience in a Market Development or Marketing Communications role.
Experience:
Highly organized, independent contributor able to deliver on plans and deadlines.
Exhibits good judgment, remains flexible, and quickly responds positively to rapidly changing priorities and circumstances.
Team player who is prepared to go the extra mile to accomplish critical objectives to drive business and financial outcomes.
Exceptional analytical, project management and planning skills necessary.
Strong communication skills, especially in digital channels.
Good analytical, communications—both oral and written, and organizational skills.
Preferred Qualifications:
Expertise with Microsoft Office tools, particularly PowerPoint and Excel, and experience with Power BI preferred.
Experience in digital and social media marketing a plus.
Experience in Bioprocessing/Bioproduction marketing and/or life science industry marketing preferred.
Experience of working with the Salesforce CRM system would also be advantageous.
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $25 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 75,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.

Our Los Angeles, CA office is seeking a highly driven Marketing and Business Development Assistant to provide tactical support in the execution of a wide range of initiatives, including developing and updating practice group materials, proofreading materials, compiling pitch books, creating presentations, executing client events, and supporting internal communications and firm operations. The Assistant will be responsible for supporting the firm’s administrative, operational, and business development goals. The ideal candidate is expected to have excellent written and verbal communication skills and be very detail-oriented.
Founded 70 years ago, Ropers Majeski maintains offices throughout California, as well as in Boston, Las Vegas, New York, Paris and Seattle, with an affiliate office in Hong Kong. We conduct a broad, far-reaching practice offering litigation and transactional services to domestic and international businesses and individuals. We pride ourselves on client relationships, pragmatic results and exceptional value.

This position can be based out of any of our California offices, or be remote from anywhere in the United States assuming the ability to work the required schedule.

Key responsibilities of this position include:Perform various administrative duties, including scheduling, processing invoices, preparing expense reports, etc.Coordinate with appropriate internal resources to provide and other research and information to lawyersPreview and edit internal and external materials to ensure grammatical accuracy and consistencyAssist with the preparation and production of business development presentations, marketing materials, and new business proposalsCoordinate updates to practice materials and lawyer biographies on firm's external website and internal proposal databaseAssist in production and distribution of firm newsletters, client alerts, invitations and announcementsMaintain and update mailing lists in firm marketing database to enable external communicationGather recent matter information from attorneys and advisors, and update and maintain marketing materials and firm experience databaseSupport onboarding efforts for newly hired lawyers and business professionalsAssist with practice and industry-related sponsorships, events, and membershipsHelp to track and evaluate sponsorship opportunities throughout the year and manage the Firm's local and industry-based membershipsTrack inventory of the Firm's branded items and place new orders as necessary

Requirements
The Marketing & Business Development Assistant will meet the following qualifications:Bachelor's degree (B.A. or B.S.) and 1-3 years of related administrative support experienceAttention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneouslyStrong written and verbal communications skillsAbility to work with a variety of personalities, strong interpersonal skills and work ethic to meet the demands of the positionWorking knowledge of Microsoft Office SuiteAbility to learn and use additional software applications (experience management, marketing automation, web tools, ext.)

Professional Development
Do the best work of your career! Join our team and work with industry professionals who are continually expanding their depth of expertise, building partnerships, and offering mentorships along the way. We are dedicated to your professional growth and development. This mid-size firm atmosphere allows you to contribute more and take advantage of learning and growing in an exciting work environment.

Culture & Diversity
At Ropers Majeski, we believe in promoting and encouraging diversity. Cultivating an environment where different backgrounds, beliefs, and perspectives can come together and thrive is vital to the legal profession and integral to our firm’s success. Ropers Majeski respects and values each and every individual contribution to the firm and celebrates everyone’s unique perspective. Women and minorities are encouraged to apply.

Benefits & Perks
In addition to a great work environment, we offer a competitive salary and benefits. Some of our benefits include:Competitive SalaryExcellent Benefits and 401kOpportunity for AdvancementDiscretionary Bonus PotentialPaid Time OffContinuing Education and paid Association FeesProfessional, but business casual work environment

About Sollis Health

Founded in 2016, Sollis is a healthcare services business that is revolutionizing emergency medicine and urgent care. Our 24/7 concierge medical centers can handle acute medical emergencies, advanced imaging needs and simple complaints all in a single location with no wait, so patients receive the smart, simple and stress-free care they deserve. Our flagship center is on the Upper East Side of Manhattan, with a second center in Tribeca, a summer Hamptons service, and an LA office opening Fall 2020.

We now serve over 3,500+ members and have an extraordinarily high renewal rate, because we treat everyone like family and go the extra mile in an often inefficient industry. We are a fast-growing, VC-backed organization that is rapidly expanding across the country. We are looking for energetic and passionate self-starters who are excited about healthcare and want to raise the standards for excellent emergency and urgent care.


Your responsibilities

Sollis is looking for an energetic, highly structured and patient-focused Care Navigator to manage several aspects of our clinical operations and ongoing patient care. Strong project management and exceptional organizational skills are critical. This role could be performed by an administrative individual looking for increased operational experience and has worked in medical settings before.

Specifically, your duties will include:

Organizing physician referrals for patients who need to see specialists in the LA area, surrounding counties, and sometimes globally.
Managing requests for private nursing, hospice and other external care requests. This will require strong perseverance and research skills
Facilitating home imaging for patients via our list of approved providers
Entering data to eCW (our electronic health record) and Salesforce (our CRM)
Schedule: Likely will start Monday-Friday, with expectation that some weekends will be required as we grow.


Skills

To be successful in this role, candidates will demonstrate the following:

Exceptional organizational and project management skills
Excellent attention to detail and a conscientious personality type
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work cross-functionally among departments and teams
Strong database and systems skills, especially with Salesforce and eCW
Ownership for projects and problems to ensure they are executed to the highest standards
Ability to think and work independently, effectively, and efficiently
Ambitious, strong work ethic, and open to new ideas
Be a team player, willing to help with any task, large or small


Experience

We believe extraordinary people come from a variety of backgrounds, but ideally we would expect that you:

A strong administrative leader, who has worked in medical settings before
Looking for a challenging opportunity to help build the operations of a growing business
Previously worked in operations within an urgent care practice, concierge physician office, medical dept or hospital division


Schedule: Full-Time, immediate start. MUST be willing to work some weekends!

Full-Time positions are categorized as employees working more than 35 hours per week for Sollis, and includes:
Competitive Salary
Excellent Health, Dental and Vision Benefits
401k plan with 3% company matching
3 weeks PTO

Key Details:

Full-time role at our LA office
Location: Beverly Hills (potential to work from home)
Reporting to: VP, Patient Experience
Desired start date: ASAP

Mortgage Loan Underwriter II

A Mortgage Loan Underwriter II reviews a mortgage loan portfolio with a credit limit of $650,000 to determine a credit decision as well as compliance with all bank and investor loan-to-value and documentation requirements.

What You Will Be Doing
Confirming maximum loan amount and LTV requirements
Determining earned income amount(s) through analysis of employment verification documentation and/or tax return(s)
Documenting sufficient assets to close
Determining adequacy of credit documentation provided (verifications and supporting data)
Ability to comprehend and accurately interpret credit reports and credit reporting requirements
Analyzing risks and make a final credit decision for the application
Reviewing the loan file for compliance with all regulatory requirements needed at initial application: TIL, good faith estimate, servicing transfer disclosure and authorization
Issuing loan approval/commitment or notice of adverse action in a timely manner

High school diploma or general education degree (GED)
A minimum of four to six years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience
Strong comprehensive working knowledge of underwriting/qualifying requirements for financial institutions and secondary market investors, including FHA, VA, FMHA, Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac and private companies

Overview
Seeking driven Hunters.
ABI Document Support Services is eager to expand the sales division and looking for (100% remote) Regional Sales Executives to join our organization.
As our sales hunter, you will be responsible for generating revenue by growing regional program sales revenue in large LAW FIRMS, discretionary business, proposing firm program pricing and developing staff counsel opportunities.
You will also provide application, product and industry knowledge to all new and existing business opportunities.

Responsibilities

Prospect: On-board new large regional law firms, uncover and develop staff counsel opportunities and cultivate relationships which could grow discretionary business and offer firm program pricing to capture all business.
Duties include:
Cold calling
Preliminary consultative presentations
Consistent team selling strategy and partnering with Vice President of National Sales and Director of National Sales on overall approach.
Activities align with the vision and values of the overall organization, including partnering with Director of National Sales to further support their efforts of successful carrier program implementations.
Eventually candidates will provide presentations to decision makers and key influencers regionally for mid-level carrier and TPA accounts as needed.
On-Board New Firms: Prospect regional law firms, uncover existing carrier opportunities and also qualify firms for program pricing to direct bill and capture records retrieval currently being done in-house.
Regional Clients: Engage with current clients if Account Management Team has lost revenue and proven they’ve done all they can to recapture the business.

Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent industry sales and/or management experience preferred.
5 plus years on consistent success closing and managing high volumes of business and implementing growth strategies preferred.
Must have industry experience selling to law firms/insurance
Must demonstrate extensive knowledge of the insurance and legal industry
Must be able to work 100% remote
QUALIFICATIONS
Must be extremely effective in cold calling and moving a cold client to a close
Must demonstrate the ability to be highly effective at exceeding sales goals
Must be effective at presenting features and benefits to decision makers and end users
Must be highly self-motivated
Must demonstrate collaborative selling and strategizing with all members of ABI Sales and Account Management Team
Must demonstrate good knowledge of the law as it pertains to document retrieval
Must be adaptable and receptive to direction from proven leaders
Strong ability to embrace a vision and make it a reality
Must demonstrate knowledge of Microsoft Offices, Work, Excel, Power Point
WHO WE ARE
ABI Document Support Services is the largest nationwide provider of records retrieval, subpoena services, and document management for the legal and insurance industries. There is no other company in the market that provides the volume of successfully retrieved records or the document management solutions that ABI offers. Our singular focus is records retrieval and the most advanced technology solutions for our clients to manage, analyze and summarize those retrieved records. We are committed to continually raising the bar for cost effective record retrieval and more thorough analysis and summarization.
ABI is an Equal Opportunity Employer and affords equal opportunity to all qualified applicants for all positions without regard to protected veteran status, qualified individuals with disabilities and all individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or any other status protected under local, state or federal laws.

Overview

Newsflash: SALES is in your veins.
It's been in your blood ever since you've been selling homemade lemonade on your stand back in the corner of your neighborhood years back. Leading the business development is not only a notch in your belt, but it is a skill that you're honing every day.
At ABI Document Support Services, we're seeking a seasoned veteran of Sales to navigate our Regional Carrier Program Sales Executive role by providing foresight and wholeheartedly spearheading our sales division. As the Sales Executive, you will drive the development of new regional, Mid-level, TPAs and self-insured carrier programs as well as uncovering untapped carrier opportunities within existing accounts.
As our Regional Sales Executive, you will maintain consistent contact with our clients, maintaining awareness regarding industry standards, client expectations, and travel on an as-needed basis.
As we're on the search for the right person, location is not an affair we're limited by as this position will be 100% remote, reporting into our office in Loma Linda, CA.

Responsibilities

Drive the development of regional mid-level carrier, TPA and Self Insured business.
Consistent team selling strategy and partnering with Vice President of National Sales and Director of National Sales on overall approach and application.
Meet or exceed new business sales and order volume quotas assigned by management.
Activities align with the vision and values of the overall organization, including partnering with VP of National Sales to further support their efforts of successful carrier program implementations.
Understand various products or product lines and make recommendations in various geographic areas.
Develop and implement strategies for expanding the company’s customer base; identify and prospect new accounts/clients.
Maintain key customer relationships and act as a liaison between clients and the company, actively promotes services, gathers and exchanges information.
Understand operational procedures to assist with communication between clients and various departments.
Represent the company at industry functions, conferences, tradeshows, seminars, meetings, and when necessary, organize and conduct client entertainment.
Inform clients of updates to policy changes, products and services.
Assist in resolving client concerns relative to service and report quality issues in a timely manner; assist in any recruiting efforts.
Evaluate the results of overall sales efforts regularly and reports these results to management.
Analyze the market and competition and identify external threats and opportunities; adapts sales strategy to changing conditions.
Conduct website demonstrations to sell products and services to existing and potential clients.
Provide weekly, monthly and or quarterly updates as directed. Update CRM system accordingly.
Perform miscellaneous duties as assigned by management.
Qualifications

Bachelors’ degree or equivalent experience.
**Minimum 5+ years successful experience in the document retrieval industry/legal/insurance is required**
**Extensive experience presenting, selling and closing sales in legal/insurance industries.
Prospect new regional mid-level Carriers and TPA accounts
Must demonstrate exceptional communication skills by conveying necessary information accurately, listening effectively and asking questions where clarification is needed.
Must be able to work independently, prioritize work activities and use time efficiently.
Must use intuition and experience to effectively market the company’s services.
Must be able to demonstrate team behavior and willing to promote a positive team -oriented environment.

When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, and you’ll be valued and recognized for your performance. With talented managers and inspiring coworkers to support you, you’ll find the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world.
Location/Division
The Laboratory Products Group (LPD) unites deep scientific expertise, a collaborative culture and rich resources to deliver the lab equipment and consumables that our customers need to achieve their scientific goals – quickly, reliably and safely. Our smart lab solutions make it faster and easier for our customers to focus on what matters most – delivering answers and innovations that save and improve lives.
Our laboratory equipment products are used primarily by pharmaceutical companies for drug discovery and development and by biotechnology companies and universities for life science research to advance the prevention and cure of diseases and enhance quality of life. Our offering consists of equipment, accessories, and services for sample preparation, storage and protection, and analysis.
Our laboratory consumables products include plastics, glass, and related equipment that customers use every day to support their scientific research, drug discovery and development, quality and process control, and clinical and basic research and development needs. Our product categories include sample preparation and storage, liquid handling, and specialty plastics and services. We also manufacture a line of reusable plastic containers sold to the consumer market under the Nalgene brand name.
LPD operates with four key businesses: Controlled Temperature Technologies (CTT), Growth, Protection and Separation (GPS); Water and Lab Products (WLP); and Laboratory Plastics Essentials (LPE).
This position is remote in North America.
How will you make an impact?
This role will have responsibility for delivery of profitable revenue growth and customer satisfaction via digital channels for Laboratory Products Division (LPD). Through close connection with the LPD Commercial organization, the ideal candidate will enact strategies to drive new customer acquisition and retention through digital channels in North America and be the single point of contact for the commercial organization.
What will you do?
Drive overall thermofisher.com revenue in NA for the base business as well as eNPI revenue to meet/exceed annual target.
Develop data driven strategy to acquire and retain new customers on thermofisher.com and further to nurture and expand our share of wallet with repeat customers.
Provide training to North America commercial organization to ensure commercial team is familiar with capabilities of thermofisher.com in order to drive commercial advocacy.
Develops and execute on promotional tactics to drive eCommerce revenue working with regional sales leaders to support their strategy and coordinating with business unit stakeholders.
Providing support for commercial organizations in interpretation of eCommerce revenue data.
Support customer escalations on thermofisher.com related issues.
How will you get here?
Education
Minimum education requirement: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent.
Experience
Direct and channel commercial experience in laboratory sciences or related field and/or managing/selling into relevant segment (pharma, biotech, academia).
Experience in commercial support functions such as field/regional marketing, sales operations, commercial excellence is a plus.
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
Comfortable working in a matrix environment with many stakeholders with differing priorities.
Must be customer centric. Experience working in laboratory using relevant products is a plus.
Ability to make data driven decision and ability to gather opinions of diverse perspectives.
Ability to multitask, organized, be able to prioritize.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Self-motivated.
At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 70,000 extraordinary minds have a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.
Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com

Overview:

Great American's Strategic Comp division is currently seeking a Claims Operations Specialist (Claims Assistant) to support our growing Claims Operations department. This is a work from home opportunity that will be located in California.

Here’s who we are. Strategic Comp is part of Great American Insurance Group, which was established in 1872. Based in Cincinnati, Ohio, the operations of Great American Insurance Group are engaged primarily in property and casualty insurance, focusing on specialty commercial products for businesses and in the sale of annuities.

Our employees at Strategic Comp make a difference and feel appreciated for it. In fact we received 98% rating for overall job satisfaction from the participants in our last employee survey. This clearly indicates the passion and energy our staff has for our company and for the job they do!

Here’s what we do. We insure workers’ compensation coverage for large companies, using our deductible program. Our service in claims and loss control is second to none. We’ve found that a large majority of our customers feel the way our employees do. Our renewal retention is 90+%, meaning they enjoy working with us too!
Responsibilities:

Here’s what you would be doing if hired for the Claims Operations Specialist (Claims Assistant) role:
Demonstrate working knowledge of the claims operation and learn to resolve routine incoming operations partners’ requests; refer all non-routine/more complex issues to more experienced staff
Actively seek information to understand operations partners’ circumstances, problems, expectations and needs, for the purpose of resolving inquiries/issues
Share and/or convey information to business partners, regarding their claims; maintain a professional demeanor in all situations
Interact with business partners to share and/or convey information in response to issues and inquiries; respond to general claims information requests and complaints received via telephone, email, or voicemail
Provide assistance to Claims department in areas requiring beginner to intermediate skills or knowledge.
Perform claims operations and payment functions on claims:
Perform electronic indexing, coverage verification, claims transactions, recoveries, and complete drafts and forms
Complete claims setup and entry, and assign claims numbers
Compose, prepare, review, and respond to correspondence; answer and respond to inquiries and gather information
Perform general processing; enter information into company systems and utilize the company systems to identify the appropriate recipient of correspondence within or outside the company
Prepare, order, and maintain records, reports, registers, and schedules
Maintain/purge documents according to record retention guidelines and distribute files/file systems
May perform systems functions, including determining errors/corrections on claims system(s)
May coordinate/maintain contractor system, assigned manuals, repetitive payment schedule and bulk billing system
May receive/verify information on loss reports and expense and/or medical bills
Comply with company and regulatory guidelines
Perform all other duties as assigned
Qualifications:

Education, Experience, Location and Skills Required
High school diploma
At least 2 years of relevant claims assistant / claims operations support experience
Experience with workers' compensation claims is preferred
Strong customer service skills
Professional phone etiquette and phone skills
Ability to work well with a group
Data entry experience is a plus
California residence required

We are looking for a dynamic Sales Representative with an entrepreneurial spirit interested in uncapped earning potential to help take our team to the next level!

Sales Representative Position Summary:
Partner with schools and school districts on learning solutions that enhance teaching effectiveness.
Advise and consult on TCMs best-in-class products and services that align with educational targets and goals.

Essential Duties / Responsibilities:
Develop an understanding of students and teachers needs and expectations within your territory.
Understand opportunities with various customer buyers in order to develop viable solutions.
Build relationships with decision makers in order to build relationships and gain their support and commitment to various initiatives/programs.
Cultivate business plan/solution and contingency plan in collaboration with the customer using information collected during the account discovery process to ensure the plan meets customer needs.
Solve issues that arise during execution in order to eliminate barriers.
Develop customer call strategies to interact with buyers (coaches, gatekeepers) in order to gain access to senior-level buyers.
Coordinate implementation of agreed upon activities (e.g., trade shows, product training, regional workshops) within geographical responsibility in order to execute plan.
Identify opportunities consistent with the objectives, priorities and strategies of assigned customers through discovery in order to prioritize potential focus area(s).
Review with the customer how the recommended solutions are linked to customer's needs to highlight Teacher Created Materials commitment to customer needs.
Receive and answer incoming telephone calls and communications from customers in order to solve customer problems/requests.
Qualifications
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience
K-12 classroom teaching experience AND/OR
2+ years in professional sales

General Sales Competencies:
Customer Focus: Making customers (external and internal) and their needs a primary focus of one's actions; developing and sustaining productive customer relationships; creating and executing plans and solutions in collaboration with the customer.
Communicating Effectively: Conveying information and ideas in a clear, meaningful, and timely manner; providing information to ensure understanding; solicits input from the audience during the communication.
Planning and Organizing: Establishing courses of action for self and/or others to ensure that work is completed efficiently in light of the strategies and destination of the department and/or organization.
Exerting Personal Influence: Persuading others to support or agree with an idea, issue, or position.
Acting with Integrity: Maintaining a commitment to honesty; models social, ethical, and organizational values; firmly adhering to codes of conduct and ethical principles.
Work Standards: Setting high standards of performance for self; assuming responsibility and accountability for successfully completing assignments or tasks; self-imposing standards of excellence rather than having standards imposed.
Knowledge of the Business: understands value from a customer perspective; stays informed; understands the organization; understands the educational market
Building Value Based Relationships: explores opportunities for relationships; identifies relationship needs; facilitated mutual agreement; develops credibility; maintains open lines of communication

Physical Requirements:
Frequent travel by automobile.
Sit, stand, and walk for extended periods of time.
Must be able to carry up to 50 lbs. when traveling and/ or carrying materials to and from sales meetings and destinations.
Repetitive hand and wrist movements for frequent use of computer keyboard and mouse.

Company Overview:

Riverbed enables organizations to maximize performance and visibility for networks and applications, so they can overcome complexity and fully capitalize on their digital and cloud investments. The Riverbed Network and Application Performance Platform enables organizations to visualize, optimize, remediate and accelerate the performance of any network for any application. The platform addresses performance and visibility holistically with best-in-class WAN optimization, network performance management (NPM), application acceleration (including Office 365, SaaS, client and cloud acceleration), and enterprise-grade SD-WAN. Riverbed’s 30,000+ customers include 99% of the Fortune 100.
About this Position:

Title: Enterprise Sales Executive
Location: remote office - Los Angeles

Who we are:
Riverbed is a place where hundreds of different personalities have the same customer obsession. We seek builders from all backgrounds to join Riverbed and encourage employees to use their voices and chart their career paths. We are looking for talented sales-driven professionals to be a part of an organization driving Riverbed's advanced technologies in today's hyper-growth digital world.

Do you have the business savvy to work with a cross-functional team that includes, Solution Engineers, and Product and Partner/Channel teams to deliver business growth for our customers? Riverbed is seeking an experienced Strategic Sales Executive to lead and expand our growing business with current and future customers.

The Opportunity:
The Enterprise Sales Executive is responsible for selling at the most senior level (C-level) within larger accounts and implementing a broad strategy for earning customer acceptance and implementation. The Strategic Sales Executive works collaboratively with all appropriate Riverbed resources (Executives, partners, support, and solution engineers) to support customer interests. They will also understand how to advocate for customers and balance that advocacy with Riverbed's business needs. This includes dotted-line responsibility for partnership and technical collaboration.

Responsibilities include but not limited to:
Owning account relationships and driving overall customer successDeveloping relationships and alignment at multiple levels – C level executive sponsors, influencers, and decision makersMaximizing sales into enterprise accounts and being part of the customers’ overall business solutionParticipating in cross sell and up sell opportunities. Penetrating additional buyers within the accounts, identifying their needs and then configuring an appropriate offering from our portfolio to meet those needsLeading large scale enterprise agreements to close large-scale, multi-year subscription-based dealsPreparing accurate forecasts, building a funnel to cover bookings target, documenting activities in Salesforce, and performing other tasks necessary to drive revenue and communicate activities to sales managementUsing disciplined account planning to maintain client relationships, enhance customer satisfaction, and increase account penetrationLeading a complex sales cycle; orchestrating and leveraging additional resources – i.e. partners, inside sales, Solutions (Presales) Engineers, Sales Management, and Executive Leadership – when needed

Requirements:
The candidate must meet the following requirements:
Minimum of seven years of quota-carrying sales experience, as the lead account owner of an enterprise customer, at a technology companyA strong understanding of technology, (Cloud/SaaS/On-demand/on premise), network performance management/visibility, application acceleration, software-defined WAN, and WAN optimizationHigh emotional intelligence and expertise in influencing technology decisions in collaboration with othersAble to establish credibility with C-level executivesExtensive complex deal negotiations with a successful track recordExperience with channel alignment and partner sales modelsClosing new, multi-year and subscription-based SaaS dealsTrack record of driving results faster with a sense of urgencyDemonstrated ability to understand how to run business and growth model (including, but not limited to, account territory management, P&L ownership, business planning and pipelining)Cultivating relationships with a strategic customer base and advising on industry insights, best practices, and strategyBA or BS degree preferred

About Riverbed:

Riverbed offers a rewarding experience of working with the best minds in the industry, delivering exceptional network performance and visibility for any application. We are proud of our great culture that continuously fosters innovation, collaboration, and diverse work environments. We remain committed to attracting, developing, and retaining the most diverse group of talent to better serve our customers.

Riverbed is an equal employment opportunity/Affirmative Action (EEO/AA) employer and provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, physical disability (including HIV and AIDS), mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or child birth (including breast feeding), sexual orientation, genetics, genetic information, marital status, veteran status or any other basis protected by and in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

www.riverbed.com

Area Sales Manager
As a Digital Sales Consultant (Area Sales Manager) for Capital One Auto Finance, you will partner closely with a defined set of Automobile Dealerships, providing consultative guidance to help each dealer achieve its operational objectives. Your ability to build entrenched relationships with business owners and key decision makers throughout the organization will ensure adoption of our suite of lead-generation products and lending solutions. As the primary point of contact for each dealer, you will be responsible for the end-to-end activities related to product adoption including the product presentation, dealership training, and monitoring of dealer performance. Backed by the strength of Capital One Auto Finance’s dominant position in automotive financing and powered by our position as tech leader in the industry, you will become part of the team that is rapidly expanding its footprint across the spectrum of dealership sales and financing operations.
Job Description:
Establish trusted relationships with key decisions makers at each dealer location
Maintain and grow Capital One Auto Finance’s leading position as a national full credit spectrum auto lender
Be a product expert across our digital lead-generation platform and provide solutions that help dealers achieve their sales objectives
Confidently deliver sales presentations and facilitate dealer training to drive product adoption
Be innovative, organized, and driven to achieve extraordinary business results while providing best in class service to each dealer
Create and execute a monthly plan of dealer engagement based on careful analysis of available data and sales metrics
Work closely with internal business partners and teammates to drive cohesion and operational excellence
The ideal candidate will:
Have an entrepreneurial spirit and serve as an advocate for our customers
Thrive in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment, acquiring and maintaining high levels of product, service, and process knowledge
Be innovative, highly organized, and have a measurable, demonstrated ability to drive business results while delivering superior service to our customers
Demonstrate the ability to work remotely and independently with ample self-motivation and discipline
Possess superior relationship building, consulting, and closing skills
Have exceptional written, verbal, and presentation skills
Cultivate a desire for learning and personal growth with the ability to use feedback in a positive way with personal accountability
Demonstrate proficiency in using customer relationship management systems
Basic Qualifications:
High school diploma, GED or equivalent certification
At least 1 year of financial services experience or business to business sales
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree
At least 1 year of experience representing lead-provider products and solutions
At least 1 year of experience in the automotive financing or advertising media industries
At this time, Capital One will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.

Text: Job DescriptionHave you ever thought of working in the Financial Services Industry but you didn’t want to be tied to a Corporate umbrella? This opportunity could be what you’re looking for.This is not a typical 9-5 employee position. It is a telework/work at home position that’s meant for someone who wants to create their own business without the stresses of required production minimums or corporate proprietary products.Whether you’re an insurance agent or financial advisor part-time or full time, there is a spot for you within the organization.When you join Synergy Financial, you’ll have the opportunity to establish, grow and manage your business as an independent contractor. You’ll be rewarded for building genuine, long term relationships as you guide clients to their goals. With a full range of financial products to offer, you’ll be well equipped to help clients:Confidently prepare for a secure retirement.Financially protect their families in the event of illness, injury, aging or death.Fund their kids’ or grandkids’ college education.Create and leave a legacy for the people and causes that matter to them.Thrive, as a result of your ongoing guidance.What Synergy Financial OffersAt Synergy Financial, we’ll support your goals and reward your success while giving you the independence to build a business. Job Description
Account Executive - Online Division, Los Angeles, CA
Join us at Grand Canyon Education and begin your career helping Grand Canyon University students succeed! We are looking for a motivated Account Executive to oversee the Los Angeles, CA territory in this unique remote (work from home) opportunity. Starting salary is $65,000 per year with an earning potential of a six-figure income after 5 years of successful service as an Account Executive/University Development Counselor.
Who you are:
You’re a goal-getter who is passionate about the power of education. Over the past 3+ years, you’ve demonstrated success in outside business development, consultative sales or account management.
You know it’s not all about achieving (and often crushing!) your goals. While that does get you excited, what you really thrive on is using your exceptional communication and coaching skills to help non-traditional Grand Canyon University students’ level up in their lives through quality education.
Now is the time to bring your talent to Grand Canyon Education, where you’ll have the opportunity to play an integral role in providing Grand Canyon University students the roadmap for success from application through to completion of the first few classes. Here’s a taste of how you’ll make your mark as an Account Executive with us.
As an Account Executive, a typical week might include the following:
Strategy and execution. You’ll be consistently identifying and implementing event/activity plans for your territory, building awareness of our online academic programs for education, healthcare and business and drive inquiry generation. You’ll be using your unique ability to fly at 25,000 feet in shaping high impact partnerships for your territory, while diving down to 'sea level' to execute in daily work through informational presentations, calls and emails, iterating as needed to maximize value.
Partner and influencer. Through a variety of mediums, you will use your passion for serving others to provide exceptional counseling to prospective students, their families and partners. Whether in-person, over the phone or via email, you will champion the GCE mission, promoting Grand Canyon University student success and institutional growth.
Heart and Hustle. This is a work from home role with ambitious targets! Working independently, you’ll be using your out-of-the-box critical thinking skills to support prospective Grand Canyon University students through the admissions process, guiding them on the right path towards a successful online learning experience.
The role might be right for you if you have:
A bachelor’s degree .
Outstanding time management skills. In this role, you’ll be wearing many hats, so you’ll need to show that not only have you honed your time management skills, you also know how to prioritize competing priorities even while travelling.
Clear communication skills. You can explain just about anything to anyone and you’re comfortable communicating in person, in writing and on the phone. You’ll also need to have well developed listening skills.
Self-motivation and drive to succeed . You volunteer for new challenges without waiting to be asked. You’re going to take ownership of the time you spend with Grand Canyon University students and truly make a difference.
High emotional intelligence. In this role, you’ll be coaching a diverse range of Grand Canyon University students, each with unique circumstances. You’ll also have partner relationships to develop and nurture. Ability to demonstrate empathy is key to success in this role.
A valid driver's license, reliable transportation and a flexible schedule. Since this role requires extensive travel in your territory, you’ll need a clean driving record and ability to use your personal vehicle. Some events might require evening and/or weekend availability.
Computer literacy. As part of a remote workforce, we rely on a number of digital tools to help you execute your work and keep you accountable. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite is required.
Bonus points if you have:
Relevant industry related professional experience.
Experience working with CRM tools.
What we’ll offer in return:
A career where your work makes a difference.
A stable income with a good salary.
Opportunity to own your part of the business without the risks of owning your own business.
Ongoing professional development and growth.
Outstanding benefits and work perks.
Collaborative and supportive work environment. ...and more!

Commercial Real Estate / Finance Counsel (Remote)
Latitude is seeking attorneys with sophisticated commercial real estate and finance who are licensed in California to assist on a 6-month engagement. In this role, you would work closely with the client and their outside counsel team reviewing and updating real estate agreements, including deeds, titles, leases, easements, and other contracts and conveyance documents. This is a full-time engagement with a target start date in January 2021. Experience in California is required. Experience at an AmLaw 100 firm or California boutique firm is preferred.
Minimum Qualifications of the Commercial Real Estate Engagement Attorney
5-25+ years of experience as a transactional attorney either in-house or with a well-respected full-service law firm (or sophisticated boutique firm which serves large corporate clients).
Demonstrated ability to draft, review and negotiate commercial real estate documents of varying types
Prior experience as an associate or counsel in an AmLaw 100 law firm is preferred.
Capability and experience to work independently
Licensed to practice law and in good standing in California
Excellent academic credentials
Outstanding references

Position Details of the Real Estate Engagement Attorney
Type of role: Engagement
Schedule: Full-time
Location: Remote, working with a company located in California
Compensation & Benefits: Highly competitive and commensurate with experience

Confidentiality
Latitude will not disclose your identity or propose you to prospective clients without your prior consent. Candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted.
Only qualified applicants should apply.
About Latitude
Latitude offers life-changing engagements and permanent positions with companies and law firms to outstanding attorneys and paralegals.
Latitude Engagements
Great attorneys and paralegals who are seeking contract engagements or consulting roles choose to work with Latitude because of our law firm-level compensation and benefits, sophisticated and engaging work, a chance to work with great clients and peers, and a refreshing blend of freedom with self-designed boundaries. Our consulting attorneys and paralegals have the level of skill, experience, and judgment as would be expected of a permanent attorney or paralegal in a corporate legal department or law firm and the versatility to step into challenging environments and hit the ground running. If you have the right skills, personality and experience, Latitude helps you do what you are good at in a more rewarding way. Latitude attorneys and paralegals serve on a full- or part-time engagement basis, and work remotely or on-site at the client office.
Latitude is an equal-opportunity employer.


For more information about Latitude, please visit us at https://latitudelegal.com.

JobTitle: Account Based Marketing Lead, Health Systems North America (Home-Based)
Text:
Los Angeles, California, United States


Job Type Full time
Job Number 373234

In this role, you have the opportunity to

Plan, execute, and measure a range of multi-touch programs for specific audience-based (segment) accounts, including intelligence gathering, demand creation, and sales enablement.

You are responsible for:

Overall Demand Generation

Actively seeking and creating joint customer success stories to showcase best practices and demonstrate strong partner relationships



Account Based Marketing

Together with insights and analytics and sales leadership, creating and updating the customer segmentation to identify top tier accounts

Aligning with sales leaders and business marketing and strategy leaders to define shared priorities and areas of opportunity for account based marketing

Teaming up with sales to create and execute account marketing plans that drive market growth for top tier accounts and aligning account marketing and account sales plans

Creating and executing account specific awareness, demand generation and preference plans

Measuring, analyzing, and reporting on MQL, SQL and conversion rates for top tier accounts and marketing ROI

Sharing best practices and leveraging insights from ABM to support overall demand generation activities locally and globally

Providing input and guidance to operations and digital teams on CRM and marketing technology requirements needed to better enable ABM


To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience; MBA preferred

5+ years B2B marketing experience

3+ years' experience working within channel marketing or with partners

Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills.

Understanding of campaign management and demand creation processes

Experience working in a CRM (Salesforce.com) and a Lead Management/Automation platform

Demand creation/execution to deliver results

Data and insight gathering and analysis

Market segmentation and prioritization

Development and execution of campaigns

Use of dashboards to track and measure performance

Ability to travel as needed, approximately 30%



You are a part of

Our North America marketing team, reporting directly to the Senior Director, Solutions Marketing. Our updated approach is helping us move Philips toward being a solution-based company, and we are in search of passionate team members to join us as we strengthen our way of working and helping solve our customers' problems. Philips (NYSE: PHG, AEX: PHIA) is a leading health technology company focused on improving people'shealth and enabling better outcomes across thehealth continuum from healthy living and prevention, to diagnosis, treatment and home care. Philips leveragesadvanced technologyand deepclinical and consumer insights to deliverintegrated solutions. The companyis a leader in diagnostic imaging, image-guided therapy, patient monitoringandhealth informatics, as well as inconsumerhealthand home care.

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It's a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.

To find out more about what it's like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

It is the policy of Philips to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, pregnancy/childbirth, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or perceived disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran or military status or a person's relationship or association with a protected veteran, including spouses and other family members, marital or domestic partner status, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.

As an equal opportunity employer, Philips is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants that require accommodation in the job application process may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.

Northrop Grumman's Enterprise Services organization is seeking a certified and experienced Microsoft Azure Solutions Architect Solutions Architect to support the Cloud Service Brokerage mission of the Enterprise Cloud Services Group (ECSG). This position is located in Falls Church, VA but can be performed virtually.

As a Cloud Solutions Architect on our team, you’ll work with both internal and external customers to design, architect, and deploy Azure-hosted cloud services and solutions to support national security mission requirements. You will be expected to recommend architectural strategies, tools, and capabilities based on your experience, industry best practices, and success patterns; as well as your research into the operational domain. As a member of a large, multi-disciplinary team, you will create new solutions – and occasionally breathe new life into old ones – in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment.

As the cognizant cloud architect for assigned program engagements, you will be responsible for:

Regularly evaluate cloud infrastructure, applications, and software.Work closely with IT security to monitor and refine the corporation’s security framework.Offer guidance in infrastructure movement techniques including bulk application transfers into the cloud.Responsible for ensuring that all Cloud solutions comply with industry and Government mandated security protocols and best-practices; working closely with our Information Security Service line.Responsible for ensuring technical project deliverables are completed accurately and on time.Responsible for escalating issues, problems, risks, and constraints to the appropriate levels for clarification and resolution.Responsible for design and engineering of Cloud Based Infrastructure solutions based on AWS or Azure CloudTechnologies.Responsible for communication with senior/executive leadership.Responsible for keeping abreast of new and emerging technologies.Support sector strategy function including investment planning and prioritization process.Experience architecting automated, fault-tolerant, scalable Cloud environments adhering to best practices.Maintain Cloud Infrastructure in Optimal Configuration from both technical and budgetary perspectivesDeploy, test and document development, pre-production, and production environmentsTrain and mentor Architects and Engineers - Provides guidance and coaching to solution and system architects, ensuring consistency with enterprise architecture tenants, Lean-Agile and tenets, user experience mindset, and cybersecurity requirementsImprove the operational capabilities of enterprise infrastructureOwn communication with stakeholders at all levels - Internally "sell" the architecture process, its outcome, and ongoing results through effective communication and influencing skills.Support the investigation of reported and suspected outage issues, documenting issue, resolution, maintaining a knowledge base of known issuesGain an understanding of the existing technical environments and workloads that are targeted to migrate to the cloud, taking note of any potential gaps or risks.Frameworks, structures, and policies to ensure the requisite availability, elasticity, and business continuity is built natively into the cloud environmentPolicies and controls to ensure compliance with the applicable Government frameworks and corporate standardsArchitectural design to support optimal performance, effectiveness, and efficiencySecure and effective integration with those networks, capabilities, and capacities required for mission performanceRegularly evaluate cloud infrastructure, applications, and software.Work closely with IT security to monitor and refine the corporation’s security framework.Offer guidance in infrastructure movement techniques including bulk application transfers into the cloud. #LI-AA1

ORGANIZATIONAL BACKGROUND

Public Counsel is the largest pro bono public interest law firm in the country. Founded in 1970,
it is dedicated to advancing equal justice under law and addressing economic, racial, and other
inequities by delivering free legal and social services to the most vulnerable members of our
community. Public Counsel operates eight legal projects: Children’s Rights, Community
Development, Consumer Rights, Homelessness Prevention, Immigrants’ Rights, Veterans’
Rights, the Audrey Irmas Project for Women & Girls’ Rights, and our impact litigation project,
Opportunity Under Law. Public Counsel has a full-time staff of over 130. We seek to have a
racially inclusive staff.
Public Counsel’s Children’s Rights Project (CRP) serves children, youth, and their families on a
variety of legal issues, including probate legal guardianship, public benefits, and adoption. The
Education Practice Team is part of the larger Children’s Rights Project.
PROJECT DESCRIPTION
The Education Rights Practice Team is an interdisciplinary team that combines legal advocacy
with social work support to address racial and economic inequalities and confront the school to
prison pipeline and the opportunity gap for students of color. Our direct services practice
prioritizes representation of our most marginalized students, including students of color, those
who are being pushed out of comprehensive schools, and those whose families are involved in
the dependency or delinquency court systems. We apply a human rights framework and
systems-change approach to our direct service advocacy based on our belief in an education
system that honors the dignity of all students and their families —where access to education is
valued as a human right and students are free from discrimination and criminalization in the
school setting.
JOB SUMMARY
The Education Practice team Staff Attorney will represent students and their parents/Education
Rights Holders in obtaining appropriate special education services and preventing or mitigating
the outcomes of school discipline proceedings. The attorney will engage in all stages of special
education advocacy from IEP meetings with school districts to administrative due process
proceedings and will support students and families to develop self-advocacy skills so they are
equipped to advocate for themselves when our representation ends. The staff attorney will
primarily focus on direct client representation and will also be responsible for:
 Drafting complaints, attending resolution sessions and/or mediations, and preparing
and conducting the administrative hearings
 Representing students who are facing expulsion in disciplinary proceedings and will
engage in community trainings and developing Know Your Rights materials for families
facing educational barriers
 Participating in collaborative workgroups to advocate for systemic change and work
with our education staff attorneys who lead policy and legislative efforts
ESSENTIAL JOB SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED
 
Admitted to the California bar or provisional license;
 Excellent organizational, case management, oral and written communication, and
analytical skills: ability to be detail-oriented, multi-task, set priorities, and work
independently, but also in close coordination with other staff;
 Commitment to economic and racial justice and the mission of Public Counsel;
 Experience working with individuals of diverse cultural, racial, geographic, and economic
backgrounds;
 Ability to communicate in an empathetic and professional manner with the community
we serve;
 Understanding of California’s education, dependency and juvenile justice systems
strongly preferred;
 Fluency in Spanish language is highly preferred;
 Entry level position requiring up to three years of experience in legal advocacy



START DATE AND COMPENSATION
 
Salary is commensurate with abilities and experience
 Immediate full-time, exempt position
 Public Counsel offers a competitive benefits package including: (1) medical, dental, and
vision coverage with both HMO and PPO options, (2) the option to enroll in a Flexible
Spending Account, (3) a 403(b) retirement plan with elective contribution and an
employer contribution after a year of employment, and (4) employer-paid life insurance
and disability plans.
 Public Counsel follows all emergency state and local orders arising from the current
COVID-19 pandemic. Though generally this position is office based, currently all staff
must work remotely from their homes. Public Counsel will assess when the physical
office will reopen in a manner consistent with public health and local and state
emergency orders
APPLICATION DEADLINE
Continuous until position is filled.
TO APPLY


Please e-mail a cover letter and resume to:

Mayra Lira, Senior Supervising Staff Attorney

Children’s Rights Project

Public Counsel

Los Angeles, CA 90005

Email: edu@publiccounsel.org
No phone calls please.

Public Counsel is an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants shall receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color,

religion, national origin, ethnic group identification, ancestry, sex, age, marital status, political

affiliation, condition of physical or mental disability, gender identity or sexual orientation, in

accordance with requirements of Federal and State laws.

All qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with the

requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring.

Meet Alliance Apparel:
Alliance Apparel is an industry-leading fashion design and production house based in Los Angeles. Founded in 2014 and recently acquired specializes in contemporary apparel, footwear and currently designs compelling and distinct brands – Lovers + Friends, Tularosa, NBD, X by NBD, Majorelle, L’Academie, Privacy Please, GRLFRND, LPA, House of Harlow 1960 x REVOLVE, Chrissy Teigen, NBD x Naven, RAYE, by the way, and About Us. With an unparalleled ability to identify a specific market niche, each Alliance brand has its own identity and is designed with a distinct consumer interest and personality in mind. The company’s honest connection with consumer is what makes each Alliance brand compelling, covetable and unique.
At REVOLVE the most successful team members have a thirst and the creativity to make this the top e-commerce brand in the world. With a team of 800+ based out of Cerritos, California we are a dynamic bunch that are motivated by getting the company to the next level. It’s our goal to hire high-energy, diverse, bright, creative, and flexible individuals who thrive in a fast-paced work environment. In return, we promise to keep REVOLVE a company where inspired people will always thrive.
To take a behind the scenes look at the REVOLVE “corporate” lifestyle check out our Instagram @REVOLVEcareers or #lifeatrevolve.
Are you ready to set the standard for Premium apparel?
Main purpose of the Assistant Designer (Femme) role:
The Assistant Designer for the Femme category will utilize their organizational skills to assist and support the Design team with daily administrative and design-related tasks. They will assist with the design development process which includes creatively finding solutions and different perspectives pertaining to design, ultimately supporting the Designer’s creative direction. This is a permanent full time role for a candidate who truly understand the market consumer and is passionate about his or her work.
Major Responsibilities:
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Strong knowledge of premium quality, feminine design details. Must incorporate an elevated personal aesthetic and taste level
Create detailed technical flats and line guides; this includes intricate CAD work, zoom construction details for review with Lead Designer. This includes thoughtful and intentional construction work and ability to execute on those CAD’s independently
Assist in the process of executing elevated product with the direction of a higher-level Designer.
Attend designated fittings, support Lead Designer in updates
Assist and receive sample shipments and check-in to system daily
Maintain and organize all sample racks and label samples accordingly
Create and maintain monthly line guides
Set up swatch and print packages
Create detailed CADs/Tech Packs/Construction Detail Pages/maintain BOMs
Check in samples and blocks into Product Consoles
Accurately take notes for Designer in meetings
Complete ad-hoc tasks and assignments as directed by management
Required Competencies:
To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:
Possess ability to sketch and CAD design details and knowledge of garment construction as needed by Designer
Strong understanding of application of fabrications and an assortment of trims
Able to clearly communicate silhouettes and detailed garment construction through tech pack creation and CADS
Proficient knowledge and skill-set to achieve high-end and aspirational embroidery/ embellishment layouts
Knowledgeable and consistently up-to-date with market/runway trends and good understanding of the REVOLVE customer and Revolve Owned Brands
Strong knowledge of design details and interior garment construction
Independently complete daily tasks while working from home
Self-motivated, positive and dependable attitude
Exceptional communication and organizational skills
Effective time management and ability to stay organized
Flexible and adaptable to a very fast-paced environment
Must be able and willing to lift and carry up to 10 lbs., perform frequent repetitive finger, hand and wrist motions, as well as, bending, stooping, reaching, squatting, kneeling, pushing, and pulling
Must be able to sit for extended periods of time
Minimum Qualifications:
Minimum one year experience in previous work or internship in related field
Intermediate knowledge of Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator a must
Advanced visual and written communication skills
Some to advanced knowledge of fabrics across categories
Preferred Qualifications:
Degree in Fashion, similar related field
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications and Gmail
Proficient knowledge of garment construction and fit
A successful candidate works well in a dynamic environment with minimal supervision. At REVOLVE we all roll up our sleeves to pitch-in and do whatever it takes to get the job done. Each day is a little different, it’s what keeps us on our toes and excited to come to work every day.
ATTENTION:
After submitting your application, please check your spam folder for emails on your application status. Emails are sent from an ADP email address.
