Match Group, the market leader in the dynamic and evolving category of dating is offering opportunities in the Strategy & Research department’s consumer research team.
We are currently seeking a bright and motivated individual who has the ability to think strategically and can execute various projects throughout their lifecycle.
You will work closely with other research team members in the design, development, and deployment of key research projects across brands.
This opportunity requires relocation to Los Angeles, CA
How you’ll make an impact:
Work on consumer research studies for one of Match Group brands, Tinder. Must be able to design, structure and manage quantitative and qualitative research.
Partner with business stakeholders to answer key business questions through consumer research. You’ll be responsible for defining business objectives, designing research projects and delivering actionable recommendations.
Participate in short term and long term strategic planning for consumer research initiatives across businesses.
We could be a match if:
BA or BS degree in something quantitative like Statistics, Math, Social Science, Economics etc. A graduate degree in a relevant field is a plus.
At least 3+ years of hands on experience with consumer research.
Must thrive in a lean, hands-on, and fast-paced environment. That means you’re willing and happy to get your hands dirty and own all stages of research.
Strong analytical skills with hands-on experience in statistical analysis, as well as proficiency with statistical software packages (SPSS).
Experience with both quantitative and qualitative research methods
Proficient communication and report writing skills.
What’s the team like?
Our Consumer Insights team is a small group that reports into a larger Strategy team led by Match Group’s Chief Strategy Officer.
We're highly collaborative and serve customers globally, so being organized is key!
We’re based out of Tinder's LA office. We’re all working remotely now, but eventually (when safe to do so) we’ll be back in our West Hollywood office with great perks like free catered meals, massages and free snacks.
#LI-CENTRAL
Why Match Group?
Our mission is simple – to help people find love and happiness!
We love our employees too – here are some examples how:
Annual training budget for each employee
100% employer match on 401k contributions
Specific COVID-19 allowance for home office set-up
Matched giving to qualified organizations
100% paid Parental Leave
Happy Hours and Company events (they are all virtual now, but still a ton of fun!)

We value diversity at our company and will never discriminate based on someone’s race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Bally Sports is looking for a Digital News Content Producer to package and program content for our soon-to-launch new national website and syndication partners including 21 regional sports networks across the U.S.
This producer will master production tools for creating audience-facing digital content and help colleagues do the same. They will understand our online voice, audience, and objectives, and will be trusted to make editorial decisions for our sites and partners with little oversight. The job is remote (work from home) with evening and weekend work as dictated by events.
RESPONSIBILITIES:


Site programming and packaging
Update our sports platforms with relevant and timely news, photos, engaging headlines, videos and related content
Create and publish content including breaking news, highlights, photo galleries and push notifications
React to breaking news with a commitment to speed balanced with accuracy, and help others do the same
Exercise strong news judgment and support our platforms mission and voice
Collaborate with digital content managers
Production
Ideate and advocate for new site features and functionality
Address errors, outages, and broken functionality or escalate as necessary
Master our photo sources/rights agreements and best practices â€“ and facilitate photo sourcing throughout Sinclair's digital sports organization
Be fluent with video production tools
Syndication partners
Surface regionally produced videos and other local content with national impact for use on our national platforms, and vice versa
Manually craft app alerts to fans who've asked for relevant news, video, and more
Populate feeds, tag and title content, and communicate with colleagues to help them troubleshoot publishing obstacles
Populate our YouTube channel with relevant videos, SEO friendly title, and teases. Curate YouTube playlists
ATTRIBUTES:
The right person for this role will be:
Deeply knowledgeable about the NBA, MLB, NHL sports and teams
A self-starter requiring little oversight while maintaining excellent attention to detail·
Willing to work hours as dictated by the digital news cycle and sports including evening and weekends
Collaborative and passionate with a team-first attitude toward building a next-generation sports digital media business
REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor's degree in journalism, communications, or a related field
Demonstrable experience and aptitude for web publishing tools including:
Photo editing software (Photoshop, etc.)
Video editing software (Premiere, Wildmoka)
Content Management Systems
Experience with audio production software is preferred
Demonstrable experience writing, copy editing, prepping and publishing content for the web (including some HTML) and mobile app
Thorough knowledge of digital media best practices, including SEO and content sharing
Strong editorial news judgment
Must be a good communicator and able to work cross-functionally
Organized, detail-oriented and able to multitask under pressure
Writing skills and working knowledge of Associated Press Style a plus
Sinclair Broadcast Group, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and Drug Free Workplace!
About Us
Make your mark in Media with Sinclair Broadcast Group, a diversified media company dedicated to connecting people with content everywhere! We have consistently led the broadcast industry since our inception, and now Sinclair owns the largest regional sports network business and one of the largest television broadcast portfolios in the country. In addition, we have affiliations with all of the major broadcast networks, own Tennis Channel, and several multicast networks including TBD and Comet. Our content is distributed over-the-air, on multi-video providers, and through our industry-leading digital media platforms. We also recently launched a free TV streaming service called STIRR. Our success is the direct result of our extraordinary employees and management team who believe in our vision and are dedicated to ensuring a great future for our employees. We are advancing the world of Media and want YOU to join our winning team!
About the Team
The life-blood of our organization is our people. We have a compelling story, a goal-oriented culture, and we take really good care of people. How good? Here is a glimpse: great benefits, open door policy, upward mobility and a strong desire to see you succeed. Ready to be part of a winning team? Let's talk.

Do you think design has the power to make the world better? Are you excited by the challenge of helping people analyze and draw mission-critical insights from big data?
If so, we here at Splunk would love to hear from you!
As a Principal Product Designer, you'll be involved in the full life-cycle of design. You’ll partner with product managers and engineers to deliver great experiences to our users, enabling them to demonstrate the full power of Splunk. You’ll also work with your fellow UI/UX and UXR team members, to develop and deploy Splunk’s design language, across our products.
We’re looking for thinkers and innovators who are willing to challenge the status quo and are energized by developing creative solutions to complex problems.
What you’ll do:
Work in close alignment with our product and engineering teams, to define and execute on a vision for Splunk’s unified suite of observability products which illustrates a best-in-class user experience for DevOps teams.
Advocate for and execute user-centered design/lean UX process for interaction design at throughout the product development process
Push creativity, challenge established thinking, and discover new ways of solving a problem
Present designs and effectively communicate design rationale to diverse partners
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (UX, visual designers, UX researchers, product managers and engineering) to create compelling visual designs of interactive experiences
Bring to bear Splunk’s component library/design system across early-stage concepts, prototypes and detailed product designs
Ownership of full design process within a project from early stage mock-ups to final detailed designs
Partner with product management and engineering teams to define product roadmaps and prioritize requirements for releases
Create detailed design specifications and design standards
What you’ll bring:
10+ years of demonstrated ability in UX/UI Design
Expertise in enabling highly technical users quickly and intuitively to analyze, and get insights from, data produced by a wide variety of services and devices, in a wide variety of formats
Expertise in data visualization
Deep understanding of design systems, and experience leveraging, and contributing to, design systems
Expertise in using industry-standard design and prototyping tools (Sketch, Figma, Adobe CC)
Expertise creating prototypes to communicate design concepts to users and project partners
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Not afraid of ambiguity and willing to learn new skills
Experience in a fast-paced, iterative development environment, experience with Agile a strong plus
Open to remote opportunities #LI-Remote

Text: We are looking for a Marketing Coordinator to participate in our company’s marketing efforts. Your main responsibilities include conducting market research, producing promotional materials, and analyzing sales data. Our ideal candidate is able to interpret customers’ behavior and suggest creative ways to increase brand awareness. If you have excellent communication skills and a passion for advertising strategies, we want to meet you. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, detail-oriented, and passionate about marketing and strategy. We in the CBD Industry, knowledge or prior experience much appreciated.*Must be knowledgeable about google adsPrimary Duties:Professionally present information while displaying outstanding product knowledgeBuilding rapport with customers and generating new businessIdentifying profitable opportunities and managing territories effectivelyProvide feedback regarding new techniques and active and passive marketing efforts and activities company-wideUtilizing good digital marketing principles, oversee the growth of website, social media channels, and other digital marketing materials, while working with others to produce relevant content, measure effectiveness, and boost web presencesManaging sales and marketing campaigns, reporting on the effectiveness of said campaigns and activities, giving thought to the return on investmentsCollaborating with other departments to coordinate and accomplish marketing tasksConduct research to analyze customers’ behavior (e.g. purchasing habits, trends, and preferences)Design and implement successful marketing campaignsPrepare reports by collecting and analyzing sales dataOrganize promotional activities for new SummaryWant to work at the coolest new agency on the block? A company that people say what you are working on is freaking awesome?Do you like music, social tech, fashion and lifestyle?Are you passionate about social media and communications?Well, you have found the right place.Since Covid is locking us down, we are providing opportunities to learn new skills and go up!While having the below skills and requirements is a plus, the most beneficial quality is having the ability and drive to find solutions for problems.Say hello to SHINES Creative.SHINES originated in 2020. We’re not just the newest agency on the block, we’re the agency of tomorrow. One that stands ahead of the curve, looks to the future and puts culture at the center of everything it does. We specialize in lifestyle category design, manufacturing and brand partnerships. We stand at the intersection of fashion, media, marketing, and technology. By implementing brand innovation through creative and strategic thinking, our goal is to revolutionize brands. To do this, our interdisciplinary teams work in close collaboration with clients to help them build impactful relationships and innovative experiences.Our clients include:Fortune 500 music companies where we lead their lifestyle divisionConsumer packaged goods companies where we revolutionize their boring products and turn them into a lifestyleMobile Social Music apps that bring opportunities to artistsThe benefits include:Creating relationships with brands, musicians, creatives, and industry executivesLearning new skills in a fun and encouraging environmentExecution of real-life projectsBuilding your resume so you can continue to grow your careerResponsibilities:Work with our Director of Social Media to create social media strategies for clientsCreate social media content and copy for both growing social media channelsExecute social media planning initiativeAnalyze social media analytics to measure the results of campaigns.Asking questions and creating ideas that impact our goalsA belief in one’s abilities and the drive to attain excellenceHacking ideas together to create innovative ways to solve problemsBe original and let your creativity shineTasks:Work directly with our internal management teams to help deliver projects to clientsWrite copy for broadcast commercials, websites, product launches and socialShow up for weekly meetingsWhy work with us:A unique opportunity to be a part of the acceleration of a new agency with amazing clientsWork with a group of passionate and motivated entrepreneursWork with talented people who are industry influencers and trendsettersDo something awesome and productive while on quarantine lockdownJob Types: Full-time, Part-time, InternshipPay: $0.00 per hourSchedule:Monday to FridayCOVID-19 considerations:This is a fully remote opportunity so we take social distancing to the max.
